reviews.title: Forza is the only reason I own an XBox One
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:568371de010945d756d6ee42f092a132]] One key works on PC and XBox. Forza 6 is the reason I bought an XBox One. Now we have three. This runs fine in 4K on an i5-6600K @ 3.5GHz with a Radeon RX-480 8GB. Easy enough for beginners. Challenging enough for experts.

reviews.title: Could be better, but I'm sure it would cost more.
reviews.text: This is a newer version of the PowerA charge stand we already had. It seems a bit more fidgety than the first ones. Otherwise, it charges my Elite controller just fine, as long as I'm careful to place it in exactly the right spot on the stand.

reviews.title: Best XBox Yet
reviews.text: Really makes a difference on Forza Motorsport 7 and Forza Horizon 3. If you plan to install more than a couple of 4K games, get an external USB 3.0/3.1 drive. 4K games take up a lot of space. A good external drive will load just as fast or faster than the internal. It would almost make sense for Microsoft to sell these with a smaller drive installed, but smaller than 1TB isn't cheaper anyway. I also have a second external drive attached to save game clips. You can record a clip up to one hour long clips with an external drive. It requires separate drives for each purpose, storage and media. For storage, let the XBox One format it. For media, format it as NTFS using a PC. Once a game is installed on the external drive, it can be played on any other XBox One. All video formats will be available, whatever the machine supports. It makes a decent heater for a small room also.

reviews.title: Better than humans can use.
reviews.text: I bought this for my son, who's a 30-something kid. There was only one better at the time, but better is subjective. Some of the things it had were superfluous. It would be hard for a human to tell the difference, unless they read the specs so they could brag about how much more that one was than this one. He wasn't disappointed. In fact, he had to learn not to click too early, because it has no noticeable lag. The Flash might find it a bit too slow for his taste though.

reviews.title: Solid product
reviews.text:
I'm 5' 11", 240 lbs, and 60 years old. I am a Forza addict and decided I needed a wheel, for which I needed a seat. I'm glad I picked this one to go with the Logitech G920.

I added the lift kit (Amazon B07G67FB1W), for a more "normal" seating position, and it was easy enough to install. All the tools you need are provided with this seat, and another wrench with the lift kit. There's no lack of adjustability. It's very solidly built. The seat itself is better than I expected. It's tempting to get two extra for my 2000 Frontier.

If you have a favorite car seat, it's also available without the seat, and it should be no problem mounting a car's seat to the frame. It should bolt right up.

Well, back to driving imaginary cars and learning how to use a wheel, after taking 5 years to learn how to drive with an XBox One controller.

My other car is a 2017 Freightliner Cascadia.

reviews.title: Fits perfectly
reviews.text: My son drops everything. My Nintendo Switch has a crack on the screen because he dropped it going up the stairs. There is no way I am letting him use the Oculus Quest 2 without any protection on it. This hard shell cover fit perfectly. It was easy to put on. Just slide it on and it secured into place. I like the texture of the protective shell because you can get a better grip on it. However the case seems rather thin and there doesn't seem to be any shock absorption if the headset is dropped. I'm sure my son will eventually test this part out.

reviews.title: Great for playing Beat Saber or golf games
reviews.text:
First off, this is a great add-on for Beat Saber and the golf games (I used it with Walkabout Mini Golf). It definitely made it easier and more fun. The kids enjoyed having the additional extenders on while playing.
The handles had a nice grip to it so I did not use the straps. However I did find trying to click on the controller buttons were more awkward. Also, make sure when you set up the extension, that the pin is secure over the lip of your controller or else your controller will fall out. I love how there is a case to put everything in when the extension not in use.

reviews.title: Great Controller Grips for Oculus Quest 2
reviews.text: These Chargeable Controller Grips are a great accessory to the Oculus Quest 2. I've only had the Quest for a few months and I already had to change one of the batteries in the controller. The silicone grips makes it more comfortable and easier to hold the controllers. I can't even count how many times my kids have dropped the controllers. Add the protective rings and it's (almost) kid-proof. It was easy to set up. I wish we didn't have to take off the back cover and hand strap though. Now I have to put them somewhere where I will hopefully remember. I like how it comes with 1 charging cable but a splitter so that I can charge both controllers at the same time. It helps that it lights up to see that they are charging.

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.text: The Lampelc Headset Charging Dock was easy to put together. Plastic seems a little flimsy but it's doing a good job holding the headset and controllers. I have two Oculus Quest 2 sets so I had headsets, controllers and charging cables all over the place. This stand keeps everything together and it looks nice. I love how the green light lets me know when the headset is fully charged.

reviews.title: Comfortable Head Strap
reviews.text: I hated the original Oculus Quest 2 head strap. It would make my head hurt. I would also get headaches because the picture was blurry. I would have to keep pulling the velcro and adjusting the headset. At first, I was hesitant about this head strap. It looked bulky and the battery felt heavy. But once I put it on it was so lightweight and comfortable. I like the knob adjustment in the back over the velcro strap. With all my headbanging playing Smash Drums, the headset didn't even fall down my face. I played for an hour and the battery life barely went down.

reviews.title: Doesn't stay on
reviews.text: I can't tell you how much extra time this Magnetic Battery provides because it doesn't stay on the head strap.  My son would attempt to put the head strap on and the clip would fall off. And if he managed to get it on without the clip falling off, if he made a head movement, the battery would fall off. Both the clip and the magnet are not strong enough to hold the battery in place. Disappointed.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: It felt heavy when I took the head strap out of the box but once I put the head strap on, I did not notice the weight of it. It took me awhile to figure out the back cushion part snaps in place. Also the battery was not always charging the headset. I would have to push the plug back in for it to start charging again. I do have a protective case over the headset so maybe it is knocking the plug out a little? Overall, the head strap is comfortable to wear and easy to adjust. I wasn't crazy about the lights on the back. It's quite bright and since I'm wearing the head strap, I can't see the lights anyway.

reviews.title: Best game of the Raving Rabbids
reviews.text: I bought this gift as a gift for an adult family member.  I own all the Wii Raving Rabbid games.  I am a huge fan of all the Raving Rabbids games however, this is by far my favorite one out of all of them.  I would recommend this game for the whole family.  My nephews and niece (ages 7-16) always want to play this game when they come over.

reviews.title: By far one of the best family games on the Wii
reviews.text: This is by far one of the best family games on the Wii.  I know this is geared towards children but I can tell you from a 30 year old who has broke this out NUMEROUS times for family functions, game nights with our friends, with my nephews and niece, etc, it's been a great game for everyone of all ages.  The oldest has been 60 and the youngest has been 6, if that gives you a spectrum how fun it is.  There is fun games for all like (dodge ball, tether ball, slot cars, paper racers, dart shooting, and wall ball).  Dodge ball seems to be the fan favorite as 4 people can play and it gets really competitive (especially when adults are playing).  Anyway, great family game for all ages and I would recommend buying this for your Wii.

reviews.title: It's just ok
reviews.text: Let me preface, I own several Wii games (like over 50 or so) and this game is just ok.  Granted I am in my early 30's but even my nephews and niece who are of all ages (6,9,10,12,15,17,etc.) and all have pulled this game out of my collection since it sounds like fun.  Within 10 minutes they are all bored with it.  It's not bad but it's just not a game that keeps your interest very long. I really wouldn't waste your money on this game.  It's not horrible, it's just ok and I guess if I am going to own a game, I don't want any "just ok" games.

reviews.title: It's ok
reviews.text: I am huge Mario fan so I thought this would be super fun.  It's not bad but I feel like I've went back 20 years.  The graphics are subpar at best.  It's a very odd game, it's definetly not like your normal Mario so you have to get use to that. I hadn't read anything about the game before buying it, so I didn't realize that the game is set where you are playing inside Bowser's body.  Hence, "Bowser Inside story".  The part I liked about the game the most was the story line.  I never really understood the whole Mario and Bowser thing but the story line in the game definetly helps you understand those dynamics.  However, I must admit if you are buying this for a younger kid, I wouldn't recommend it because it might be hard for them to play.  I am a 30 year old and I struggled at times to understand exactly what I needed to do at points.  It definitely not like "regular Mario" so if that's what you are looking for than this game might not be for you.  However, if you are a huge Mario fan and like the story line, than this game might be for you.

reviews.title: Disappointed Raving Rabbids fan
reviews.text: I own almost all of the Raving Rabbids and Rayman games.  I have all but one on the Wii and a few now on my 3DS.  This by far is my least favorite game out of all the games I own.  This one was a lot more difficult to figure out and very cumbersome than the typical raving rabbids/rayman games.  I was very disappointed and actually have stopped playing it which is something I never do seeing that I have to play the game until I beat it.  I wouldn't recommend this for younger kids since I am 30 and I struggle playing this game on my DS.  I wouldn't waste your money on this game.  The graphics are about the only highlight to the game.

reviews.title: $10 down the toilet...
reviews.text:
This game wouldn't be worth it if it were free.

It took forever to get this installed. First Steam installed, not that I wanted it to. Then Steam had to update itself. Then I was forced to create a Steam account, not that I wanted or needed one. Then the game installed. Once the game was installed it then updated the game, without asking.

After finally getting it installed I attempted to run the game and start a single player game. When the Steam program came up I tried starting an offline session but the game would then just quit out to Windows. I could not find a way to play, alone on my computer, without allowing some 3rd party software free and completely unnecessary access to the internet. I don't know what information they harvested but I hope they choke on it. I should have just stopped there.

Finally deciding to take the risk I allowed Steam to make a connection, logged into THAT so I could not play online and started a single player game. What a total disappointment. Long boring cut-scenes, dull graphics and the humor that made the original so great was so OVER done, so blatantly bad it wasn't fun or amusing it was just pathetic. I played for a short time, about 30% of which was spent twiddling my thumbs watching cut-scenes and finally gave up, quit the game, uninstalled it (which went far faster than the installation) broke the disc in half and tossed the thing in the trash can.

I waited all those years for this?

This game is not worth buying. Avoid it like the plague.

reviews.title: Decent Cable
reviews.text: I had high hopes for this cable. I often need to use my phone when it's charging and having a straight plug sticking out of the bottom of the phone is annoying and I worried about damaging the port. Thought a 90° bend cable would give me the best of both worlds. Unfortunately the plug end is just too short to use with the Otterbox case I have on the phone. The base of the plug hangs up on the edge of the case and the slightest touch rocks the plug out of contact. It worked ok with my tablet which also uses USB-C charging but I need one cable here in the back room to swap between devices and I'm stuck with the old straight cable. I'll keep this around as a spare.

reviews.title: Best game - Funny, Action Packed, Easy to learn, and long!
reviews.text: First, it's easy to get started.  No steep learning curve here!  The missions start out slow to get you acquainted, and pick up steam as you move on.  Plenty of missions means that the game isn't over after a weekend of playing.  It's funny, entertaining, and the best game available hands down.

reviews.title: Singstar pales in comparison to Karaoke Revolution - just not fun
reviews.text:
My wife and I have tried all of the karaoke games available for PS2 - and Singstar is the worst. It's not even close.

First, the inability to dial down the voice but leave the background music is enough alone to dump this for a good used Karaoke Revolution. Then the mics - they're MUCH heavier - perhaps 5-10x as heavy as the K-R microphones, and much bigger meaning harder to store when you put everything away.

The game itself, well it's not really a game. It's just karaoke. K-R is a game, where you compete, unlock things, win trophies, etc. SS does allow you unlock a few songs, but the gameplay is boring and unfulfilling.

The scoring is obnoxious and annoying compared to K-R as well. It grades 10x more for singing the exact PHRASING as the original than singing on pitch.

Go buy a PS2 - they're terrific. Then go to ebay and type in KARAOKE REVOLUTION PS2 and actually enjoy singing into your TV.

reviews.title: Rickenbacker is PAINFUL to your strumming arm!
reviews.text:
I'm a huge Beatles, Lennon, and Rickenbacker fan. But this guitar is flat-out uncomfortable and painful to use in Rock Band.

I'm talking about your strumming arm - the part of your forearm that contacts the edge of the guitar is just beat-up to no end while you're playing. There's no comfortable place to put your arm anywhere on the guitar while strumming. In stark contrast, the standard Rock Band Fender guitars always have a nice angled area that is perfectly designed for this issue.

I'm not pleased, and am planning on returning the guitar. For this much money, it has to feel good as well as play good. (And I will add that playing is perfect - spot on. No glitches or issues with the keys, the wireless reception, nothing. It's great)

One other note - I've heard from many other people online and in person that both the McCartney Bass and the Harrison Gretch have the same issue - painful strumming forearm syndrome (PSFS) "Puss-Fuss" is no laughing matter.

reviews.title: Best.  Game.  Ever.  If you have ANY Beatles love, this is your game!
reviews.text:
I'm a huge fan of musical games - I've got every Karaoke Revolution game, every Rock Band game, and a bunch of Guitar Hero's also. This is FAR AND AWAY my favorite, hands down.

Why? It's THE BEATLES. I love every song, know them all by heart, and love playing not just along with the music, but as a Beatle!

The graphics are awesome, the RB2 format improved a little bit, and all in all, it's just a great game.

The new harmony singing feature is terrific.

reviews.title: This is not Civilization
reviews.text:
Like many of the other reviewers, I've played and enjoyed the Civilization series since the first one came out back when I was in college. Each one seemed to improve on the previous one, with new elements merging well with the established tactics and strategies.

Sadly, this latest version removes elements that worked and added in new changes that pretty much ruined the game itself, at least as far as being Civilzation. If the makers had given it a different name, I would not have been as disappointed, but without the name, I also probably would not have purchased it.

I have already removed Civ V from my computer and gone back to playing Civ IV. It doesn't have the same graphics, but 4X type games are not supposed to be graphics masterpieces, so I don't miss much there. I play for the experience and fun, something that Civ V left out when updating hte graphics and playing with the rules of population happiness.

reviews.title: Better than Civ V, but no Master of Magic
reviews.text:
I remember the original Civilization. it's spawned many copies and variants since then, one of those being Master of Magic, which kept the basic theme of Civ, but added in races and magic to the mix. It also gave us the first appearance of heros.

Many of hte original writeups about Elemental suggested that it was going to be the sequel to Master of Magic. I looked forward to getting it, as I love this type of game, and trying to run the odl Dos Master of Magic on my computer doesn't work all that well.

Sadly, when Elemental first came out it did have major bugs taht left the game nearly unplayable. Fortunately Stardock didn't quit on the game and they have made numerous refinements and improvements. I have no had a crash in months, and the game appears stable.

Unfortunately, it still is no Master of Magic. The races are divided effectively into a light and dark side and the dark "Empire" races have a huge initial advantage due to their tech tree. They don't get some of hte top Techs that the light "Kingdom" races can obtain if they have enough time, but they do have a huge early advantage.

It doesn't help taht the AI isn't very good especially at dealing with a well organized "stack of death". If you have time to put together a powerful stack of 8-9 high level units, you can easily crush anything the computer sends against you. Tactics tend to be simple. Keep one stack together and build it up to a high level doing quests and killing the wandering monsters until its powerful enough to kill anything it faces.

The game is in my mind better than Civ V. It doesn't have the city states, but it offers more choices in the city management and tech choices.

A good game, but not a great one. I hate that I paid full price considering what I know now, but its not a horrible deal either.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text:
I've always been a huge fan of console RPGs, but usually find that I cannot manage to finish any game. I'll play for a while, but eventually the experience gets dull and I stop.

This game is one where after 60 hours played, I'm not only still playing, but actually looking for more to do, even if its just wandering the ocean on my golem looking for new islands to pick up.

Others have talked about most of the aspects. The game itself is not completely unique, but it is rare. Crafting is simple, but a good deal of planning must go into obtaining the resources for many of the best items, and obtaining recipes usually means completing quests for the games NPCs. Getting those quests usually requires a high level of friendship with the NPC, so again, there's a lot of planning to put into the game.

My only complaint would be the camera issue others have noted. You have limited control of the camera and there have been times I got stuck behind a wall until I could get the camera to rotate the view. Frustrating, but hardly a game breaker.

reviews.title: Civilization in Space
reviews.text:
More than any other 4X game this one comes closest to being Civilization in space.

As others have noted the interface is very busy, and the game does sometimes bog you down with details such as custom designing a ship, or deciding what upgrade to build next as your colony worlds.

It's a good game, and fun if you enjoy 4x turn-based strategy.

I can't give the game 5 stars though. The AI is not well programmed and the computer races will regularly take actions that display the limitations of the programming. Worse, there are times that no computer race will sign a treaty with you, even though you have been perfectly honorable up to that point. I have played several games where at some point I'm ready to pull my hair out because of the illogic the computer uses. It even extends to surrendering. You could have the last 1-2 worlds of one computer race surrounded and he'll suddenly surrender to a third race rather than allow you to defeat him. This is extremely frustrating, especially if you are trying to get a conquest win as you then have to start a new war with an enemy who might have been a friend up to that point.

Still, its fun, has an amazing amount of detail and technologies to research, and does not have a vertical learning curve. If you like 4X games, its worth looking into, but those who don't have the patience for the slow pace of most turn-based games should avoid this.

reviews.title: Great fun!
reviews.text:
It's hard to imagine that a game about being a pirate could be fun, but this game breaks all the rules about what is fun. Who knew that a game of sailing from city to city could turn into an adventure.

But that is what makes Pirates! special. This is not a simple trading game. Sure you can make money being a peaceful trader and sailing between ports, but the game truly comes into its own when you get into the spirit of the game and attack one faction or another. Once you join in the fighting, you can attack cities or ships, woo the daughters of governors allied to your nation, defeat pirates and find the treasure they buried on land, and search for your kidnapped family.

The controls can take a little time to get used to and swordfights are definitely a challenge at first, but the game easily becomes one where you start playing saying "I'll play for 1 hour" and when you finally look back at the clock 5 or more hours have passed as you terrorized the Spanish Armada and raided the treasure fleet.

This is a great game for all ages.

reviews.title: Fun,simple, not much more
reviews.text:
I have enjoyed playing this game since I purchased it. It's simple to play, and entertaining.

However, it isn't a deep game, nor does it really present challenges which offer a feelign of reward when they are completed. Despite the quest system laid over the Sims engine, this game has a limited range of options.

I am not even sure I'd say this is a "simulation" game, even through it claims to be the Sims. You decide what path your sim will follow when you create them. To play you ahve to select a quest from a list of 6 that will be avaiable, dependent on what buildings and sims you have available. Completion of quests improves your kingdom and gives you money that can be used to purchase food and furniture for your sim.

The quests are rather straightforward and usually have a combination of 4 basic steps.
1) go to a location
2) obtain certain items
3) talk to certain sims
4) interact with an event point or person (may include fighting)

Finishing a quest with a high score requires concentrating on the steps while keeping your sim fed, and entertained. Depending on the "fatal flaw" you have your sims that could be harder. Some flaws have a greater effect than others.

As I said, i have had fun playing hte game and exploring the world, but it is limited. This game is not one that truly offers an infinite amount of gameplay. Eventually even with new quests there just won't be anything that feels "new" available to perform. The achievements are interesting, but most just require that you play a certain amount ot time to achieve. A few require planning, but are otherwise achievable.

I'd say this game is good for lovers of Sims2 and Sims3, not bad for those who like RPGs and want to try one that's a bit more talk than fight, but will definitely bore those who enjoy the energy rush of first-person shooters and sports games.

reviews.title: Playable and time consuming, but not special
reviews.text:
This is a game that can definitely burn a number of hours as you build up forces and try to conquer the world. In style of play it most resembles Elemental or Civ V than other older turn-based 4X games.

I have to say that I liked elemenats of hte game, but could not call this a masterpiece. The standard for most fantasy 4X games is still Master of Magic. Yes, the graphics are terrible, but the shear number of races and spells and the addition of heroes made the game a huge step up compared to the other options. Age of Wonders tries to capture the same elements, but for me it never quite achieved the same elegance.

Warlock doesn't try to be as expansive as Master of Magic. There are only 3 races and no technology tree. The only research is for spells, and the research tree is rather linear, you see 5 options to research and from what I could see the system works by a "researched X spell and spell X+1 appears in the tree. The spells appear to follow a very linear tech tree.

Combat is not much different than Civ V, the lack of stacking makes it a bit more tactically than Civ IV, but it's still rather straightforward in execution.

Honestly, this feels like it could have been a lot better if more time had been spent expanding options. The lack of races, the lack of a tech tree, the linear nature of spell research, all leaft me thinking the game could be so much more.

But I love 4X games, so I still enjoy this one. It plays faster and smoother than Elemental, and while lacking in some elements, does not have the same balance issues that make Elemental nearly impossible to enjoy.

If you like 4X games, and like the idea of adding magic, this is worth trying. Otherwise, it will likely frustrate you.

reviews.title: My niece and nephew loved this
reviews.text:
My family isn't much into games with the exception of rummy and other card games. This means that I usually struggle to get any member of my family to try any of the games I bring with me when we are going to get together.

However, when I described this one my sister was willing to allow her children (8 and 6) to try it. There was a bit of a problem getting my 6 year old niece to understand how things go, and neither of the children did a good job of looking and planning ahead, but both loved the game and immediately wanted to play again.

The game itself is so simple its almost scary. Setup takes only a few minutes and game play is straightforward, with no dice or cards involved. I managed to teach a 6 year old how to play and while the strategy might confuse her, she still had a wonderful time.

This is a great gateway game or one for a quiet afternoon when no one wants to have to think while playing a game. I definitely recommend this one.

reviews.title: Nice graphics, but the original was more fun
reviews.text:
I don't know why, but the original was a lot more fun than this was. The graphics here are much nicer and you can actually ride the coasters and waterslides you make, but something was missing.

I think its the same thing that has been ruining most tycoon style games for me. I play these games mostly for the tycoon aspects. I like having decent graphics, but for me the key is always the struggle to get some money and the question of if I can make the business work. RCT 3 minimized that aspect to push the graphics and a few other features that were unsatisfying for me.

This is not a bad game, but it doesn't do anything special and the original has more coaster types and options. The only advantage RCT3 has is the graphics and the fact that its new enough to work with less trouble on the latest version of Windows.

reviews.title: Winning the world with trade
reviews.text:
I quickly found that republics end up with lots of money, especially if properly managed. Of course, they also have the potential to spend even greater amounts of money.

I think this is my favorite of the expansions. It offers a new twist to the game, and definitely requires a different touch. Republics rely much more on mercenaries and trade, which is a definite change. Even their marriages adjust as you now can end up paying money to arrange an advantageous marriage to the neighboring duke. (if you can convince him to wed his daughter to a common merchant.)

Not much else new, but anyone picking up this DLC probably already has the original game and has discovered the time-consuming fun and frustration that is Crusader Kings.

reviews.title: I am very Pleased with my Wii U!
reviews.text:
I have owned a "normal" Wii for several years now. And I recently decided to purchase the Wii U, based on how much I had enjoyed many great games on my previous Nintendo system. Thus far I am loving my Wii U! I did a systems transfer of my old Wii game data, and everything went fine! So I am now playing all my old favorites on my Wii U, as well as looking forward to new games which will take advantage of the new system.

The Nintendoland game which came with the deluxe set I purchased is loads of fun, and I would recommend the Wii U to anyone who has either owned or enjoyed a "regular" Wii.

The new controller is fantastic and I can't wait to see what future games will be like!

reviews.title: Excellent Wii Motion Plus Controller
reviews.text:
I just purchased this Blue Wii Motion Plus Controller for use with my Wii U, and it seems to be workng great! I chose the Blue version only because it was a little bit cheaper price wise.

Up until now, all of the previous Wii Remotes I have owned have been the older model "original" type of Wii Remote. So this is my first time trying a Wii remote that includes the Motion Plus feature.

It seems to work very well and is very responsive! I am very pleased with it.

I bought this controller because I needed a Wii remote which has the Motion Plus features in order to play certain games.

reviews.title: Awesome Game!
reviews.text:
I just recently picked up The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword for play on my Wii U, and I just wanted to say how much I am enjoying it!

I have been a Big Fan of the Zelda series for years now, and I can honestly say that I am not disappointed with Skyward Sword! I have been been playing for quite a few hours now (I think around fifteen or so thus far) and everything seems just great!

The experience seems very well put together and seems to include all of the Classic Zelda elements!

reviews.title: Very nice rechargeable batteries...
reviews.text:
I thought I would try these Replacement Rechargeable Batteries for Wii my Remote Controllers, and I have been very pleased with them.

I have also tried using one of the rechargeable batteries to play games with while it was plugged into a USB port (and charging) and it seemed to work just fine with no problems.

reviews.title: Works fairly well as long as..
reviews.text:
I purchased this Wii Recharge Station and have found it to work fairly well, although, there might be problems if certain areas do not always make good contact with each other.

EDIT: So charging may be a bit "hit or miss" depending on if the contact areas connect with each other properly for the individual unit that you have.

I have read that a few other folks have also noticed these sorts of issues with this type of recharge station.

reviews.title: Fantastic game so far!
reviews.text:
I recently purchased the Nintendo Switch version of the game "The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild" and I must say I am very pleased with it!

Keep in mind I haven't played it for very long, ..but this game appears to be simply awesome!

Breath of the Wild definitely looks like a game that I am going to be playing for a long, long time to come. The sheer size and depth of the world (and it's gameplay) seems incredible.

As a huge fan of the Zelda series I was hoping this game would be something special.. and that most definitely seems to be the case!

reviews.title: Really Great Product!!
reviews.text:
I just recently purchased this fine item, the "amFilm Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Nintendo Switch 2017 (2-Pack)" and I must say that I am very pleased with it!

Let me start off by saying that I am not really good at installing this type of item, in fact I have never done anything like this before.

So I was glad that this screen protector package includes two tempered glass screens within each set.. I presume that this is just in case you are not totally happy with your first attempt at installing this product.

That is sort of what happened to me. I installed the first tempered glass screen protector fairly easily.. except for the fact that I ended up with one small piece of dust that became trapped beneath the screen protector during installation.

I must stress that this error was due solely to my own actions, and not because of any flaws in the product. It was due to my inexperience.

I ultimately ended up removing by screen protector completely, which of course rendered the first tempered glass screen protector useless. And I started over fresh, using second tempered glass screen protector contained in the set.

My second attempt at installing this item was successful.. and I am very pleased with the end result!

I was able to find a video on YouTube detailing how to install a tempered glass screen protector on the Nintendo Switch.. using what was called the "Hinge Method". (The "Hinge Method" basically involves using some tape to secure the screen protector securely to the Nintendo Switch during installation.. and I recommend using this method.)

This screen protector seems to be a really Wonderful and well made product! I am most pleased!

reviews.title: Really Excellent Nintendo Switch accessory!
reviews.text:
A while ago now (way back when I first bought my Nintendo Switch console) I also purchased this fine item, the Nintendo Switch - Joy-Con Charging Grip (by Nintendo).

I must say that I'm very happy with it. This item allows me to charge my Nintendo Switch Joy con controllers using an included USB charging cable, which I can easily plug in to the Nintendo Switch Dock.

The item is really easy to use and I can even charge the controllers while I am using them to play games. This device really comes in handy if you buy extra joycon controllers.. because you can use it to charge them up.. while keeping the original two controllers attached to the switch itself to keep them charged.

This is a very good product!

reviews.title: Really Fantastic Controller!!
reviews.text:
A while ago now (back shortly after I had first bought my Nintendo Switch console) I had also purchased this Fantastic item, the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller (by Nintendo).

And I have to say that I am most pleased with it! This controller is amazing! And it works very well. I highly recommend it to anyone who plans to purchase a Nintendo Switch. You won't be disappointed.

Now.. don't get me wrong.. The standard joy-con controllers, which come with the Nintendo Switch work fine as well. They really do.

But, if you are like me, I am sure you can appreciate the option for purchasing a more standard type of game controller.. And the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller is an excellent choice!

It feels great in the hands, and is highly responsive.. exactly what you would expect from a well-built Nintendo brand controller.

If you're thinking about getting a Nintendo Switch console, you really should consider also investing in this great controller! It will just give you a more classic way of playing your games. And you'll find that you will prefer playing certain titles with this controller.

It is that good.

reviews.title: Very useful and well-made product!!
reviews.text:
A short time after I purchased my Nintendo Switch console, I also bought this Excellent item, the HORI Compact Playstand for Nintendo Switch (Officially Licensed by Nintendo). I am very glad that I did!

If you think you will probably be using your Nintendo Switch often in what is commonly referred to as "Table Top" mode, then you will most likely want to pick up one of these incredibly useful Play Stand accessories.

The Play Stand itself is very easy to use, and it provides you with three different viewing angles.

And, because this Play Stand raises your Nintendo Switch up off of the table, you can then connect a USB C type connector to the bottom of your Switch, thus allowing you to charge your system, while the play Stand is being used. This is a nice plus.

The HORI Play Stand is well-constructed.. and I would definitely​ recommend it to anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch!

reviews.title: Very Nice (and Useful Product)!
reviews.text:
A while ago I purchased this item, the Nintendo Switch Wired Internet LAN Adapter by HORI (Officially Licensed by Nintendo) .. and I must say that thus far I am very satisfied with it!

I bought this Wired Internet LAN Adapter in the hopes that it would provide a more stable internet connection for my Nintendo Switch (while it is withinn the Dock).. in addition to the standard Wi-Fi connection that I typically use (whenever my Switch in not Docked).

So far it seems to work just fine!

In case you don't know, this process basically works pretty much as expected: As long as my Nintendo Switch is within the Dock (and thus connected to my TV) the Wired Internet LAN Adapter is used to connect it to the internet.

But as soon as I remove my Switch from the Dock (using the Switch as a handheld device).. the active internet connection automatically switches over to my Wi-Fi connection.

And of course whenever I place my Switch back into the Dock.. The Wired internet connection becomes active once again.

The Wired Internet LAN Adapter was also very easy to connect to my Nintendo Switch console. The adapter simply plugs into the blue USB connector on the Dock.

As I said I am very happy with it!

reviews.title: Another Really Fun Nintendo Switch Game!
reviews.text:
A while ago I purchased this game, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe - Nintendo Switch (by Nintendo).. and I have to say that it is a lot of fun!

The graphics are great, the gameplay is smooth, and the overall experience is very enjoyable! This game also allows you to play online.. against other players. And of course you can play single player as well if you like.

I would very likely recommend this title to almost anyone who owns a Nintendo Switch!

reviews.title: A Game that is Tons of Fun!
reviews.text:
Quite a while ago now I purchased this Wonderful game, ”Splatoon 2" for the Nintendo Switch.. and I have to say that I have really enjoyed it!

Even though I had owned a Wii U for several years.. somehow I had simply never picked up the original "Splatoon" game for it.

So when "Splatoon 2" came out for the Nintendo Switch, I knew I had to give it a try. I am very glad that I did! The gameplay is really amazing.. and it is loads of Fun!

I can see why this title has been such a huge hit!

reviews.title: Great Game for the Nintendo Switch !!!!!!
reviews.text: I while ago I purchased this Wonderful game "Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle" for the Nintendo Switch and I have to say that I truly Loved it !!!!!!  It is a fun strategy game that is very challenging !!!!!!!!  It has got to be one of my favorite Switch Games !!!!!!! Highly recommended !!!!!!!!

reviews.title: RIP tangled cords
reviews.text:
PS2 users and the people who live with them can breathe a sigh of relief after buying this cordless controller. Installation is so easy that anyone who can read Basic English can complete it in minutes, including reading time and putting in the two AA batteries which are included in the package. Quadruple your time if you're counting the time it takes to open the tightly sealed packaging as this may require the use of power tools. (Slight exaggeration)

After releasing the controller from bondage and putting in the batteries the right way, simply plug the receiver into the slot where the old wired controller used to be, and you're good to go.

My son, the resident expert, reports better control, better feel and better buttons, and I guess he likes it because he disappeared with it into his room, and we've had a peaceful day since then.

Instead of sitting up close to the TV, he can now sit way back on the bed in royal comfort, and best of all, I know I won't be risking my neck tripping over wires as I pass through the war zone. Another thing that I can say is majorly cool and improved is the vibration feature. I received permission to hold it and push a few buttons during a game, and this feature really put me in the game. After being rescued from peril by an exasperated child, I retired hurt, but very pleased with this controller.

Two minor cons are keeping track of the controller without using a tracking device or bloodhound, and having to change the batteries every 45-50 hours of playing time. No biggies.

Amanda Richards, December 25, 2008

reviews.title: Oh, my achin' agin' anteriors!!
reviews.text:
Santa dropped this off at our house the other day, and I'm pretty sure he had a smile on his ruddy face when he did it. "I'll teach those bleedin' couch potatoes", he said with a laugh. "Ho Ho Ho", and off the old jelly belly flew, with his sleigh full of Wii related accoutrements for sedentary families around the world.

Having the good fortune to have a semi-geek in the house, the Wii thing was soon set up in the kid's bedroom, and after 5 hours I thought I should check on the adult kid and the little kid - just in case.

Santa had sadistically included an extra controller and nunchuk with the package, so added to the pair that comes with the set, a full scale 2 kid war was in progress, covering bragging rights for five included games - boxing (little kid leading), bowling (big kid ahead), baseball (no clear advantage - but then we don't play baseball here, because it's just not cricket), tennis (neither will see Wimbledon) and golf (Tiger's safe for now)

They had set up a Mii (avatar) for each member of the family (self included), and looking at the body shape they chose for me, I immediately remembered that I should make a New Year resolution to lose weight.

Soon enough a challenge was issued, and hours later I emerged as the household bowling champion, but threatening to sue for physical abuse for my boxing loss. (I think they made it personal)

All these games have an aerobic and physical element, and if you don't get yer lazy azz in gear, nothing much happens. Bowling for instance, requires you to swing the controller like you would a bowling ball (making sure that you secure it around your wrist first so you don't put a hole in your TV), and after hours of unaccustomed exercise, your muscles can really feel the burn. And it's not only your arm muscles. One does not bowl without the correct body language after all.

Oh the pain!!

Now they're looking at all the other doo-dads and wing-dings to further their Wii experience, and making strong birthday and father's day hints. IMHO they should drop off their requests to the fat man in the red suit, and get HIM to come over and play some games.

Off to review some Icy Hot and Radian B, and make a massage appointment.

Amanda Richards, December 28, 2008

reviews.title: A big bundle of unnecessary clutter
reviews.text:
Adjective:
Not necessary: dispensable, inessential, needless, nonessential, uncalled-for, unessential, unneeded, unrequired

Add:

Superfluous
Redundant

And:

Fugeddaboudit

I thought that this would have been a fun accessory set for the Wii Sports package, but on reflection, I should have used the money towards an additional controller or nunchuck instead.

1. The pieces don't fit together well, and it requires some patience to get the threads to line up properly.
2. The base that holds the controller feels flimsy, and if you use too much force to unscrew the attachment, it'll probably break.
3. The base is uncomfortable for small hands, especially for the baseball grip.
4. You lose the vibration effect
5. In baseball, you have to take the controller out of the handle to pitch, or else look rather silly pitching with a bat in your hand. It doesn't take long, but it's something you don't need to do if you're not using the accessory.
6. You'll need to take the controller out of the padded sleeve before using these accessories. (And then put it back on when you're through)

The bottom line is that these accessories add nothing to the Wii Sports experience, and you're much better off keeping things simple and using the regular remote controller on its own.

Amanda Richards, March 7, 2009

reviews.title: D'oh, oh dear!
reviews.text:
Let's start at the very beginning.
If you're new to gaming, this is NOT a very good place to start.
You're better off beginning with I, II, III
Or you'll go directly to d'oh (and probably give up)

The graphics are fantastic, and the settings and story line imaginative. There are new weapons, skills, maps, characters and modes, but unfortunately the controls are confusing beyond my comprehension (my fault entirely, I'm sure)

Loaned to a friendly (and mature) teenager who had prior experience with the game, it came back a couple of days later with rave reviews about Ezio defying Templars in the hunt for an ancient library in Constantinople using hookblades and bombs (or words to that effect)

Not for the uninitiated, but from all reports this is a challenging game for skilled gamers, and well worth the time spent to master it.

Amanda Richards, December 3, 2012

reviews.title: Fun Game loosely based on the movie!
reviews.text: Nice fun game that follows some of the storylines from the 2nd Hulk movie. Tons of cool moves, a sweet level where you get to throw buses and cars and people while you basically demolish New York City add to fun in this game. It also has some of the hulks greatest foes along for the ride. If your a Hulk fan and liked the second movie and just like the hulk in general then this is your video game.

reviews.title: Best controllers on the market
reviews.text: Can't miss with these dual shock controllers. Wireless and easy with the ps3 system. Long charge life too.

reviews.title: Much fun
reviews.text: Fun throwback video game that lets you play all of the mystery machine team.  You can relive this cartoon classic as all the voices are there, the jokes and even the canned laughter is included.

reviews.title: Awesome game
reviews.text: A must have for sonic fans everywhere.  All the sonic games are included as an Uncle of a 5 yr old boy who is just discovering the world of sonic he loves these games!

reviews.title: Holy cool games Batman...
reviews.text: Great game set that looks as if your getting one game yet two are included in one nice case.  If you love the Batman you can't go wrong here as the Return to and Arkham are both here included.

reviews.title: Puppy Power
reviews.text:
I got this for a 6 yr old for Christmas and he seemed to be really pleased and has played this often. I would like to say though it seemed so repetitive to me as I watched him play. I was surprised at what characters were not there the Kitty catastrophe club and Mayor Humdinger were not even represented as you would have thought they would be there in the game somewhere.
It looked fun to play just everything was the same no matter the character. If they ever make another hopefully there is some variety.

reviews.title: Keep ur $.
reviews.text: Forza 3 was/is better. The graphics are NOT as polished, there isn't much new...with fewer cars.  I'm trading it in, ASAP!

reviews.title: Fun!
reviews.text: This is a Very Polished platform-game...with an actual story line and great graphics. CUTE?...yes, but in a nice, exciting & relaxing  manner. Although I'm not, I feel that the pre-teens should especially become enamored with "TIN TIN...The Game!"

reviews.title: Fun Flight Game, with a Great Story Line.
reviews.text: Although I normally purchase & play flight sims, THIS is a neat item. Has a quite interesting story involving the main character, "DE DE", a heroine who is also a crack fighter pilot. Locales from No. Africa, East Europe & ? The "Rookie" setting allows everyone to play...and win!

reviews.title: Hard...EVEN on "Simple" setting.
reviews.text:
If ya enjoy arcade-type flight games, you will NOT care for this. VERY difficult to accrue points/rank to purchase new planes...and you can LOSE points quicker, in some cases, very spooky.

THIS IS THE FIRST GAME I'D BE WILLING TO PAY $ FOR AN "OPEN-ALL-PLANES" CHEAT CODE!

reviews.title: First time great, second time BORING
reviews.text: I love the graphics and detail with this game. Love the interactive use of the xray, goggles, straw etc. However, after solving it once, going back a second time was pretty tedious. No new story line, no new characters and the rooms etc are all the same. The items to locate vary from the first go round, but by this time you already know where most of them are anyway. Moving on now to WordJong instead.

reviews.title: Loving the challenge and graphics
reviews.text: I'm an adult player and loving this game! For me it's just easy enough to make progress without feeling bogged down or too stupid to win. It's also just hard enough to make you think a bit - dead ends, certain actions that must be completed in a specific order before a path or doorway will open up so you can move on. I really like that the graphics are well done on the DS and it's a visually attractive set up. Glad I bought this one!

reviews.title: LOVE THIS ONE!!
reviews.text: I love this game. It's easy to play, the stylus works very well in this setup, the challenges are fun and increase in difficulty as you advance. The only complaint I have is that it's too easy to earn all the badges or rankings. I could do without the bonus point with the fortune cookie at the end of each round, but that is a very trivial complaint. I would totally buy this one again!

reviews.title: LOVE this game - great graphics, fascinating to play
reviews.text:
My husband and I bought a Wii on a whim after Thanksgiving and 7 different games to get us started. We bought games in a variety of genres so we could get a real feel for the system & figure out what we really enjoy. After trying a couple of other shooting games with the Wii pistol attachment for the Wii Remotes, "Dead Space Extraction" is the winner! This game is by far the best of all the games we've tried, including those that are not in the shooting categories.

The graphics are amazing, the story line was quick-paced, made sense and the story actually had us wanting to know more. We loved being able to play side by side on a single screen without having to do the whole split screen effect - each of us has our own cross-hairs to aim and shoot the aliens with, but on one screen so we can make full use of the 50" television. The other nice thing about this game was that the main characters change without losing the flow of the story and the point of the game - keeps things interesting and stirs up the skill set. There are multiple difficulty levels here as well so when you think you've mastered it, you can come back and let it kick your butt all over again. SO GLAD WE BOUGHT THIS ONE!

reviews.title: Adults Playing on Wii - LOVE this Game!
reviews.text:
My husband and I bought a Wii on a whim a month ago and bought 10 games in several genres to go with it. With no kids we're flying by our pants here when it comes to picking games - it's been a 50/50 proposition finding great games vs duds. This "Call of Duty - World at War" has turned out to be a great game!

Both of us play this one alone and together at the same time and we've been having a blast with it either way. The story line is engaging, the graphics are excellent on a large high def television, we've definately found ourselves laughing at the humor (maybe inappropriately, but who cares, it's a GAME!) and laughing at each other as we play through the campaigns, the difficulty level is about right for first time gamers. We're challenged, but not to the point of frustration or watching my husband fling the Wii out a window. One of things I really like is that we can play together at the same time with two targets on a single screen - no split screens here.

One hint - We did buy the smaller pistol type guns to use with this one rather than the big Wii Zapper contraption which really makes the game so much better! When we conquer this one, we'll definately move on and buy the next verson of the "Call of Duty" game.

reviews.title: Difficult for newbies, great graphics and storyline
reviews.text:
First thing - this game is really difficult for newbies to the gaming world. As adults with our first game system, we purchased several games in different genres for our new Wii system. We bought one of the other Resident Evil titles and loved it, so this one seemed like a natural choice due to the rave reviews and the first person shooter perspective. I love the graphics here - it's very easy to get sucked into the world and the feel of the game without question. Especially if you have the opportunity to set it up on a Hi-Def large screen television - gorgeous.

However, this is a hard game! It's not a game for beginners unless you just enjoy frustration and shrieking at the tv and starting over again and again and again. The little tricks and subtle ins and outs that long time gamers all pick up as they play game after game after game hours on end seem to be needed and assumed for Resident Evil 4. That in and of itself is not a dealbreaker, just something I wish I had known ahead of time - I would have waited and purchased this game later on. What ended up happening is we got frustrated and stuck at the first village, stopped playing the game for a couple of months, conquered some others, learned some gaming tricks in general and have now come back to Resident Evil 4 with a fresh perspective and attitude and we're enjoying it much more the second time around. So.... not a game a for first timers, but one worth playing when you've gotten your feet wet elsewhere first.

reviews.title: Works perfectly!
reviews.text: After a power surge during a massive thunderstorm, the power supply to our Wii was fried. Nothing else was damaged, but when you have two kids desperate to finish the last level of Super Mario Bros, you NEED power to your Wii! I ordered this power supply and it works perfectly. Everything seems to be correct and I am now streaming movies and playing video games again. This is for the US with a standard household 110v outlets.

reviews.title: Substantial feel, perfect bedtime light
reviews.text: I got this lighted case for my Kindle Keyboard and it fits perfectly. I had been using another brand cover with the slide in pocket for the Kindle, but no light. The Amazon brand cover is heavier, feels more substantional all around actually. Insallation was easy - the little hooks clicked right into place on the side of the Kindle with a single try. The light slides out of the top right corner and lights up about 95% of the Kindle face. It's a pretty strong little light and makes it possible to read comfortably in an otherwise dark room. One thing I did like immediately was that the light doesn't spill out - my husband can sleep while I read without disruption. Definately glad I splurged and bought the lighted cover.

reviews.title: One of the most beautiful games I've ever played!
reviews.text:
This game is a side scroller, with beautiful anime graphics, and excellent voice acting. It's set during a war, in which many sad things take place. Although there is a heavy level of sadness to this game, all-in-all it can have a happy ending if you play it right.

One of my favorite things, is how classic fairy-tales are incorporated into this game. Beauty and the Beast, Red Riding Hood, Sleeping Beauty, The Blue Bird of Happiness, and much more.

One tip I will give is this: Never throw food away. If you have no room in your bag for food you find, make room by eating the extra. Eating is what increases your HP!

reviews.title: It's very pretty! But BLINDING!
reviews.text: I thought the idea of a glowing controller sounded awesome. However, it was TOO bright, and heavily distracting from my games.

reviews.title: Broke within a few months!
reviews.text: This controller worked just fine in the beginning. When I wasn't using it, I would set it on my shelf without rolling it up. But all of a sudden the left thumb stick was 'stuck'. Not visibly... my characters were stuck going left. I would jostle the thumb stick to no avail. Sometimes unplugging the classic controller, and plugging it back in helped. But eventually, it ended up never working again. I have no idea what could have possibly happened to it, seeing as all I ever did was use it for its intended purposes.

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.text:
My friend has one of these, and he convinced me to get it, insisting it would make typing easier. I don't like it... for me, it make typing harder. The buttons are tiny and glossy, so my fingers are constantly hitting the wrong keys. My other complaint is that it also made my controller much heavier, so every time I set the controller down to rest, the L2 and R2 buttons would get pressed (depending on what game you're playing, this can be seriously annoying).

Don't let my review stop you from giving it a try, if you still want it. My friend absolutely loves it, and says it's flawless.

reviews.title: I'd buy it again, that's how much I love it!
reviews.text: Oh man, am I a huge fan of Atelier! This game was everything I expected it to be, and was so much fun! If you're a fan of RPG's, give the Atelier series a try :)

reviews.title: Great game!
reviews.text: This was a pretty good installment of the Atelier series. I loved the story, the characters, and the new building your kingdom part of it. My only nitpick is that it's easy to screw up your ending if you aren't careful, and that after you complete the game, you do NOT get to keep your money like in the other Atelier games. But these few gripes didn't stop me from replaying the game three times in a single month ^.^

reviews.title: John Deere should have done a better job!
reviews.text:
Well, I got this for my JD-obsessed, former-farmer husband who is finally learning
to use a computer.

First off, he said that his computer came with a demo mode of this game, and he didn't care much for it.
Who knew? He never mentioned it, and I was happy to find a JD game. I liked the looks of the graphics.
So, he installed the game anyway and gave it a shot. It works better on Win7 than Vista or XP.

I do agree that the first several levels are boring as all get out. You simply harvest - back and forth.
The controls are NOT intuitive - it uses weird keys for forward, backward, etc, instead of the arrow keys.
He didn't like that at all, and in fact, found it very uncomfortable to use the keyboard to play.
That didn't stop him, as he was trying to get to a certain level.

There are places in the game where you can see unusual things (like a fire in the field?), but going over to them
does not tell you what they are, how to fix it, what to do, etc. There's nothing in the manual that he saw, so it is
just a smoking pile of mystery out there in the field. I guess someone dropped a cigarette or lightning struck while
he was plowing over a few rows!

All in all, I expected a LOT more from a game with John Deere on the label. We all know they charge enough for their
licensed products! They should do some quality control too.

I can't recommend this one. If he continues to play and changes he mind, I'll update the review.
Until then, feel free to try another game. This has a great package but awkward and sometimes boring play.

reviews.title: GREAT looking controller!
reviews.text:
Well, this controller is completely worth getting.
The blue color is amazing. We've only had it a little while, so I don't know
how long it will last. However, this is my son's current favorite
controller.

The glow part is very bright, and makes it easy to see all the buttons while
playing in the dark. I have to admit that this is one amazing-looking thing!

All thumbs up as far as appearance. After he has used it a little while longer,
I'll add his comments about the performance. Meanwhile - love it. Wish I had one
in green for Mom!

UPDATE: We have now purchased the RED Lava Glow as well.
Both of the controllers look great while playing in a darkened room.
No complaints of any kind so far on either button response or durability.
But then, the users in our house are older, not little kids, so maybe little ones are
rougher on them.

We enjoy all of the specialty controllers we've purchased here on Amazon.
We have both red and blue lava glow, as well as the white and the black iGlow.
GREAT controllers that make the game better somehow.

reviews.title: it is too bad no one could write a manual
reviews.text:
Well, this game was kind of fun, even if only for the challenge of completing a level.

I have now finished level 100 and "been accepted as one of the gods" (per the game).

The game was fun enough. It is a standard make-a-match-of-at-least-three icons.
The things are kind of small (at least for my eyes), and I wished I could enlarge the game!
When the chains are over the icons, you can barely make out what it is. I had to go by the colors.

That being said, the documentation that comes with the game is THE PITS. It tells only the most
basic information, things you automatically know if you have ever played any sort of electronic game.
The game itself has a few notes that show up as a pop-up screen while you are playing.
It is okay if you memorize everything, but I know I couldn't do it all!

My biggest complaint is that the MANUAL should tell you what all those bloomin' power-ups on the
side actually do! It doesn't. When you use one, it moves so quickly, you can't really tell what it
did. I finally got it that the globe-type ball will destroy something like 11 tiles around whereever
you place it. The hourglass gives you an unknown additional amount of time to complete the level.

The rest? I don't know - they go too fast - I can't follow them.
The flame burns some icons up, but which ones? I don't know.
The purple globe does something, but no clue what.
And on it goes...
So, using them strategically is really hard!

I think a game is a lot more fun when it is explained thoroughly so I know what the goal
actually is - not a random stab at completion.

I am in the process of going through the game again under a diff ID to write things
down as the screens pop up. Seriously, how hard would that have been for the developers to do?!?
Basic documentation of the game, and it is missing.

It was okay, but never pay a huge amount for the game, and know that it is going to be
a stab in the dark the first time through.

reviews.title: More match 3 games
reviews.text:
Well, I got this one because I thought it might be another level of fun
or some other sort of goals. I had the Athens game and wanted to see how
this one went.

First off, my game was faulty. Since I had already left a review for the seller
(that I apparently cannot change) and had the game for a while before I played it,
I guess I am stuck. Many of the sidebar bonus items don't work - they only show up
as a half an item, or just sit there, without being able to drag them to the game.

But overall, getting back to the game alone, it is just another one of the games
that you drag/swap to make matches of three or more like items.
You buy/build your port city while you progress through the levels.

Many of the levels are a little hard to see because of the small icons
and the color combinations (like blue items on a blue background). The "cure" for this
issue is to restart that level 0 it shuffles and you'll get a different color screen.

Overall, my rating is "eh".
I would not buy it again, and don't think all that much of the game.

reviews.title: What a great series!!
reviews.text:
I love to play games of all kinds, but many of the DS games are just not my style.
(I am one of the few people around that don't really care for Mario, I suppose! Jumping
for coins or mushrooms just isn't my thing.)

This game is absolutely crammed with brain teasers. Nothing that would take a PhD to solve, and
they vary in difficulty from easy to super hard. The difficulty is rated in "picarats", the point system
the game uses.

Like other Layton games, there is a mystery to solve. However, this one had a lot more to do than the
Curious Village game. There are extra games in Layton's "trunk", and you have to find ingredients to brew
various teas. In the course of the game you will come across characters that are thirsty and really want a nice
cuppa tea of some sort. It will be your job to brew what they want. If you serve the right one, it will unlock
yet another puzzle.

I finished Curious Village completely in about 16 hours of play time. (I wasn't rushing, but still wasn't all that
hard.) So far, I have been playing for about 22 hours, and still not completed. This is just more fun. You can keep
going back to places you've already been to, and there will be another puzzle.

There is also a place to collect pieces of a camera that was "dropped". Once you reassemble the camera, there are
several places where you can take a "photo". That is yet another part of the game - you then compare the real scene
with the photo you took, and spot three differences. If you get them all (per photo and there are 12), it unlocks yet
another puzzle.

I really truly love this series, and hope they continue to make them every year.
I can hardly wait for the next two. These are a little pricey, but honestly, they are worth it.
Lots of fun game play. All the puzzles are woven into a storyline that involves a lot of characters to solve
the mystery.

If you like brain teasers or even puzzles like Hi-Q, get this game. You won't be sorry.
