reviews.title: my son loves this game
reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old because I thought the commercials made it look like a fun game where you can build rollercoasters and run a theme park... which of course it is!  But what he's really enjoying is running around 'talking' to the other people visiting the theme parks and getting them to 'like' him.  Typically Cody has a very hard time with most Wii games because he's used to using the Playstation or Gamecube controllers which don't require alot of movement.  This game has managed to successfully keep his interest and even teach him a little about interacting with other people (listening to what they say and responding appropriately or talk about things that interest them).  I really never considered this game a teaching game when I bought it but he's having a great time and developing some people skills - it's a win win situation!

reviews.title: not an 'enjoyable' game
reviews.text:
this game really isn't that much different from other 'fighting' games I've seen - aside from the fact that there are lots of 'monsters' to be fighting.

The main thing I didn't like however was that after only 10 minutes of playing my son was so frustrated the controller was spiked off the floor, he's yelling obsenities, and crying. This is a game that he was looking forward too and for whatever reason could not get the hang of the battles and was very frustrated.

The graphics are good - even I enjoyed watched the monsters maneuver about but otherwise I really didn't see anything about this one to get overexcited about.

reviews.title: fun for adults to play wih their kids
reviews.text:
My son loved the idea of the Sims games for the computer but never quite got the hang of what buttons to press to get characters do do certain things (when social services came to take away a baby one time it was major trama in our house and I don't believe he's even tried the game since). While with most Wii games he has trouble working the controller to get it to do exactly what he wants on cue with MYSIMS he's having a blast creating his own little world.

If your a big fan of the regular Sims for the computer then you may not enjoy this game as it seems very simple and of course the characters are cartoonish but for kids and adults who just want to have fun, relax and take a break from everyday life then it's a fun game worth checking out.

reviews.title: perfect device to add a sense of realism to your racing video game
reviews.text:
we've never owned a racing wheel before so my 11 year old son and I were both excited to give it a try - the hubby is an OTR truck driver so he doesn't get too excited over this sort of thing very often - but he even had a great time playing with it.

Within 10 minutes Cody had decided that he doesn't like the wheel and gave up - still don't fully understand why he doesn't like it, but he switched to using the regular controller for the driving games and is having a great time.

At 37 years of age I do not possess a driver's licence and never have. Just have never learned how to drive. In any case, I had a great time playing with the wheel and loved the realistic feel as it reacted to whatever was occuring in the game - need I even mention that I'm a TERRIBLE driver! This allowed me a safe venue to get behind the wheel and experience road rage and all the crashes I could desire.

This wheel is very simple to use and looks very realistic so it's a wonderful way to make your racing games feel more intense and enjoyable

reviews.title: love the game BUT....
reviews.text:
we're more than a little ticked off at the way it's presented! If you don't have high speed internet don't bother buying the collector's edition because the extra costumes have to be downloaded from online. We have internet (obviously) but live in a rural area and do not have high speed internet and therefore unable to get the costumes - my husband just contacted the company and got a big fat 'too bad!'.

The bookends are cute and Cody's given them a place of honor holding his other Little Big Planet games. The stuffed character is okay but nothing to get too excited over but otherwise there's nothing to really recommend this package and certainly no reason to pay extra for it.

Honestly, my son loved the Little Big Planet games from the very beginning and I was so excited to get him this set but felt very let down by the whole 'downloadable costume' thing. For the price we paid they should have had the costumes on a separate disc or even had the game disk already contain the costumes. At the very least there should be another option for us poor shmucks who live in the middle of nowhere and don't have an option of high speed internet.

reviews.title: love these headphones, but...
reviews.text:
When I got these headphones I thought it would be a great way to avoid having to listen to whatever gaming system my son was playing on the television. Unfortunately do they not only drown out his yelling at the TV, but they also don't quiet the gaming noise either (I thought all you had to do was plug the device into the proper slot on the HD TV and instant silence, not so). Instead, my husband and son sat there for an hour going through the various ways to turn off the sound on the television and finally found some button on the remote that mutes it. However, if they forget to undo it when they're done then I'm stuck with a mute television and no clue how to fix it. LOL I don't know how it would work with any other kind of TV. We have a Vizio (if anybody has figured out how to get the headphones to work without all the drama please let me know!)

Now, that being said, the headphones work beautifully for the computer, iPad, and iPhone and the sound is awesome. I really love how big the earcovers are as well. I wear glasses so my ear isn't being pressed down onto the frame (which hurts after awhile). The glow from the headset is very cool even though you can't see it when you're wearing them but still... it makes a useful device neat to look at :) The headphones are on the large size so any visions I had of packing them to the local library for a few hours of mindless internet usage using them is out (the black piece you see in the picture sits on the top of your head - everything above that is actually way above it if that gives you any idea of how large these are.

When I asked my son if he had anything to add, he said the microphone could be a little longer. Apparently it only extends to the side of his face and he'd prefer it be closer to his mouth. Otherwise he loves this headset. It makes it much easier for him to sneak internet gaming time.

reviews.title: Rude, Crude, Socially Unacceptable ... and a WHOLE LOT OF FUN!
reviews.text:
ok, first off if you've ever seen the show 'South Park' then I'm sure you're fully aware that political correctness and niceties are non-existent - and the video game stays true to form! If you're offended by violence, cursing, or a complete disregard for offending anyone than I'd suggest you steer clear of this title. For the rest of you, grab a copy and immerse yourself in hilarity. I'm sure someone else covered the intricate details of the story so I'm not going to bother going there, but I do have to tell you I really enjoyed the way the game makers stayed true to the cartoonish appearance of the characters and scenes. There's no attempt at making them look 'real' or make the graphics more dramatic. It's the simplicity of this game that makes this game fun.

Admittedly I do allow my son (now 17) to play games such as Halo, Left for Dead an Skyrim so the rating didn't faze me. What did surprise me was his reaction when I told him I'd nabbed a copy with the Amazon Vine program. He thought I'd lost my mind and actually said "um, mom you do know that show has a lot of cursing and violence." I said, "yeah, but it looks like it would be fun" and to his surprise, it is... one of his favorite parts so far is right at the beginning when you select your player name. It had us all laughing hysterically and he keeps bringing it up in conversation.

reviews.title: Fun game but not something you'd play over and over
reviews.text:
I waited until my son reached the end of the game before writing a review and I was actually surprised by how much he enjoyed it since he doesn't particularly like playing on the PS3 due to the smaller controller (he prefers the Xbox 360 controller). Since we live in a rural area and therefore have to make do with satellite internet online play wasn't possible for us, however, he did love just playing it as a single player.
He got a huge kick out of being able to access people's banks accounts and discovering the things they do in their homes (spying on neighbors, fighting, in once case I believe he said that there was a suicide). He did mention that the police are very persistent BUT they don't have boats which he mentions is kind of stupid since it limits the ways they can catch you. (of course this he says is a negative but then complains because the police never give up.)
I do have to mention that he hasn't played this game even once since he's beat it and normally he does play games over and over so I'm not sure it's worth buying brand new.

reviews.title: the best pc stereo headphones I've had so far.
reviews.text: the best pc stereo headphones I've had so far.  We've tried cordless headphones and they're either really heavy or can't seem to keep a connection so I decided to give the Turtle Beach headphones a try and they're a huge hit!  The ear pieces are big enough to go all the way around the ear rather than laying on them, squashing down part of the ear (which just sucks when you're wearing glasses), you can have the microphone on either your left or right side by just flipping the microphone over and turning the headphones around.  The headphones are comfortable to wear for an extended period of time - and the audio is just right for my needs.  Granted I'm not an audio freak and don't worry about base, tones, etc. so for me as long as the sound is coming through and clear I'm good.

reviews.title: great set for Yoshi fans and kids of all ages!
reviews.text: I admit it, I bought this bundle simply for the amibo, but my 18 year old son has played this game over and over since it arrived.  He actually told me 'it's just too cute of a game to get angry at' - this from a kid who thrives on first person shooter games.  I have to agree with him, the game is super cute and a lot of fun to play... and I love the way the game creators make it a fun challenge to find certain coins so that you can get the different Yoshi's (my personal favorite is Moo, Moo).

reviews.title: great keyboard for gamers who like mechanical keyboards
reviews.text:
I had just bought my son a mechanical keyboard when this one became available on Amazon Vine so grabbed this one for him as well because I thought it looked cool. He has a couple issues he mentioned but overall he said he'd highly recommend it.

cons:
keys aren't flush to the keyboard so hair and other debri can get under the keys.
there's no website information or disk to get the programs necessary to change the colors on the keyboard. Fortunately my mouse is also made by Corsair so I knew where to go

pro:
the keys are really responsive. As soon as you start to press down they register.
its got a sound control wheel at the top right of the keyboard.
Windows button at the top locks the windows key so no accidentally leaving because I accidentally hit the windows button.
right next to that button is another one to control the light level of the keyboard so you can have it as bright or muted as you want.
the cord's really good (I was worried about the nylon cording but so far no trouble)

reviews.title: son already thinking of ways to use this prop for cosplay
reviews.text:
my son is a huge Gears of War fan so I couldn't resist when I saw this replica available in the Amazon Vine program and I'm so glad I managed to nab one. He LOVES it! The prop replica is heavy (just over 10 pounds) and with the exception of the orange safety thing on the end looks pretty real. My son spent over an hour walking around with it, displaying it and talking about the possibility of using it for cosplay.
While I thought the gun replica was cool looking I was surprised that it took so many batteries and really doesn't do anything besides having several LED lights.
From a collectors standpoint this is a brilliant prop replica.

reviews.title: great keyboard the gamer in your life will love

He even called me all excited because the colors synced up with one of the games he was playing.  I'm not going to pretend to fully understand how that works or why but he was sure excited and that made my day.

reviews.title: Love the compact size but maybe it's not for me
reviews.text:
SO at first I hated this, the caps key, letter A, and another were sticking like crazy when I pressed them! I found out what it was... If this happens, look down and you'll see the edges of those keys have some excess plastic hanging out, just pop the key caps off and use a knife to trim the extra plastic off. Now my keyboard works perfectly. It looks nice and the lights are really cool. Mouse works well, all buttons and scroll wheel work perfectly.

I don't think I'll keep this keyboard though, I didn't realize it doesn't even have the arrow keys to the right. I honestly wish this keyboard was just a few keys wider as it's difficult for me to use in my lap. I imagine it'd be easier to use on a desk but I needed a keyboard to keep by the bed and use on my computer there so I can sit in bed and surf the internet. This keyboard is just a tad too small and I miss my 10 key and arrows. I don't count that against my ratings though- I just didn't know how much I'd miss these things until they were no longer on the keyboard. You can use the letter keys to arrow up, down, and sideways but I can't figure out how to make that work no matter what key combination I use.

reviews.title: A great board game for a good price
reviews.text: This is a really great game. I love the artwork and how vibrant it all is. It comes with lots of tokens and cards which I love. This is not a game for some of my more casual friends, but for those between casual and hard core. Though any smart kid will be able to play this just fine. Pretty quick to play and shouldn't take too long to get the rules down. It's been fun and is a good price for how much you get with it. Definitely a game I'll keep around to play more and I do recommend considering it for your own game table.

With the exception of the large pricetag and the 35 minute install, it is great. I run a GTX580 and did not even update the drivers per the games own request. Great experience!

reviews.title: GTA 4 Where have you been all my life!
reviews.text:
I have never played or even knew about the GTA series until yesterday! What an awesome game! I purchased the digital download because I could not wait to go buy the CD at a store. The YouTube videos cracked me up!

The 13 gig download took about 2 hours on my 20 meg cable connection. After it self extracted, it launched the installer. Installation was a breeze and went off without a hook. I launched the game and Games for Windows Live automatically updated and patched it without any issues. The graphics were nice on default but I wanted to set everything to max. Went to options and maxed out the video settings (GeForce GTX 580). When I clicked apply, the game kicked me to the desktop and then I got worried because of all the negative reviews on Amazon.

Since I am running Windows 7 64 bit edition, I went in and set the game to run as administrator. It started flawlessly and to my surprise, had applied and saved my video settings. I started a new game and it has performed remarkably and without error or flaw! I am getting excellent frame rates and not so much as a hiccup.

I have nothing but high praise for this game and I am very glad I got it!

Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-2600K CPU @ 3.40GHz (8 CPUs), ~3.4GHz

Viper 12288MB RAM

GeForce GTX 580

reviews.title: The Al Gore, Geoengineering and Global Warming Game of the century
reviews.text:
I enjoy a good sim and especially a city builder. I read some other reviews that kind of compared it to a modern city builder and ummm no! This is nothing like SimCity and more like outpost, outpost 2 or other similar games. Very unhappy with the result based on other reviews. The graphics are not all that great in reality.

This game has the absolute largest agenda I have ever seen in any game or even movie. Normally I don't care because I look at games and movies as entertainment but this one is extremely obvious and in your face. First off, your faced with a choice to go with the green movement or with the alternative, who, are surely made into the "bad" guys because they use oil and coal among other things. I must say it's pretty true to character from what I have seen thus far(except the "conservatives" (ie: those who don't care about the green movement), who are made to be the bane and evil of society), even the environmentalist guys who are portrayed in such a good light are classic 60's Woodstock hippies.

All things aside, for entertainment value it is just okay if you can use your sensibility and common sense. Seems to have a decent and in depth story line if you can get over the socialist, geo-engineering, uber left and one world crap that is totally embedded within! No joke! If you have kids and want to help prevent them from being indoctrinated into the lie, keep them away from this game at all costs. I know many people will think my review is crazy but they are in denial. If you are conservative then you will understand this review with total clarity.

At the very least I am happy to have purchased this so I can warn people off. This is a sure method the green movement is using to try and sway younger peoples viewpoints and ultimately change this country and world into what they want.

reviews.title: Great in some ways, not so in others
reviews.text:
Ok first off, I had the Rift before this S model, so this is somewhat of a comparison.

The Rift S is definitely more comfortable than it's predecessor. The foam is soft and it seems a tad lighter. I wear glasses, and the S does not rest on them as much as the last generation, which is good. I can spend much more time using the Rift S because it's comfort is that much better. The S also slips on and off my face a lot easier than the last generation and I have a large head, being 6'5" @ 275lbs.

It is great that it does not use external sensors to track movement, because it is just far less cumbersome and more of a simple plug and play device now. I have an Acer Predator 17, which has a display port, but the Rift S does come with an adapter if yours does not.

The controllers are the same size and weight, which is really good. They are far less bulky than it's competitors, which makes using the VR much more enjoyable in my opinion.

Headset tracking of itself is flawless, it is right on when you move your head around. However, I do get headset out of bounds type messages just looking around sometimes and that is annoying.

Eye relief, I don't really know about. I've adjusted it to max (72) and least and noticed zero difference in anything.

The bad news.

External tracking of the controllers is glitchy and glitchy a lot. You no longer have a fine tracking experience that is so smooth, as it was in the previous Rift. Your hands in the VR like to twitch, jump and sometimes freeze. It's not 100% of the time that it does this, but it happens frequently enough to be bothersome. The rest of the time it is smooth and responsive.

Optics. This is where the Rift S falls even shorter, in my experience. For starters, your field of view has reduced and it is not quite as immersive as the previous Rift. For example, it is as though you are looking through toilet paper tubes now, as there are large black areas of nothing surrounding the visual field. Tunnel vision. Although the experience is still fun, I am very disappointed in this, as it has lost some of it's VR experience as a result.

The resolution is supposed to be higher, but I do not see that at all. Fonts are still grainy and it is too similar to the last Rift to say that there is much, if any improvement in resolution.

The screen brightness is less in the Rift S, so it loses points for that. Although still pretty vibrant, it's just lacking something I can't exactly put my finger on.

Overall, it is a step back from the Rift in the critical areas a VR should be and a step forward in comfort and convenience. It all depends on what is more important to you.

reviews.title: Excellent Value for a One-Handed Mechanical Gaming Keyboard
reviews.text:
RedThunder One-Handed Mechanical Gaming Keyboard is a functional half keyboard with mechanical keys. The only issue I ran into during my use of this item was that once the re-bindable macro keys were altered, I was unable to revert them into the original "F" keys they began. The instructions were difficult to fully understand. I am uncertain if it was due to translation difficulties or a lack of space on the small pamphlet.

RedThunder One-Handed Mechanical Gaming Keyboard allowed me to conserve space on my desk. The keyboard is a good starting point for any gamer interested in an mechanical keyboard that does not want to commit to the higher price for a full keyboard.

With small rubber-like feet to help keep it in place and the light weight design the product can help on-the-go laptop users. The keyboard had built in anti-ghosting, so you would not drop keys when pressing multiples at the same time. This will allow more hectic game-play without dropped inputs. The half of the keyboard you get with this covers most basic PC games (most First person shooters), but may leave you lacking for games which expect a full range (such as Smite or a multitude of strategy games).

A small card that came with the keyboard from the creator pressing for those with issues to reach out to the makers and those with positive opinions to share their opinion. The website advertised by the production company was mostly not useful as I was unable to find anything of great use and there was a number of translation errors on the physical box [example: "Fast eating chicken stability with many key no conflict reaction"].

Overall, I find RedThunder One-Handed Mechanical Gaming Keyboard is a good product. It's ideal for someone who is looking to reduce their wear and tear on a laptop, shared keyboard, an addition to their portable/space sensitive options, or anyone wanting to dip their toes into a mechanical keyboard.

Of note: the box does not mention support for windows 10. They keys are click-y and the extra volume can be jarring for those whom live in close quarters.

Thank you for reading my review. I hope you have found it helpful and informative.

reviews.title: A Little Known Gem of a Game
reviews.text: I really liked this game. I had never heard of it before, until I did an impromptu search for games by Ubisoft and found it in the list. A quick view of what the game was like on YouTube and I decided to try it. The story is interesting, and teases you all the way to the end. It has challenging puzzles and the gameplay mechanics are easy to master. I'm not a huge fan of 1st person style gameplay, but it worked well in this game and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Since you play as one type of character (mage, warrior, assassin, etc...) you can play the game more than once using a different skill set each time. You can also choose whether to be evil or good, which will change the story as well. If you like Oblivion, Dragon Age or The Witcher, I think you will really enjoy this game as well. There are multi-player online options of play as well, that will further extend your enjoyment of the game.

reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.text: Works great! Easy install to the PC.

reviews.title: Good game, #3 is better.
reviews.text: Risen 3 is easier to play and has a great story. This one is just okay.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: This game is interesting, but clunky game mechanics make gameplay difficult. I also really hate that enemies and stuff doesn't respawn....ever...because it makes it REALLY HARD to earn enough money to get training and buy the equipment you need to keep you alive. Risen 2 and 3 really did a better job at that problem, making gameplay much more enjoyable.

reviews.title: Fantastic! Love this game!
reviews.text: Awesome Game! I'm on my third playthrough since I bought this and have loved it! It is a great addition to the Dragon's Age story. Being able to play as a Quanari is VERY cool! The new combat abilities are awesome! The new health/healing system takes a little getting used to, but with practice I am able to play without dying...much (Of course I'm on casual mode, since I hate dying). The new characters are interesting, the story is compelling, the created world is GORGEOUS! My one complaint is that the boss battles are perhaps a little bit too easy, but that might just because I play in the easiest mode. If you want more challenge, try the harder modes of play.

reviews.title: LOVE Dragons Dogma!
reviews.text:
I'm giving this game full stars, because I love Dragons Dogma. It has the best combat play of ANY RPG, in my opinion. The creatures are unmatched in any RPG for realism, creepiness and dreadfulness as opponents. The story, quite frankly...SUCKS!...but don't let that stop you from trying out this game.

DISCLOSURE: I haven't actually gotten to play the Dark Arisen portion of the game yet. I had been playing the game without the DLC for quite some time. I finally ordered the DLC version and was going to play, but a house fire destroyed my new copy of the game. :( I plan to reorder it though as soon as I am able. I have heard that it is much more challenging than the original, and can't wait to try it.

reviews.title: Love Hoyle, great games! Wordox Rocks!
reviews.text: I repurchased this game because my previous version got wiped off my hard drive when my husband took stupid windows 10 from my laptop. It works, but worked better with windows 10. With Windows 8, it isn't expanding to full screen, the way I like, but I love this game pack, so I will live with it.

reviews.title: Good game.
reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He doesn't do gaming much, but he enjoyed playing this with our son.

reviews.title: Great Sound - Mic is worthless.
reviews.text: The mic died the day after the Amazon waranty ran out. I contacted Turtle Beach and they said they would send a new mic piece. That was a month ago, and I still have't received it.

reviews.title: Worth it.
reviews.text: Good quality, keeps charge for a long time.

reviews.title: Parially recommend.
reviews.text: The keypad works great. The headset is not worth the money, it is a piece of junk.

reviews.title: Would buy again.
reviews.text: Love the Hoyle Games.

reviews.title: Full Immersion into Tamriel! Couldn't be happier.
reviews.text: Outstanding game! I am thoroughly enjoying my adventures in the Elder Scrolls Online. There is so much to do, I've spent hours in the game and have still barely left my original spawning area. I am a huge Elder Scrolls fan. This game definitely delivers a satisfying experience as far as being true to the history and lore of Tamriel. The quests are challenging, the stories engaging, the game world is beautiful. There are new mechanics for crafting and the skill/ability builds are different than what you may be used to in say...Oblivion or Skyrim. Crafting has been expanded and it really helps to have friends online to play with, form guilds and share abilities. That helps to let you focus on one or two crafting abilities, while your friends can specialize in others. You can all share the results of your labor to mutual benefit. I fully intend to purchase the DLC's to the game when I get a chance...and the money.

reviews.title: Middle of the Pack.
reviews.text: This headset is adequate for the job. The earpiece is fairly comfortable and produces good sound. I like the mic's flexibility. It is easy to manipulate it into a good position. The mic's pickup, however is weak, and I often find my online friends saying that they can't hear me, even though the mic is right next to my mouth, and the volume is all the way up. The headset also slips out of position, which is annoying. It's still better than the basic xbox mic/headset that microsoft sells. I will probably be in the market for a better headset soon. I need an upgrade to this one.

reviews.title: Mixed Feelings. Not quite the quality I've come to expect in Turtle Beach.
reviews.text: I am disappointed with this headset. It is definitely better than the vanilla chat headset the comes with the xBox One, but not as good as my other stereo headset by Turtle Beach. The sound in the ear is pretty good. I like the "open" ear feature that allows me to hear my family when they try to talk to me. The part that I'm not as happy with is the mic and the cord. The sound quality of the mic isn't as good as the stereo headset. My chat friends notice a difference when I switch and say they can't hear me as well with this one.The other problem is the cord.  I've owned this headset for less than 3 months, and the cord has frayed and is breaking at the base of the connector to the controller. Where the plug-in becomes wire gets pinched against me when I hold it. It can't be avoided, therefore it is breaking. I wish the connector was a 90 degree plug-in that I've seen on other headsets. Those seem to hold up better.

reviews.title: Simple, but smart.
reviews.text: the 90 degree plug-in is just what I need to keep the cord from crimping.

reviews.title: A must for wireless controllers.
reviews.text: Works perfectly! Fits xbox one console and controllers.

reviews.title: Wondered if this was a real Microsoft product
reviews.text: I had a lot of trouble syncing this controller to my xbox. Got really frustrated, until I finally just plugged it in with the charge cord. That didn't even work, at first, but it finally kicked in and synced up. The other weird thing is the center "x" button in the center. My other controllers have a button that is slightly domed. This one is flat and just feels weird. It is more awkward to press than the domed version. It just made me wonder if this was really a knock-off, instead of the real deal. It is working fine now, though, so I'll keep it.

reviews.title: Uncomfortable
reviews.text:
I gave this headset a middle of the road rating. It has some good points...like good sound, nice fabric wrapped cord, easy controls, and the headpiece adjusts easily, but it has some drawbacks as well. One of the most glaring problems is the ear covers. They are just too small...and round. How many people do you know with ROUND ears? Most ears are oval in shape. I think my ears are pretty normal size, but they don't quite fit in the ear cushions. It is very uncomfortable.

I tried using the headset with my xBox One in a chat group with my friends. At one point they were having trouble hearing me. There are only two sound controls, the mute switch (which works fine), and a volume control. I thought the volume control was to control the level of sound I was hearing in the earphones. Apparently, it controls my voice to the group, because my friends were having trouble hearing me until I tinkered with the volume control. When I turned it up, they could hear me better. That was a little confusing.

In the end, I took this headset off and went back to using my Turtle Beach headset. I don't recommend this headset.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: I am mostly a console gamer, but I wanted to play RLCraft, which is only available on PC...for now. Trying to use a keyboard for gaming was a little daunting for me. Too many keys...very confusing. I thought that getting this half-keyboard would help break me into it. I do like it. Using the mouse and the keyboard together works great. I'm still pretty clumsy at it, but that's just my learning curve, the equipment works great. Hardcore PC gamers would probably rather use a whole keyboard, and I admit that it would be better, at least for RLCraft. With the half-keyboard, too many keys overlap and I am not savvy enough with the PC to figure out how to configure everything properly. For now though, it works fine and I recommend it, especially for new PC gamers.

reviews.title: Fail!
reviews.text: I really HATE this controller. I tried to play Enderal (a mod for Skyrim) on my laptop. It was horrible. The look sensitivity was WAY off, and no matter what I did, I couldn't adjust it or make it better. Every where I looked the view camera would SWOOP from side-to-side, and up-and down. After a short while, it actually made me feel a bit seasick. I had to disconnect it and plug in my old MIcrosoft made controller. Fantastic! My old controller worked fine and I had no more problems. This is not a real Microsoft product and it shows. It is horrible. Completely unusable. Get the real thing instead.

reviews.title: Cute
reviews.text: Love this cute carry case for the Nintendo Switch. It keeps all the pieces safely tucked away. The hard case means that there is no chance of breakage during transport. Suitable for use while traveling in a car, train, or airplane. I highly recommend.

reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.text: This is a great little docking station. It does a great job of charging Switch controllers. It is easy to use, charges quickly and easily, It takes up little counter/table space. I like the way that the controllers can stack. I highly recommend.

reviews.title: Don't like it
reviews.text: I keep trying these off-brand xBox controllers, and I keep being disappointed by them. My biggest beef with his controller is that the controls in-game are just...swoopy! It doesn't matter how low I turn down the look sensitivity, when you look around it swOOPs left and swOOPs right. There is no feeling of control at all. It's horrible. In game, it gives you the feeling of being on a floating, with no connection to the landscape or spaces. I played Skyrim on it. If I swung around to smack a sabre cat that was attaching me, I would way overswing. Aiming with a bow was nearly impossible. I put this away after just a little while. I couldn't handle it. The wacky movement was making me sick to my stomach. Buy the real Microsoft product. Honestly, it is just not worth buying an off-brand.

reviews.title: Not as good as the real thing
reviews.text:
I have a horrible problem with this controller. For some people, it may be fine, but for me, I can't use it at all. Let me explain.

I play RPG's, like Skyrim, Dragon's Dogma, and Valheim. I nearly always play as an archer. These off-brand controllers have a real problem getting the look sensitivity right. For a smash and slash sword weilder, this would not be a problem. For me, I can't aim my bow. As I try to aim, the crosshairs swOOOP right and left, up and down, I have no fine control over my aim. It's horrible. Adjusting the look sensitivity does nothing. I don't know why I keep trying these off-brand controllers, but I am always disappointed by them. Pass this up and get a real xBox controller. My old, broken one works better than this one.

reviews.title: Nicest headphones I have ever owned
reviews.text:
These headphones are really beautiful. I've used a lot of different headphones and these are the most comfortable headphones I have ever worn. They don't put pressure on your ears or head. The ear cushions are exquisite. So comfortable.

The sound quality is really good. While playing Valheim, I could easily detect the direction where the cackling Fulings are hiding in the brush, or when a Draugr is trying to sneak up behind me. I really appreciate that level of sensitivity in headphones.

I don't have a cellphone, so I can't speak about the Bluetooth functions. I will say though , that some of the technical mechanics of the headphones were a little hard for me to figure out. The instruction manual wasn't much help. I am a technical dummy. My level of technical expertise is basically, find the button, push it, and I expect it to work. If it doesn't work, I will get immensely frustrated. I found myself getting very frustrated trying to get my headphones to work. I thought I was following instructions, but it just wasn't working. I enlisted my husband to help me. He got it working and it turned out to be something really simple...the USB cord for plugging the headset into my laptop wasn't plugged in all the way into the headset. I didn't realize that I needed to push so hard to get it to click into place. One of the things that confused me, is that the cord has a control on it, for sound. The control has no marks on it. There were 3 buttons and I couldn't figure out what all of them were for. The long was was a volume control. I got that one. I still don't understand what the other two buttons are for. It would have been nice if this was explained better in the manual, and if they were actually visibly marked with clear, understandable icons.

Basically, these are really great headphones. I just think that the company is trying to hard to look cool at the expense of functionality and customer accessability. Perhaps the company feels that it's customer base are savvy techies that would appreciate the level of coolness that they are trying to achieve, but that leaves us normals frustrated and struggling to understand how to use their product. If the company reads this review...fyi. Normals like great sounding gaming too. Make these easier to use.

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.text: This is a very neat little mouse. I really like the way that you can customize it's function and look. I added the weights, because they just felt better that way. Love the pretty lights. Everything functions as expected. I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: This is doing a great job of charging my Xbox One Controllers. The batteries are lasting a really long time, like at least 24 hours. This is easy to use and works great. I do recommend it.

reviews.title: Doens't work
reviews.text: I have followed the instructions, but I can't get this to work. My computer doesn't recognize it, and can't load the driver, so I can't use it. Disappointing.

reviews.title: Worked great...until it didn't
reviews.text: When I first got this, I loved it. It worked great and felt almost as good as my real xBox controller. But, only a few weeks after I got it, it went wonky. All of the sudden, the controls didn't work. They just quit working. I pushed buttons, nothing happened. Pulled triggers, characters in the game walked around in circles and I couldn't steer them. The controller was useless, and I chucked it in the trash where it belongs. Don't buy this. It is a waste of money.

reviews.title: Great game for everyone
reviews.text: This is a great game. I have three young children and it can be very difficult to get the kids moving, especially as it enters the winter months. This is a great way for the kids to get some physical activity. They can really work up a storm while doing it, and they are having fun at the same time. Most people thing of video games as a very sedentary activity, but this is a way for kids to get some great physical activity. It is also great for the adults, too. It is a lot of fun, and has many great songs. The combination of sound and video make it a lot of fun. It is also great for parties. This very has also seen some improvements over the others.

reviews.title: Good quality headset
reviews.text: Overall I was very happy with these headphones. The sound quality was very good. They look very nice. They felt very durable and of high quality. My only issue is that the mute button is the same as the power button and gives no indicator the user can see. You might try to put it on mute and not and there would be no way for you to know. Also, if you hold the mute button accidentally you'll turn the entire headset off. Still, the positives far outweighed the negatives in this set, and I'd highly recommend it.

reviews.title: This keyboard has a nice look. I like the red lights
reviews.text:
This keyboard has a nice look. I like the red lights. Each key has an individual light. There's no mechanical click to the keys, which I would prefer.

I like that you can switch out the keys. That was very easy to do. The entire keyboard was pretty easy to set up. I found that it worked well with gaming, better than our standard keyboard.

I really like the USB Pass-through-port. This was a nice advantage.

Overall, I am happy with this keyboard.

reviews.title: Great wheel
reviews.text: We are really happy with this wheel. It works great. We have four kids and they love playing the riding games at the arcade, but with a baby we just don't get out there that often. I don't let them ride real go carts or anything dangerous, so this is a wonderful way to get that authentic feel from our living room. It gives them the same feeling of being at an arcade right from our home. It can be used both with the Play Station or on a game on the computer. I was at first concerned about the negative reviews, but after looking through them, I realize that most of them are a reflection of the company practices and not this actual wheel. The wheel is very responsive and works great. It was easy to set up. Everything worked perfectly with no problems at all.  What a difference from the normal video game controllers and other wheels we have used. I like that the brake is separate. We can set it up perfectly for our kids. The force feedback is really realistic. We love it.

reviews.title: Outstanding keyboard
reviews.text:
This is an outstanding keyboard. First,t he look: I (and my kids) love the rainbow keys. You only have... 16.8 MILLION colors to choose from so I think most people will find this sufficient. I like that it is full size because some of these are not and skip the number pad. That is important to me. It has a great look. It was also not difficult to change the colors, which I like.

I loved all the shortcut and customizable keys. I can control my media easily with built in shortcut keys for for things like play, pause and volume. It than has about a dozen more keys that you can customize.

I thought the performance was excellent. It was extremely responsive. It was a very comfortable keyboard to use. It was pretty smooth and quiet. Everything worked perfectly and without a problem.I didn't feel any delay at all. For people who do gaming, this can be a very big deal. This is not just a keyboard for gamers, however. It's quality and features also make it perfect for home or office use. It felt extremely durable. I have four kids, and I need a keyboard that can put up with a little bit of banging.

reviews.title: Great keyboard
reviews.text:
It worked out perfectly for me to get this keyboard right when my son spilled lemonade on my old one. Both were Logitech, and I am very happy with this new one. I really feel like it is very responsive. I like the full size keyboard with the number pad - for me that is a must. It is very comfortable to press the keys. I am a writer and type very fast so I need something that is comfortable and works well.

I like the customization keys that this has. It makes it very convenient.

It worked well. It was simple to set up and use. I like the lighting very much. When I first got a lit keyboard I never wanted to go back. With this one you can customize it, which is nice.

I am very happy with this.

reviews.title: Nice keyboard
reviews.text:
This is a very nice keyboard. I really like the blue illumination. After starting with an illuminated keyboard I would never go back to a plain one again. It really helps to see the keys. The blue is very pretty, and looks great.

The keyboard worked very well. I thought it was very responsive. I liked how much you could customize with it. It really allows for a lot more customization that other keyboards.

The anti-ghosting is a great feature. Especially when you are gaming and typing quickly, it can prevent keystrokes you don't want.

This keyboard was very easy to set up. It was very intuitive.

It was not as loud as a lot of the other mechanical keyboards, which I appreciated. This would be especially important if you are near someone else.

I am very pleased with this keyboard and would recommend it.

reviews.title: These headsets are comfortable and they sound good
reviews.text: These headsets are comfortable and they sound good, but the mic quality isn't great.  I have $300 headphones, these aren't that level, but they definitely beat the $100 headphones I have and with the mic integrated they are a pretty good deal.  But the mic quality is about the same as a $10 cheap mic on its own and that's a problem if you are in a situation where audio quality matters.

reviews.title: Cool Colors And A Fast Response Time
reviews.text: This is a pretty neat mouse.  I have an RGB keyboard on my MSI laptop with similar color control software, so it's great to have a mouse that matches.  It doesn't have as many buttons as my other mice, but for gaming I have a custom keyboard that does all that and more.  But overall it works great.  Fast response, easy to click, and it looks great, what more can you ask for (other than a few more buttons)?

reviews.title: Great storage system
reviews.text: Great storage system.  I've used a few in the past that only held 6 or 12, this is far better.  Finally, a design that works.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Great mouse pad for gaming or just general use.  The surface doesn't irritate my wrist when moving around!

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: I love the colors...  The keys are easy to press and the response time is fast for gaming too!

reviews.title: A Good Basic Mouse
reviews.text: I prefer my G60 for gaming, but for a low-cost mouse to use on my regular computer, this one does everything I need!

reviews.title: Fits Right
reviews.text: This fits correctly and it isn't too shiny so I can use it outdoors still.  Perfect!

reviews.title: A Good Basic Case
reviews.text: This case does a good job of stopping scuffs and also carries a few accessories.  Overall, it works well!

reviews.title: A Fine Set Of Games For Young Kids
reviews.text: This is a good set if you have young kids.  I don't want violent games, which is why I stick with Nintendo where not every game is about killing people!  But I will say that these are not meant for adults, they held my attention for like 5 minutes.

reviews.title: Do You Love Gameshows?
reviews.text: On tablets, these games often end up having ads, or charging money to play after a time.  This version is not ad-supported, and the colors and sharpness of the display make the Switch the best platform for the games!

reviews.title: Great Controller
reviews.text: If you want to add a wired controller to your switch, this is the way to go!

reviews.title: Looks Sleek
reviews.text: This looks sleek and it performs well too.

reviews.title: Pleased with Mouse
reviews.text:
I really liked this mouse. It was very responsive. It seemed to be very good quality. It worked very well.

It had a very nice look to it. It was very attractive.

I liked all of the buttons and pre-programming options. I like that it has seven buttons and the wheel works fine. It makes it easier to use, whether you are using it for gaming or for just everyday use.

It was comfortable to use. It was easy.

I would recommend it.

reviews.title: Works
reviews.text: This cable (with an appropriate charger) powers the switch faster than it uses power (so if you plug in and start playing, the battery will still charge up).  NOTE:  To do this, you need a good charger.  I've got about a dozen battery packs, and only one of them will supply this much power!  That one is an Anker, but then again, so are 4 others that don't work.  The PowerCore 20,000 is the one that works, but Anker has made several versions of this and I own two and the other doesn't work.  So I guess what I'm saying is "good luck!"

reviews.title: Nice keyboard
reviews.text: This is a very nice keyboard. We really like Alienware and have a lot of products from them. They make high quality. I felt like the keyboard was very responsive. It had a good feel to it. It worked very well. It was quick. It felt well made. It also seemed durable. It had a nice look. I was able to type very quickly on it. It is good for gaming or just for general use.  Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Very pleased
reviews.text: These headphones were very nice. They were comfortable for my daughter. I really like that they have noise cancellation. The quality was fantastic. They worked great. Of course they are wonderful for gaming, but you could just use them for general use as well. The sound came through very nice. We have several Alienware products and have been very happy. I would recommend them.

reviews.title: Nice mouse
reviews.text:
This is a very good mouse. It was very fast and responsive. It can help your performance in your game. It works well than many others. I like all the buttons and the features. It feels good in your hand.

Alienware is a great company. They really put out quality products. We have several from them and have been happy. This mouse can be used for gaming or just as a general mouse. I would recommend it.

reviews.title: Nice headphones
reviews.text: These headphones were very nice. They were easy to use. They were comfortable for my daughter. I really like that they have noise cancellation. The quality was fantastic. They worked great. They were attractive. I would recommend them.

The colors are pretty.

This mouse was nice. I like that it wasn’t too big. It was easy to hold. It didn’t take up a lot of room. It worked as it was supposed to. It was pretty responsive. It looked nice and sleek. I have many items from this brand and have been happy. It felt good in my hand. I like the extra features. It is pretty quiet. It is easy to bring along. It worked fine. It was easy to set up. I would recommend it.

reviews.title: Great Cheap Converter
reviews.text: This works well, it took no time to set up, and it gave a good picture quality.  I had no problems with it.

The mic was very good. It was very easy for people to hear me. I like all the options.

reviews.title: Works with Nintendo Switch!
reviews.text:
I didn't know what to expect from this product as I have never owned a pair of gaming headsets, but I wasn't willing to spend hundreds of dollars on a pair of headsets that may or may not enhance my experience.

So let me break down the description given:
-- 7.1 surround - I've always see this more as a gimmick than an actual feature, even in headphones that cost hundreds of dollars but don't have discreet speakers. The computer sees these headsets as stereo and not 7.1 so whatever program you run, whether it's a trailer with Dolby Atmos or a game, the output will still be stereo. While their program supposedly tries to simulate virtual surround, you would still need the source to be 7.1 discreet channels so that their driver can process the signal to simulate surround sound. These headsets do not have DTS-HD or Dolby ATMOS certification so they aren't actually able to process raw 7.1 channel data. It means that in the end, the video player is still just playing stereo sound. The end effect of turning on virtual 7.1 surround sound is that the soundtrack is more "atmospheric" or "wider" sounding, but you wouldn't be able to tell that a sound is coming from your rear left flank. Since I never expected much out of this feature, I didn't mind that it wasn't true 7.1

-- USB - True plug and play on Windows 10. I plugged these headphones in and immediately, Windows output sound through them. No muss no fuss. It just worked. You can install their driver, which turns on the "virtual 7.1" feature but that's pretty much like installing drivers for any realtek sound card. You just have access to a few extra DSP effects. Honestly, I don't like extra processing to my audio signals. Being USB, it is a completely digital signal to your headphones all the way up until the speakers themselves. On 3.5mm headphones, the audio signal is analog at 3.5mm port, at which point, you will get some signal degradation just from the connection itself.

-- Gaming Headset with Microphone - I don't really play games online so I can't tell you whether the microphone is better or worse than any other headset but I can tell you that I used the Spirit Wolf with a few games and I was hearing sounds that I didn't hear in my Sennheisers.

-- PC Gamers - BONUS! This headset isn't just for PC gaming, it works with the Nintendo switch, too, using the USB port on the dock. Even the volume buttons on the headset works!

My overall experience with Spirit Wolf has been positive. The sound is crisp and clear and the high frequencies are very good but the bass could have been better. I'm not big on turning up the bass so it's not a big loss. I still feel that the overall sound quality is very good.

The headset is circumaural which means it surrounds your ears and the speakers are not pressed right against your head. It means that noise isolation isn't as good as earbuds or even supra-aural headphones (which press up against your ear), but there's a reason professional gaming headphones are this style. You can wear them for longer periods without discomfort and you are able to achieve a wider sound.

Overall, I recommend this headset for its price and overall sound quality. The ability to use it with my Switch is just bonus.

EDIT: I must amend my previous conclusions regarding the virtual surround sound. I recently started playing Shadow of the Tomb Raider and as a test, I went into the audio settings for the game. The options were stereo, 5.1, 7.1, and spatial sound. Reading the description for spatial sound, it states that it is meant to be used with Windows Spatial Sound (right click on the speaker icon in your system tray and you'll see an option to turn it on). Well, I tried the spatial sound in three different ways: with only the in-game spatial sound setting on, the in-game setting + Windows Spatial Sound on, and in-game setting + XEar driver 7.1 on. All three give slightly different positional sound effects but I found that the XEar effect was the best. The sounds simulate a wide environment and I was able to distinguish the direction of each distinct sound source. Very impressive.

reviews.title: joy-cons fit a little too tightly and charging status indication could be better
reviews.text:
I purchased this product because I wanted a grip for my second set of joycons and while I was at it, I wanted an easy way to charge those controllers.

Whie this grip looks like it will do everything I need (it will charge the joycons while connected to the power adapter or on battery power and it provides a satin grip that keep the controllers secure), execution could have been better.

Here are some of my complaints:
-- The grip has a satin surface which is somewhat outdated, I think. Most manufacturers mold textures into the plastic to give them grip. My past experience with satin surfaces is that after a few years, they become a sticky mess.
-- Perhaps it is the product that I got but I charged the grip overnight without the joycons inserted and the red charging light was still on when I checked on it in the morning so there is no indication that the charging has completed. This might mean that there is no cut-off for when the battery is fully charged.
-- The joy-cons fit too snugly. It is actually a little difficult to slide the controllers in and out of the grip. This could be because of the satin finish that is sprayed on to the underlying plastic.

Other features:
-- Charges the joycons with the built-in battery pack. A blue light indicates that the controllers are charging.
-- Not much heavier than the original switch grip.
-- Wider than the original grip. For me, this is actually more comfortable.

Again, this will meet my requirements but I wonder how long the internal battery pack will last if there is no charging cut-off.

reviews.title: A must-have accessory for the switch;  This is not an exaggeration.
reviews.text:
Firstly, it must be stated that in the early days of Nintendo Switch's launch, Nintendo Switch's adoption of the Type-C PD standard was unknown and news began to emerge that various Type-C chargers were causing electronics to overload. This wasn't limited to just the Switch, but cell phones and laptops were suffering the same issue. At this point, news of those issues have generally subsided. Power adaptor designers have taken safety more seriously and personally, I have been able to use multiple docks and hubs with the Switch with no issues. In short, this KIWIHOME Switch Dock did not blow up my switch.

This KIWIHOME USB C Charger is a very compact dock for the Switch. When travelling, it is usually necessary to pack the official Nintendo Switch charger for power. This third-party charger is no bigger than the OEM charger but has the additional advantage of a detachable charging cable, which means it is even easier to pack.

Of course, the best feature of this charger is the ability to act as a dock. In a normal case, one must add the large Switch dock in addition to an HDMI cable in order to play in docked mode while on travel. This charger allows one to leave the large dock at home. It is an elegant solution.

While on the topic of travel, this charger is rated for 110-220v. This means that with the addition of a plug adapter, this charger will work in Europe as well as the US and around the world.

An issue that one may face due to the design of this product is that the television may not be close enough to an open power socket. This would need to be solved either with a long HDMI cable or an extension cord.

reviews.title: My complaints may be down to personal preference...
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:a4d91a6fb11c550cd582ff40a0fe7596]] The Logitech G733 K/DA Lightspeed Wireless Gaming Headset is a League of Legends themed headset with a great design and colorful, but unintrusive LEDs. The headphones cover the ear and not on them. It also sports a suspension style headband. I'm not a streamer but this headset would not be out of place on a twitch streamer's head, in my opinion.

The most important feature for me when it comes to the G733 is the wireless feature and the sound quality. The sound is clear and crisp with a good range, but not a booming bass (which I don't mind. I would have turned that down anyway). When I put on the headset and launched Biomutant, I noticed that the sound was very close, almost like in a sound booth. Compared to my wired headset, the SADES Spirit Wolf, the sound profile of the Logitech G733 is much smaller as opposed to the large hall feel of the SADES.

Personally, I prefer the large, open feel of the SADES to the smaller close-up feel of the Logitech. It makes games feel bigger and more intense.

Initially, I wanted to give this product 3 stars but I realized that perhaps my complaint is a personal preference and Logitech couldn't be blamed for it. This is a good product that works well, but personally, I wouldn't feel that it justifies its price when compared to the sound quality of a sub-30-dollar usb headset.

reviews.title: It seems like this is all you would need for your Oculus Quest 2, but...
reviews.text:
I went through a bit of flip-flopping with the Eyglo 5 in 1 Accessories Case for Oculus Quest 2. When I saw the listing for this product, I thought that it was a great set that included everything I needed for the Quest 2, although from the pictures, I did note that the hand strap seemed flimsy.

When I received it, I found that the head strap was made of stiffer plastic than the original straps so it was very difficult to install. I was still worried about the click-in button at the top of the hand strap and the fact that it was so narrow. I expected that any swinging of the controller could slip the strap off. The silicone eye piece fit well, but at first, it gave me a fright because when pressed against the head, the cover would flare out and obstruct the sensor that Oculus proximity sensor, making it think that the headset turn off because it didn't detect a face. I thought my Oculus was broken! Lastly, I found that the controllers were hard to fit into the case (They needed to be looped through each other just so) and even then, the case didn't close without the back piece of the headset pushing against the top, creating a slight bulge. I found that this was a case of "looks good on paper" but not great in actuality.

Because of all of these problems, I was going to give this product 3 stars, but after spending some time with it, I found that I didn't mind any of those shortcomings. The head strap is much more comfortable and secure than the original oculus. The eye piece is MUCH better than the original cloth as sweat is easily wiped off (Facebook is currently addressing this issue and the Oculus will now come with silicone eye pieces). The hand straps turned out to work well enough. I don't worry about losing the controllers because I find that I don't have a tendency to flick the controller with my hand completely open. Lastly, I find that I don't need to use the case when I'm at home so I will only face the awkwardness of putting in the goggles when I intend on taking it on travel.

In the end, I got a complete set of accessories all in one package and they do work. I'm much happier having this set than not. The out-of-the box experience with the Oculus leaves much to be desired and accessories are just a fact of life. Just as purchasing a case for a phone or tablet is just part of the cost of the device.

reviews.title: Great nose piece but headband needs work.
reviews.text:
This X-super Home product for the Oculus Quest 2 comes with a headstrap and silicone face cover. Both of these things are accessories that every Quest 2 must get and there are many options available to fit the bill.

Out of the box, the Quest 2 comes with elastic straps that just aren't enough to hold the VR Goggles in place very well. When turning your head, the goggle tends to swing around and feel like they will fall off. Also, if you're one of the early adopters that purchased the Quest 2 before Facebook issued their recall where they will send you a silicone cover for the goggles, you're stuck with a cloth face cover that lets too much light through and gets pretty disgusting after just a short time using the goggle due to sweat.

So the X-Super Home head strap features a battery holder at the back of the head, the theory being that the extra weight of the battery will help to counter balance the weight of the goggles, reducing neck strain while extending the play time of the goggles. In practice, the battery makes the entire setup too heavy and reintroduces the problem of the goggles swinging around when turning your head. In addition, there was a design error on the attachment bracket where the slot is shorter than the tab so the battery holder never fully slides into place.

Due to the placement of the battery, the tightening knob is offset to the right of the battery. This offset design creates a problem with the tightening system where one side would tighten more than the other, giving an unbalanced feel to the strap.

The silicone cover, on the other hand, is quite excellent. It has a texture on it that helps to keep a good grip around the eyes even when you sweat and the flaps over the bridge of the nose is larger than many others out there. While not perfect, it greatly reducing the amount of light that leaks in. Compare this to the silicone cover that Facebook sent as part of their recall, the Facebook cover is smooth and doesn't have a flap at all to cover the bridge of the nose. The X-super Home cover is much better.

So a less-than-ideal head strap and a great silicone cover. Unfortunately, this doesn't justify the price of this product.

reviews.title: A good idea
reviews.text:
The basic idea is that most people need a grip when using the switch controllers anyway. Add some batteries in that grip and you can extend your play time. It's quite obvious when you think about it.

In practice, these grips feel good. They add more surface area to the controller than the ones that come from Nintendo, making it more comfortable to hold for people with larger hands. They click in well adn fit the controllers perfectly. When connected to the controller, the switch will show that the controllers are being charged, verifying that the batteries are indeed doing their job.

The only problem I have found is that these grips will lose charge over the course of a few days if connected to the controllers. This is because the controllers will trickle charge even when they are off. This is quite a waste and it is better to remove the controllers when not in use.

reviews.title: No need for a fancy dock.
reviews.text:
The fancy docks that you see for the Quest 2 usually has a place for charging the goggles, and two spots for the controllers. The only problem is that the docks are made for the controllers without the silicone sleeves that people usually put on their controllers. In fact, there aren't many solutions out there that allow charging while using the silicone sleeves.

With this All-in-One Magnetic Charging Kit for Oculus Quest 2, I'm able to resolve all of my problems. This system is well thought out. It comes with two rechargeable batteries and special battery covers that expose a magnetic charging port on the side of the controller. It also comes with a magnetic type-c connector for your goggles.

By cutting a small hole in the silicone sleeve, I'm able to charge the controllers without removing the sleeve and the cables are easy to connect because of the magnetic connectors. The goggle is just as easy to charge with its corresponding magnetic connector.

There are two problems with this system that you need to be aware of, though. The first is that the type-c connector is not very strong. It means that when pulling off the charging cable, the type-c plug with come with it. The second problem is that the three devices will be sharing a single cable and thus, sharing the available amps. The charging speed will suffer as a result.

Overall, not having to go through the hassle of removing the silicone sleeve to change batteries makes this kit worth the purchase. I don't have long play sessions with the VR system so I'm not so worried about charging speed.

reviews.title: Smaller than I expected, but still useable.
reviews.text:
There are many third-party switch controllers on the market and each make claims about compatibility or useability. It takes a little bit of digging to actually know which one is worth getting.

The listing doesn't say it but this controller's brand is Sound Fox. It is a fairly compact controller that is noticeably smaller than the Switch Pro controller. It is actually well-built and has a great texture. The entire controller feels soft and satin with nice analog sticks that don't feel loose. The buttons feel good and the digital pad is fairly standard.

Outside of these basic features, the controller has two programmable buttons in the back and turbo mode for all of the face and shoulder buttons. The programmable buttons actually can remember fairly long sequences of button presses and digital pad inputs. I used it to go through some particularly annoying menus in Xenoblade 3 that I needed to do over and over again (collectopedia). I programmed a series of presses, holds and wait times that allowed me to go through the menu 5 times with each press of the programmable button.

What's more, the vibration strength is programmable, the face plate is easily removeable (although I haven't seen replacement faceplates available) and even Amiibo support is built in. It really is a good value for the price. Aside from the smaller size, this is a great replacement for the Pro controller.

On the PC, this is a great bluetooth controller that can operate in Xinput mode for maximum game compatibility. This feature is something you don't find in many other third party controllers out there.

The only problem I have with this controller is the fact that the ZL and ZR triggers are digital only. When using this controller on the PC, you really need to have analog triggers to get the most out of many games.

In the end, this product is geared toward the Switch and has the added option to be used on the PC and mobile phones but without analog triggers, it really is only good on the Switch.

reviews.title: I've been looking for an affordable headset with surround.  This fit my needs.
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:bcce61b61b8337c3b68e072c0d20d249]] I had a USB gaming headset that worked fairly well. It had large speakers that gave the sound a "roomy" feeling, especially when paired with the driver software that it came with, but the wire was driving me crazy. I couldn't step away from my desk without removing a few things or I'd end up pulling away my computer with me.

So, I was in the market for a nice pair of wireless gaming headsets. I've come across many in the 30-dollar range but none of the descriptions for those touted surround sound. Eventually, I had to look in the 60 - 90 range.

This pair of OCG Gaming Headsets 2.4GHz Bluetooth Wireless Gaming Headphones were just what I needed. I wanted bluetooth capabilities because I wanted to have it as an option in case I wanted to pair it to two computers (one via dongle and one via bluetooth). I also wanted the option of using it with other gaming systems such as an XBox or Playstation. The usb dongle gives that versatility.

I really don't care much for RGB as they just make my computers distracting and I'm not a game streamer or youtuber (not yet, anyway, ha ha), but if you do like them, this headset has them...

So, what do I think? I'd been playing Uncharted 4 on my PC with my old pair of headphones and it sounded great. The surround didn't really seem like it worked very well. After I received the OCG, I plugged in the USB dongle and booted up the game. The game automatically detected the headset and showed that it was using virtual surround. Immediately, I found that I was hearing sounds that I hadn't heard before!

As the character walked around, I heard the jangling sounds of the equipment he had at his belt, I heard the companion character talking behind me and as I turned, her voice moved around my head. I was super impressed!

I then disconnected the dongle and tried the headset in bluetooth mode. The sound was a little muffled and there was almost no surround effect, even though the game still said that it was doing virtual surround.

So I'm definitely using the dongle for all my gaming. I love this thing!

reviews.title: I switch-ified my XBox One controller
reviews.text:
After a couple of years of intense gaming on my XBox One controller, the rubber on my left analog stick pretty much rubbed smooth, losing grip. Eventually, the rubber actually rubbed off. Add to that, the right stick began to stick a little for some reason.

I knew it was time to attempt a repair. While doing so, I thought I'd pick interesting colors for the analog sticks to make it fun. I bought the TOMSIN Replacement Joysticks for Xbox One Series X/S Controller in the Nintendo Switch blue/red combo.

The installation was straightforward. Just followed a teardown video on youtube and used the included tools. The tools came in handy to pry the plastic open and unscrew the screws holding the controller together.

Replacement was simple. Just pull off the old analog sticks and pop in the new ones. They fit perfectly and now, I have a controller that feels new and responsive. Great product.
