reviews.title: Decent HARD case for travel - charging a bit of a trick when in case.
reviews.text:
Many Nintendo Switch cases have hit the market since the release of the versatile gaming system and this this one meets all of the critical criteria of a good case but falls a bit short in order to be considered great.

The Switch fits perfectly in the top with adequate padding to protect the critical top glass LED screen. The 2 Joy-Con controllers fit snugly into individual slots beneath the main unit and there is another secure area to store the power adapter (and a few games) which is a huge plus for this case - which many other cases neglect.

As I stated, for travel purposes, this case is excellent.

While this case advertises itself as one where you can “charge and play” - that is awkward at best. First the Joy-Cons do not comfortably fit on the primary unit while in the case. If too much pressure is applied to the screen while propped on the stand it moves too much for accurate game play.

I have to give this case 3 STARS - it will definitely protect your Nintendo Switch and all of its necessary accessories when traveling better than many other cases but it won’t be staying in the case as you play...

UPDATE TO ORIGINAL REVIEW: Now that my son has had more time using this case he has told me that he liked it much more than he initially did.

Since I do not actually use the Switch I had to write my review based on his impressions and as he has used it he has liked it more and more. Often when the Nintendo Switch is played in handheld mode the joycons are held separately from the central screen unit so the fact that they don’t fit on it in the case does not matter.

In his opinion this is the best case he has used for his Nintendo Switch and we would definitely recommend it as a great way to protect your investment.

reviews.title: AMAZING KEYBOARD to WORK ON
reviews.text:
While I don’t use this keyboard for gaming I can say it is the best keyboard I’ve used for working.

The design elements make it not only highly functional but very comfortable for many hours of use at a time. By designing the keyboard with a curve and having the keys at slightly different levels I’ve found that my hands become less strained when typing all day.

The clicks of the keyboard give both a tactile and auditory response when the keys are depressed allowing the user to know the key has been depressed. At first I found the noise overwhelming but I soon got used to it and found I appreciated the feedback.

The response rate of this keyboard is simply incredible. I never realized there was such a vast difference in quality between keyboards until I began working on this one. This keyboard can actually help you be more productive and make less errors when typing.

Aesthetically this keyboard is super cool. It allows for the colors of the keys to be changed in all sorts of patterns and designs to suit your particular tastes. In addition there are LED light strips on both sides that can be adjusted.

This is an all around incredible keyboard that is a joy to work on.

reviews.title: Awesome Wireless Mouse
reviews.text:
I have used wireless mice for many years and have used those made by all of the major manufacturers.

Without question wireless technology has come so far over the last decade. This mouse makes use of the latest Bluetooth 5.0 technology making connections dependable and consistent. While having a steady connection is critical for a reliable mouse that is only one of the factors that makes this mouse excellent.

There is no adding batteries to this wireless mouse. While most similar products mean replacing batteries and locating a new one when the old dies- this one has a powerful battery built within it. All that is required is plugging the mouse into a USB port - and it can be used while the battery is charging! The mouse sleeps when not in use preserving the battery and reawakens immediately, in addition there is a power switch for when work is completed. The battery lasts far longer than I anticipated - I plug mine in to charge once a week to 10 days and I’ve never had mine die.

There are 3 DPI settings which control how sensitive the mouse is or how many dots per inch it detects. This mouse is every bit as accurate as my wired mice but doesn’t have the restrictions that come from being tethered.

This mouse has built in LED lights that “breathe” - slowly illuminating and dimming. It looks great whether you game or not.

In terms of how it fits in the hand - I love the ergonomics of this mouse. I have found this mouse fits perfectly within my palm without over extension of my wrist. It’s comfortable to use all day without having hand or wrist fatigue late in the day.

This is an excellent, highly responsive, well made mouse. It utilizes the latest technology for outstanding performance and durability. This is an excellent product that I definitely recommend.

reviews.title: More Accurately Described as a Workstation Pad - Flickers in Scrolling Mode
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:23b66e0d4d6deb4493df890cc9f52620]] I recently built a custom computer workstation that suspends next to my recliner with the desk surface swiveling over the arm for me to work. I thought this would be a nice addition although it was simply too big.

While based on the dimensions it should have worked, due to my swiveling desktop being made up of 2 surfaces, one for the keyboard and the other for the mouse, there was no way to have this lay flat across both. This is certainly not a failing of the product, only my experience.

I have ended up using this beneath my PC and server on the table next to my recliner and it looks great while providing a soft surface for my computer equipment to rest.

While this does not come with a micro USB cable I always have additional so this wasn’t an issue but should be known. I have mine plugged into a multi USB outlet that automatically adjusts to the power required for whatever is plugged into it, it’s provided constant power without issue.

I feel that the color descriptions are accurate. I have tested this product over the last 2 months and what I have found is when set to any of the scrolling color modes it continually flickers every few seconds which is very distracting (see video). While it didn’t do this in the beginning it now happens nearly continually. This is not an issue in the breathing color changing modes but, for me, makes the scrolling modes unusable. I have tested changing cables and outlets but neither makes a difference therefore this is a defect with the product.

While the lights are bright and vibrant, the patterns varied, the defect I have encountered makes this a product I would not recommend.

reviews.title: Better than my other devices!
reviews.text:
Update, I’ve been using it on my PS4 and enjoy it very much. I love wireless VR but the benefit of this is you will never run out of battery charge as it don’t use batteries. I use it from bed to play games and media and don’t have to worry about that.

As far as people reporting that it looks blurry well that’s not caused by the headset, it maybe be a fact that some people may have myopia (nearsighted) and never new about it. I have myopia so if I used this device without my glasses in then it will obviously look blurry. So when I put on my glasses it’s perfect.

My wife on the other hand does not have nearsightedness so when she uses them she says it’s razor sharp even more so than our large screen tv she says. Tidbit all VR are designed to have the sharpest part of the image towards the center as that’s how human vision works we see in a 120 degrees arc. But most of that arc is peripheral vision so most of what we can see in total focus is towards the center of our vision, same goes for VR.

Anyway with this I enjoy best of both worlds wired, and wireless with my other devices.
I also plan to get Oculus Quest, but this psvr can handle full featured games and not just VR experiences.

I can’t help it, I’ll review the psvr in two parts.
Okay 1st part and at a later time I’ll review the vr experience as I got the headset ahead of my ps4 arrival.

Okay let me make this clear, as of now I’m using the psvr on my Xbox One as a monitor for media and Xbox one games
until I get my PS4.

I own both the Samsung VR and Oculus Go and can assure you even with my myopic eyes I can see that this looks far better than either the Samsung Vr or Oculus Go without a shadow of doubt! And I don’t have to worry about the other headsets having to charge batteries ever again!

Let me tell you something...
I would get this just for media use alone for fact!!
Okay now the comfort of this device can’t be matched, it’s so darn comfortable comparing to my other devices,
I’m shocked how comfortable it is! They nailed it they put lots of TLC into this!
The build of the headset and the cushion pads are fantastic!

I don’t know what other people are doing wrong with a bad experience with it, because I am more than pleased with it, and should have gotten it sooner !

Thanks Sony!

Not comparing with other high end pc vr units, I’m speaking specifics about Samsung Vr and Oculus go and fact is this is way better nuff said!

reviews.title: NOT good sound quality seems it was designed by fish men underwater.
reviews.text:
Update 6/5/2020
they lied and never sent me my free gift (controller)
Also audio processing on this controller vs the official ps4 controller this one sounds horrible.

If you need it as a extra controller for a second player or for kids then okay.
But if your serious about gaming then don’t be cheap because that’s what your gonna get a cheap controller, there are inexpensive items that are great but cheap is cheap as in bad quality in regards to the sound on this controller is not good! The controller itself is okay as to play with but sound is like a tin can even with high quality headphones attached and makes the game sound like dollar tree headphones. So don’t get it for sound quality. And beware they lied and never did their part as they said a review for a free controller.

Update: dunno if related to Covid19, but the In box card proposed a free PS4 controller in exchange for a review on Amazon,
In order to promote future sells of this controller.
I fully followed all requirements in order to revive the free item.

It has been a while and have not received anything, I replied fully and promptly to their email request for my shipping address
I’ll wait a bit more if not I will have to retract this positive review and edit it to reflect a negative review.
..
..
..

I’m surprised how good this controller is, unlike other third party controllers I’ve owned this one feels almost premium at a low price. I would recommend it, I would have liked if the led light bar was towards the front of the controller. Other than that it’s great.

reviews.title: Like a glove
reviews.text:
Update I discovered when you put the protector on if it powers on (goes out of stand by mode) tap power button once (no need to shut off) this will put it to back into sleep mode even with the protector on.

Works very well, it fits in my Quest 2 just right. Now then it’s obvious that you should use this when your headset is not in use and your headset is powered off. Not good to use in standby mode because it will trick the unit to believe it’s still on your head going out of sleep mode and drain your battery. So use this when your totally done playing or when charging it to protect the lenses. Otherwise turn it off and then put the protector on the lens. Also good if you need to quickly put down the headset you can put the protector in the headset briefly to go afk and have your lenses protected. But don’t leave it for long because the headset will go out of standby mode. As I said to store your headset turn it off then put in the protector. Great to keep your lenses safe from scratching or to keep other object from knocking against or coming into contact with the lenses ruining them.

reviews.title: Good Halo
reviews.text:
This is a good Halo type strap. Nothing to complain about so far so good.
Nice fit, takes pressure away from face.

reviews.title: Good strap!
reviews.text: Better than I expected and actually better than my Halo Strap. I added these extra accessories and I’m loving it.

reviews.title: Worth the money
reviews.text: Great product.  I have not killed the battery yet and I've played 18 hours straight on saturday. Only thing I don't like is the light. Its really bright and flashes on n off.  Other than great totally worth the money

reviews.title: Must have item
reviews.text:
One my first ALL 5 STAR.
I AM very impressed. Wasnt sure what to expect but wow.
VERY sturdy, holds position with no lag.
Made solid metal not breakable at all.
This is a must have for phones or nintendo switch.
Glad I bought this 100%

reviews.title: Good product
reviews.text: Very nice case and all.  Glad I spent the money.  Very happy with purchase and so will you.

reviews.title: Must have controller, best one in 30 years I swear by it
reviews.text:
Very rare 5 star review

UPDATE:
After 3 months of use (soild use, everyday).
This has been the BEST controller I've ever bought from ANY system in my 30 years of gaming. The battery still last 40+hrs, and only takes 2 hrs or so to recharge. Its durable as hell and holds up great. Buttons and stick still works like perfect. And I have used it for 100s of hours since purchase. A mist have even for the money wont.buy anything but from now on.

( I've said that 3 times today but man, I've bought some good stuff)

my 1st pro controller was the 30$ version amazon offers here n now. I wore it out very quickly once I started playing fortnite.
You get what you pay for. This controller is FKIN amazing.. the smoothness the control and feel of buttons and the controller itself.in your hands is like holding liquid gold. I absolutely must insist that you spend the money and get this pro controller. It will make you a pro all the way around.

Must have for all gaming shooters will see a huge difference between brands. Promise

I will update as needed to see how long the controller will last. I see alot of review complaining about left stick after a short time... I will let you know as it happens and my.use will not be lite.

reviews.title: There are cheaper versions they all work the same.
reviews.text:
It works. I often wonder why I didnt go buy 2 64gb cards for 21$. Because it wouldve saved me 12$. But I was cautious of using a non nintendo product for various reason so I spent the extra money.

It reads fast it writes fast and I can stop archiving my games now. Plenty of room for what I need.

reviews.title: Muat buy for building lovers.
reviews.text:
I lobe this game. I'm a huge minecraft fan with over 1k hrs on 2 systems, but builders 2 has everything u wish minecraft did (without mods). The story is ok to progress through game kinda childish but that's what I would expect. It's a great builder game without having to collect so many resources to do so.
A must buy in my book

reviews.title: Dont buy get builders 2 instead.
reviews.text:
This game was good thought but builders 2 is way way better.
The story is ok but over all game play I just didnt like it. If ur going to buy a buolder game skip 1 and just get #2 you wont be disappointed.

reviews.title: Come a long way
reviews.text:
This game is really well designed and fun to play. I am simply amazed by the graphics. Boy these games have come a long way since the original Zelda games came out. I found a couple of the movements for the controller had a little bit of a learning curve, but it didn't take me too long to learn. This game is almost like watching a movie. The characters are really well developed and look much more realistic than in previous games. I love the world that was created in this game. The water and trees and other surroundings make you feel like you are really there.

I would recommend this game to older kids and teens/adults. I haven't finished the game yet, but it has kept me entertained for hours already. Great game.

reviews.title: Endless joy for the ocean lover
reviews.text: This game is amazing. I have no experience with the first Endless Ocean game so I can't compare, but I absolutely love this one. This game is such an adventure that you tend to forget about everything else around you. I love that you get to interact and "heal" the marine creatures. Filling the aquarium tanks is also really fun. The thing that made me fall completely in love with this game though, is that after you think you are finished...you really aren't. There is still more to complete. I would recommend this game for anyone old enough to understand the basic commands of a Wii remote. This is so much fun, but I warn you, it can become quite addictive.

reviews.title: Really? the PS1 game was better!
reviews.text: I absolutely love the Spyro games. That being said, one of my favorite things about the original Playstation Spyro games was the ability to have a little free roaming ability. I loved chasing the sheep and getting the little dragon into trouble. This game doesn't give you that option. You can't go too far out of bounds or it just resets you to where you are "supposed" to be. I was finishing this game at a ridiculous rate without even having to try. The controls are not complicated and fun like the old games. In my opinion, this one isn't worth the money or the time.

reviews.title: Fun!
reviews.text:
So, there is a slight learning curve when teaching a child to use the fishing reel, and you pretty much have to spend a few minutes practicing before you can make a successful cast, but after you get it down this game is a lot of fun. There are multiple levels and many different species of fish to find. They vary in weight and there are special fish in each lake. One of the things I like about this game is how much free range you have to drive the boat around. On a big screen this looks crazy cool!

The kids enjoyed using the fishing pole after they got the hang of it and didn't have any further trouble with it. They liked doing the challenges and felt like kings of the fishing arena when they pulled in a big one. I'd recommend this game to anyone who likes a pretty realistic fishing experience.

reviews.title: hmmm
reviews.text:
The controls in this game are somewhat ridiculous. I actually think you might fare better if you just randomly push buttons and hope for the best. I thought the graphics were okay, and the overall story was expected, but the game controls just ruined it for me. After ten minutes I felt like I had arthritis.

The kids have no idea what does what, but they enjoy trying to beat up the bad guys anyway. If you can get it really cheap it might be worth it.

reviews.title: Just fun no matter what age you are
reviews.text: This game has a huge selection of vehicles and customization options. The courses are really life-like and there are a lot of different challenges for you to complete in order to reach the top of the ranks and unlock the next level. My kids and I had fun with this game for hours, and I think anyone would enjoy the arcade feel to this game. This reminded me of being a kid playing some of the first racing games, except of course this had better graphics. I love it.

reviews.title: I'll get you yet feather brain!
reviews.text: So, this game is really cute. There were a lot of things to like about it. As far as shooting games go, this one isn't particularly violent, more cutesy. The characters are silly and funny and the game has a lot of funny sound effects and animations. The chickens made my kids laugh and they had a good time with it for a little while. The main reason for the three star rating, was that the first level was difficult to get past and so they kept doing it again and again until they tired of it. Since they couldn't get past that level, they soon grew frustrated. It wasn't bad, but I think for my seven and eight year old children it was a little too difficult.

reviews.title: Fun and cute
reviews.text: I bought this for my pre-teen sons and they have been having a really good time with it. They said it was harder than they thought it would be, but that it has loads of characters to unlock and the graphics are really good so they like it a lot. I watched them play it for a while and it looks like fun. I didn't see anything that should concern parents while watching it, the characters are cute. This was a good buy and lots of hours of entertainment for the price. I'm happy we got it.

reviews.title: different....
reviews.text: I usually love the Samurai and Dynasty Warriors games, but this one really threw me. I wasn't sure what to think about the first person action, it was strange compared to the other games. The gameplay isn't too bad and the controls for the Wii aren't that difficult to figure out, but I didn't like it nearly as much as I thought I might. It isn't bad as a budget game, but I wouldn't choose it as a favourite.

reviews.title: Good for younger kids
reviews.text:
I bought this looking for an inexpensive game system for younger players that doesn't require DVD type disks and am happy so far with what this does. With the games already programmed in, it makes it easy for the parent. There is a decent selection of less complex games for younger kids and it comes with two controllers so two player games are no problem. The unit is lightweight but built to last and was just what I was looking for. I'm happy with it.

There is a pretty versatile selection of games with this system, even including some Sonic games. Not a bad deal for paying less new for this one than some systems cost used after many years.

reviews.title: Improvement over the first
reviews.text:
I liked this game much better than the original version because there isn't so much running around lost inside the castle. There is a decent selection of characters you can play as and the scenery in the background is varied with the graphics being slightly better quality than in the previous game.

The weapon and items screen is easier to get through and doesn't take up as much time so you can get to actually hacking and slashing sooner. I'm happy with it and my older kids and I are having a good time exploring this game together.

reviews.title: Good slashing fun!
reviews.text:
This game is a lot of fun and has a good cast of characters to choose from, even in first player mode. I like the story behind the game and the final battle is difficult even when you are playing with the game set on easy. I liked the way the weapons level up and the selection screens are a breeze to get through. being able to swap out characters with the touch of a button during gameplay was fun, but may have spoiled me a bit for when I return to other games where you can't do that.

The graphics aren't bad in this game and there are lots of areas to explore with your characters and not all of them look the same. This is pretty fun and worth the money for anyone who loves hack and slash games.

reviews.title: gone fishing...again
reviews.text: I didn't find that this game is as complex as the first one, there just isn't as much going on. Yes, you have to gather things to build stuff and aid in your survival, but there are often times when there just isn't much to do. If trying to catch fish to keep yourself from starving to death isn't your thing, you might want to rethink this game. Overall, it isn't bad, but I still prefer the original game to this one.

reviews.title: so much fun
reviews.text:
Out of all of the need for speed games, I think I like this one the best. The graphics are really good in it, the tracks are varied and I felt like the story made more sense and was a nice. solid reason to want to put some effort into winning races and taking over territories.

There is a wide selection of cars to choose from after you start unlocking them and even the two player mode on this game is a lot of fun. I liked the characters and the way you can jump from one event to another by using the world map. The canyon races are challenging but still fun and the other modes keep it interesting. Definitely recommend this to others who enjoy racing games. Love those right angle turns and shortcuts!

reviews.title: not quite part of the 'family'
reviews.text:
I'm not convinced this game is really for people who love the Godfather. Yes, they may have used the Corleone name and there may be some characters from the books and films represented in this game, but you aren't playing as Michael or anyone else important, just a random street grunt looking to move up and become a member of 'the Family." La Cosa Nostra? I think not.

While the game can be fun at times, there is also a lot of pointless running around on foot and stealing cars that look like something out of a bumper car lot at a local carnival. Some of the graphics are questionable and the controls can be oddly complicated for such a cheesy game.

If you want to become a hitman, there are better games than this one. If you want to laugh your butt off at the silliness of one dimensional characters swearing at one another and spraying artificial, on screen blood across the pavement, this is your game.

La stessa costa? Nope. Not in this case.

reviews.title: easy controls and fun chases
reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun and is one of the better need for speed titles for ps2, in my opinion. I liked the different tracks and the cop chases in this game are a lot of fun. There are plenty of shortcuts to be taken on these tracks and the cops are determined to get you, so it is a challenge to get away from them, which makes it so much more interesting. The story isn't bad and the other characters don't interrupt you every five minutes, so you actually get to play more than just sit and wait. I liked it.

reviews.title: it wasn't bad
reviews.text: As far as games go, this is a decent racing game. There is a good selection of cars to choose from and some interesting tracks. I didn't love all the interruptions that the story causes in the beginning that keep you from getting to the actual racing and the way the world map works in this game is kind of annoying at times. You spend a lot of time driving from one location to another and back to the garage. The graphics aren't bad and the races are interesting and varied with drag, drift, circuit and other things to do. Not the best of the need for speed games IMO, but still fun.

reviews.title: meh. Funny but not complicated.
reviews.text: I expected the graphics in this game to be a bit cheesy and they are, so that was no real surprise. The game itself isn't bad. What the characters say is funny, the different modes allow you to have fun in different ways and two player mode is crazy, where you can steal passengers fro the other players. Still, I don't love the main one player mode because it feels too individual and not like you are really accomplishing anything since you have to choose a new character and car again after the end of every one. It won't keep you busy for weeks at a tie, but it is okay to goof off with when you don't want to get involved with something that takes more time and effort. Cute, but not much more than that.

reviews.title: worth the money to have fun
reviews.text: Graphics are pretty good in this game and there are some pretty funny moments. The gameplay is good and the controls are not hard to figure out. This is one of the better movie based games that I've played recently. The battles are epic and there are some challenging aspects to this game, so it will keep you busy for a while for the $$ you spend on it. I am impressed, overall, by the quality of this game and the way the characters were designed.

reviews.title: Not what I thought but okay
reviews.text: Meh...not sure I love the idea of killing off characters that I love in order to progress in this game and some of the controls are a bit wonky. It is kind of fun in some parts and allows you to build up your characters, but it isn't as good as some of the other Star Wars games, IMO. It takes a while to figure everything out though, so if you want something to keep you busy for a bit, this will do it.

reviews.title: Good monkey fun
reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun. I liked that you can either be king kong or be the guys, both are fun. The graphics are decent and the game controls aren't that difficult to figure out and remember how to use, even if you don't play it again for a while. My older boys are having a great time with this game.

reviews.title: fun for the parents, too!
reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun and will keep you on your toes. I like the graphics and the story is interesting as well. The controls aren't that hard and the surprises just keep coming with every new thing you have to do. My twelve and thirteen year old boys are having fun trying to beat this game and it has proved to be fun for the parents as well. I also like it because it seems like it will take a while to get past all of it, so it should be hours of fun for the price. A good buy.

reviews.title: Different, but fun
reviews.text: This is a lot different from the original Tetris game, but it has some fun modes and once you get past the little learning curve it is pretty fun to play. The rules aren't complicated and most of the levels are pretty easy, so this is good even for younger children who don't have a lot of gaming experience. Overall it is a fun game with a lot going for it.

reviews.title: Complicated but fun
reviews.text: There are a lot of complicated button combos in this game and it took me and my kids a while to get the hang of things, but once we did, we had a good time with this game. There is a good selection of characters unlocked in the very beginning, so you don't have to be someone unknown to start with and the different match styles and events as well as arenas are fun. This is one of the better wrestling games in my opinion.

reviews.title: We enjoyed busting out
reviews.text: I like the fact that you can play two player mode in this game in the main mode, although doing so does create some interesting complications as you get farther into the game. The graphics aren't bad for being a ps2 game and the controls are basically the same as the previous sims game, so there isn't a huge learning curve to get over before you begin playing. Some of the story lines it comes up with and missions you have to complete are quite funny. Overall, this game is enjoyable and will keep you busy for many hours.

reviews.title: Love the multiplayer modes
reviews.text:
What's not to love about a need for speed where you have the opportunity to be the cop instead of just getting chased by them? This game is really fun. The graphics are kind of blocky---yes, I realise it is old...but otherwise this is really great. I think this Need for Speed has the best multiplayer mode of any of the games, allowing you to do more than just simply race one another. I like the different modes in this game in single player as well.

This is fun and perfectly appropriate for younger kids, as there is nothing in it that is inappropriate for their age group. Overall, this is one of my favourite racing games and was a good addition to our library of Need for Speed games.

reviews.title: Too fun!
reviews.text: Okay, so we may have burnt down our Sim house a few times and killed a few gnomes before we got the hang of it, but once we did, this game is really great. I will warn anyone who hasn't played it that it can become a bit addicting :) I had fun with the single player mode, but also with building a neighborhood and the kids loved it as well. If you are looking for a game that will keep you playing for a long time, this one should do the trick.

reviews.title: really different than most slot games, and fun
reviews.text: I thought this game was a lot of fun. Rather than just being a basic slot game, there are quests to follow and it has more of an organised story to it. I liked the games that are included with it and found myself lost in them without even realising how long I had been playing A lot of fun for an outstanding price. Recommended to those who enjoy slot games with a bit of a twist.

reviews.title: There's some good and some bad
reviews.text:
First, the good. I was so excited when I found out they were coming out with a second overcooked. I loved the first one and have had hours upon hours of fun playing this game with my family and friends. This second incarnation still has adorable characters and much of the original functionality that the first had. There are some new critters to use ( I personally like the octopus,) and you now have the ability to throw certain things into pots or to other characters, which is a nice improvement. Some of the worlds are challenging and there are new hurdles to overcome, like flames popping up here and there that have to be put out. So there are some good things about it, however, there are also a lot of things that I found lacking.

The levels are way too easy to earn points in. With the first game, you might be lucky if you served a handful of successful dishes and earned a couple of hundred points before the timer ran out. With the second game, you can easily earn more than a thousand points with hardly any effort. I was able to play through this game with my husband in a single afternoon and beat the final level without a problem, literally in less than six hours. That was not the way it was with the first game at all. Whereas in the original overcooked, the last level, when you face the giant meatball you have to really put your heads together and strategise and probably do it over and over again until you are successful, the final level in this game is easy. There isn't much holding you back from doing the level on the very first try.

Some of the levels in this game are simply annoying rather than challenging in any meaningful kind of way. The things that made the first game challenging and fun were the rocking boats, the slippery ice and stuff like that. In this game it feels like they tried too hard to go out of their way to come up with hurdles for you and most of them are just ridiculous. You can easily get around most of them after you figure it out the first time and they don't change much throughout the rest of the game.

The way the menu works annoyed me, because it isn't straight forward to change characters as you wish anymore like it was in the first game, and adding or subtracting players isn't easy anymore either. The emote icons are a pointless addition that does nothing to enhance the gameplay experience and don't work as well as they should. Overall, I thought this game was a massive disappointment. perhaps for those who haven't played the first one and don't have raised expectations based on that bar being set so high this would be a lot of fun, but for me, it was just barely okay. I hope if they come out with a third one they take into account what made the first one fun.

reviews.title: You had better have a decent internet connection
reviews.text:
I was really disappointed after waiting so long for the release of this game to find out that it is really only the first game that is on the disc and only an intro for the other two. There is a 38 gig patch that has to be downloaded before you can play the full game and if you have a slow internet connection or serious restrictions on the amount of gigs you can use, you will be in trouble with this.

Needless to say, I wasn't pleased that Activision decided to release this disk as is when they could have put so much more of the game on the disk. I resented having to do such a big download even though I was capable of doing it. I feel sorry for the people who aren't able to download it.

The graphics in the game look really good and there are a few changes, but nothing substantial enough to change the original feel and look of the game. I do think that they managed to break the glide feature somehow, because I don't recall it being such a pain in the butt to use before.

Overall, it is still a great series of games, but the download is ridiculous.

reviews.title: Great for 2ds as well
reviews.text: This was a gift for my son for Christmas. Not only was I pleased with it because it is well-made, and it looks just like the picture, but it also works perfectly to hold a 2ds. Unlike some of the themed items I have purchased before, this one really does look like the character it is supposed to portray. Overall, this is a very cute product that is also functional and I am quite happy with it.

reviews.title: I finally understand what all the hype was about
reviews.text:
I've been a dedicated PlayStation user for many years, but I decided I wanted to see what X box was all about so I gave in and got one. I see now why people love it. I love just about everything about this game system--except that the remote require actual batteries and does not come as a standard rechargeable. That actually seems not only silly to me, but perhaps even prehistoric.

Otherwise, the games are great, and having the Game Pass and Live Gold is great too. I wanted to try those services out and now I can see that I really do want them. The X Box itself has some really great functionality, is easy to set up even for a technology numpty like me and I like the design and build of it. There are a great range of games available for the whole family, so as a parent, I like that as well.

I'm no longer sure that Playstation is it for me. We will see what happens in the future of gaming, but I have to say, I'm impressed with the X Box.

reviews.title: Quite woring after less than a week
reviews.text: Bought this controller as a replacement for my son's PS2 controller after seeing that the reviews for it were pretty good. We've had really bad luck in the last couple of years with off-brand gaming remotes, and sadly to say this was another example of that. After less than a wee of normal usage, this controller stopped functioning altogether and we had to return it. We only tried the one, so perhaps it was an abnormal experience, but I'm not going to risk it again.

reviews.title: Excellent performance and cute, too!
reviews.text: I love pigs. Pigs of all kinds, so when I saw this, I knew I had to have it. The controller is great. It is stylish and works beautifully, just as one expects from X Box. The controller is a nice colour and I think is really cute and adds a bit of a personal touch to the X Box experience. I would definitely recommend this to other customers.

reviews.title: I'm on the fence about this one
reviews.text:
It works...kinda. I think? So, it is easy enough to set up and is easy enough to figure out, but at the same time, it doesn't work as easily as expected. Getting the controllers in the right spot requires an engineer with at least a four year degree and then you never really know if the controller batteries are charged or not. he light is red, then green, then red again, even when you were certain you had it in the right spot.

If you put the slightest amount of pressure on it, then it changes colour. If you leave the battery packs in the controllers as they claim you can when you go to use the charger, it takes hours longer for them to charge, or in any event, for it to recognise that they are charged. Eventually it will charge them, and the battery packs fit nicely in the controllers, but it is rather a pain to use when you never really now if it is charged or not.

At this point, I'm not sure what to think.

reviews.title: still not as good as the original
reviews.text:
I like this game well enough, but not as much as the first one. Most of the game is pretty good, but there's a lot that's different in the free roam mode. I like the photo abilities and the choice of vehicles, but honestly, I could have done without the planes and the boats. I like driving games and that was one of the thrills of the first game, especially with the wild run expansion pack.

This game is a bit different and some of the races are too short, some of them are just silly IMO. The graphics are good for the most part and there is a lot to do, but sometimes the other players can be a real pain in the rear end and you can't always get away from them like you can in other games.

Overall, it's okay, but not what I was hoping for based on how great the first one was.

reviews.title: fun and challenging
reviews.text:
I love all of the different farming games, but what i love about this one the most is the amount of animals you can eventually have if you keep working at it. Want 500 pigs? No problem. Want to focus on gardening instead? No worries. There is freedom to do what you want in this game, including being a goblin fighting miner.

There isn't anything gross or any graphic violence in this game, so it is good for kids and parents alike. There are some difficult to solve puzzles and sometimes finding the lost items in the game can be maddening, but really, overall, there is so much to do if you get stuck doing one thing, then you can easily move on to another.

This truly is a great game, although the graphics are a bit wonky, even though one expects that with these crafting games, it can make it hard on the eyes after a while.

reviews.title: I say oops a lot
reviews.text:
So this game is really fun in either single player or multiplayer and I like that you can couch co-op with a friend without having to go online. There aren't enough of those games anymore, IMO. The characters in this are fun to use and their special abilities grow as you continue on with the game. Some portions of it can be challenging and it is truly one of those games where you have to work together if you are going to play in co-op mode.

I like that you never really know what to expect because each new place you come into is different and you have to get a feel for how to get through it before you really make progress. There are a lot of hurdles you have to get past and they make it more fun. I enjoyed solving the puzzles and fighting the various enemies.

reviews.title: Broke after a week of use.
reviews.text: Very poorly made and designed product. To use the microphone, you need to plug in an ADDITIONAL jack, so you have 2 plug in hanging from your earphones. Very strange design and cumbersome. Also, you need 2 jack plug ins. The male part of the plug-in is very thin and snapped off after 1 week of use. They can't be used now and ended up in the garbage. Bummer. I put 1 pic of secondary mic jack and 1 pic of where the plug-in snapped off in my review.

reviews.title: Extremely sturdy.
reviews.text: My 2 boys have used these hard during quarantine and homeschooling. Of all the countless headsets we've purchased, these have lasted the longest and have really taken a beating. They are comfortable to wear for extended periods of time, the volume control is easy to access. The microphone wand sticks out about 2.5 inches and has a slight curve to it so it rests near your mouth. We are using these on our desktop. No issues, and very happy with them!!

reviews.title: Good noice cancellation
reviews.text: These are very comfortable to wear for long periods of time. The ear part is big and soft. It has a usb plug in and gets clear sound. Pretty much eliminates all outside sound. The microphone is flexible and no one has had trouble hearing me. These also have a metal band over the top of the headpiece that reinforces their strength.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: These are really comfortable to wear over long periods of time. The ear part is oversized and the pad is soft. They do an excellent job of canceling outside noise out while providing crisp and vivid surround sound. They have a usb plug. They are on the bigger side so if you have a super slim noggin, you might not like the fit as much

reviews.title: Excellent quality
reviews.text: This is oversized, thick and very comfortable to use. Top quality material, excellent stitching. My gamers enjoy using this daily

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: My kids complained about the original oculus strap hurting their heads. We switched out to this and WOW what a difference it makes. So much more comfortable. My boy has a gigantic noggin, my girl has a narrow one. It’s adjustable sonic fits them both and elevates their play!

reviews.title: We love the Just Dance games as a family
reviews.text:
We love the Just Dance games as a family! Only problem is we found out after the fact that the fun video review (where it takes some recorded footage of you and makes a hilarious short music video at the end) didn't come out until JD 4. We bought this after loving how much fun 4 was, and wish these songs were available with the features of the next versions!
Oh well, Some great tunes, classic, contemporary and obscure, but all fun to dance to with or without the video review feature.

reviews.title: Closest thing to being an actual Jedi.
reviews.text:
As a SW fan and a fan of Kinect games in general, this is just a hoot to play. My 8 year old son loved the demo on our 360, and begged me to buy it for us to play. I'll be honest, there are better Star Wars games out there. And there are even better Kinect games. But for the price this sells for used, if you've got a Kinect and even a slight affinity towards Jedi, this is a must have.
Some mini games are better than others- my son and I enjoy the Jedi adventure story, and I'll admit to playing Rancor Rampage to blow off some steam now and then. The Galactic Dance Off is kind of silly, though. Sort of makes it feel cheesy and cheap, (jar jar binks style, if you know what I mean), but I suppose they wanted it to be fun for everyone of all ages and interests, so kudos to the developers for doing exactly that!

If I may admit, when starting the Jedi adventure and being trained to use a light saber, I started to really get sucked into it. The Jedi Master instructed me on screen to reach for my light saber (which flew into my avatar's hand), and feel its weight as I swing it around. I did that, and for a moment I felt like "Aw yeah, I can feel it!". Tons of fun!

reviews.title: Lots of connection types, but annoying USB
reviews.text:
These are decent low end headphones. I'm not expecting high quality sound for the price, but they get the job done and have quite decent bass, although other tones could be a little clearer. But I have some issues with the connection type, which is the exact same experience I've had with other headsets in this price range: I like that these come with an option for both stereo and mic jacks (as 2 TRS 3.5mm plugs), or a combined TRRS with both mic and stereo in one (for phones, certain laptops, etc) via an adapter. But it also comes with a big annoying USB A cable which I can't get rid of. I understand the USB cable is for power which works the lights, etc, on this thing, but unlike the 2 cables which can be combined into one for smaller portable devices, the connection ports are just messy with a dangling USB cable if you don't need it.
In my personal opinion, there should be an option to detach the USB cable and/or have it plug into a null adapter on the TRS/TRRS adapter wire so it has somewhere to go. It just looks messy like this, and requires too many ports to look clean on a laptop even if you're using all of them. On a desktop this is less of an issue, however the logo still seems kind of cheesy on the side, so I guess I'm just not a fan of the aesthetics of this set. It DOES work however, so if all you want is the utility of it, it works alright. Personally, I'd go with either a fully digital USB model if you wanted that (nice clean single plug, no analog jacks), or one without the LED lights and therefore doesn't require the USB plug.

reviews.title: Solid and CLICKY!
reviews.text:
I love this keyboard. Yes, it is slightly smaller than a full sized keyboard, but it is SO SATISFYING to use. The keys are tall and have a big mechanical click like a vintage PC XT keyboard. The sound is audible and glorious, and the backlight LEDs really make it fun to look at too. I love turning it on and seeing the circles of light dancing around the keys to tell you its powering up.
Speaking of powering up, it has multiple device settings, which is something I haven't had in a BT keyboard before, or any Bluetooth device for that matter. Now that I have it I'm wondering why more Bluetooth devices don't offer this. I have it paired with my Amazon Fire stick, my phone, and our family Tablet, and a quick flip of the switch to 1, 2 or 3 can toggle which one is connected now. With other Bluetooth devices, it annoyingly usually just tries to repair with the last connected device (especially frustrating with headphones!), but with this you can really use it with multiple devices and chose which one to reconnect to at power up. Brilliant!
I didn't notice any BT lag, but I understand this is something that is mostly noticeable by gamers who use wireless keyboards, and find it very irritating. If you are concerned about that, thankfully this also has a wired mode directly over USB. I was a little bit uneasy to recommend this at first because of the price tag on it, but I'm really impressed with the device overall. It's worthy of 5 stars in my opinion.

reviews.title: Fun for retro gaming!
reviews.text: I'm a fan of retro gaming, but installing 8 and 16-bit classics on modern tablets and phones is frustrating to say the least. You need buttons. That's where this adorable and super useful controller comes in. I love that it has several modes for different devices (act like a generic controller, a keyboard, a switch gamepad, etc), and I was able to use it both with a tablet and my Fire TV over bluetooth. It's really great on the Fire TV since the remote that comes with that stinks for gaming. The size is a little less comfortable than a full sized controller, but the portability is great. You can slip this in your pocket and take it out on a bus/train to play retro games on your phone. The button combos to switch modes are a little bit difficult to figure out at first, you need to use the instructions to understand how to set the mode and then put it into pairing to set it up with different devices. For example, hold one button and start for Switch mode, another button and start for Android mode, etc. Then press and hold the other button until it starts blinking to put it into pairing mode after that. And if you don't commit the button combinations to memory, you'll need to look it up in the instructions again. If you only intend to use this with one device, that's less of an issue as you'll probably just set it up once and never change it. But otherwise, I wish there was a cheat sheet or something printed on the back so you wouldn't need to keep the instructions around. All in all, it's still a very functional and great little remote game controller for a great price.

reviews.title: Flashing colors!
reviews.text:
I don't have as much time for gaming as I used to, but I do use my desktop for a lot of graphic and media applications. I love the idea of the programmable buttons on the side which can be mapped via the driver software to shortcuts. Getting used to pressing the right one takes a bit of getting used to, but it's a very cool thing to have. The flashing colors are pretty cool looking and go along with the gamer styling like my gaming keyboard and Crucial RAM sticks that shift colors inside my PC case. The ergonomics are great, I actually find this mouse really comfortable to hold and use. The resolution and response is great, too. My only complaint is that I wish the speed button in the middle was harder to press by accident. My wife was using the desktop and accidentally pressed it, and the mouse started flying all over the place and she couldn't figured out how to go back to normal until came and pressed it again for her.
Otherwise, what a great product from Amazon Basics!

reviews.title: Cool lights!
reviews.text:
So, I'll be honest, I'm not sure what makes this for "gamers" beyond the light changing LEDs within. My son is starting to get into gaming with his friends, and he's been begging me to get him something like this, so we tried it out.
It claims to have gaming DPI or whatever on the mouse, but neither my son nor I could really tell any practical difference in it when using for any 3D games. It works well enough, and it definitely LOOKS cool, especially in the dark. So, if that's what makes it a gaming keyboard and mouse, I guess it serves the intended purpose!

reviews.title: The wireless version is just OK
reviews.text:
I noticed a lot of positive reviews for this so I had high hopes for sound quality. I see now that there are 3 different versions of this headset however, a wired standard 3.5mm TRRS one, a USB one, and a wireless one. I got the wireless one, which is also the most expensive version, and I have to admit I'm not impressed with the sound or features. With the glowing reviews, I have to believe the wired ones sound better and the culprit is in the transmitter. The quality of the sound over the wireless transmission is just OK. It's decent enough for VOIP and voice chats, maybe even gaming, but for music or watching videos it falls flat. I was watching a movie on Netflix and the dynamic range sort of collided with itself in such a way that it was hard for me to separate the voices from the background music compared to headphones that cost half as much as these.
That being said, I DO like the microphone and that it can be easily detached. For gamers that want wireless sound and mic for chats when needed, it can be a decent product when it works well. But that leads me to my next point:
The transmitter and headset seem to loose sync everytime one or the other shuts off. You you don't use the headset for a while, it seems to "go to sleep", and if the computer goes into sleep or hibernate, it doesn't seem to reconnect on its own upon waking up. I was trying this on my laptop and constantly felt like I had to power cycle the headset and unplug/plug the USB to get it connected again. Honestly, I feel like I could get a better connection experience and perhaps even sound quality from a pair of BT headphones, and just use my computer's bluetooth system to manage the connection upon waking up. If your computer doesn't have bluetooth, this system can be useful because it works like a USB sound card, but honestly I feel like for the price they are asking it should have been a better experience.
Giving it 3 stars because it's fine for chats, is comfortable to wear and DOES look pretty cool. I just feel like you could do better. The wired versions are likely better.

reviews.title: Great and clear audio and classic gamer style!
reviews.text:
I've had good experiences with Skullcandy before, but this is my first time trying their Wage brand of headsets. I'm happy to say the experience was positive, the headphones were comfortable to wear and the sound was excellent- definitely crisper and better bass response than the classic Apple buds I've been using on this laptop before trying these (and what I'm using for baseline comparison purposes). The microphone is excellent as well, I like that it aims in front of your mouth so it doesn't pick up ambient room noise and echo voice like other headsets which have the mic on the line or even worse, on the earphone itself (I've almost never had a good experience with a mic on your ear!). And the best feature is the way the mic will mute if you lift the mic boom arm up away from your face, and then come back when repositioned. A physical action like that is far better than a button or switch.
The only catch is that you need to be into the gamer's aesthetic. Someone in our home wanted to use these for Zoom meetings, and found that she didn't like looking like she had such a large headset- it didn't go with the look she wanted to have on camera. But that's no fault of this product, as gamer / audiophile 'phones are usually the bulky variety and it is expected. I think this is a really solid options for gamers.

reviews.title: Pretty excellent for the price!
reviews.text: My daughter wanted to try these to replace her older busted BT headphones, and so far she really likes them! I got the pink variant, and the color makes her really happy- even the case is pink, which isn't how the last pair we got worked (only part of the ear buds were colored on that one, and not the case at all). The sound quality is pretty decent, more bass than expected and that's definitely a feature on smaller buds. The build quality was pretty good too, but I'm personally not a fan of touch-controls. I've owned a pair like them before and found that I would accidentally activate things every time I reseated them for comfort in my ear / keep them from falling out. My daughter says she doesn't mind this because she doesn't touch her ears as much when wearing them, so maybe this is something that doesn't effect all people. The microphone quality isn't great at isolating your voice, you get a lot of background noise but that's all common for this style of ear bud. It's not perfect, but for the money it's actually pretty good.

reviews.title: Great for turn-key setup
reviews.text:
As a DIY enthusiast who's bought and installed Pis for all kinds of things, I was a skeptical about this product's purpose and value. I mean, you could easily set this up yourself with dozens of tutorials online, and arguably the entire purpose of a Raspberry Pi is the DIY part of it.
However, that assumes you have a spare memory card to commit to the project, as well as the time to read up on it and actually set it up properly. For only a little bit more than the cost of a memory card, you can get this one already set up with everything you'd ever need or want. That's a reasonable argument.
And personally, I always said I wanted to do this to one of my Pi boards, but never did. Now that I've gotten an opportunity to try this, I see the value in not re-creating the wheel when someone has already put in the time for me.
I'm still a fan of DIY if you have the time and a spare card, but I'll happily spend the time I saved playing some classic Mario on this one.

reviews.title: This thing is BIG
reviews.text:
This is a great gamer's mousepad for a few major reasons. Yes, it has LEDs that can flash different colors and totally fits into the gamer's aesthetic along with similar keyboards and mice. But more than that, it actually responds well to the different brand mice I have tried (great response and feedback from movement), and is big enough to have your keyboard in the middle yet have some room for the mouse on EITHER SIDE! That means you can mix it up and swap hands as needed for games that you might require more dexterity with one hand vs the other! Or if you have friends that are different-brained than you, or perhaps you are ambidextrous... the possibilities go on!
Just measure first and make sure there's enough room. My old computer desk had a pull out keyboard that was narrower than this mat is, so make sure you have a large enough surface like a tabletop for it.

reviews.title: Works but hard to remove game cartridge
reviews.text: Item arrived quick,  works well, the games play fine.  However the games are very hard to remove from the nes.  My daughter used a pliers to remove the cartridge.

reviews.title: Kids loved this game
reviews.text: Great game, kids loved it.  Arrived quickly, new in box.

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter said it is the best game in the series. She loved it.  Arrived in new condition shipped promptly.

reviews.title: Good quality used guitar
reviews.text: Good quality used guitar,  had it for 6 mo still works great.  Kids play with it a few times a week.

reviews.title: bought as a gift works great! Kids love it
reviews.text: Brand new in packaging,  bought as a gift works great!  Kids love it!

reviews.title: NIB great game, daughter loved it
reviews.text: NIB great  game,  daughter loved it!

reviews.title: not happy for the price
reviews.text: Works but arrived in very used,  beat up condition,  not happy for the price,  but the kids liked it, drum sticks not included.  Note,  This item is wired in case you are not aware,  and does  have a delay when using with certain TV models

reviews.title: Works great with Xbox 360 rock band games
reviews.text: Works great with Xbox 360 rock band games,  note this  is a wired plug in device,  sounds echoey but I think that is how it is supposed to sound in the game.  Kids use it alot had it for 8mo still works great

reviews.title: Arrived in new condition my kids love this game
reviews.text: Arrived in new condition my kids love this  game!!  Fun for entire family( if you purchase all the instruments sold separately) to play together

reviews.title: Sleek, Elegant.....Perfection!!!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:9e704e3271eccfc3019f38f39661ddbe]] Love this headset....A must have folk's!!! I've tried my fair share of headsets, by far the best one yet for the price!!!! Check out video review....hope it helps! ~Happy Shopping~

reviews.title: Love it!!!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:faafa7540c9bc2ee6970f7dcfeb95860]] OMG! It glide like a hot knife through butter. Super comfy feel in the hand.....easy and fast. Also when I say fast it responds perfect. The battery last a long time.....Just an awesome product. Make sure to check out the product review video and photos! Hope this helps....~~~Happy Shopping~~~

reviews.title: Awesome in every way!!
reviews.text: My son is over the moon about this controller! It comes in such a nice carrying case and has swappable parts if you wish to change it up. It looks nice, feels nice when using, and works perfectly! It comes with 3 stickers too. My 3 year old was excited about that!

reviews.title: The nicest mousepad ever!
reviews.text: This mousepad is seriously so nice! It’s better than all I have used in the past. It’s easy to navigate on and the base is rubber so it won’t slip all over the place. It lights up beautifully with different colors, is quite large, and feels very durable!

reviews.title: Nice feel and look great!
reviews.text: These are great quality key caps! Pretty easy to install and they have a nice textured feel to them and look so nice!

reviews.title: Perfect for game console and accessories!
reviews.text: The material of this case is strong, not super thick, but not too thin. It is durable. The zippers work well and the game console and accessories are held in place with Velcro straps. There are little slots for holding game cards. There is a front zippered pocket on the outside of the case, but it is tight, you can only fit thin items in it, game cards, or some papers. The Velcro straps are easy to open and it is easy to put the game and accessories in their place. As the pictures show, there isn't really any extra space for carrying other items. It does hold the game console, game cards, power cord, and a hand held controller. When zipped up there is a thin carrying handle. I recommend this game case if you just carry the items listed but if you want a case to hold a lot of other personal items you might look for a larger case. It's perfect for the game console and accessories!

reviews.title: Nice quality controller at a great price!
reviews.text: The game controller is made of sturdy clear plastic, so it's cool you can see the insides of the controller. It has an ergonomic design so it feels good in your hands. It plug in the game unit perfectly and it works great. The cable it really long (8 feet) so you can sit back at a comfortable distance and play you games and not have you face right up against the TV screen. This is a great extra accessory for your game console and I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: The ultimate gaming mouse!
reviews.text: My teenage son loves this mouse! It’s perfect for his computer games! The look is sleek and it has a nice ergonomic feel. Nice grip and easy to maneuver. Looks nice as it lights up with different colors. Very nice quality! It’s really the ultimate gaming mouse!

reviews.title: Makes charging so easy!
reviews.text: This dual ultra slim Xbox controller charger is great! Super easy to hook up and it doesn’t take up much space at all. The magnetic port snaps the controller into place automatically, so no need to stress if it is connected or not. It does the job perfectly and my son loves it!

reviews.title: Fun for the entire family!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:d439e298aeee53e1d9d8bbfe1507f0ac]] My entire family loves Just Dance! This review is for the 2021 disc version and it works perfectly with my Xbox One. You have the option to use Kinect or your phone, but we prefer Kinect so you don’t have to hold a phone in your hands while you dance. There are a bunch of different songs to choose from, and there is even a Kids mode. It works just as expected and is so much fun!

reviews.title: Works, except for the audio part.
reviews.text:
This game controller works great, however it’s supposed to have a built in audio jack to hear, however my son can’t hear anything when using this controller. We switched controllers, and the audio worked again. That tells you it’s this controller causing the issue.

The buttons are easy to use, like any other controller and it does connect easily. This controller does not have a built in microphone either, however the specifications list that. It’s decent for the price.

reviews.title: Loads of fun!
reviews.text:
Both of my kids love this set. Even my 16 year old loves it, it is truly fun for all ages.

The Akedo Ultimate Arcade Warriors Starter Pack contains 3 warriors, a training dummy, and a joystick controller.

You can change out the figures on the joystick controller which is cool. They snap right off and on.

The figures are so funny as the more you punch, the other warrior or dummy will split apart. They are held together by magnets, so it is an easy fix to put them back together again.

This idea is so much fun and we can’t wait to collect more of these as they are a huge hit already in my house!

reviews.title: Perfect headphones for gaming!
reviews.text: These wireless headphones are great for the price. They have the ability to connect to Bluetooth or to use as a wired headset. The headset is adjustable and is completely padded all around for extra comfort. They fit a teenager or adult perfectly. I would say these would be too large for a young child. The cord is braided nylon, so is durable. The microphone is noise cancelling so is perfect for gaming.

reviews.title: It’s perfect, so easy to use and teen loves it!
reviews.text: This X-box wired game controller by Turtle Beach is perfect! My teenager absolutely loves it. It was super easy to connect to the console and the controller itself is easy to use and has a lot of features. It also has a nice cooling ergonomic grip. The cord is heavy duty as well.

reviews.title: Easy to use and can customize to fit your needs.
reviews.text: This controller is quite fancy as you get 14 swappable components to customize your needs. It comes in a nice case and is easy to hookup. My X-Box playing teenager approves of it as it is easy to use.

reviews.title: Awesome game card case!
reviews.text: This game card case for Nintendo Switch is awesome! I love the Halloween design and it fits your games perfectly inside. The games are easy to insert and remove as well. Excellent quality game card case!

reviews.title: Disappointed kids everywhere
reviews.text:
Yep, broken :-( Even PERMANENTLY broke the FREE App version. (Android: Nexus 7 Tablet, nothing else installed on it yet). And is now messing with the Nexus software itself.

Absolute fail Activision. ESPECIALLY since your game app relentlessness encourages kids to demand the starter pack from their parents.

Since this was our first purchase of Skylanders, we're at a good spot to quit already. Now that our 4YO can't play at all, anyway. He's too young to be into real gaming (like the xbox).... So were considering abandoning Skylanders and waiting on Lego Dimensions.

reviews.title: Nice alternate replacement Joycons!
reviews.text:
Ordered as a replacement for my drifting used up Joycons. So far they are working nicely
They feel nice in your hand, but with the grips on the back they are too big to fit into the stock Joycon grip
- easily synced up with no issues
- "soft" feeling controls, no clicking or sticking
- feel very light compared to official joycons
Would recommend for a nice feeling accurate replacement

reviews.title: Everyone loves it!!!
reviews.text: I picked this up for our daughter, because she absolutely loves to dance! It is the end of 2020 and our local dance classes have been closed since March. So I knew she'd enjoy this game, but was really surprised at how much she had been missing dancing.... it really revived her love of both music and dancing! She hasn't stopped asking to play it since since she got it. Or singing the songs (over and over again) when she's off doing other things. Or moving in general. I can't recommend it enough!!! We all have a good time when we join her. It really has brought some life and a lot of fun into our household!!! Thank you Just Dance!!!

reviews.title: High quality, secure fit with extra long cord.
reviews.text:
Needed a replacement charging cord for both our Xbox controllers, and my son's Samsung Tab.
This cord is long and very sturdy with the nylon construction. The port connection is very snug and fits tight on the Xbox controller. We are using the other to charge our USB-B tablets as well, and it charges at high speed and again, nice secure port connection.
Overall very satisfied with these cables, and will order again when the dog destroys them.

reviews.title: Great retro style SNES+ controller
reviews.text:
I got this to use with my RaspberryPi station, and it works like a charm! Feels just like the original SNES controller but better. I wish I had had this back in the 90s!
Contains dongles for both an original SNES and also USB for Switch, computer, etc
I have used it on my Switch as well, and it feels great and is very responsive!
I will likely go back and get the black one as well for some old school 2 player action!

reviews.title: Another quality controller from PowerA
reviews.text:
I have had several PowerA controllers over the years, and several for my Switch.
This is the best looking "Pro" style controller I have found yet! I love the gray with the colored shoulder buttons.
Very comfortable to use. It is slightly smaller in size than the official Pro controller, but for my kids, its just right. The additional 2 programmable buttons on the back are a nice feature. I have not needed it so far, but I can imagine there are games where that would come in handy.
As a note, this controller does not have rumble or NFC, but most of these 3rd party controllers dont.

reviews.title: Should be better for the price
reviews.text:
The Good:
- Looks great. The white with black/red accents looks sharp.
- Comfortable to use (mostly). Feels very much like an official Pro controller to me, with the exception of the extra programmable buttons on the back. More on that in a minute...
- Extras. Comes with extra thumbsticks and faceplate, and a case. Nice perks

The Bad:
- does not support HD rumble, IR or Amiibo NFC. For a $100 controller, it should be able to do all of this and more. Disappointing
- Mappable back panels. This is the gimmick for this device. I do like the idea of programmable extra buttons, but they are in an odd place and it does not feel comfortable to me. I ended up hitting them by accident a lot when trying to adjust my grip. Depending on what you hot keyed to them, that can be frustrating.
Overall, its is working just fine, its a good controller, but I can't say that it offers enough extras (and some glaring omissions) that justify an extra $40 over an official Pro controller.

reviews.title: Received all six!
reviews.text: All six boxes of this delicious chocolate arrived quickly and in good shape. The expiration date is nearly four months out, which is more of time for me to finish this off. And the chocolate is delicious, as it always has been.

reviews.title: Great controller, awesome design
reviews.text:
If you have a previous Razer Pro controller, you know they are great with tons of customizable options and superb comfort and grip. This is no different, however it also LOOKS great with the Mando skin from the very popular Mandolorian Star Wars show. Full charge in under 3 hours and magnetically secure! Sleek silver with the Beskar helmet emblazoned on the charging stand. I love this controller, and I will likely get the Boba Fett inspired one to go along with it.
This is the way!
