He said he would probably give it five stars! So I guess he agrees with me. To me We Ski is a game that you should really get!

reviews.title: Just what I needed! Better than I hoped! Worth the money!
reviews.text:
I have one of the older Kindles and the only complaint that I have had over the years is that while traveling or at night, I can't read without some kind of light. Of course I have purchased various independent lights that either snap-on or attach to my old case, but this also means keeping up with two things (the Kindle and the light). So I finally asked myself "wouldn't it be easier to invest in one product that would offer both protection and light"? So I purchased this case and have not been disappointed! I'm glad I made the investment.

For the cost of the case, you get:

1. A sleek, attractive case that not only looks smart but is extremely functional. This case is made from a leather (a durable material) on the outside, and is well padded (in a charcoal grey material) on the inside. It definitely appears to be well made (sturdy) and seriously protects the device. The device attaches to the case with two prongs that secure it in place. It is pretty easy to attach. The bottom of the case is open, so you can access the area for the charger easily. Thus, charging your Kindle while it is in the case.

2. The case (with the Kindle enclosed) is not heavy. You can comfortably fit in your purse, book bag; backpack or briefcase, and it won't weigh your bag down.

3. There is a built in expanding (rubberband) type cord that is attached to the case that will allow you to either keep the case open or closed (as desired).

4. The light conveniently rises out of the top right corner of the case. I will warn you that there were times when it seemed difficult to pull out. (Just be mindful that you don't force it, but instead pull the tab up by the indention provided.) However, once it is up, the built-in light does illuminate the screen (more than I ever thought it would) well. The light cuts on and off with the device, so there are no batteries. The light works off the charge of the Kindle, and you control when you use the light. (I also haven't found that the light drains the battery any quicker normal). The light gives just the right amount of illumination, and isn't so bright as that it will bother others sleeping in the same room. My husband always complained that when I would read at night, in bed, that the lamp (on my nightstand) was too bright and kept him from falling asleep. And when I used the traditional clip on book light when traveling in a car, he use to complain that my book light was too distracting. He actually doesn't seem to be distracted or bothered by this gem. Perhaps because it seems to be more defused or softer.

In the end, I don't regret my purchase. I definitely got more than I had hoped and would definitely recommend this case. It is affordable and the benefits outweigh the cost. 5 stars!

reviews.title: Definitely Worth The Money
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:5a58574fde2e94d8d9512d9b7d589e5a]] I ordered this product, my son reviewed, and loved it!

reviews.title: If you can handle the TRUTH this remote will DELIVER.
reviews.text:
This review is based on my teenage son’s observations. **Note he spends countless hours playing 2K and Call of Duty. Therefore, he is comparing this controller to his white, wireless one.

Appearance: This remote looks like the classic XBOX controller. It is black with the traditional analog joysticks, buttons and signature XBOX logo. And while there are a few new features (i.e., buttons), the overall look is the same. *NOTE: He feels that this controller is lighter (in terms of weight) than his other one, but attributes that to the fact that it’s wired versus wireless, which means rechargeable batteries. *The cord has a nice length (several feet) so you don’t have to worry about sitting super close when gaming. You can sit back, play XBOX and chill!

New features: (1) You can control the volume of the mic from the controller. (2) You have the ability to reassign controls (rb/lb) using the rolling buttons located on the bottom. AND (3) You can change the color or design of the face of this controller.

Versatile (computer or game system): You can use this controller on the PC or the XBOX 1. Simply plug it in.

Now the cons: In the end, my son gave this remote only 4 stars. While he likes the cool new features (controlling the volume and assigning controls), he loves the versatility that the wireless one offers. He said that when you compare the cost of the two devices (wired vs wireless), the difference is worth it to have the versatility and freedom of movement.

reviews.title: Definitely a satisfied customer.
reviews.text: My son wanted these to improve his gaming. He is satisfied and says that they help him hold his controller.

reviews.title: Game on.
reviews.text: The Razer Electra V2 is fantastic and perfect for gaming teenagers or young adult gamers. I can count on two hands the number of headsets that I have bought or received because my kids are careless and broke them. To parents in similar situations, these (the Razer Electra) may be the answer. These over the ear headset are extremely attractive (black and neon green) and compatible with several gaming systems. We have both Xbox One and PS4. They are affordable, the setup is simple and they are easy to use. The (surround) sound quality is good. They are noise canceling, meaning you really can’t hear outside while gaming (but it probably helps that my sons listen to their games and music extra loud). You can control the volume by a slide control and you know you’ve muted when the orange light is on. The (aluminum) headband is comfortable and can be adjusted easily. The headset is light and can be stored anywhere. The only drawback is that these are not wireless, but the cord is long enough (3-4ft) to play without being too distracting. The cord is long enough to use while sitting at a desk, on a sofa or in a chair. You should not have any issues. And finally, the microphone does detach. Overall, I am very pleased and would recommend them. I give them 4 out of 5 stars.

reviews.title: UGH. They didn't fit well or work at all.
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I ordered these thinking that they would work with the family PS4. They don’t. To be honest, nothing that goes on the right side of the controller (thumb or extender) worked or fit well. One of the thumb controllers wouldn’t even stay on! This is the first Amazon Basic, computer or gaming product that I haven’t liked. I was extremely disappointed. I wouldn’t recommend these.

reviews.title: Perfect for gaming on TV or on the PC.
reviews.text: This “Cool 2000” gaming headset is great. They are aesthetically attractive. Kind of space-age looking. The ear portions are bold and vivid. They glow red when plugged into a USB port. These work on the Xbox, PS4, Smartphone, Tablet or computer. We use ours on the PS4 and computer.  The microphone rotates 360 degrees. They are extremely comfortable when wearing them. The ear muffs are padded. The sound is decent. You can control the volume by turning it up and down on the ear.  You can also turn on the LED and microphone on and off in the same place. Overall, this is a pretty great headset that can’t be beat especially if you consider the attributes and the price. I’d recommend it.

reviews.title: Game On.
reviews.text:
Easy to set up.
Noise cancelling.
Sound quality is clear. When playing on line, people say that I am clear. If I have a device that is near it (like other household devices), there is a little static.
This set is comfortable on the head and over the ears. The ear muffs are soft and cover the entire ear.
There is a detachable microphone.
They are not too heavy but a nice weight.
We use ours primarily for gaming on the PS4. This headset has elevated my Fortnite & Rainbow 6 Seige game!

reviews.title: Click Click!
reviews.text:
AUL Mechanical Keyboard is pretty sweet.
It has a great ergonomic design. It is sleek and cool looking. Space-agey.
Easy to connect and store.
It is a wired keyboard. You simply have to connect via USB to your device.
The keyboard is illuminated and colorful as you type.
You can use it with your PC, laptop or gaming system [PS4]. Most of the keys are in the same location as those on the traditional keyboard.
There is a magnetic (removable) hand rest. This is super convenient for those who don’t like hand rests.
You can change the color by pressing the large round dial in the upper righthand corner of the keyboard. Not to mention there are over 20 options of color combinations. You can make is strobe or stay constant. It’s up to you.
I like the keystroke and the ease of pushing the buttons.
Whether you have large hands or small, you can navigate this keyboard.
It is pretty light, so not too heavy.
The quality of the keyboard appears to be decent, but of course only time will tell for sure. It will take a few months of constant use for me to tell how durable it is.
In conclusion, this is the perfect keyboard for a gamer or someone who wants to use with a PC or laptop. I’d recommend it.

reviews.title: Game on.
reviews.text:
The Lupsan Gaming Headset in a nutshell.

Positives:
-The sound quality is great.
-This headset is noise cancelling.
-It can be used on multiple devices (i.e., lap top, PS4, Xbox and cell phones).
-The ear muffs are well padded. (see other concern below)
-The boom is flexible and easy to adjust.
-This item is reasonably priced.
-Comes with a stereo cord.

Negatives:
-The ear muffs are semi-comfortable. They fit fine on my head, but my teenage son (whose head and ears are slightly larger) says that over time, they start to feel a little uncomfortable. Even adjusting them didn’t make a difference for him.
-The mute button is located on the mic, under the foam cover. My son, who likes to mute the mic while playing FORTNITE, found the location of the mute button to be inconvenient. He would rather have it on the cord somewhere.

In conclusion, with a few simple design changes, the Lupsan could have had a perfect score, instead I’m giving these 4 stars.

reviews.title: Let the gaming begin.
reviews.text:
My son loves the T. Flight US Air Force Edition Gaming Headset.
This headset is lightweight and wired.
It works great with his PS4 gaming system.
The sound quality (i.e., audio) is good. While I can’t get into Fortnite, I was able to connect it to my laptop and listen to some music. I agree.
The design is nice and pretty rugged looking.
It appears to be durable and made of quality materials.
You can customize the design on the ear muffs by switching the magnetic interchangeable faceplates.
The mute button and volume is conveniently located on the cord.
The eye muffs are well padded and comfortable.
The headband is comfortable and adjusts easily. “Thrustmasters” is printed on top.
The removable mic is located on a moveable/flexible boom.

reviews.title: Boys and their toys!
reviews.text:
My 20-year-old (college student) son already has a PS5, but for some reason his brother wanted him to have the Nintendo Switch. And while I don't get boys and their electronic toys, I was at a loss as to what to get him this year for Christmas, so I chipped in on the system and purchased this game. Hopefully he is happy and loves it!
Boys and their toys.
Mothers and their unconditional love.
Merry Christmas! And he'd better keep up his grades!

reviews.title: Let the gaming begin!!
reviews.text: My sons love gaming! Both of them and they are in their early 20s. They have the Xbox 360, the PS5 (one son has a digital version, the other has a disc version) and I recently purchased the Oculus VR for my husband as his Christmas gift.  [I really hope he doesn’t read this review.] With my “gamers” in mind, I thought this would be a nice accessory them. I have noticed, when I do venture into either of my son’s room, their PS5s seem to give off a little heat! This device (by Heatfun Store) is perfect and has multiple uses. You can organize, charge and cool. The stand allows you to keep your device vertically while cooling with a fan! It is easy to assemble. The fan is pretty quiet and has 3 settings (low, medium and high). You can store up to 12 games/DVDs beside it and charge your controllers. Overall, he is extremely satisfied and gives it 5 stars.  **Note: I am going to have to order enough for my other son.

reviews.title: The perfect Christmas gift!
reviews.text:
My husband and I were at a friend’s house (a few months ago) who owns a Meta Quest 2. He invited us to play and I noticed how much my husband enjoyed it. So, I decided this device would be the perfect gift for him, for Christmas. He seems to be really enjoying it and so do other members of the family!

The set-up is simple. Once connected you are ready to begin downloading games. Some are free and some aren’t. You can even travel to different countries (which is cool), go on a safari,
mountain climb, play golf and so many other activities. There are informative and interactive videos. The graphics are great and offers you a realistic view (360 degrees) of whatever you are looking at. There are also chat rooms (if you are interested in that type of thing), interactive and multi-player games (like Saber), and much more. Some of these games (like Saber) improve hand/eye coordination. It can be a family friendly game/environment. The set comes with the headset, 2 controllers, and a storage bag/cover. It is lightweight and portable. It even comes with an adaptor for eyeglass wearers. Overall, while a little pricey, I think it is worth it (especially for a man who has everything).

reviews.text: Case & LED Lights Work Great. The Dvd cover sucks. Cover keeps poping off and Game won't play. So don't try that mod. The rest is sweet. Very easy to install. Kudos!

reviews.title: Condemed 2 Bloodshot
reviews.text: Game controlls change from the first Condemed. But game play is still freakishly hard on hard mode. Multiplayer Is ok, but always replayable when having newbies to fry.

reviews.title: Talismoon Whisper Fan
reviews.text: This is such an improvment from the standard fan in the 360. It keeps my 360 about 8 degrees cooler. Which makes games run smoother and I don't have system crashes anymore from overheating. Mega Kudos Dude!!

reviews.title: Three Stars
reviews.text: It holds ok. Works as described.

reviews.title: A Top 3 Zelda game!!
reviews.text:
This game has definitely brought back memories for me! Definitely worth getting.

Pros: Controller configuration is much better than the N-64 version. Some bug were corrected in this version. Still a classic and worth it.

Cons: A few fighting mechanics are slow but not unplayable. Nothing else wrong.

You won’t regret buying this version for yourself or a child. A great game all around!

reviews.title: It is not exactly as expected… But works!!!
reviews.text:
Product came in a well packaged box and had clear instructions.

Pros: Cleared up some desk space. Good quality materials. Great instructions.

Cons: You’re Xbox series x can easily fall out of this, like in an earthquake, (Easy to fix though, so not a deal breaker. )

Overall it was fun to clear up my desk and have better ventilation for my Series X.

reviews.title: Above average gaming headset
reviews.text:
The corsair virtuoso is a pretty good headset. I previously used my Void Pro SE, and draw most of my comparisons off that. I broke down my thoughts into few categories.

Fit: The headset feels stiff and a little tight on the sides of my head. I prefer the fit of the void pro. I think I have a pretty medium sized head, and I felt a fair amount of clamping pressure on my ears. This also makes the headset feel lighter because there was less weight resting on the top of my head. I wish this were more adjustable because it's a little too tight.

Sound: (tested in wired & wireless mode, and experienced similar results): Just to clarify, I am no audiophile and have not owned a high quality set of headphone, but the sound seems ordinary. I tried to give this a big sample of uses: thx intro video, streamed music, I still have some .wav files, and gamed a bit. The headset handled all of it, but in much the same way as my void pro.

Mic: This was my favorite part of the headset. My experience with detachable my microphones has been less than stellar. Most of the time they look incredibly flimsy and generic. This mic matches the rest of the asthetics of the headset, and has sounded better and crisper than any mic I've tried. The mic is flexible, but I wish you could change the color of the mic LED. It is solid green when unmuted, and red when muted.

Design, look, feel: very nice corsair style. Perforated side RGB is cool, ear pads are a nice cushy leathery feel. It feels like all the surfaced are metal, padding, or coated plastic to make it nice to touch. With the mic removed they look like a nice set of headphones.

Other thoughts: I had some pains with the setup of these. They did not auto sync with corsair's icue software, and had a lot of crackling when used just with plug n play. I had to manually update the software and plug the headphones into the usb via cable. This fixed the sound issues, but the headset will sometimes not show up next to my other corsair devices in icue. This is frustrating, and I did not have these problems with my Void Pro.

I feel like these are very nice for a normal gaming headset, but it doesn't seem to be worth more than $200.

Hope this has been helpful:)

reviews.title: Very nice headset but some problems with PC
reviews.text:
This headset is the best headset I've used to date. I used this exclusively for PC, and I moved to these from the Corsair Void Pro. These are much nicer quality, but it did have downsides.

Sound - best sounding gaming headset that I've ever tried. It sounds super crisp and has plenty of bass.

Mic - the recordings sounds pretty good for a headset, but nothing great.

Fit & Feel - Fit is great, very comfortable. Feel is meh for a $300 headset, feels plasticy and adjusting the arms (which you have to shorten most of the way for it to fit into the charging dock) feels a little janky in the way that it moves slowly, but if i apply more pressure, then I might break the headset.

Other notes: This is for XBox 1 and PC, but it feels like it was made more for the former, and merely is compatible with the latter. It has a volume toggle control on the side (as well as 4 other buttons, switches, and rollers) that is labelled "Game" on one side and "Voice" the other. I somehow triggered one of them that rendered me barely able to hear the audio even with my system maxxed, app volume at max, and even the headset volume roller (that for some reason does not control the system volume) at max. It made me wonder why I have 3 seperate volume controls, and then a 4th toggle that somehow also dramatically affects volume. It is because these were made with a console in mind (and it makes perfect sense for a console), but having that many additional buttons controlling just volume seems ridiculous when you have a mouse that can easily interact with volume sliders and a physical volume roller on my keyboard.

reviews.title: So clicky!
reviews.text:
So I'm not a gamer, I just use this as a regular keyboard. It's flat design took a bit to getting used to, but it's fine now. The lights are very cool and you can adjust them to the color you'd like or for them to constantly change. In the beginning it was a bit distracting but I forget about it now.

I LOVE how clicky this keyboard is though. Feels and sounds great.

The only issue I've had is that when I'd press the "t" key it would print t two or three times. I didn't know why it was doing that so I just disconnected it and then reconnected it and it's been fine since!

reviews.title: Meant for specific games, wish wire was longer
reviews.text:
This fightpad can really only be used with specific games. You can't pull up the this out for games that would require both joycon controllers.

Personally I don't think these feel great or any more comfortable than other, much more affordable options.

The wire also isn't that long and reminds me of the struggle of wired controllers stretched across the living room in the worst way possible

reviews.title: Happy with these
reviews.text: These keycaps are a very nice set. The font is not my favorite. I wish the font of the legends were a little heavier, but that is more personal preference.  These are made out of PBT which is a higher quality material than OBS (which is what most keycaps seem to be made out of these days). The texture should feel nicer on your fingers and is supposed to more resistant to wear, oil, and dirt. These are also double shot and the legends are transparent so that the backlighting works.

reviews.title: Plain larger size basic mouse pad
reviews.text:
Larger size mouse bad with plain black design and red outer stitching.

It's a little bigger than what I typically need, especially if you have limited space, but still not bad for a pretty inexpensive travel pad for my laptop.

reviews.title: Great charger, sits flush with switch
reviews.text: This charger is great! I don’t have any information on the speed of which this charges, but the form factor is perfect. This product looks like it is part of the switch, and lets me get rid of the other big piece of plastic (and its cable) that I was previously using to charge my joy cons.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: Works great with my pixel 3XL. Charge us quick, and length is long enough for me to be able to use my phone while in the couch or in bed without having to crawl over by the outlet. This charger is doing what it needs to and I've had no problems with it this far!:)

reviews.title: It was great fun until my town turned into a wasteland....
reviews.text:
I got this game as a new to videogames player. I loved it.

I thought it was cool that the snow seemed to be 'melting'. Then it snowed for two days straight, but I didn't get any more snow cover. I wondered why. So I found an online animal crossing community and learned the awful truth: playing the game destroys the look of your town! What???

Yep...all that wandering aimlessly lost I did in the beginning, racing around in hide-n-seek games, running to catch a present, and all the saves required by multiplayer gaming combined to turn my town into a virtual desert. I have probably made my last snowman. No snow also = no grass when summer comes as well.

I am very sad. The grass/snow will regrow eventually, but it will take months if not years, and you can't walk on it AT ALL during the process. My other choice is to tear down my town and start over, reminding myself to walk around as little as possible and NEVER run. Not as much fun anymore. Or I can just resign myself to life in the desert. Animal Crosssing: Desert Dwellers. Yippee.

Whatever, a lot of the lightheearted fun of it is gone for me now that I hesitate to walk in spots where there still IS some snow. I don't wander around looking for fossils or shaking trees, and hide-n-seek is out of the question. What is the purpose of planting and watering flowers and trees and pulling weeds if my town is still going to look like a dustbowl town when I'm done?

Boo to Nintendo for not testing this "feature" fully before release and not fixing it when when it became a problem. I would not recommend buying this game until a patch becomes available.

reviews.title: Do not buy, Nintendo has killed all support for any Wii online functionality
reviews.text: Was very cool when it worked but Nintendo is killing off all support for any online play using the Wii.  Very sad.

reviews.title: It's cute. Bigger than expected.
reviews.text: I love Animal Crossing so I had to have this case. The outside is smooth shiny plastic and the interior is soft cloth. It's big though.  Much bigger than I expected. It turns out that my Kindle paperwhite fits the big compartment like it was made for it, and my Nexus 5x phone fits the smaller compartment like it was made for it. So it will be great for travel......can toss my phone, Kindle and headphones in there and they won't be rattling around my bag.

reviews.title: Lack of instructions is annoying. Should include positioning tape.
reviews.text: I got this to give to my mom for Christmas to go with her Nintendo switch light that I bought her as well. Thankfully I decided to put one on my own switch and then put a screen protector on hers rather than just give her the package. Because she’s never put a screen protector on anything and I know she would’ve had no idea how to do it.  There are no instructions whatsoever in the box. Many times manufactures just stick a piece of paper in there with a link to a YouTube video to explain how to do it, but there wasn’t anything like that either. I’ve done screensavers on phones and iPads and digital cameras and stuff before so I know how to do it. but not everybody does. Missing from the package were the positioning tapes that most glass screen savers use to make it easier to apply the screen in the correct place. I used washi tape I had laying around. Also, they had a little sticker that said some thing about this being the back. I pulled that little tiny sticker off and the protective film on the back did not come off. I stuck the little sticker to the box to get it out of my way and then realized that you were intended to stick it on another portion of the protective film on the back of the screen protector and then it would stick and you could remove it. I do not understand why they did that that way and with no instructions, you were left to figure it out for yourself. The screen protector itself is nice. Once I got it on I had no bubbles, I don’t even know it’s there, it doesn’t seem to interfere with the touchscreen, and it seems to be good quality. But the lack of instructions and other issues make me unable to recommend it.

reviews.title: Really clear sound
reviews.text: These were tested out on a gaming pc. The sound is really clear and the cushion inside is extremely comfortable. The headphones also twist and turn. They are great for gaming because you can hear a lot of detailed sounds in the game. Setup is pretty easy... you just have to follow the directions for pc or ps4 and make sure you have the right cords. I would high recommend these for gamers.

reviews.title: Charging system
reviews.text: This is a easy to use and convenient charging system for PS4 controllers. There's a piece that goes on the back of the controller, which plugs into the usb port. Once that's on, you can just set the conttroller (with that part attached) onto the charging system and it's good to go. And when you're ready to use it, and it's done charging, you just pick the controller up and play. I wasn't able to time how long it took to charge, but it's average. There is a light indicator on the bottom of the charging system to let you know that the power is on. Overall, I would recommend. It's easy to use, doesn't take up a lot of space, and charges the controllers with no problems.

reviews.title: Gaming Headset
reviews.text: I used this gaming headset with a PS4 and had no problems connecting it. They are comfortable and provide great sound quality. The sound is also clear. The noise cancelling feature works well... it works better as the volume goes higher. Overall, the quality is great and I would recommend this headset.

reviews.title: Android gaming controller
reviews.text:
Pros: Easy to connect and use. I connected this through bluetooth with my samsung galaxy S9 and my Samsung chromebook plus (I did not have any of the devices listed for this item so I couldn't test the fit of the cases, but I was able to mount a case inside one of them for my phone and can play with the controller that way. But I mostly use it for gaming on my chromebook that is flippable, so it's like playing on a gaming system). The device was recognizable and instantly connected with no setup required. The app shows you all the games that are compatible with the item and lets you customize the buttons. The battery life is insanely long. My son has been playing with this thing for two days straight and it still has not died. It does not have a cheap feel to it.

Cons: Does not come with it's own charger. Have to charge each side individually. The letters on the buttons are not easily readable, they are very skinny.

reviews.title: Headphones
reviews.text: I like these wireless headphones... the color is really pretty. I especially like the lights as well. However, I thought it would be some ombre or glowing effect with the lights, but instead, it is a ring around the earphone and it changes colors. But it still looks nice. The sound quality is good, they can get pretty loud...nothing deafening though. They are not the most comfortable headphones I've ever used, the cushioning isn't too soft. They do adjust easily as well. I've been using them for about an hours or so every other day and they still haven't died on me yet. Also, they were very easy to pair to my phone (I have a galaxy s9).

reviews.title: Bluetooth controller
reviews.text: There were no directions on how to start use/connect the item. However, I was able to figure it out because the booklet included just a labeling of the buttons and what those buttons are for. Most of the buttons are labeled on the controller so you know what they are, but some on the back and top of the controller are not so you have to look at the booklet to know. It resembles the design of an xbox controller. The controller does work well. I paired and used it with a galaxy s10+ with a GTA game and all the functions worked. You'd have to play it along with whicever game oyu choose to understand what buttons control what functions. Also, the clip is adjustable to the phone size and fit my phone well.

reviews.title: Fantastic Mouse, LOVE the buttons, very comfortable
reviews.text:
I got the 3lue, this and Razer to replace my MS wireless mice at home and work.

All amazing mice. 3lue's thumb buttons are too close to you/palm of your hand and hard to find. But for $11, that was great for work.

Razer and this were very comparable. One thing I did not see in the add that should be mentioned is that this has a very nice cloth braided cord! Much like the Razer.

As far as design, LEDs (can set it to any color, can't change it on Razer), feel of the mouse, this is the best mouse I've ever tried.

The buttons blew me away. They are ALL comfortably reached and distinguishable with ease (and I'm not good at that). AND they are programmable with a simple downloaded app.

This was going to be the winner in all fronts, including price for me, but alas I don't use a mouse-pad, I just put my mice on my desk with a wrist pad, and unlike the 3lue and Razer, the feet on this one would EVER so slightly stick to my desk. Never while in motion, but when trying to point at something precise, I'd end up a millimeter to the side, and trying to move back would mean the ever so slight jerk to get it from the ever so slight sticking to move, ending the cursor yet at the other side of where I wanted to point.

So, if you have a mousepad, I'd recommend this instead. More buttons, better design, all around better mouse. Otherwise, get the Razer. If you dont' have much money or don't care about the side buttons, then get the E-3lue Cobra Type-M EMS131BK High Precision Gaming Mouse

reviews.title: I bought 3 mice, including my two old ones, and this one won.
reviews.text:
I got the E-3lue Cobra , this and Razer to replace my MS wireless mice at home and work.

All amazing mice. 3lue's thumb buttons are too close to you/palm of your hand and hard to find. But for $11, that was great for work.

Anker and this were very comparable. Both have great feel, quite, both have braided cloth cables, though this has a slightly softer thinner cable.

As far as design & LEDs, and Anker was better. I like it's curve better and of course you can change the LED color to anything, and you can't change Razer's.

The buttons on Anker blew me away. They are ALL comfortably reached and distinguishable with ease (and I'm not good at that). AND they are programmable with a simple downloaded app. That's not to say Razer's buttons aren't great, they really are, but you get the standard 5 buttons. There you can 3 programmable thumb buttons that are fantastic for figuring out which is which by feel, and 4 buttons for your middle finger.

The software on the Anker also won. The Razer mouse software wants to log into their server every time you boot (or always stay connected as another option). As everyone else has said, WHY FORCE US TO CREATE AN ACCOUNT AND STAY CONNECTED??

Anker was going to be the winner in all fronts, including price for me, but alas I don't use a mouse-pad, I just put my mice on my desk with a wrist pad, and unlike the 3lue and Razer, the feet on the Anker would EVER so slightly stick to my desk. Never while in motion, but when trying to point at something precise, I'd end up a millimeter to the side, and trying to move back would mean the ever so slight jerk to get it from the ever so slight sticking to move, ending the cursor yet at the other side of where I wanted to point.

So I'm going to keep the Razer as my gaming mouse... because its feet don't stick to my desk, it slides around quietly and effortlessly on my desk.

So, if you have a mousepad, I'd recommend Anker instead. More buttons, better design, cheaper, no loggin in, great software, great LED colors, all around better mouse (though the Razer's cable is slightly nicer). Otherwise, get the Razer. If you don't have much money or don't care about the side buttons, then get the E-3lue Cobra Type-M EMS131BK High Precision Gaming Mouse

Ps. The "programming" software you see everyone talking about is fairly useless. You can't program the buttons. What it allows is assigning a program to execute when a button is pressed, to assign different button numbers than the defaults or have a mouse button map to a keyboard (so pressing a button will press that key). But you can't create programs or scripts.

reviews.title: Note that these controllers are wired!!  But they work fine with the PS3
reviews.text: Controllers work just fine with the PS3 version.  If you want spare ones or additional ones in case of a party, these are perfect and a fraction of the cost of the PS3 version.

reviews.title: Best game series ever.  Nothing else compares
reviews.text: Though Mass Effect 3 is not as good as the previous ones due to having made for game consoles and kids, it is still one of the best games out there.  Removed is your ability to equip various things like you used to, but still a 10.

reviews.title: Looks and feels great... but!
reviews.text:
This mouse looks awesome, feels great, and I love the two textured thumb buttons and their positions.

HOWEVER! A mouse that doesn't track is useless and this does not track on my black desk with no mouse-pad. I've had this desk for a long time and easily tried 8 to 10 other mice, and they all work just fine. This does not, so I guess the laser is not as good of a quality.

reviews.title: Great sound, but major hardware and driver problems
reviews.text:
I am generally a fan of logitech and have two of their other headphones but I'm having a lot of issues with this one.

First the cable is too stiff and you can CONSTANTLY hear it in the headset scrapping against your shirt. You immediately become aware of just how much and how often your head moves. This noise is horribly loud and annoying. You can hear it even if the headset is not plugged into anything so this is a physical design issue.

The headset seems to work all of 20-30 seconds when using Google Voice, which was the primary reason I got them. Then it just simply cuts out speaker and microphone, EVERY SINGLE TIME! Basically useless.

It will however play music just fine. I even tried playing music, then starting a call. First it cut out the music, then the call, then a few seconds later the music cut back in. That's reliability.

So I decided to download their drivers rather than relying on Windows 8.1 drivers. Their drivers made all sound on my laptop useless. Gone is the smart switch from the headset to the laptop speakers when I unplug the headset or the other way around. So is the builtin ability to have a default sound system for playing music and a default system for communications.

Worst of all? The drivers stop the ability to open Sound from Control Panel. I rebooted, tried again, then went to uninstall their drivers/software. Surprise, the Sound settings popped up on its own as soon as the it was uninstalled. It was being held back by the software. HORRIBLE programming.

reviews.title: Six hours later, the DVDs are in the trash, and I'm downloading 27 gigs, into a directory I didn't elect
reviews.text:
Trying to battle the retarded installer from the 80s, picking drive D, it created D:\Program Files (x86), create D:\Origin, created the folder that I ACTUALLY specified (though it put nothing in it), created shortcuts to nowhere on my desktop, etc.

After easily 1.5 hours of basic installation off of 4 DVDs (hadn't done that in over a decade) and 3 more hours fighting the installer, then fighting the supremely low IQ Origin app, I have a dozen deleted directories in my Recycle Bin, and downloading 27 gigs from the internet.

Oh did I mention it is still not where I would want it? The Installer and Origin application is not smart enough to be able to have things installed off of a main drive. You can't install it on, say, D:\Dragon Age. It HAS to be in a sub-sub directory. Oh and you can't change it's directory name. So mine is installing under D:\Dragon Age\Dragon Age Inquisition.

You spend all this money making games, and ruin it by having art or history majors program your installer or your feeble attempt to create a Steam center lookalike.

reviews.title: 10 / 10.  Excellent game, excellent story, specially the first one.  Less the second.  And so on.
reviews.text:
They are all some of the best games ever.

I am not a fan of first person shooter, but this isn't your average FPS.

reviews.title: Super comfortable, but microphone is horrible.  Changing from 5 to 1
reviews.text:
Bought both the wired and wireless. Happy with both purchases minus the following issues:

On the wireless, the sounds is...acceptable, but not great. People say it's the transmitter, but since I don't have another transmitter, it's all I get.

On the wired, the braided wire makes a surprisingly large amount of noise that you can hear as it brushes against anything, like your clothes.

On phone calls, Zoom and Team calls, the wired is basically useless as people often can't hear me, or can't hear me for the first 10 seconds as the microphone adjust (I assume to noise cancellation). And when they can hear me, it's often broken up.

reviews.title: OMG I was sooo worried about not finding another SUPER thin pad.  This is AWESOME!
reviews.text:
I bought 3 of this other brand's mouse pads (stickers?) before they stopped selling them:
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01FU0AK54/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

And had been looking for another super thin, sticker like pad. I'd use my desk (and did for years) but the surface slowly becomes too slick over time.

As others have said, this is not as bright as pictured, not even as birght as customer pictures. Sitting on my black desk, black everything down to the carpet, the colors don't stand out or clash. Just lovely!!!

Already bought a second one of these. Even though one of these is the size of two of the other pads. THANK YOU Razer!!!

reviews.title: This is is really thin & FLAT, it goes from about 1/3" to 1" so not ergonomic.
reviews.text:
The software is just garbage. No help, or even about, or link to the website, auto updater, nothing. You have no clue what version you are on or what's the latest.

Macro recording does record mouse clicks but not movements. Though macro programming window doesn't stretch correctly as you can see words are cutoff, super Windows programming armature hour.

Biggest programming issue: *There is no option to run something infinitely or toggle a loop on and off!*

If the toggling option was present, I'd keep it and just have it on the side of my keyboard. It's way to flat on my desk and keys are way too loud to actually use, but I could at least automate some tasks. But not being able to just toggle a set of things to START running for a while then STOP it, that's a deal breaker. It's going back.

reviews.title: -NOTHING- compares to Corsair macro programming options!  But false advertising here.
reviews.text:
EDIT: Changing my review to 2 out 5 instead of 5/5 because I feel there is false advertising here: You CANNOT program all the buttons. You EITHER get the 2 buttons on the left, OR the 2 on the right.

------------

I've tried Logitech, Razor, MS, and every other low and no brands out there.

I've tried keyboards, mice, and keypads. Onboard hardware macros or program-ran ones.

The Corsair Macro options are everything I dreamed of, and more. EASILY created, EASILY edited, exact delays or random range of delay on EVERY SINGLE ITEM. AND on how random options on how far apart a macro should repeat.

Speaking of repeat, you can have things run once, X number of times, or toggle continues. ALL with beautiful graphics interface that's not at all hard to figure out! I've not had to look up a single thing.

Just freaking beautiful. Everyone else in the industry should follow Corsair and hire actual educated, disciplined, capable programmers. Oh my god what a breath of fresh air after years of utter garbage.

reviews.title: -NOTHING- compares to Corsair macro programming options!!
reviews.text:
I've tried Logitech, Razor, MS, and every other low and no brands out there. I've tried keyboards, mice, and keypads. Inboard hardware macros or program-ran ones.

The Corsair Macro options are everything I dreamed of, and more. EAISLY created, EASILY edited, exact delays or random range of delay on EVERY SINGLE ITEM. AND on how random options on how far apart a macro should repeat.

Speaking of repeat, you can have things run once, X number of times, or toggle continues. ALL with beautiful graphics interface that's not at all hard to figure out! I've not had to look up a single thing.

Just freaking beautiful. Everyone else in the industry should follow Corsair and hire actual educated, disciplined, capable programmers. Oh my god what a breath of fresh air after years of utter garbage.

That all said, while my partner likes this keyboard, I'm not a fan of where the G keys are. I keep pressing them instead of CTROL, Shift, Caps Lock, and Tab.

reviews.title: This mouse is SUPER light, but is too small for my hand, coming from DeathAdder
reviews.text:
Though I saw reviews about it being too big, it's noticeably lower and smaller than the Razer Death Adder and feels like half its weight.

It is nearly effortless to move it around, but it also feels not substantial, like it's made out of thin plastic (which I guess is exactly what it is).

The left-hand side buttons are as you'd expect but are dramatically smaller than the DeathAdder and higher.

The right-hand buttons seems just fine with me(I'm right-handed), I never accidentally click them. Though I can really only make use of one, can't feel which is which.

You can define one button to be a "clutch/shift" allowing you to hold it down and have/program all the buttons do something different while it's held down.

The wireless only works if you install the software. But it works beautifully as a wired mouse. The cable is nothing short of exquisite.

All in all, most of my negative feelings is because I'm used to the bigger, heavier, with bigger side buttons, Death Adder. Already ordered the new V2 Death Adder.

reviews.title: Great mouse but OSX weird behavior
reviews.text:
super comfortable and great, one note: if you are using it wired and plug it into a Mac. it will start up if it's plugged in before you start the computer.

If you unplug and try to plug it in again while the computer is on, the mouse will not function. This doesn't affect the wireless dongle tho, only the wired one.

Not really a big deal as my mouse is usually always plugged in.

reviews.title: Android Activator Product is currently broken and you have to activate everytime you reboot
reviews.text:
Android activator throws a bunch of 404 File not Found errors trying to download apks etc, as of 12/10/2019 which renders this completely useless for android. Also what people don't mention is that you have to run the activator every time you reboot your phone.

Note that what is also not told is, this emulates button pushes and is not a true bluetooth controller for games, That being said other emulation apps have gotten people banned for cheating. Buy at your own risk!

reviews.title: absolute must have if you share your oculus with family members
reviews.text: the easy adjustment is much better for smaller kids. we were having problems constantly readjusting between the kids this helped a lot. the extra battery life definitely helps as well

reviews.title: Great headset for the price
reviews.text: Switched over my wife from beats by dre to these, they're much cheaper and way better for gaming. The retractable mic is a nice touch, also if you squeeze the mic it disables the mic and there's a red light indicator that it's off. These were so good I got another pair for my daughter and now we have two!

reviews.title: Wholesome fun for young and old
reviews.text:
It is refreshing to have a game show up in the industry that seems sold out to blood and gore that is purely fun entertainment.
In the orginal tradition with slightly modern adaptations, the Nancy Drew game STAY TUNED FOR DANGER is easy enough for young inexperienced gamers, but with a challenging level for older gamers wanting more fun.
The story is fun, the scenery beautiful... P>Great game to give a young lady for a gift.

reviews.title: The Most Fun Our Family Has Had in Years
reviews.text:
I waited a long time to write this review. Why? Because I wanted to test this game out thoroughly. Also, I wanted to play it just one more time before writing my review.

Buzz Jr allows you to play in multiplayer mode- up to four players. There are four buzz units which are connected at one point. Anyone can enter information that will be recognized by the game.

We played this across the room- about 8 ft from the PS3 and had plenty of room to move around without feeling restricted by the controller cords.

You can also play singler player.

There are practice options so you can learn the games.

You can also save and load games, align the screen, and there is a widescreen option. We played in widescreen mode.

When you are ready to play you have the following options:
marathon
single player
short game
medium game
long game

We played the short and medium so far as we did not want to be locked into anything long- everyone wanted a chance to win.

To play a game you have the choice of quick start, standard, and custom games. The nice part about custom games is that you can set up a list of games that you especially like and play them without having to suffer through games that you don't enjoy or that frustrate you.

The list of games to choose from is this:
Totem Poles
Whack a Squirrel
Wheel Running
Balloon Battle
Bridge Out
Bubble Bath
Card Counting
Elephant Baseball
Free Fall
High Voltage Voting
Island War
Jungle Hurdles
Keep It Up
Leaping Lily Pads
Lion Taming
Monkey Bomb
Monkey Bingo
Monkey Catapault
Monkey Slide
Odd One Out
Primate Penalties
Rocket Riders
Run Around
Simian Shootout (not sure of that one- can not read my own writing!)
Splat

WHAT I LOVE ABOUT THIS GAME

There is so much that I can write about this game in the positive mode- it would take pages.

For the first point, it is there is color- LOTS AND LOTS OF BRIGHT CHEERFUL COLOR! That in itself makes the game enjoyable to play.

We loved that you could personalize your monkey with crazy glasses, clothing, and feet, and the ability to name them is great too.

The music is delightful and fun - very happy music but it does not get to you to hear it over and over like some games.

The game controllers work beautifully. They are very responsive and everyone had chances to win games. The game is easy to use, and yet challenging enough for everyone that no one was bored.

What I especially like about it is that the games were challenging without being insulting or off color in attitude. There were a couple of crude things that some people might object to such as gorilla flatulence underwater and a few things like that, but on the whole it was really fun.

ONE THING I DID NOT LIKE

I did not like voltage voting, however, I thought that was in bad taste- that was the only game I recall being so irritated with that I refuse to play it- voting will electrocute a gorilla I think it is and it just seemed sadistic even cruel- and although it is just a cartoon, the attitude behind it upset me and I don't think it is family oriented.

FINAL COMMENTS

However, the rest of the games- and I think we have played all of them- are really fun and entertaining. All of the games take different skills so each member of the family had a chance of winning. That made it fun to keep going back to try playing over and over. No one felt that they were not able to have a chance at winning.

All in all this game is a huge winner- it gave the entire family a chance to play on Playstation without any concern for content and suitability for different family members. Playing this game has been one of the highlights of the last few months. Our son said it reminds him of Mario Party 3.

reviews.title: Excellent Quality Cable for a Great Price
reviews.text:
Because we like to try out electronic cables and devices for a while before drawing a conclusion, I have made sure to test out this cable for several months now. The verdict is in- this cable is a very high quality cable which works beautifully with no problems at all.

Despite it being thick and a little tricky since you can not bend it at a sharp angle, it is easy to work with by looping a bit as the 6+ft of cable gives us plenty of room to do so, but I would advise you to check out any holes in furniture or other small areas that the cords might have to pass through to be sure you have enough room to pass this cable through if there is any question- BEFORE you install it.

We have checked this cable with various devices- PS3, HDTV, Blu-Ray player and most recently it is being used from a high quality amplifier to a very high level audio-visual computer system. In all cases, the picture/sound has been top notch, with no disintegration of information flow or integrity of signal.

The quality of this cable is definitely high and equals or surpasses the performance of cables that are much more expensive on the market but have brand names that people are more familiar with. We have a LOT of cables and cords in our house as we have an electronic addict in our home, so we have a lot of HDMI cables and devices to test and compare with. This cable is also a good choice for future equipment upgrading as it will be compatible.

The frustration free packaging is brilliant, by the way. Makes life a LOT easier!

I highly recommend this cable, as long as you are not required to make a sharp angle for installation with no extra cord to loop around, or as long as your cable does not have to pass through a very tiny space (as is often the case when you have multiple cables running through holes in furniture, or other small spaces.

reviews.title: Not Super High End But Great For Most Applications
reviews.text:
I have a family of headphone fanatics.

My daughter listens to music or does her school work using headphones most of the time. What is very helpful is having a microphone built into the headphones for some of her work which requires responses such as Spanish.

My son is a headphone enthusiast who goes into such depth about each set of headphones that my eyes tend to glaze over and I am not quite sure what he is talking about. It is THAT in depth. His favorite are Turtle Beach.

All three of us have tested these headphones.

I think they are great for music and gaming. I think they are pretty nice and I like using them. They cancel noise outside well too.

My daughter loves them when doing her school assignments because they cancel outside noise and it is hard to get her attention when she is using them for work online on our PC. They are comfortable and she does not remember she has them on a lot of time. She loves the extendable microphone but she wishes it was just a half inch longer or so.

She likes all of the different extensions that come with it. The cord seems to be a good length. The only other thing she was not keen on was the plastic quality.

My son's major comment about them is that often companies will sacrifice the midrange sounds in an effort to get the higher highs and lower bass sounds and he said that seems to be the case with these.

For what they are, however, the three of us agree it is a decent buy and pretty good for use in games, school programs, and listening to music as well.

We don't have an iphone to test it on so I can not comment on that application of it.

reviews.title: A Few Frustrations But Overall Great Gaming Experience So Far (And Some Things I Wish The Instructions Said)
reviews.text:
My entire family is into gaming and other applications that use headphones and speakers, so I was very interested in try out the Siberia P800 series wireless gaming headphones. There are a lot of excellent highly technical reviews out there for these, but I intend to approach these headphones for someone who is not as into gritty tech details as they might be into practical every day applications.

I am writing this review for those who really want to know about products prior to purchase. I am as detailed as I can be without being overly so, because I want to provide information that I would like to know before purchases. This is an expensive purchase, so it deserves some explanation and time given to research.

WHAT COMES IN THE BOX?
The box that these come in is excellent. It is sturdy and you can keep it for storage of the extra cords and parts if you like. Inside the headphones come carefully pressed into a molded insert. It comes with a wireless transmitter box, every cord you might possibly want to connect it to the Playstation, PC,or Xbox. It also comes with a mobile cable and analog cable for use with TV or mobile device.

The startup guide is, well, let me say really not as good as it should be with an expensive set of headphones like this. For visual learners, you might have some issues unless you are a real techie. There are no pictures of the back of the transmitter box or of the back of the playstation (or other items) you want to connect to so if you are not really good at understanding what goes where, you might have to look up online somewhere how to hook this up to your console or other devices.

WHAT ARE THE HEADPHONES LIKE?
The headphones themselves have a cushioned top and small ear covers on them. The retract and get slightly bigger, but not a huge amount. The top is cushioned and they hold onto the had pretty well, at times feel a bit tight. That will loosen up over time, I am sure.

The left ear pad has a retractable mic in it. When the mic is turned on, a red ring lights up. The disc on the outside of the left ear pad also twists off and that is there the lithium battery is put. When you want to replace, you quickly twist off the cover, replace the battery and you are good to go. There are two arrows that line up for you to replace the cover quickly so you don't have to fumble with it in a hurry to continue your game.

The right ear side has the on off switch on it located just slightly toward the back of bottom of the circle. If the ear pad was a clock with 12 at the top and 6 at the bottom and 9 toward your front with these on, it is about at 5 o'clock. To turn it on, you press for about a minute or so. The switch will light up. If you want to turn on the mic, you tap the same switch once and the mic goes on. Tap again and it goes off.

On the right ear side, there is also a control. It is a wheel which controls volume, but when pressing it, will change the menu on the transmitter box. Then if you move the wheel it will scroll the menu.

The ear pads do fold flat which makes them a bit easier to store when not in use.

I also find that the longer I use these, the more comfortable they seem to become- I imagine they will continue to loosen up over time.

HOW DOES THE TRANSMITTER BOX WORK?
I tested these headphones out on a PS3. I found very little on the internet about using these headphones with a PS3, so knowing that many still use the PS3, I wanted to test using that gaming console first.

SET UP WITH PS3
Optical cable- plug in to optical out on PS3 in back then plug into optical in on the back of the transmitter box.
USB- plug in mini USB side of the cable to the transmitter box and plug the regular USB side into the front of the PS3

POWER - this is optional. The power plug can be plugged in where it says DC but keep in mind that means the transmitter box will be on at all times. If you prefer that it turns off when your PS3 is off, then don't use it. The advantage of the power plug is if you want your battery to charge up when the unit is not on, you can have it plugged in for that. Once done, you can still remove the power plug until needed again.

SIDE SLOT
This package comes with an additional battery. One battery had a single bar of charge on it and the other had two bars of charge on it. So, while using on, the other is charging in the box. I found that with the power plugged in, it took about 45 minutes to reach a full charge or so. One battery took almost an hour. The battery pushes in and locks into place while charging, and then if you push on it again, it will dislodge and come out so you can use it and replace with the other one if you like.

FRONT PANEL
The front panel has a white light up design. It shows the battery charge, that the headphones are on and if you are using gaming and voice and the balance of the two. There is a dial on the right and a back button to the left of that. When turning on the headphones, I get a light that shows they are on then a quick large display of battery power left in them, and then it goes to the screen that shows me PS3 and how much volume is being used at that point. It will also show me the current battery charge of the battery that is charging on the side of the unit too so I can keep track of when it is ready to use should I need it.

The menu is pretty simple to adjust. You press the button to change menu and turn the dial to run through it. There are presets for equalizer and you can also set custom.

WHAT THE DON'T SAY IN THE INSTRUCTIONS
Call me dumb if you want, but although I have programmed computers and done a lot of technical work, I guess I was having a dull moment when I set up these headphones. I could not get them to work. I went through every setting over and over again and just could not make them work right.

Since I have never had headphones on my PS3, (I am the only one who hasn't) I did not realize that I had to change the settings in the sound menu. I should have, but I didn't remember. So, after much looking around, I finally found the setting that has to be changed. There is no mention of it at all in the instruction book. Since this review is geared more toward the casual gamer, I thought you might like to know that small important fact.

You have to go into the PS3 settings menu for sound and pick either the optical sound or you can have both going if you like- through the TV AND headphones. I like to do that when the family wants to be in the room and see what is being played but I want to hear details of sound you normally don't catch on just the TV speakers. You just have to remember to change the settings when you change how you prefer to transmit the sound.

HOW WELL DO THESE HEADPHONES PERFORM?
I am going to have to really work with these for a while to find the ins and outs of them. My first impression of them was awful. I really was disappointed. There was hissing, crackling and all sorts of noise with sound effects on various games. The music seemed fine, but every time there was an explosion or some sort of noise that was supposed to be electronic in nature, the headphones had so much other noise in them it was distracting and annoying. I messed with volume and settings and everything and it just didn't get as good as I thought it should have.

I kept on, however, changing to various games. As I moved through all sorts of different games, I realized that some games must be designed with engines that do not seem to transmit clearly over the wireless headphones. They just are awful. Then other games seemed to be clear and a lot easier to play.

DOLBY
So far, I have had the best results when removing Dolby on all of the games I have tried. I am not sure if that is because the headphones are designed for 7.1 and the PS3 is designed for 5.1, but it seems to be more muffled with the Dolby on and there are more annoying features that come up with sound effects. I will continue to play with this and see how to make it work if I can. I will update this review at that point. We have several different gaming consoles we can try these with, so over time I will elaborate if I find solutions or differences. The listing on these headphones does specify that it will work on both PS3 and PS4 so I plan to see what I can find out about this over time.

MUSIC
I have watched videos on these headphones and found them to be excellent. I can hear all sorts of nuances that I did not catch on just the TV speaker. I watched them via Netflix and also Bluray on the PS3. Sound was much better than some games. Like I said, however, it could just be the software used when developing some games that does not translate as well into the headphones as others.

I do want to point out, that these are GAMING headphones. They are not going to be the top of the line for music listening, so if that is primarily what you want them for, they probably will not be what you want. For the variety of needs I have on the PS3 of videos to music in games and movies, they are surprisingly good.

MICROPHONE
I have not had the opportunity to test out the mic yet with other players. I will update as that opportunity presents itself and will comment on performance during gameplay.

THE BOTTOM LINE
So far I really like these headphones but have a few issues with them. Some games do not sound right in these at all, and others sound beautiful. That is not always the fault of the headphones, but it does make for annoying experiences in some games. The design of the headphones is nice and I do love how they work when they work well with games. The transmitter is easy to use and battery life seems a bit shorter than 20 hours, but I like the fact that you can keep a battery charging while playing so when you need to replace you can.

I also like that you can opt to have the power on to them while the PS3 is off so you can recharge battery, but then unplug it so that it only turns on when the PS3 is on too.

For the price, I have rated these four stars at this time. As I continue to use them and learn more about them and the ins and outs over time, I will update and amend my rating if need be.

FUTURE UPDATES
I plan to test these out with other games as well on my PC games as well as tablet in the future and will comment on those experiences as well.

GAMES TESTED SO FAR (more coming soon)
Monkey Island (newest one)
Hydrophobia
Zen Pinball
Peggle
Planet Minigolf
Spellunker HD
Beyond Two Souls

reviews.title: Solid Headset For Computer Gaming, Adequate for Tablet and Phone, Make Sure To Download The Software
reviews.text:
When it comes to headphones, my family is a bit obsessed. There are always plenty of opinions and preferences flying around our house, so when I had the chance to test these out, there was a grabbing contest and then we had a winner! Let's see how these rated with our headphone fan.

WHAT ARE THESE HEADPHONES LIKE?
A full set of headphones, these are meant to be full coverage. There is plenty of padding on the top of the headphones and in the ears as well. There is a wheel volume control on the left side. There is a flip down mic that flips up when you don't need it. There is also a button on the left side that turns the mic on and off. There is not any light indicator to show if they are on or off.

The mic comes with a foam head that you can apply if you need to. There is a regular plug for a tablet but if you want to use it on the computer, the adaptor allows me to plug into the computer via USB. There is a dolby option for surround sound that seems to be only for the computer. If you want to use this with Xbox One, you need to purchase an adapter

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
I am going to break down what areas that this has performance in.

GENERAL SOUND
Just by itself on a tablet or phone, this is okay. It is not overly impressive, but still works well enough to be worth using. Later on in this review, we will explore the sound after the software engine was used on the computer.

CORD
The cord is a little over 6 ft long which is plenty long enough for comfortable moving around while listening.

COMFORT
These headphones are really comfortable. The cushioning is great and allows for many hours of use without any problems. The swivel of the ear pieces is fabulous. The set up is wonderful. These headphones excel in comfort and the way that the parts work as far as wear on the head goes and operation of the mic and such. The foam on the ears and top of head is cooler to wear than leather or synthetic leather as it breathes nicely.

CONTROLS
You can use volume on the headphones but also the base unit you are using it from. The controls are handy, so you don't have to be bound to use only the base controls from what unit you are using. The mic button is handy and much nicer than a wheel control.

MIC
Calls were heard fine and so far the mic seems to be good to use - people can hear well and it is clear. Used with voice activated systems it worked very well. When used with the foam cover it seems to block outside noise well.

DOLBY
It makes it sound like you are in a tin can. It just is not that great.

DRIVERS
The best performance from these headphones is using the Conair Utility Engine (CUE). That is only available through the computer use. It is really a nice separation of sounds, base is excellent, and the allowance for custom settings is great. This satisfied everyone and they really liked these better once this program was used.

Gaming was greatly improved using this engine. It is great surround sound using computer games which is what this was designed to be used for.

CONTRAST EXPERIMENT
We tested out the same song recording on a phone, tablet, and then on the computer. The sound difference was worth mentioning. When listening on the tablet and phone, the sound was muffled and there was not a great separation of sound. It was adequate but nothing to write home about. When listening to the same song on the laptop using the Corsair Utility Engine it was like a very different set of headphones.

COMMENTS
Is this a jaw dropping set of headphones? No. Is it a great set of headphones to game with and enjoy when you want a decent set that is comfortable, but if you are very picky about your headphones and are fanatical about sound separation and definition (aka realism) this is probably not the headset for you.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This set of headphones is a good starting set of gaming headphones. VERY comfortable to wear for long periods, the mic on these is good and works clear enough to be heard and operate voice activated software well. Separation is best using computers with the Corsair Utility Engine, but is adequate for tablets and phones if you just want to hear music or something without anyone hearing you. These are not top of the line, but they are a hit with our daughter who uses them constantly for everything from phone and tablet, to gaming and voice activated lessons.

MY RATING
Despite them not being top of the line, our daughter really likes these. We all feel that they are one of the most comfortable headsets we have ever used and they serve us well for her basic needs. As for five stars, I would say four is more accurate. The rating is more like FOUR AND A HALF STARS

reviews.title: My Family Is SO Jealous..  BTW, Might Need Longer Cord
reviews.text:
I know, it is silly. Having this HUGE mousepad which rests under my keyboard and that I can also use as a mousepad is really cool . I mean after all, it does light up. Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
I have to say, I was a bit confused when I first saw the photos of this. It looked like it has all of these fancy designs on the pad. In reality, it is just the edging that changes, that is all. It is still cool though. This fits across the entire slide out ledge for my keyboard and mouse. It is plenty large enough for both and then some room too.

LIGHTS?
The edge is what lights up. This either is a static color, a slow fading from one color to another, or a combination of two colors fading on each corner of the edging. It is fun to have and really does look cool when gaming or using the computer in a darkened room. It also has a low and high setting. The high setting supplies just enough light for a darkened room to help see a bit better.

CORD
The cord that comes with this was a bit too short for my set up. I have it on the slide out shelf which the keyboard rests on. The plug in for the mat is at the front edge, but it has to double back to the computer USB connection and not get in the way of the shelf sliding in an out. I had to get a longer cord for this as the cord that came with the unit was not quite long enough.

PERFORMANCE?
This performs very well as a mousepad both as gaming or every day use.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a great addition to a keyboard/mouse area that covers the entire pull out shelf of a computer desk, this pad is fun to have. It is not hard to use, but I did need a longer cord to make it work for me.

MY RATING
Despite needing a longer cord, I am giving this five stars. I like it. It is fun to have and has worked well for quite a while. The color changing edges are really fun to have and add a great touch to my computer area.

reviews.title: Fun Lighting, Works Well With Alienware Laptop
reviews.text:
ALIEN MOUSE
When you get a top of the line Alienware laptop, of COURSE you are going to want an Alienware mouse to go with it.. Let’s take a look at how this performs with the Alienware M17 R2 laptop.

WHAT IS THE MOUSE LIKE?
This is a very ultra light USB mouse with RGB enabled lights all over it. It can be programmed to coordinate with the Alienware laptop and in individual games via the Alien Command Center.

CUSTOMIZABLE DPI
You can customize the DPI on this through the alien command center.

SCROLL WHEEL
The scroll wheel has worked well for the internet and pages we need to use it for. It has been pretty accurate without any frustrations so far.

BUTTONS
Most of the buttons have a basic set up which you can find online, but you can program the buttons too. It takes some work to be able to program them as there is a bit of a learning curve on this mouse. We have had some issues with the Alien Command Center being complete for some things. This mouse is one of them. It could be from our original problems with the laptop and trying to re-download everything.

PERFORMANCE
The mouse is nice and robust. The textured raised pattern makes it really easy to move it back and forth without slipping. This performs like expected for gaming. There is no lagging in tracking and it will work on almost any surface. The basic programming we have done has worked so far. We have not done anything intense or complex with it yet. We just use it as a mouse that lights up.

PAD FOR THUMB REST
The pad for the thumb to rest gives you dependable grip and helps you keep track of your thumb while gaming so you are not pressing buttons. There are three buttons above the thumb rest.

CORD
This has a mesh covering on the cord which allows the cord to move and keeps it from catching on surfaces or tangling when you are winding or using it.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you happen to have an Alienware laptop (in our experience the M17 R2) this mouse is a great companion. I has extra abilities to be programmed in sync with lights on the laptop as well as setting features through the Command center. The cord is tangle free and really nice to use. The mouse works very well so far on a number of surfaces.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This has more potential than we have learned yet. We have had to spend so much time trying to get the laptop straightened out after an initial period of frustration that we have not had as much time to explore all of the dimensions of the mouse. So far, it is really nice and it has worked well for what we have programmed it to do in games and other applications.

UPDATE
I will update this in the future if we discover any more to add to this review.

reviews.title: My Headphone Fanatic VERY PICKY Kids Love These
reviews.text:
I originally got these headphones with the thought that I could play my playstation with them. Unfortunately, I forgot that you can not use headphones with a PS3. So, my kids got to try these. Let's take a look.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These headphones are really nicely designed. My daughter said they are brilliantly designed. The top that goes on top of your head is very stretchy and the wire part about it is one position.

MICROPHONE
The microphone is not retractable, but folds out of place if you want it to. It lights up when it is in use, and when it is disabled, it is not lit. The mic is clear and very loud. It is easy to control.

EARPHONE PADS
The pads are very comfortable and cushioned well. We can wear these a while before they have to be taken off. It is quite comfortable to all of us who tried these on. They are not leather, so if you have sweaty ears, you might have to remove them for a bit now and then.

CONTROLS
The controls on the left ear are all in the back. They are difficult to control unless I take off the headset. However, one of the kids has no problem doing it with them on. I guess it depends but either way, it is not difficult.

CORD
The cord is only about 6ft long which means you can not sit very far away from your PC or gaming machine, unless you have an extension you can add to it, which I suggest you get prior to purchase.

LIGHTS
The lights on these are really cool. They are colorful and can be turned off if you want. If you have a keyboard or gaming pad that has lights on it, these will go well with them.

SOUND QUALITY
When used with PC games, the sound quality of these is really nice. The kids love the sound, nice base, vibration is decent, and the separation of the sounds is great. Even without the drivers installed, it worked really well. My kids are VERY critical and picky, so for them to rave about these is significant.

DOES THIS WORK WITH PS3?
If you have a lot of USB ports on your TV you might be able to use these with your PS3 through the TV but not use the mic as that has to be put in a different way. If not, then it won't work with the PS3 although you can use the mic, just not hear the sound effects through the headphones.

THE BOTTOM LINE
These headphones are excellent for PC gaming and if you can get them to work with PS3 or PS4. The sound separation is great, the 3D is nice and even without the drivers on the CDROM included, the headphones work well.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. For the price, these have been a surprise for our family. The PC gaming is really nice with them, and if I can get my PS3 hooked up to a TV with USB ports, perhaps I can make it work for that in the future. For now, I am content to play PC games with these, if I can get them away from the kids, that is.

reviews.title: Happy with this one.
reviews.text: So far very happy with this purchase! Battery life seems to be ok but I charge it after every gaming session and haven't let it completely die.

reviews.title: Great gaming headset for the $$
reviews.text: My son's talked me into trying these out as they love theirs and I needed a new set. I bought them a while back when they were on sale and haven't regretted my purchase on bit. I know there are better headsets out there but for the money, these are a win for me. They do what I need and being bald, they are quite comfortable for many hours of use. Other headsets tend to get uncomfortable and hurt the top of my head after only a short while. Also, I wear glasses and was worried that these would get uncomfortable because of that however I've got no complaints. Totally would recommend these to anyone looking for a solid headset.

reviews.title: Sound and function great but my ears get sore after about 30 minutes.
reviews.text: I put these T.Assault Six Collection Edition headphone to the test with some extended gaming sessions the last few days and overall I'd say they are pretty nice however there a couple issues I've noticed. As I noted in the headline here, after about 30 minutes of wearing them during some gaming sessions they started to feel like they were squeezing my ears a bit. Sound quality was great and the microphone worked almost better than a more expensive set that I own. The inline mic control works as it should and I like the volume control that's located on the left ear piece. They are easy to adjust to fit my medium sized head comfortably. The mic is removable and once inserted it's a little tricky to get it back out and when doing so, I broke a little plastic tab off the mic where it locks into place. the mic still works however, and seems to still stay in place anyway. There is also an included plug that fits into the headphone jack when not using the mic.

reviews.title: Razer quality as always!
reviews.text: I have always been a big fan of Razer products and the Razer BlackWidow Mechanical Gaming Keyboard 2019 did not disappoint. The new Synapse app has been updated and much less buggy than when I last used it which was nice. The keys on this keyboard are nice and clicky (Razer Mechanical Switches) yet feel solid and not mushy. I love how customizable this keyboard is with the Synapse app. Color options are endless and you could spend hours personalizing every key with a different color if you wanted to. Personally I just like the presets that are available to tweak to your liking. Through the Synapse app you can also create Macros to your hearts content, however my Macro days have long since passed. It's even got on-board and cloud memory for your favorite programmed presets. If only this new version BlackWidow would have been available back in my WoW days! Seriously though, 5 stars all around!!

reviews.title: Precision is spot on!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:18ba20ed40be8cc07d6211425f7b00de]] Right out of the I didn't have to make any adjustments for what I am mainly going to use this mouse for. I used to game pretty hard core back in the day and my favorite mouse back then was one of the higher end Razer mice which was a bit bigger and more involved to use.
