This new Razer Basilisk Essential Gaming Mouse was a breeze to set up and is the perfect size and has everything I need and more. For the little PC gaming I do now the Basilisk has plenty Macro options and I love the Chroma effects which sync perfectly with my Razer keyboard. The slightly textured rubber grips actually give me better control than I initially thought they would. The buttons are nice and clicky and feel like they will hold up to some heavy smashing. It glides super smooth which is due to the butter smooth pads, weight and the perfect soft flexible cord.

reviews.title: Great sound for the price.
reviews.text: The sound quality from these Razer Kraken Gaming Headset 2019 - [Green] Headphones is pretty good actually. I'm not only impressed by that, but the material quality of these is quite impressive as well and the foam ear pads (and head cushion) are very comfortable. I love the soft braided cable and that it's not stiff like many others out there. The mic does very well (but needs to be fully extended) and I never had any complaints from any friends while chatting via X-Box games. The only issue I felt there was with the headphones was that they didn't fit as snug as I prefer, which made them lack on sound isolation.

reviews.title: Solid gaming mouse!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:5f4afe2ac85800e8e30c919d83ea9432]] I ordered the Lenovo Legion M500 RGB Gaming Mouse, Up to 16000 DPI 50G 400Ips, 7 Programmable Buttons, 3 Zone 16.8Milion Colors RGB, 10G Optional Magnet Weight, 3 Onboard Profile, 50 Million L/R Button Durability to use with my gaming laptop. I have never used anything by Lenovo before and I was surprised to see that they made Gaming Mice. I knew that they made laptops but not other peripherals. With that said I am quite pleased with the M500 RGB Gaming Mouse and I would say that it compares to other high end gaming mice on the current market. The weight, shape and feel of this mouse fits my hand perfectly and is very comfortable to use and control. The RGB lighting is amazing and the Lenovo Legion App makes it so easy to configure not only the lighting, but for fine tuning and setting up profiles for the mouse. I have been using the M500 now for a few weeks and I absolutely love it. There are a lot of Gaming mice on the market right now and I have used a few different brands, some well known and others not so, but this one has definitely made an impression and will be my go-to Laptop Gaming mouse for quite a while.

reviews.title: Volume control design is probably my favorite feature!
reviews.text:
I ordered the ‘HyperX Cloud Stinger Wireless Gaming Headset with Long Lasting Battery Up to 17 Hours of Use, Immersive in-Game Audio, Noise Cancelling Microphone, Comfortable Memory Foam, and Designed for PC’ to use mostly for video editing and listening to music on PC. I would like to share my thoughts after quite some time using these headphones thus far, but first I would like to say that I am a big fan of HyperX and the quality products they produce.

Cons:
Comfort - My initial impression was how light these headphones are and expected them to be extremely comfortable, however after about an hour into wearing them I noticed that the head padding just doesn't work for me. I have a bald head and find that many headphones just don’t have either the right amount of padding, or use a “not so comfortable” material. I much prefer my wired HyperX headphones for comfort.

Sound - Although the sound quality is good, I expected it to be much better. For me there just isn’t enough Bass nor Volume to these Cloud Stingers. Don’t get me wrong here. The sound is nice, clear and not muddy but I really think that my wired HyperX cloud headphones sound much better.

Frame - The Steel Slider frame is nice and light however the slider is a bit loose and tends to adjust too easily which gets annoying when you find just the right fit (btw they fit big in my opinion).

Pros:

Swivel Earcups - I absolutely love the Swivel Earcups which make it easy to turn the earcup away from your ear so that you can listen to someone talking to you in the same room without having the headphones slide off you head. I wish my other headphones had this feature.

Sound - I may have expected better sound quality however as I stated in the cons, but they do actually sound good and are very clear.

Earcup Padding - I have no issues at all with the comfort of the Earcups nor padding. In fact they are very comfortable, just as my other HyperX headphones.

Wireless Connection - The 2.4Ghz Wireless Connection has exceeded my expectations and works much better than Bluetooth in my opinion. I can walk into the next room without any loss in sound quality or losing connection.

Battery Life - I have not fully tested how long the battery “actually” lasts but it does last a long time. I don’t charge them after every use but I will say that I have used them for hours at a time, then turned them off and came back days later to find them still capable of several more hours of use with zero issues.

Volume Control - Though the Cloud Stingers don’t have the volume level that I expected, I do like that the volume control is nice in the sense that you can “fine tune” the volume level. By that I mean, as you slide the volume control it doesn’t jump up or down super fast as most do. As you rotate the volume control, it’s very gradual. The control doesn’t stop either way you rotate it. To adjust the volume you need to rotate it several times to go all the way up or down and the tension is absolutely perfect. This makes it nice so that if it slightly gets bumped by just putting the headphones on or taking them off (or rubbing against your hoodie) you’re not going to suddenly change the volume by much at all. I appreciate this feature probably most of all!

Other Thoughts - The Swivel Mic does seem to work well the few times I have actually used it however I kind of wish that it was removable. The USB Dongle is nice and small however I have to admit that I have lost it a few times. I have recently however found a solution to this problem by placing the Dongle flat inside the earcup and twisting it slightly to fit snug and secure (see attached images)
Overall I am a fan of HyperX products and do feel there is definitely value to the Cloud Stingers and I do plan to continue to use them for video editing. However, I think there are better “wireless” headphone options for gaming and listening to music, but you will spend considerably more for those options.

reviews.title: Not compatible with the Xbox One Astro Command Center App.
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'ASTRO Gaming A20 Wireless Headset, Black/Green - Xbox One' to use as my main X-Box One gaming headset and because Astro is such a great brand. Now that I have had plenty of time to use and play with the headset I am ready to share my thoughts.

Pros:
1 - This headset sounds great for gaming and for music both on Xbox One and PC. They are nice and clear and quite satisfying.
2 - I find that even after a few hours of wearing they are still comfortable and do not irritate my ears, nor my bald head which is impressive, as I have tried others that tend to either cause my ears to feel as if they are being squished and or irritate the top of my head. This set is nicely padded both with the ear cups and headband.
3 - The Mic performs better than most and I find that compared to others that I have tried and tested, the Mic performance is probably the top of my list out of all that I own.
4 - I have had zero issues with this headset connecting and pairing up (quickly) with the control module, both when connected to the Xbox One or PC.

Cons:
1 - Seeing as this was going to be my main Xbox One gaming headset, I was extremely disappointed that it would not connect to the Xbox One Astro Command Center App. I tried several things and eventually contacted Astro Customer Support. They were quick to respond stating that the A20’s were not compatible with the Xbox One Astro Command Center (ACC) and could not tell me why. They stated that even if they knew why, that they probably wouldn’t be able to tell me. This is my main gripe and why I docked one star. I mean, it makes Zero sense to me that if the A20’s are made and designed for the Xbox One and PC then why should I also need a PC to connect to the ACC to make adjustments to the EQ settings and update firmware. Fortunately, I do have a PC and was able to do this, but for those that don’t, good luck.
2 - The placement of the volume control makes it so that if you are wearing a hoodie, and because the volume control is easily adjustable, it can easily be adjusted just by moving your head. Now with that said, it’s not a huge deal because fortunately it adjusts in very small increments but it is still a bit annoying. Also the A20’s don’t remember the last volume setting and every time you turn them on you need to adjust the volume, which for me means rotating the control up several times to get max volume.
3- I wish that the Mic was removable. Now this isn’t huge as it is nice to just be able to rotate the Mic down and it’s on, and rotate is back up and it’s muted but it would be nice to be able to remove it if you wanted.
4 - lastly I don’t like the overall look of this headset. I was concerned that because of the “square” boxiness look, that it wouldn’t fit right but as I stated in the Pro’s, this set is perfectly comfortable and because of that, I will give them kudos - but they do look a bit funky compared to other brands and styles out there.
Overall and even with the listed Cons, I love this headset and think that Astro has produced a fantastic headset at a great value for the money but again, it makes no sense that it doesn’t work with the Xbox One ACC App.

reviews.title: Buttery smooth "clicky" keys!!
reviews.text:
I ordered the ‘Logitech G815 RGB Mechanical Gaming Keyboard (Clicky)’ to review, and because I have been a long time Logitech fan, but never have owned a keyboard made by them. My first impression when I opened this G815 was that it screamed Quality and it's absolutely gorgeous! It's solid and heavy for a keyboard of this size and I couldn't wait to get it hooked up and install the Logitech G Hub software. I am not so much into PC gaming as I once was, so I won't be able to really put this "Gaming Keyboard" through its paces in that sense, but I will tell you this, I absolutely LOVE the ever so smooth "clicky" mechanical keys. They aren't as loud and annoying as other keyboards I have owned. The keys are (IMO) perfect. Clicky yet not loud and they are very responsive. Not only that, but there is very little throw to them. I would almost go as far to say that they are a "buttery smooth clicky", if there is a such thing. Seriously though, the G815 has now bumped my other favorite keyboard off my desk, and it has now become my favorite keyboard of all time. I also love the lower profile and the RGB lighting effects are super cool and it's been fun customizing them via the G Hub software but honestly I just stick with the default presets and animations. I mean you can really go to town on customization if you want, and it can be a bit overwhelming. Oh, and I almost forgot to mention that the volume control and buttons for your media is very nice too. The wide volume roller bar is pretty sensitive, but the placement is easily accessible, yet not so much that you will accidentally bump it during normal use.
Overall, I think if you are looking for a solid quality keyboard at a great value, you should most definitely check this one out!

reviews.title: Nice build quality but not my favorite.
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Alienware Mechanical Gaming Keyboard AW310K: Cherry MX Red Switches - Nkro - Per-Key White LED - USB Passthrough & Media Control - 5 Onboard Profiles' for review and would like to share my thoughts.

I love the Alienware brand and had high hopes for this keyboard and though I am a big RGB fan, I felt that I would still give this (white only lighting) one a go. My first impressions were that this was a really nice built keyboard but after playing with it a bit I found that I do not particularly like the feel of the keys. They are not really clicky (but loud), and the keys seem to have a fairly long thrown to them. They are quite sensitive, but to me they feel like you really need to press them all the way to ensure that they are being registered. It's not the case, as it doesn't take much pressure but it just feels like you need to press hard because of the long throw they seem to have. Another thing that I don't really like is the media control buttons. Personally I prefer a dial or knob rather than buttons for this feature. Overall I am happy with the build quality but I feel that for what you get, it is retailed a bit steep. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice keyboard and again very well built bu there are others in this price range that I personally would prefer.

reviews.title: Nice build quality but pretty plain and simple design.
reviews.text: I ordered the 'Kain 200 Aimo RGB Gaming Mouse - Black' because I am a sucker to try any new gaming mouse. This Roccat Kain 200 is definitely a great build quality and I do love the wireless connection and have had zero issues with that. I love the little included cable adapter which allows you to plug into the back of your PC with the included cable, then bring it closer near the mouse, then plug the wireless USB adapter into the cable adapter (see attached images). The mouse is nice and performs well and I actually like the button that allows you to (on the fly) adjust the DPI. Most of the others out there you can adjust the DPI, but you are required to open the associated app and find the setting from within there to make the adjustments. The scroll wheel on the Kain 200 is a little on the tight side but with that said, it does make it less likely that you will scroll to quickly as others on the market tend to do. The scroll wheel also has a nice rubber feel with that satisfying sort of smooth clickyness. It just feels good. Again, build quality on this guy is great but the overall look and feel is just sort of plain to me. Some might like this but for me personally, I like a more ergonomically designed mouse. Plus I like more grip. The design of the Kain 200 has a smooth finish and not much grip. Overall I do believe there is a market for this mouse and many people will love the simple design but for me, I will be moving back to my favorite gaming mouse.

reviews.title: A little laggy but overall fun and easy to set up.
reviews.text: I ordered the 'PDP Xbox One MARS Starter Pack - Voyage of the Dead, 048-132-NA' for review. I was curious about this latest take on the arcade style lightgun and I feel that MARS has done a great job at their design however there is one thing I'd like to see improved. Before I explain that, I'd like to share my overall thoughts. First I would like to state that I had absolutely zero issues with setting this up on my Xbox One S. I was leary because so many others had issues with calibrating the camera. I set mine up in a mid sized living room about 8 feet from our old 55 inch plasma TV and for me, the set up and calibration was a breeze. There are many different games you can play besides the main Voyage of the Dead game. It totally reminds me of the old Duck Hunt from back in my day. All of the games are fun to play but I do wish it would have come with two guns. It would have been a more "complete" kit in my opinion. With all that said, the real issue I noticed is that although the gun is quite accurate, there is a bit of lag. This tends to get a bit annoying but it just takes some getting used to. I would hope that eventually this could be improved. Other than that, I think MARS has done a great job on this product and I look forward to more from them in future games.

reviews.title: Looks nice but has a few quirks......
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:5fb4b847c95831afd3178dd8722131d]] I ordered the ‘MOJO Wireless Charger Mousepad - Qi Quick Charging Gaming Mouse Pad with RGB Lighting’ for review and would like to share my thoughts.

First off out of the box this looks and feels great however I wasn't sure about the the top surface material. I am more used to the feel of a fabric top that is padded. I am not sure how they could have used this type of material with the wireless charger so I understand the material choice, but I really am not sold on the overall design.

There are small very thin rubber pads on the bottom of the pad that are supposed to keep the pad in place, however even on a flat glass table top, it does not grip enough and tends to move around while using the mousepad. I have attached a bit of video that demonstrates this a bit as well as the wireless charging. Speaking of wireless charging, it does work but it does take some getting used to where your mobile device needs to be placed. When you find that sweet-spot, it does work but it does not Fast Charge unfortunately. This may be due to my 5 year old computer and my USB 3.0 ports may not provide the power to do so.

There is also a fingerprint touch button at the top middle of the pad where you can touch to change the color options and this is fun to play with however I have noticed that while playing, the button is easily “accidentally” touched, which messes up your color choice. It’s not a big deal but it does get annoying if you have a certain option that you like and need to press through the options to find the one you prefer.

Overall my thoughts are that this is a pretty nice mousepad and does have value however it’s not my favorite design. I do appreciate the wireless charging capability and it makes for a convenient way to keep your phone close while gaming and have it charge.

reviews.title: Looks awesome!
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Tilted Nation RGB Headset Stand and Gaming Headphone Display with Mouse Bungee Cord Holder with USB 3.0 HUB for Wired or Wireless Headsets for Xbox, PS4, PC' for review and would like to share my thoughts.
I have been wanting a headphone stand for my wireless gaming headphones for some time but I have not found one that I really like. This Tilted Nation stand has everything that I was looking for. It's sturdy and looks really nice on my desk. The RGB lighting is pretty sweet and the color options are nice and work well, although I have had one time where the lights shut off and I had to unplug the device then plug it bag in to get the lighting back on. I am not sure what happened but since then it has worked fine. I love the fact that I can also use the base to plug in a couple other USB 3.0 devices such as my RGB mouse-pad and even an SD card reader. Another great feature is the flexible mouse cable arm that keeps my mouse cable from getting snagged. I have never used anything like this before and I must say that it is pretty nice! Overall I love this stand and think it is a great value for what you get.

reviews.title: Saves my AA stash.
reviews.text: I ordered the 'Xbox One X Slim Controller Charger, GYORGKSHI Dual Console Charging Dock Station Stand with 2 x 800mAh Rechargeable Battery Packs for Xbox One X Slim Elite Controllers' for review and because my daughter was eating up my AA stash. My son has this same kit and he loves it so I thought this would be a good X-Box One S Controller Charger for my Daughter's new X-Box One S. The rechargeable batteries fit the new controllers perfectly and the only issue (same with my Son) is that sometimes the controllers wont seat right in the charger. This is pretty easy to correct just by re inserting them and giving them a little tap. Other than that this kit works great for the price and keeps my AA stash from disappearing.

reviews.title: Currently my favorite!
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:15c368008dd4839790dca1b2e254fb9a]] I ordered the 'HyperX Pulsefire Raid - Gaming Mouse - 11 Programmable Buttons, RGB, Ergonomic Design, Comfortable Side Grips, Software-Controlled Customization' for review.

I am not as much of a gamer as I used to be but I do appreciate a quality gaming mouse. I used to be a die hard unmentioned brand fan boy at one time, but I have found that there are many others that have risen to compete against the best. HyperX happens to be one of those. I have a few other products from them that have blown me away in performance and quality. This Pulsefire Raid is most definitely my favorite at the moment. These days I mostly use a good mouse for video and photography editing and though I don't game much anymore, I would rather use a gaming mouse over a standard boring mouse. The Pulsefire Raid is anything but boring. It feels good in the hand and with the responsive clicky buttons, it makes for a better editing experience. I love that I can still take advantage of the programmable buttons as shortcuts within my editing software. It has become my new obsession to find the most useful and time saving shortcuts to map to my mouse. The Pulsefire Raid makes this so easy and I couldn't be happier with the overall performance. The customize-able lighting is fun to play with and that lighted logo is just so sick looking. Plus I love how smoothly it glides across my mouse pad. HyperX really nailed it with this one and I think it'll be a long while before I find another gaming mouse that I like better. I hope that this was helpful!

reviews.title: Sound, comfort and quality are absolutely amazing.
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Plantronics RIG 800LX wireless gaming headset - Xbox One' for review and would like to share my thoughts.

So far I am loving this headset and it has performed quite well for me. The comfort is one of the best that I have tried so far and the sound quality has exceeded my expectations. The only issue I have had is that when using them with my X-Box One, is that every once in a while they will cut out, but I am not sure if that is the fault of the headset, rather my set up or possibly the radio interference in my home at the moment. Overall listening to music or movies via my PC, and the sound quality while playing games is fantastic. Plantronics has always impressed me with their quality and this headset is no exception.

reviews.title: My new favorite mouse!
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Razer Basilisk v2 Wired Gaming Mouse: 20K DPI Optical Sensor - Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - Chroma RGB Lighting - 11 Programmable Buttons - Classic Black' for review and would like to share some of my thoughts.

I have tried several gaming mice over the years and though I am not so much into gaming as I once was, I still love a good gaming mouse. This Razer Basilisk v2 has become my new favorite "wired" mouse to date. I use it mainly for PC use as well as video and photo editing, and it has performed flawlessly. I think my favorite feature is how comfortable it is. The ergonomic design and the way my thumb rests on the mouse rather than dragging on the mouse pad really makes this mouse enjoyable to use. It is also has a nice grip to it which really ads to the comfort and control. I also love the included optional thumb button that magnetically snaps into place and can be macro'd to commonly used Photo and video editing keys. The mouse glides smoothly across any surface and all the buttons are nice and clicky. Razer makes a great mouse and they are always innovating and creating better and better peripherals. Overall this really has become my favorite mouse to use, and I have to say that for a wired mouse, it is the most comfortable and reliable. I hope that this was helpful.

reviews.title: Sound great but issue with random static/lag
reviews.text:
I ordered the 'Corsair Gaming VOID RGB Elite Wireless Premium Gaming Headset with 7.1 Surround Sound, White' for review. First I would like to mention that I had originally ordered these in White. The box I received was tagged as white however it was mis-tagged and the headphones are black. This was not a huge deal to me but you may want to make sure you get the color you order before you open the box.

I have had these for a while now and I must say that I am a Corsair fan but these are just a bit of a disappointment actually. The build quality is great, the sound is pretty good but the issue for me is the random static or lag that these have with my fresh install of Windows 10 Pro. I don't own a PS4 to test them on unfortunately so this review is entirely based on how they have performed on my PC. They do connect super fast and effortlessly to my system, they feel comfortable but they are a bit on the large side for my head. The feel just a tad bit loose. I think the static or lag issue may be due to that these run off of the 2.4ghz bandwidth and I am using them in the same room as my wireless router which may be the issue but even so they should (in my opinion) be flawless in this situation. I can't say that I don't like these, but I can say that they are not my favorite. The RGB lights on the side are pretty cool but my guess is that they can and will drain the battery faster. As for the sound quality, they really hit the Bass, Mids and Highs spot on. The battery life is actually great for Wireless gaming headphones and they seem to charge fairly fast although I have not completely drained the battery yet. As for the charging, I do have to point out that they charge via Micro USB which is another disappointment. It's 2020 Corsair and USB C should be the standard in my opinion. Overall I do like this headset, but it will be more of a backup to others that I have that I think are much better for the price. I hope that this was helpful.

reviews.title: Great product!
reviews.text:
I ordered the "Razer DeathAdder V2 Gaming Mouse: 20K DPI Optical Sensor - Fastest Gaming Mouse Switch - Chroma RGB Lighting - 8 Programmable Buttons - Rubberized Side Grips - Classic Black" for review and would like to share my thoughts.

I have been a long time fan of Razer products and have used many of their different gaming mice and this V2 of the DeathAdder has not disappointed. It is very responsive, it fits well in my right hand, and the build quality is as expected for a Razer product. I have not had any issues thus far and though I am not very "technical" when it comes to DPI performance, I must say that I am quite satisfied overall with the DeathAdder V2.

reviews.title: Absolutely love this controller but....
reviews.text: This is my all time favorite Xbox controller. I can't go back to the regular controllers because of the extra bottom buttons. The weight is perfect but I am not a huge fan of the materials used for the grip. It's a rubber type feel which you would think it would have more of a grip but it is not, its a bit slippery. Although I absolutely love this controller for the most part, I am starting to have the thumb controller drift. For the price this controller should NOT be already failing which is why I am giving the 3 star rating. I don't think it's still under warranty which is unfortunate.

reviews.title: We love this game...
reviews.text: We love this game.  We first rented it from Blockbuster because the reviews weren't good, but we ended up purchasing it the next week.  I love the way it switches characters. My six year old can do it, but it is still fun for adults as well.  I would definitely purchase this game again.

reviews.title: I would wait for a bit to buy this...
reviews.text: Our family hasn't played rock band on any other platform than the Wii, so we really don't have anything other platform to compare it to.  Now, having said that, we are having a blast with it.  However, we wish we would have waited for a few months for the Guitar Hero World Tour - Band Kit to come out and compared the two.  We like the music scores better for Guitar Hero than the ones that came with Rock Band.  It would also be nice to see if multiple guitars can be used with the new Guitar Hero Band Kit that is coming out, as it doesn't seem like multiple guitars can be used with Rock Band... or at least we haven't figured out a way to do this yet.  Don't get me wrong... Rock Band is a lot of fun.  But, after seeing the previews for the other, I wish we would have waited a few months.

reviews.title: Very disappointed wtih this game.
reviews.text:
This game left a lot to be desired. I have skied for 25 years and this board is nothing like skiing. Yet, the skiing games that ship with the Wii board are wonderful and account for every way your body may move. This one only seems to account for side-to-side movement.

This was a real disappointment. Stick with the ski games that come with the Wii Fit. They are a lot of fun.

reviews.title: I normally love Amazon Basics... but not this one
reviews.text:
I normally love Amazon Basics, but this one was a disappointment. First, we had to take the silicone covers off and the little square Wii motion sensitivity sensors on the bottom to get these to recharge. This was a really big pain and I was afraid I we were going to lose the accessories. The remotes are a little wobbly in the charging station and you have to make sure the wrist strap fits in the little notch in the back to make them a bit more secure.

The other thing that drove us a bit crazy was the fact that it was a USB attachment into the Wii station instead of using its own power cord. So, it was always glowing right in front of the TV. If your Wii is turned off, then it will not charge the remotes. It has to be at least turned on (green light showing on Wii) or in the standby (yellow light showing on the Wii) position.

We have always just used batteries, so we were hopeful this charging station would work well. However, I think we will go back to using our regular batteries. Maybe if we were true gamers and played all the time, I would think twice, but right now we only replace the batteries in the four chargers ever couple of months and maybe only play the Wii a couple times during the week.

reviews.title: Only noticed a slight improvement...
reviews.text: First, let me preface this with the fact that I am not a hard core gamer.  This product works, but it isn't so exceptional that I would pay a lot of money for it.  Now, my teenage son that loves gaming swears that he can hear a difference.  We have attached it to the computer and the XBOX 360.  Both sound about the same.  So, would I recommend... depends on how much you have to pay for it.  Would my son recommend it, he said yes.

reviews.title: For and old Mom like me, this is a lot of fun!
reviews.text: So, I am 43 years old and I have so much fun playing this game with my 11 year old daughter.  It is a fun little workout and definitely gets you off the couch and moving.  My daughter has the Just Dance Wii, Just Dance XBOX 360, Dance Central XBOX 360, and all the Zumba dance games for the Wii and XBOX 360.  She said this is her favorite out of all of the ones she owns.  Most of the music is really catchy.  She said said she likes about 80% of the music and dances.  For an "old" mom like me, I like about 50% of the music and dances.  Of course, my daughter plays it in a much harder mode and loves it.  She said even the advanced mode is a bit too difficult for her and she has been part of a dance company for 8 years.  I like the easy mode, as that seems to be hard enough for me. It seems to pick up your moves accurately, so I think the Kinect works well, unlike some of the Kinect games we have.  So, I would highly recommend it... a lot of fun... very challenging... and a good, get off the couch, workout.

reviews.title: AWESOME headphones!!!
reviews.text:
These headphones are incredible. First... I have to say that noise canceling was amazing. The minute you put them over your ears, it blocks everything out even without sound turned on. They sound great too. Overall... here are the pros and cons:

PROS
Noise cancelling is amazing
Very easy to pair to any Bluetooth capable device
The sound is very clear when listening to music, gaming, or even just talking on the phone
Not just great for gaming... they are great all around headphones
Lightweight, so it's not an issue to wear them for a long period
Earpieces fold in so the become flat for storage
Zipper case is compact and makes them easy to store
Battery life is really great

CONS
I wish it had a little more bass to the sound
The price is a bit steep, but still... they are great headphones
Wish I could pair to more than one device at a time (for example... iPhone for incoming calls and a gaming system at the same time)

Overall... I would highly recommend them. They are a great set of headphones.

reviews.title: Game is challenging to us... we are only occassional gamers
reviews.text: I have to start by saying that we are not hard core gamers in our family, but we do enjoy playing our Wii and XBOX 360.  We found this game to be really fun.  It is not high stress like a game such as Titan Fall, but it is more of a thought game with timed events.  My 13 year old daughter got a little frustrated getting through the first couple levels because it kept starting her over in spots because she would not complete the task fast enough.  But, eventually she figured it out and was having a lot of fun with it.  Now, with that said, one of her hard core gaming friends came over and played it and he had finished all levels within a few days only coming over for a couple hours at a time.  So, I could see how some hard core gamers might get a bit frustrated with it because of how short it is.  We found it to be a lot of fun and just right for our family and I would definitely recommend.  As a parent, just be aware that there is some profanity and violence.  The profanity is probably less than a child would experience in a school hallway so I wasn't to bothered by it.

reviews.title: CM10 is a fairly good program with flaws (does run on Vista)
reviews.text:
This is a pretty good chess program for beginners & intermediate players, has a lot that helps you learn, including of course not-too-bad player simulation. It's not perfect, but I would recommend it if you're looking for something for anyone who wants to learn or get better.

There is a long list under "how this program could have been better". See some of the other reviews, but my top 3 gripes are: (1) dumb programming that chews up the CPU even when the program is supposed to be idle; (2) bugs, especially a "hang" problem on single-cpu/single-core machines, where the game program just gets stuck somewhere (looks like a race condition; solution is to temporarily lower the priority of the TheKing processes by using TaskManager); (3) explanations of bad moves, or recommendations of good moves, provide detail but not the big picture.

Finally, it does appear to run fine in Vista: I installed it normally and have been playing it without problems. (I haven't seen the hang problem, but since I have a dual-core machine now I don't expect the race condition to occur.)

reviews.title: It works, but doesn't fold prongs.

reviews.title: some ui improvements over Office 2007
reviews.text:
There's not a lot that's obviously changed in this version from Office 2007. (See [...] for detailed descriptions of changes.)

But I do like the improvements in the ribbon: firstly, you can hide it, to get more usable screen; secondly, you can customize it! Both of these were missing features in Office 2007, desired by many (if not most) users.

There are also some security improvements that are useful: e.g., Word opens downloaded files in a protected mode; PowerPoint allows presentations to be restricted from editing/copying.

If you're trying to decide between this version and a previous one, definitely I'd recommend this one. If you're trying to decide whether to pay for an upgrade, it depends on how irritated you get with the limitations of the ribbon in the 2007 version.

For users in a business setting, some of the collaboration features (using Sharepoint Server) might also be of interest. See link above for more info.

reviews.title: cloud feature is disappointing
reviews.text:
I upgraded (from 2012) in order to have mobile access to the data. And that is a useful & long-desired improvement.

Unfortunately, Intuit did its usual half-hearted, half-designed job with this feature, and it's quite disappointing:
1. You can't sync investment accounts. The old investing.quicken.com site is very limited, not worth using. (For example, you can't see simple consolidated views of your investments, can't run basic reports. etc.)
2. The sync from the desktop isn't automatic, and takes a long time. If you're used to other online products that sync to the desktop (think Dropbox & Google Drive as two very popular examples, there are many others), you will find this clunky & old-tech. Everytime you open Quicken, it will tell you you made changes, whether you did or not, and suggest that you sync. This should be an automated, behind the scenes process, it's not hard.
3. The alerts are rather dumb, and they're essentially hard-coded. You can't create your own rules, and you can't even do a lot with the built-in rules (you can just pick some parameters from a limited list). You can't delete them all either, if you consider them dumb and pointless. Again, not hard to do a lot better.

There are no significant improvements in reporting, or in investment analysis. If you look at the "What's new in 2013" page, you see mobile, alerts, and "more flexible budgeting", whatever that means.

There is a tweak to how accounts show up in the nav bar, where you can put some accounts in the "Separate" list, which means "show but don't include with main set of accounts". This is mildly useful. There's also a feature to mark an account "closed", also slightly useful -- in theory. These account still show up in the list of accounts when you're doing a transfer between investment accounts! Clearly someone forgot what the word "closed" might mean.

So all in all, same old Intuit, same old Quicken. Buy it if the mobile feature is useful to you. (BTW, I tried Mint as an alternative, and I couldn't stand the heavy-duty selling on every darned screen. Maybe some people can tune this stuff out, I couldn't.)

reviews.title: Lovely keyboard, worth considering.
reviews.text:
[Note: I updated this review and changed rating to 4*, since I was mistaken about the lighting.]

This was the first mech keyboard I tried, and I really liked the feel and responsiveness. I was switching from a Logitech Wave keyboard, and found that the slightly smaller keyboard and different layout gave me a little trouble at first, but I began to adjust fairly quickly. The Logitech G-Hub software is ok: in my opinion not quite as good as the Razer Synapse software in ease of use and configurability, but good enough.

Unfortunately, the new GX keys do not allow the secondary characters on the keys (the symbols accessed by using Shift) to be illuminated. So there I am, looking at brightly lit characters, and finding myself peering occasionally to be sure I'm hitting the right key for the shift character. Maybe a perfect touch typist wouldn't care, but I need to occasionally look, especially when I'm typing the less frequent characters. (My understanding is that this is a limitation of most mechanical keys: only the upper part of the key can be properly lit, so the only solution is to have the two characters side by side at the top.)

A minor flaw is the need to use two USB slots to plug in the keyboard, because one powers the pass-through USB slot. What? How is that useful? I'd rather just use a separate USB cable or hub and have the option of using USB 3, multiple ports, etc. I think this is just dumb, although I know that many buyers want a pass-through no matter what.

I ended up returning this one and switching to a Razer TKL with linear switches, which has even better responsiveness and feel, and is just a bit more convenient to position. And as I said above, I like the Synapse software better.

reviews.title: This is a really nice TKL keyboard.
reviews.text:
I decided recently to upgrade both of my keyboards to mechanical ones, and after doing quite a lot of research, I decided that these BlackWidow TKL linear switch keyboards were the best fit for me with price and performance in mind.

Overall I'm pretty happy: the touch and feel of the keyboard is wonderful (I really prefer the linear switches), the wrist rest is essential and quite comfortable, and the TKL size allows me to position the keyboard near the mouse, which for me is ergonomically much better. (I had been using a Logitech Wave for years, and I'm still a bit surprised by how much better this keyboard is for me overall.)

Downsides? Firstly, these are the keys with the secondary characters not lit: if you want those lit, you have to spend about $30 more to get the PBT keycap upgrade package. (Or you can buy another Razer TKL product, most likely without a wrist rest.) Secondly, I don't like the light under the keys, I think that's quite unnecessary and distracting, actually making it harder to read those unlit characters. Oh, and my pet peeve is the Delete key being the same size as the others: I happen to use it almost as often as I use backspace, and much prefer keyboards where that key is made larger.

Finally, you want to hope you never need Razer customer service. My experience with them has been pretty bad: they're really slow, they don't do what they say they'll do, and it can take several days and multiple attempts to do something that with Amazon takes about 5 minutes. They don't seem to take it seriously enough.

reviews.title: Very nice mechanical keyboard with clicky keys
reviews.text:
If you're familiar with Razer keyboards, you won't be disappointed with this one, it has that same lovely tactile feel when you're typing, and fast response. The "green" keys are a tad louder than than the others (orange and yellow), but not unpleasant, although those in a shared space may want to check if the typing might bother others nearby. I find that I have much lower fatigue using a good mechanical keyboard, and like the overall consistent response I get from them. Also note that these are the newer keys in which the shift characters are on the top row as well, so that both characters on a key are lit.

Setup was easy: I decided I didn't want to bother with a wireless connection and the need to remember to recharge regularly, so I left the cord plugged in and used it as a wired keyboard. (Yes, it's just fine to do that.)

The only minor criticism I have is that the keys should really be brighter. The main alphanumeric keys are a little dimmer than I'd ideally like.

Overall, an excellent keyboard from Razer.

reviews.title: Feels a little too light, but otherwise good
reviews.text:
This is a pretty decent mouse, but short of perfect. I think they made a mistake to make it quite so light: compared with a Razer DeathAdder for instance, it feels just a bit too light, so for me at least, not quite as comfortable to use. It's also a bit small for my large hands (slightly smaller than the DeathAdder), so not what I would pick as my main mouse for use all day. It works pretty nicely for my second computer that I use much less frequently, perhaps a total of an hour or two a day. (I'm now considering giving it to a family member with smaller hands.)

Note that I use these for "normal" computer use, not for gaming. I prefer gaming keyboards and mice for their greater precision, that's all. So it's possible for example that an avid gamer would say "lighter is better!" and I'm not going to dispute that (although I think it would be a very personal preference).

Overall, if you want a better mouse, and don't mind it being lighter (and don't have large hands), then this one is definitely worth a look.

reviews.title: Very good headset for general use
reviews.text:
I wanted a good over-the-ear headset for video conferences, with good sound and hassle-free user experience. I'm very satisfied with this one. It was simple to set up: all I really needed to do was to (1) charge the headset using a USB-C charge cable; (2) plug the USB dongle in; (3) turn the headset on. For video conferences I do need to make sure that I'm selecting the correct speaker and mike, but that's not difficult, and it all works without a hitch.

I've also used them extensively to listen to high-quality streaming and MP3 recorded music on my computer, and am very pleased with the sound. I think my Shure earbuds might be just a tad better in tone, but I'm not completely sure about that (yet).

One downside, perhaps because I'm not used to them yet, is that I tend to talk a little louder than normal, and my voice sounds a little funny to me. But the first is easy to correct, and the second happens no matter what kind of headset I use, so I guess it's just how it has to be.

I'm not a gamer and have not used these for gaming, so can't help you there. I don't see why that would change anything, but I leave that to interpretation by those who know more about gamer needs.

Overall, a very nice headset, at least for general use. A bit pricey for the purpose, perhaps, but that's for the buyer to decide.

reviews.title: Good sound, hassle-free use, but hard to fit comfortably because of non-adjustable support
reviews.text:
As you would expect, using a corded USB headset is really hassle-free: you plug in, turn on, and go. This one did as expected. Pluses are: good sound, long cord, easy to use control unit (with a clip) that can be positioned on the waist or anywhere else above.

That said, I'll compare this to the wireless model (HyperX Cloud II Wireless) I recently reviewed. Some of the comments for that one apply here as well:

"I've also used them extensively to listen to high-quality streaming and MP3 recorded music on my computer, and am very pleased with the sound. I think my Shure earbuds might be just a tad better in tone, but I'm not completely sure about that (yet)."

Same thing here. The major problem I have with this model is that I couldn't get the headset to sit comfortably on my head: the over-the-head support bands are not adjustable, the inner one slides easily to stop at the rigid outer band, which is one size only. So, with my head not being as big as their design model's, the whole thing wanted to slide down further than I wanted, so it felt like a heavy headset resting on my ears. Ugh!

So, although I really like everything else about this headset, I have to take points off, and can't recommend it for most buyers. You're better off getting the Cloud II model (either wired or wireless), if you want to stick with HyperX.

reviews.title: Works as it's supposed to, and better than that composite cable thing.
reviews.text:
I needed something to hook up my son's old Wii to a newer TCL tv that doesn't have any compositive audio/video input. This looks like a generic product sold under many obscure brand names, I just picked one at random that had many reviews and a high rating.

The adapter/converter plugs in snugly to the Wii port where that old cable went, and with a decent HDMI cable I had video and audio on the tv. This combo is way more compact than the cable it replaced. I went into the Wii settings and told it to produce 480p and adjust to a 16:9 tv, which made the image a bit better and wider (I didn't try to fill the screen).

So, a simple, inexpensive, hassle-free solution to a problem that had the potential to greatly increase the noise level at home. No complaints. Not even if it breaks in a year and I have to buy a new one.

(No, it definitely won't upscale to HD or 4K. Nor will it magically improve the games.)

reviews.title: Underrated
reviews.text:
Possibly one of the most Underrated and Undersold accessories ever. Steam marketed it to Desktop warriors, but honestly i think they are a great tool for pretty much everyone. Yes, you can obviously use it to play computer games on your TV without having to re-arrange your PC setup, but it is so much more than that. I've come to see it as a super-powered Chrome-cast. Literally anything & everything you can do on your computer can be streamed to this. This & a wireless keyboard and mouse and you can easily use your computer on a display across the house.

Not without some minor drawbacks. Wifi can be a bit laggy when gaming or streaming video, so you're best off plugging it into your router. Doesn't support the xbone USB dongle, so you either need to plug your controller in or get one of newer Bluetooth ones (which can connect without a usb) or really any other Bluetooth capable controller.

reviews.title: does the trick
reviews.text: it is stupid and frustrating to need to replace such a part, but these are exactly what you need if your latches start to fail. The included tools are a bit cheap, but they are good enough to get the job done.

reviews.title: Great result, challenging project
reviews.text:
I love the result, but proceed with caution.

the design of the joycon housing is very efficient, but this makes it tricky to replace. instead of a case around a block of components, the components are mounted directly to the housing, both sides of it. this makes it a little tricky to do the replacement. If you take your time and are careful I think anyone could do it, but this is a project that is likely to frustrate new tinkerers and DIYers. The included tools can get the job done, but are very cheap and will wear out if you are not careful, I ended up using an iFixit toolkit

If you take it slow and study where things go it can be a fun and rewarding project, just don't expect to "quick-swap" the cases.

reviews.title: Fantastic Game, too much for the Switch to handle

Get it for PC or other platform. I love the switch, but this game pushes the limitations of the hardware capabilities. very long load times between missions, and frequent 'thinking pauses' during larger fights (it freezes up). Luckily it auto-saves after each full turn, so if it crashes mid fight you don't have to redo the entire thing, you just have to wait for it to load back up.

reviews.title: Nancy Drew : The Cinderella Years
reviews.text: I love Nancy Drew and I was really excited about sharing this with my son, but this really misses the mark.  There's very little sleuthing and far too much patronizing housework.

reviews.title: Lots of fun
reviews.text: I purchased this for my son who is a big fan of the books.  We've really enjoyed this game.  It captures the spirit of the books and adds in a little whimsical activities to go along with the puzzles.

reviews.title: Super cute
reviews.text: I have a hard time finding games that are non violent,  but still hold my 11 year old son's attention.  This one fits the bill quite well.  The graphics are bright and the game play is not overly complicated.

reviews.title: No, apparently I'm not smarter than a fifth grader.
reviews.text: I bought this for my fourth grader and he has really enjoyed it.  I'm almost ashamed to admit that it has stumped me a time or two.  It's rather educational,  but also a lot of fun.

reviews.title: Sturdy and durable
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:f4ae83ce2efd4be492a6b5575511803]] I bought this for my son's Xbox system.  He likes to take it with him to his grandparents house on the weekends and needed a way to carry it easily.  It's lightweight,  but sturdy.  It protects his game as well as holds it.  It has places specifically made for his game controllers so they don't bump into anything and get damaged.  It has a detachable shoulder strap and a handle to carry it with.  It even has room for a few games.

reviews.title: The perfect size for a Playstation 5
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:7c000fde63fd3acfde2a8aca7d85126d]] I bought this for my sister who recently moved.  She wanted a way to pack her son's game system that would help protect it.  It's very easy to use and it's the perfect size.  It has places for 2 controllers so they are protected and won't get scratched up.  It has pockets for games and a nice handle with a comfortable grip.  It also comes with a detachable shoulder strap.

reviews.title: No more lost games
reviews.text: Maybe I'm just old, but I have a hard time keeping up with the kid's switch games because they are so darn small.  This is a great idea because it holds a ton of games and keeps them safe.  We can even organize them based on what type of game it is.  There are several slots for the cartridges and it all zips up neatly.

reviews.title: Easy to use
reviews.text: I bought these for my son to use while gaming.  I must admit that I am a bit of a technophobe so I don't really have a lot of experience with electronics.  Thankfully,  these are very user friendly.  The process of connecting them to the Bluetooth was very simple.  Now it automatically connects when it is turned on.  The battery life is great and it doesn't take too long to charge.

reviews.title: Really cool
reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is really into gaming right now.  I don't know anything about technology,  but they were very easy to install.  He loves the back light options.  There are three different settings and you can also the brightness.  It's just so fun and colorful.  The set also includes a gaming mouse.  It lights up too and it is very user friendly.  It moves well and feels comfortable in his hand.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: I bought this for my son who loves to play video games.  He is on the autism spectrum so he has a lot of sensory problems and the original strap gave him a lot trouble.  This is much better and is comfortable enough for him to use for a lot longer.  It's better balanced even with the battery pack on the back.  It can be easily adjusted so my husband and son can use the same one.

reviews.title: Long battery life
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:fba0e523a4c03a8dc77fc50efac53664]] I bought these for my sister to wear during hot yoga.  She loves her airpods,  but they didn't stay in place well enough.  I really like the wrap around the ear design.  Even while upside down,  these stay exactly where they are supposed to.  They are still super comfortable.  The battery life is very long and the charging time isn't bad.

reviews.title: Very easy to install
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:40cb6b4a8fa9c5bf9167ed5c47143b8]] I bought this for my daughter who is getting a Nintendo switch for her birthday.  She's still rather young so I wanted something that would protect it if she accidentally drops it.  This is adorable.  I love the color and it seems sturdy.  It's also slightly flexible so it's easy to install.  It fits perfectly and looks nice.  The buttons still work fine through it and the screen is still clear.  It protects the screen really well which is great because scratches can happen with just regular use without it.

reviews.title: Very user friendly
reviews.text: I must admit that I am not very tech savvy.  I was very concerned that I would not be able to figure this out, but it is surprisingly easy.  It is very user friendly and the instructions walk you through how to connect it to the Bluetooth.  Other than it being wireless,  it works exactly the same way as a regular keyboard.

reviews.title: Great charger
reviews.text: Works well. Very convenient to do away with cords. I like the charge indicator lights also.

reviews.title: Lights cant be used with game consoles. Poor design.
reviews.text:
I bought this for my son to use with his PS4. He likes how it looks and he says it's comfortable to wear but he was very upset that he's not able to make it light up. While this may not be a life or death situation, to a 10 year old who specifically picked these headphones for the "cool lights", it's a huge disappointment. Whoever designed these headphones is not the sharpest pencil in the box because the lights only come on when you plug the USB cable in. Well, considering the fact that the headphone jack for the ps4 is on the controller but the USB port is on the back of the console, that makes it pretty much impossible to plug the lights in.
If i had known this, i wouldve definitely bought a different product. I'm pretty disappointed.

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.text: My son loves the game. Perfect

reviews.title: Fun game
reviews.text: Fun game.

reviews.title: Mmm great graphics BUT typical MS programming
reviews.text:
OK so after my first session playing... the graphics are astounding, the game play is a little realxing but fun, its sort of Nox meets Unreal and pretends to be Diablo.
But its crashes about once an hour (on a 1ghz Athlon, raid, 32MB ATI, 128MB CAS 2) irregardless of settings. And when I say crash, I mean crash, its brings not only the game but also my usually impervious win2k system to its knees. No task manger, no reset, hard power cycle only!! I dont remeber any of the Diablos crashing ever, or the Baldur's Gates... typical Microsoft, releasing something late and expensive and unfinished!
There are tons of cool ideas in this game but its a bit like the original arcade Dragon's Lair once the wow factor is over you have to live with the limitations...
Everyone should see this game but I wouldn't reccomend anyone actually buy it. If you're short of cash (or sensible about such things) then wait for Neverwinter Nights - most likely a much better investment...

reviews.title: Great product for strategy, RPG, and "long hours" gamers
reviews.text:
Serious gamers who spend long hours at the controller will definitely benefit from the xtendplay.
I tend to get lost in long hours of strategy and rpg games -- guess I'm a binge gamer. The xtendplay simply makes my gaming more comfortable. I'd even go so far as to suggest it makes me burn a few calories because I now often find myself standing to play with the xtendplay propped against my stomach. You kind of forget about the fact that you have it once you've got one, it's just there as a new part of your controller, but I really notice that I can game longer, and more comfortably.

Whether longer hours of gaming is a good thing in your life is something you have to decide for yourself, but if you want to game longer one of these will help.

reviews.title: Fun outing in the series
reviews.text: Fun game, the low gravity adds a new element, the maps get complicated and there's even more trekking back and forth than in previous franchise outings.

reviews.title: If you've never played a Far Cry game start with this one
reviews.text: I loved this game, an authentically involving and compelling experience. It's rare that my girlfriend and I both play a game all the way through, but we did with this one. Certainly the structures typical of the Far Cry franchise are evident here but I don't see that as a major drawback. The beast master angle on the game is very enjoyable. The hunter-gatherer stuff seems more important in this outing of the franchise, it seems more worthwhile than in other Far Cry games.

reviews.title: Bad for couch co-op
reviews.text: Brought this for couch co-op, I had high hopes after playing all the Borderlands in this manner and enjoying them, unfortunately Battleborn is awful for couch co-op. Terrible interface for co-op, no save, no character progression save, no fun. Just to start a co-op game you both have to play through the boring prologue with no way to skip the movies. May be a good network game for some but I'm deeply disappointed. Battleborn sucks for couch co-op, it's "story" mode is a crock.

reviews.title: Only the second decent PS4 game this year
reviews.text: U4 and Primal are the only games I've enjoyed so far this year. If you like the Uncharted this outing delivers on all the franchise's usual shenanigans, and it does so beautifully.

reviews.title: Too Hard to do anything fun, too boring otherwise
reviews.text: Infuriatingly annoying at every stage, the very worst of open world action RPG. If you enjoy load screens, endless fetch and carry missions, and pointless meandering storytelling this is the game for you, otherwise don't bother. Merely an exercise in frustration.

reviews.title: Great Bioware Storytelling, Awful Bioware Game and Interface design
reviews.text: There are some great moments in here but boy do you have to work for them. Worse even than Fallout 4, the interface lets this game down. If you're a dedicated franchise fan like me then you'll likely buy it, if not there are many, many, better game investments out there.

reviews.title: Perfect--if you're OCD
reviews.text:
If you're OCD, independently wealthy, stay-at-home, and chronically allergic to excitement ... then this is the perfect game for you. I've been playing computer RPGs since day 1, and this is the most borish, pedantic, long-winded, debacle of petty frustrations that I've ever come across.

Want to spent 12 hours of gameplay crafting a satchel? Then RDR2 is for you.

reviews.title: Terrible. Doesn't work even slightly.
reviews.text: Hate it. I had it sent to my home (I'm currently at college) so by the time I visited home and picked it up, I was unable to return it or request a replacement. I didn't spend much on it so I guess that's good but it's still money wasted and I still have to find a USB charge cable for my DS.

reviews.title: Not great
reviews.text: There's only storage space for about three games, which is disappointing. Perhaps that is my fault for not looking at the details of the case. In any case, I saw it for cheaper at Best Buy about a week after I ordered it. Price check guys.

reviews.title: Disappointed Overall
reviews.text:
My daughter and I ordered the digital downloads directly from Nintendo's eShop, plus two pre-orders from Amazon to give as gifts. After playing my game for 15 minutes I was wishing I hadn't downloaded it because now I'm stuck with it. I can't give it away, and I can't trade it in or resell it. Only option we have is to play, and make the best of it. But I will be spending the $5.95 to return the two unopened games to Amazon.
We have played the two previous ds games and loved them both, the 2nd was better than the first one. Because of our experience we were very excited to play the new 3ds release.
There have been many changes made, some good, but more bad. The graphics are a nice improvement, and being able to play with in-game friends is a welcome addition. We think it's cute having Nibbles, the vivosaur follow you around.
We feel they have made what used to be a fun game very annoying, and more juvinile. The instructions are a little vague at times. The Bone Buggies, while nice, are harder to control. I realize that further in the game there are upgrades that improve this, but it will take some practice, patience, and feelings of frustration at the time wasted trying to maneuver into the position you want to go. We don't like how you only have one chance at digging up a fossil. Meaning you can't save before you clean a fossil in case you want to retry again. But it can be convenient because you don't have to keep going back to clean them when your pockets are full. It's nice that the jewels you find are automatically sold too.
Also, we do not like that they took away the ability to see where you are on the main Park. The bottom screen shows the map, but now there is no dot on the map making it easy to know where you are, and where you want to go. I found that convenient, and used it all the time on the other games. It takes getting used to this change, and wish it was still available.
One last thing I want to point out is there is no way we think this game should be compared to Pokemon. It is my opinion it's being compared as a selling tactic because of Pokemon's popularity. The Pokemon games are a favorite with our friends and family.

reviews.title: It looks nice, she's thrilled with it
reviews.text:
My daughter is enjoying her New Nintendo 3ds. She loves Pokemon, and wanted this cover plate. It looks nice, she's thrilled with it. I ordered myself a different cover plate that I'm happy with as well.
One thing that surprised me is how easily my cover plate got scratches. Nothing deep, but I thought I was being careful, so was surprised to notice them on the bottom already. I'll have to be extra careful if I want to keep scratches at a minimum.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: I wasn't crazy about this movie.  Maybe my expectations where too high.  I just couldn't get myself to care about anyone. The closest I came was when the Step-mother was feeling sorry for herself.  I actually felt some pity for her situation, of course she was too mean and hateful to like. Anyway, it all seemed superficial to me, like not enough time was given for a true, caring story.  It's not a movie I care to watch again.

reviews.title: Fun Little Side Game to Pass the Time
reviews.text: This is a cute, enjoyable game, if a little boring after a while.  Designing character's houses, inside and out is fun, but it's not nearly as great as the original Animal Crossing game.  It'd would make a nice add on for the next true Animal Crossing installment. This bundle deal is the best way to purchase if you're interested in the amiibo reader because of the savings. As for the game itself, I'd give it a three star because it's overpriced for the type of game it is. I'd have felt better a lot better about my purchase if Nintendo would have charged $29.99.  If not for this bundle deal, I would have waited for a sell price later.

reviews.title: Yay!! Smaller New 3ds!!
reviews.text:
Finally, we in the U.S. get to buy the New Nintendo 3ds. We had been looking forward, planning on getting this smaller size since it was announce. It came as a huge disappointment when we learned we would not be able to purchase this size after all. After using them I can happily say we are pleased with the smaller size. It's convenient for carrying if you have a smaller purse. I like the lighter feel of it in my hands. The cover plates are definitely fun!
The only down side is for those that weren't interested in purchasing the game, or the cover plates. Having to spend $220.00 is a high price for anyone only interested in the New 3ds. It's really not a big deal for us because we love Animal Crossing so much.
Of course, the new included game can not compare to the original Animal Crossing game, but it's enjoyable for what it is. We would love to see some of the things from ACHHD included in the next true Animal Crossing game.

reviews.title: Lovable Cards
reviews.text:
After playing my own game included with the New 3ds, I don't feel there is any pressing need for the amiibo cards, since the game itself isn't that deep, and the character's will eventually show up.

I made a mistake on the placement of Katt's house. I didn't realize at the time that I could move it later, so turned it off. When I restarted, I was sad to discover Katt was not there, but other character's were. Maybe this could be used to get your favorite villagers without using the cards.

It's my understanding that only the special character's, like Nook, Isabelle, etc., need the amiibo cards if you desire to decorate their homes. I have purchased a lot of the amiibo cards, but have not felt the need to use one with the game yet. I guess I just don't care enough to use the cards, maybe later. We haven't even played the game in a few days.

The Animal Crossing amiibo cards really are cute. My daughter decided she'd like to collect the set. This has proven to be more of a challenge than I realized. I refuse to pay more than retail for an expensive game add on. I would have liked the option to purchase the complete set as a whole.

The last 6-card set I bought only had one card that wasn't a duplicate. I already regret getting caught up it the collecting. I've spent enough money already. After purchasing 21 sets so far from various stores, I'm about to call it quits. At least I haven't paid more than retail for them. Just be patient, it's not like they won't be restocked.

reviews.title: Charming Role Playing Game
reviews.text: My daughter and I have been enjoying this game.  We are RPG fans. I especially like the traditional turn based kind.  We can't connect and play in this game together like we could with Fantasy Life, but it's still a very fun, charming game. I've purchased several copies as gifts.
