reviews.text: Work just great for charging my Wii controllers.

reviews.title: Not a fan of this one.
reviews.text: Not my favorite game. I was excited to find this game for my WIii since my son and I enjoyed the movie so much. I just don't like the interface with the remote. It was more frustrating then fun and I can't use a different controller.

reviews.title: Nope.
reviews.text: I usually like hidden object and find it games. But this one really annoyed me. At first I had fun but at a point it just got annoying. Once the puzzle is complete you have to search the house for other items to get out of the house. Then once that's done you have do do something else. I just stopped playing the game and said forget it. I wasn't so excited about the game to continue with the tasks. The other Ispy didn't thrill me either. So out these go.

reviews.title: Love this game wish there were more.
reviews.text:
I read all of the reviews before I decided to get this game. I too, like Deepak Chopra and I was excited to find this game.
Some reviews said they got more and more frustrated with each level and found they had to make wild movements to get the game to work.
I didn't find that to be the issue for me at all. I have found this to be a very relaxing game and I feel calm and centered after playing it.
There is a playing mode and and reflection mode for meditation.
On the play mode each level is centered on the chakras starting at the root chakra and moving up. You have a planet that rotates and from the center comes a colored spore that gives birth to a tree or mushroom. Before you start the level you see your mandala begin to pulse in and out and set you breathing to this rhythm, this is also the same rhythm for the remote for the side to side motion to rotate the planet.
And each level progresses in this manner. The point is to cultivate relaxation, the more relaxed you are the easier it is to play the game. I have noticed that when I play other games I don't get so riled up and I can stay calm and relaxed which does make it easier to play and retry a level without frustration. Good tool for the rest of life as well.
Knowing this helps to keep the focus in the game. Once you have gone through the play levels on all the chakras the free style meditation is unlocked, otherwise if you choose the reflection side you have only the guided meditation that is unlocked. I have found these to be very helpful to start my practice again. I sit in a regular chair not on the floor. If I sit on the floor I use a pillow folder over to get the height and stability needed. I find it works just as well.
I am pleased with this game and I continue to use it since I am gaining great benefit from it in all areas of my life. To help me relax I have incorporated an adrenal support that aids in relaxation and have found this has helped immensely.

reviews.title: Tons of fun
reviews.text: I have enjoyed this game very much. Some courses are very challenging but still fun. I purchased the wheel accessory for the controller and that helps a lot. Makes the game easier to play. I still haven't been able to get my kid to play with me yet but I'm work'n on it!

reviews.title: Hated it.
reviews.text: This was a frustrating game for me. The interface sucks, so my avatar was falling or not responding. At first I thought it was my remote maybe low on charge but when I switched to a fully charged controller it was the same issue. I love the show but hate the game. I'll just stick to the show.

reviews.title: Must have for racing games.
reviews.text: These are great to add to the controller. Makes the racing games easier to play and they are small enough to reach all of the controls. Very nice.

reviews.title: Perfect alternative N64 Controller
reviews.text:
The original N64 controller design is really hard to use. I started to look for an alternative and found these.
They work great with my N64 and fit my hands better.
So glad I got these.

reviews.title: These are perfect
reviews.text: I was so glad to find these extensions for my N64. They add a few more feet to add a comfortable distance from the tv.

reviews.title: The Best $52.00 Investment you're gonna buy for your Xbox!
reviews.text: I ordered this from Amazon and it's the best hard drive you can buy! It's 320 GB, more than enough space for all your games that you could save to your Xbox. I got it for my grand nephew and he was happy and so was I. He plays that xbox day & night like you wouldn't believe! Good thing this item came because he was bugging me for the last time claiming he was running out of space. Order yours from Amazon for they HONOR what they say: when they say overnight...they MEAN overnight shipping!!!

reviews.title: A great video game !
reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my nephew in law's son who i babysit. He's 11 years old & has been playing Black Ops every single passing day for the last 9 Months and now was begging me to buy him this game as an early Christmas gift to w/c i bought one of these from Amazon and since I'm a Prime member, i got the game overnight. Right now, the kid is playing it, I cannot even say anything because he says that I'm distracting him so iI can't watch T.V. downstairs and this kid is gulping Red bull energy drink right & left and he's planning an overnight stay and camp out in front of our couch fro the next 2 days playing this damn game! it's a good thing that this kid lives only 15 feet from our house.Needless to say that I'm happy for him playing this game but I'm really concerned as well for he's trying to stay awake for a game marathon about this. He says he love this game so i wholeheartedly recommend it (Hell what does a 51 year old man know anything about video games these days? When i was his age, I was playing with a paddle w/ a rubble ball with a long string attached to it).

reviews.title: One of the BEST Zombie killing games EVER!!!
reviews.text: I ordered this game for my nephew because he was giving me a hard time for a game like this so I ordered one here in Amazon and we got it the next day. This is a great game specially if you're one of those  "The Walking Dead" series fanatics and cannot wait to basg your way through them. My nephew was happy and so am I. The game is rated NC-17 and not recommended for kids

reviews.title: "My Nephew Loves This game!"
reviews.text: I bought this game because my dear nephew is insisting to have it and I told him I want to see good grades from him and he promised me he would. About 2 weeks later he showed me his graded assignments and he's bragging that he got good grades so i bought this from Amazon. A day later we got it and he never stopped playing it the minute I handed to him until later that night, I needed to pry him out and threatened to take it back if he didn't stop playing it and prepared himself for the next school day. A great game for the xbox!

reviews.title: But i think it's better than using Illegal drugs OR having a hobby of ...
reviews.text: WARNING: PLEASE DO NOT get this video game console unless that you're sure you know what you're in for! I bought this because everybody in my immediate family ahs it and i was getting sick and tired of being left out when the boys & men in our family starts talking about the action they get playing video games. So i bought one from Amazon and I KNEW immediately that i was not ready for what I'm about to experience playing those video games. One of my Nephew in laws lend me a game called "Saints rRow TheThird". OMG.....this is Way too graphic and extremely brutal of a game  not to be played by children under 13 years old. I almost hurled of all the violence! The Unit i bought came with a 250 GB Hard driive and it came with 1 game called forza 4 and 1 downloadable game. to sum it all, i had playing this console and the only Caveat about this product is: Be Prepared to lose some sleep and expect to neglect your responsibilities as an adult for this video game console will consume your time and your money buying MORE games to keep you entertained! But i think it's better than using Illegal drugs OR having a hobby of Womanizing...

reviews.title: Turtle Beach Ear Force
reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my son.  He loves Turtle Beach products.  Great set.

reviews.title: As described perfect
reviews.text: Great gaming mouse.

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: Son likes it a lot works perfectly and great price.

reviews.title: Works perfectly
reviews.text: Perfect controller better then the ones that come with original switch. Good price

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Great game, fun to play. Glad they made this for Nintendo switch.

reviews.title: Way too kiddish --
reviews.text: I bought this game because I thought it would be like New Super Mario, which I really liked. This game is for really little kids. There is no challenge value, and the game is pretty boring. Don't get this if you are an adult player!

reviews.title: Challenging, difficult, engaging
reviews.text: This game is very difficult and is up there with Tetris. I actually think it is much more difficult to keep up with Meteos, but it's a great game and you'll definitely enjoy playing.

reviews.title: Quite possibly the world's first perfect video game system
reviews.text:
Why on earth would anyone buy anything else in terms of a system? The point is, Wii gets you off the couch and requires you to socialize! This system is for multiple people! And it's fun!

You are not wasting away exercising your fingers here. You are actually up and jumping around, it's incredibly fun to play wii tennis with a friend. This is a very social system, and is really what video games have been missing. Between playing a long, solitary game that requires me to expend no energy, and playing the wii which is unbelievable work of accomplishent on nintendo's part.

I think the graphics are fantastic from what I've seen, and most importantly, everyone -- even people who don't like video games -- loves to play it.

reviews.title: Unplayable and boring
reviews.text: I bought this game because I loved New Super Mario and wanted to find another game I found addictive. First of all, this game is for little kids. But I can't imagine anyone enjoying it. It seems like it has no point. Sonic speeds through this "roller coaster" type course that goes so quickly it's not possible to follow. And there is nothing really to do. There is no challenge value, all you do it push the forward button and sonic moves really quickly until he gets to the end of the course or runs out of time. Maybe I missed the point of this game, but I wasted my money on this purchase.

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.text:
Pretty nice mouse. I'm not a super gamer, in fact, I only play a few games; Spore and Mortal Kombat. Anyways, since I only play for an hour or two a week, I only notice a few differences, that it requires just a whisper of movement to use and that you have to be careful not to brush against all the extra buttons.

My son is the super gamer, he likes Team Fortress, Portal, Spore, Five Nights at Freddies, Goat Simulator, etc. He says this mouse is a super upgrade from the cheapie mouse he used before.

He says his game play has been chiller and he 'own's' the world. Honestly, I don't really get it, for me the mouse seems almost the same but for all the different buttons.

reviews.title: Good little product.
reviews.text:
This is working perfectly for my Mac Mini. I know this says it's for an xbox, but we don't have one. I bypassed the temperature sensor and am using it for my mac and its perfect. I'm sure it would work great for an xbox too.

It has a usb port and is very adaptable. Great product, a lot more lightweight than I was expecting which is nice too.

reviews.title: Swamp ear
reviews.text:
These are the nicest headphones I've ever experienced. Here's what I liked about them.

1. Sound quality. I didn't realize how tinny and flat my old ones were until I tried these. I guess part of the difference is the tight suction over the ears that blocks out everything or it could be the speakers.

2. Durability. Well, I've been using them for a month, once I sat on them, black headphones on a black seat! But they are still working and I haven't managed to break the speaker, perfection!

Here's what I don't like.

1. Hot Ear. I haven't run out to buy canned air or tried my hand at inventing cooling gel ear muffs, but so far I can't wear these for more than an hour at a time without getting super sweaty hot ears. It's sorta swampy and gross like spandex butt, 'cept its on your head. The headphones really clamp down on your head and sometimes the tension can make my head hurt.

But other than the head pain and itchy swamp ear, these are pretty great. Good luck!

reviews.title: Wonderful Quality, no pinching or sweatiness
reviews.text:
These are very comfortable for gamers or anyone else who wears a headset for more than two hours straight.

The sound quality was good enough for me to hear whispers and to really feel the action.

Sweating - I've had a problem with getting a hot, sweaty ear and it was distracting and in one instance, gave me an ear infection. Since then I've been hyper alert to this potential problem. Somehow I think these headphones will not cause that problem.

The noise cancellation is really amazing, I was wearing these outside while waiting for the bus and I didn't even hear the bus arrive and then it was leaving without me!

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text:
This bluetooth controller works great. It was, very responsive and there is zero set up, you just pop it on and go.

My only concerns are that the holder will work but it doesn't feel as secure as I'd like, as if it could slip off or that the phone could fall out. Very disconcerting.

I used it to play minecraft, which was very fun and a bit easier with the controller.

Then I combined it with a handsfree cellphone carrier (Don't Judge), called 'Flexible Long Arms Stand Clip Holder,Hanging on Neck Universal Mobile Phone Stand Lounger's Bracket for Mobile Phone' and I sat in my recliner and read a book on my phone and used the bluetooth to flip pages in the book. It was surprisingly comfy and other than looking like a lazy slacker, relaxing.

reviews.title: Nice upgrade
reviews.text:
This is a gift for my son, he's a gamer, he really likes it. It seems a bit more responsive than his previous mouse. The added responsiveness really eliminates lag and makes gameplay more accurate.

So far he hasn't done much programming of the mouse because the standard settings are working pretty great for him with this newer version of Doom (he's been playing it nonstop for a week now).

As for the ergonomics, the curved shape is nice and the mouse is pretty lightweight, he does still get thumb fatigue, but I don't think there is any way around that.

reviews.title: Great new mouse
reviews.text:
Things I like about this mouse;

1. It has cool glowy lights that glow at a slow, pulsing rate that makes it look like the mouse is an insect that is breathing (think the iratus bug from Stargate Atlantis). They cycle through yellow to purple and blue.

2. It didn't require any software installation

3. It has a super long cord, in case that is something you like or need.

4. The mouse wheel is like a lego tire with a very grippy tread.

5. The mouse has a good shape and all the butons have good click action, the side buttons have forward and back motion and this is the first time ive seen it before, a dpi sensitivity switch that cycles through several dpi settings.

6. You can't change the pulse rate of the lights or turn off the light (someone said in a review that you can turn it off by holding down the button, not sure if that is true, because it isn't working for me with this mouse). But the lights are so amazingly pretty that I don't even care.

Things I don't like about this mouse;

1. I would like the option to change or turn off the lights sometimes, but this a minor issue and hardly affects my overall joy with this great little mouse.

reviews.title: Great for moist hands
reviews.text:
Just a few things about this silicon cover;

1. It says two in the package but I received only one. I like it so much I gave it 5 stars anyways, no reason to rate it downward but its important to know if you want to cover more than one controller.

2. Easy installation - I had a painful burnt finger so I got my kid to put the cover on this controller and it was quick and simple.

3. My hands are weirdly moist now. Maybe it's all the pandemic lockdown handwashing and then moisturizing but ten minutes of gaming and the controller feels as slippery as a pumpkin seed. Its gross and I want it to stop. This cover is keeping me from dropping it.

4. I like the cover, it adds a dollop of color to an otherwise dull white controller, like a sportscar with a bra (is that what those leathery front covers were called, bras?).

5. Inexpensive - I got it for free, to review, but I'm going to buy a second fo my other controller.

reviews.title: Excellent keyboard
reviews.text:
I have lots of positive things to say about this mechanical gaming keyboard
1. The keys arent too sensitive which is a good thing since it makes it harder to fat finger them and do something wrong ingame

2. The keys have a reasonable amount of space between them which means I don't have to be really accurate when typing or doing stuff ingame.

3. The lighting under the keys and the colors of the keyboard in general make it really easy to see the keys as opposed to some LED lit keyboards i've had in the past where the lighting feels too dim or too difficult to see because of the reflected color of the LED lights.

4. But my personal favorite thing about this keyboard is that this is very compact,it has the number pad, the F1-F12 keys, but it is still compact enough that I can fit it really well on my desk along with my wrist pad and a large mousepad. I've had trouble in the past (since I keep my mouse very close to my keyboard 90% of the time) with having the edge of the keyboard, which normally juts out at an odd angle, end up pressing against the mouse which forces me to click it again. This was an ongoing problem with my last keyboard and it's really good that I don't have that happen now with how well this keyboard fits on my desk.

Now for some negatives;

Just one, I'm not a huge fan of yellow, I wish this came in a nicer color.

reviews.title: Addictive fun.
reviews.text: Retiree here.  This is an addictive game for me.  The gun is easy to load and play.  Taking the silicon cover off the remote (30 seconds), is the most complicated part. In other words.  Not very complicated.  The shooting game is worth the purchase price.  Some of the targets, (skeletons and other vile creatures), may frighten younger children and cause nightmares. This is a relaxing game to play after burning energy playing Wii Sports.  For $20 (purchased one today at Best Buy, since Amazon is out til February), it is a value purchased, compared to other Wii items. Unless you hate arcade style shooting games, buy it.

reviews.title: Fun for all.  Easy to play.
reviews.text:
Retiree here. This is easy to play and a lot of fun. The free wheel is a nice touch. The remote fits perfectly, with no hassle. I purchased this because it's made by Ubisoft, and I enjoy their Rayman Rabbid Rabbits (1 and 2) games.

Update: Just purchased Wii Excite from Amazon. The wheel is great for Excite as well. Amazon's $39 price for Excite is the lowest I've seen. I found The Monster 4x4 as enjoyable as Excite.

reviews.title: Enjoyable. Generates laughter like Rayman 1.
reviews.text:
Retiree here (retired CPA, Professor). New to gaming. Started with my Wii purchase, Dec 31, 2007). I play these games solo. Wife won't play them (other than Wii Sports-she's addicted to that one). I'm really enjoying Rayman 1, so I purchased this one. I find this game more relaxing than Rayman 1, because it's easier to progress. If I was a hard core gamer, I'd be dissapointed. I enjoy playing in the different countries.

I am 60+, have difficulty progressing in Rayman 1, and am often frustrated. Currently bogged down in the hedgehog race. I would recommend both games for seniors. They help maintain hand/eye coordination, sense of timing, and both make you burst out laughing-if you enjoy the slapstick silly stuff. I do. My wife doesn't. I think younger children will find Rayman 2, easier to play. I'm not a hunter, but there's something about shooting rabbits with plungers, that makes your troubles go away. Own: Rayman 1 and 2. 4x4 World Circuit-another Ubisoft game. Excite Truck. Endless Ocean. Links Crossbow. Wii Play. Only Wii Play has dissapointed.

reviews.title: You will burst out laughing.
reviews.text: Retiree here. My rating is based entirely on the laugh factor. Being new to gaming, I am slowing progressing through the levels. Made it to the hedgehog race, but failed it four times. Many of the games frustrate me, but the laugh factor keeps me going. Good graphics, nice games.  As a senior, I recognize the value of this game.  It forces you to use, increase and maintain hand/eye coordination, and timing.  The dancing games are especially helpful. Some of the other Rayman Rabbid minigames have increased my heartrate to 125.  That adds worthwhile aerobic exercise to the game's other pluses.  Too difficult for my four year old grandson. One negative.  My wife doesn't play this game, but she leaves the room whenever I play it.  The dancing game makes her dizzy (just being in the room when I play it bothers her).  If you have a problem where fast dancing/flashing lights/quick though pleasant music bothers you, do not buy this game. See my review of Rayman 2.

reviews.title: A nice pleasant game.  Priced right.
reviews.text: Retiree here. This is a relaxing game, and priced right at $29.99. Probably would have been dissapointed if the price was higher.  For a relatively low price, this is a relaxing game for anyone, and highly educational for youngsters. Very nice for occasional play.  After spending some time with this game, I plan to take my 4 year old grandson to the local acquarium, and then let him play the game.  He will enjoy it after visiting the aquarium, not before. As a skin diver (not scuba diver), I consider this game realistic, and it brought back memories of skindiving in Hanuma Bay, Hawaii.

reviews.title: Why can't they make a decent sized bag for the price?
reviews.text:
I purchased this bag to keep my Wii games and nunchucks in. I wanted an attractive bag in my family room, next to my Wii. I realize that is not the intended purpose of this bag. It is so small that with my 6 games (in plastic cases), and two nunchucks, it barely closes. The cardboard cased Links Crossbow and Wii Sports fit in the front pocket. Instruction manuals don't fit. Hoped my extra two guest wimotes would fit. No chance.

The quality of the bag is fine. It looks nice. For the prices charged on Wii goods, give us some value. I wish I went I went to the local bowling alley and purchased a child's bowling bag to keep my Wii accessories in. They are $15, larger, and more attractive.

The bag is not large enough for its intended purpose. I usually give high ratings. See my reviews. Not on this mini.

reviews.title: A golf game that makes you laugh. Not for serious golfers.
reviews.text:
Retiree here. After reaching pro level on Wii golf, I wanted to play a different golf game. The same course (Wii golf) is too repetitive. I agree with the other 2 reviews posted to date. Just purchased it, have played for 2 hours, and will update this ASAP. It's a fun game with very good graphics. I have not read the directions yet, (like to jump in and play first), and found swinging confusing until I realized how it works. You lift your club until the blue line on the power bar, equals the distance you need to drive. Totally different than Wii golf, and should not be confused with a real golf match game. However, there is enough golf, and interesting scenery, to satisfy my desire for a second game. This game is a sleeper, and will get much more playing time than some other titles I have reviewed.

While Miis are not used, the characters are a definite plus. They are lifelike humans, rather than cartoonish. When you have some winnings, you take your character to the clubhouse, and dress them as you like. The costumes range from conservative to highly suggestive. I wasn't able to purchase the new clothing, but I was able to change my character into the different outfits. Initially, you only have a choice of 2 characters. I am using Hanah, a cute and personable girl of about 20. She has a cute voice. Based on my initial 3 hole practice round (done 4 times until my first birdie), I expect to put quite a few hours on this game.

This is my update. I have now read the directions. Marginal help. Then I went through the tutorial again. I was making a lot of mistakes. You need to go through the tutorial a second time. It means more after you have played. You can change the direction of your putts and drives, just like Wii golf. The special shots are fun. I just finished 3 more hours of play. The game is addictive, once you understand it. You have to like humor. I like Rayman Rabbits. I think 8 years and up is an appropriate age level. Girls 8+ will especially like the different costumes and accessories available. Boys will just like the game play. It's also great for adults. I'm a retiree. The key is to go through the tutorial several times. Once before you play. then at least once after you have played for 1-2 hours. I was initially frustrated before I went back to the tutorial. I think this is a great game and will be playing it quite a bit.

reviews.title: Nice game for 4-8 age group.
reviews.text: Retiree here. I just purchased and played the easiest version of each minigame. I purchased this so that my 4 1/2 year grandson could have an easy game.  Rayman was too difficult. He found Endless Ocean boring.  Though this game does require some use of the buttons in all minigames, (at least if you want a good score), it will still be his favorite game.  Tetherball and slot cars are probably the easiest game. Dodgeball is probably the most fun, but more difficult.  Wallball is a nice game, but like dodgeball, on the more difficult side (for a 4 year old). I would rate each minigame in the package, entertaining. I think it's a nice 4 star game.  Simple games with minimal instructions can be very nice.  Another plus.  I think he can play this game without damaging the TV or himself.  Update:  My grandson now plays and loves slot car racing.

reviews.title: Long manual.  Takes time to learn.
reviews.text:
Update: Followed discussion advice and purchased a classic controller. It made the game much more enjoyable for me. As a newbie, I didn't realize the classic controller plugs into the nunchuck slot, so I still have a totally wireless connection.

Original review: Retiree here. This is my first baseball video game. I am using the Wimote/Nunchuck only. In the easiest modes, this is very entertaining. The wimote mode is fun. It's great seeing every major league park, in excellent detail. Rather than repeat earlier reviews, I'll add a few things. I find hitting very difficult. I went to the practice mode to practice hitting, and I still have a tough time, lining up the sweetspot with a fast moving baseball. The fielding is starting to come together. I'm going to stick with it because the graphics are good, and the game has great potential. I gave it 5 stars because I didn't want to penalize it for my shortcomings. I would appreciate any tips.

reviews.title: Great game for all ages.  Takes seconds to learn.
reviews.text:
Retiree here. This is my first video pinball. I was a pinball addict 50 years ago, but am not familiar with these games. Received it today, and played it for 2 hours. It's outstanding, and really is a must purchase for anyone having a Wii. Takes seconds to learn and entertaining for anyone.

There is one negative. I have HDTV, and the Nintendo component cables, but found the graphics more blurry (less in focus), than other games. I suspect this is caused by the need to have a tremendous amount of detailed graphics, of many different colors, in a very compact area. I do have my Wii and TV set to the proper resolution. Other games, such as MLB Pro, and Super Swing 2 have great graphics, considering the Wii does not come in high definition. That said, the entertainment value of this game more than makes up for this deficiency, and it is still a must have game.

reviews.title: 4 year old grandson loves it.
reviews.text:
My grandson is 4 YEARS 7 MONTHS. He had been quickly bored with my Wii games. He loves the Wii Excite. He loves it because I have a wheel, and he can steer it like the games at an arcade (Pizza place, bowling alley).

He loves it because there are no rules. He can constantly crash into trees, go off cliffs, and sink in water. No problem. The game allows you to keep going and even awards points for good crashes. In other words, he loves it because he can have fun playing, without having a clue what he is doing. It's a great game for youngsters. It's also fun for anyone else that likes truck racing games.

reviews.title: Nintendo makes quality products.
reviews.text: I have 4 remote controllers and have never had a problem.  That's amazing considering all the shaking they get.  100% satisfied.

reviews.title: I just don't know if this item is worth buying.
reviews.text:
This is a quality item, well made and fits perfectly into the Wii, and the TV. I have HDTV with outstanding resolution on HDTV shows.

I read the directions, set both the Wii and TV to the correct resolutions. I honestly couldn't tell the difference between these and the standard cables. I wouldn't buy the item again.

reviews.title: Necessary item for quite a few games.
reviews.text: High quality item that's useful in quite a few games.  I purchased a second one to keep in my WII Zapper.

reviews.title: I like this one better then the original
reviews.text:
I have the original for Wii which I like but always thought the screens loaded too slow and some of the games are really hard to play. The New Carnival Games took care of both those issues. It also added a ton of new games while keeping the atmosphere of the old game. It does still have ski ball and a basketball game but they are different from the old game. I like how fast the menus switch between screens and they added a much needed skip button so you can get through the graphics quicker for impatient players like myself. In every area there is also a side quest with some member of the carnival looking for an item. I haven't figured out how to get those yet though. For those who would like a list of games..they are as follows -

Area - Mystic Court
Arrow Shoot (archery)
Gold Rush Alley Ball (ski-ball)
Super Gold Rush Alley Ball (unlockable)
Pool Shark
Bank a Ball
Fortune Teller - costs tickets

Area - Mousy Lane
Haunted House
Lucky Clover
Swish It (basketball)
Super Swish It (unlockable)
Gone Fishin
Wheel of Cheese - costs tickets

Area - Suprise Blvd.
Prize Suprise - 20 tickets to pull out a prize
Tractor Pull
Pitch a Plate
Super Pitch a Plate (unlockable)
Horseshoe toss
Fishbowl bounce
Twist n Win (tickets)

Area - Pitstop Parkway
Speed Bingo
Balloon Blast
Target Shoot
Start Your Engines
Bumper Cars (unlockable)
Ticket Racer (costs tickets)

Area - Snapshot drive
Clown Face
Tic Tac Toe
Under 7 over 31
Photo Booth (costs tickets)
Bottle Stand Up
Super Clown Face

Area - Players Alley
Shows your prizes and achievements.

reviews.title: Hated this game, traded it in for Amazon credit
reviews.text: Too many glitches, hard to see the screen its so dark.  The story could have been with anyone and I think it only sold because of Mickey.  I traded it into Amazon games for $30 because it made me so frustrated.  It does not tell you what you are doing half the time and killing baddies is way too hard.  This game should have went through more testing before it was released.

reviews.title: So happy with this charger...
reviews.text: I had the old Nyko charger that fit two wii remotes which took forever to balance the remotes so that the light turned blue.  I wanted to upgrade because I bought a new wii but have 4 remotes.  I have them on the charger at all times and they never get hot or cause any problems.  I researched all of the different types of chargers because my last Nyko was horrible.  They fixed the design flaws and this one works great.

reviews.title: Wii game with added content...nothing new
reviews.text: It is the same game as wii but with extra carts and better graphics.  You can still play online and can play with any controller setup you want.  Good for groups or online play but kind of boring doing the same thing over and over.  The main thing I was disappointed in was the prompts hitting you up to buy more addons for the game.  At $55 they should include more content.

reviews.title: Great game, same content as before
reviews.text: I love the game but a lot of the content is just reused from previous versions.  I love being able to fish, catch bugs, and go diving.  The downfall is you get to go to this island where you can pretty much catch all of the bugs and fish before the seasons turn.

reviews.title: Not as good as previous games
reviews.text: I've been playing Mario Party games for a long time and this one is disappointing.  The game play is fun, but I miss the old game play style.  I miss getting vending machine objects to sabotage other players.  I miss choosing options for your board when you only want to play a short game with only 10 rolls.  And I miss the mini games after everyone rolls.  This game is just lacking.  I wish they would have integrated the Amiibo play into the actual game instead of making it a side game with the same board design with different graphics for every Amiibo.  Any Amiibo's that are not in the "super mario" category you can scan once a day and play a scratch card game to get points which you then use in the store.  The problem is after you play 3 games on the real board you have enough points to buy almost everything.  You get the unlockable characters right away instead of having to work for them.  I understand that they were trying to change the game so it wasn't the same as their other games but they took out the best parts of the Mario Party series.

reviews.title: Same game, some updates

I am disappointed that this is the EXACT same game as the Wii version but with different abilities that were missing from the original game.  Still one of my favorite games but I think Nintendo is getting lazy.  They just reproduce old games with a shiny new wrapper and a few new tricks and it costs $40.  Well played Nintendo, well played.  Also, this game is not 3D.

reviews.title: Check those distances.
reviews.text:
Does exactly what it said it would, and holds the xbox securely. I elected to mount it behind the TV directly to the plaster using the provided anchors.
Two users issues, if your mounting it near your TV wall mount. 1 Make sure and orientate the retaining edge in the direction you wish. I overlooked this but luckily got it right on the initial mounting. 2. Make sure and leave enough space between the bracket and any other mounts so you can actually place the unit in the mount. I came super close to not being able to get mine into the mount. Very sturdy construction.

reviews.title: Very disappointed with amazon and blizzard/activision support
reviews.text:
Well, This review is only aimed at the business partnership between blizzard and amazon. It is now t minus 5 hours until game lauch. and my product hasn't even shipped yet. I am on the phone with a csr and it seems nothing can be done. Very disappointed. I have played the expansions for this game on day one at launch since the begining. I thought cool. I can order a hard copy this time. Worst mistake ever. Whoever I spoke with claimed to be a supervisor. What a b word. She got cussed at a lot by me....She wouldn't even expedite my shipping! That's the least they could do!

I changed my review to 5 stars to reflect the game itself. But keep in mind that the blizzard and amazon support side of things needs serious help.

Amazon did finally credit me back my purchase price so I did recieve a free expansion in the end. I did have to blatently demand this action as a long time consumer of amazon and as a seller. Overall, I got what I expected and demanded as I always do. But the factor of difficualty and frustration in doing so was extreme,.

reviews.title: not ready for release...
reviews.text:
not ready or defective. not sure because oculus tech support was fail.

I'm actually sad I had to send mine back and get a refund. It was almost an awesome product.

But oculus tech support did not do the needful. I'm certain the issue was the cable included with the headset. Lots of snow and static on screen that didnt show up in a screen mirror on your real screen.

Was ignored and treated very poorly by oculus support. After almost a month of using I frantically boxed it up and sent it back to amazon.

I think I might pick up another from best buy and see if it does the same thing or not. I tested 3 high end vr pcs with it btw. But either way. I feel let down by oculus support. And Amazon didnt offer replacement of item. They only offer return or dealing with oculus. So I realized I better return this thing asap!

I wish they were being more honest about the issues as I would repurchase once issues are fixed.

Biggest let down with this device is trying to play non vr games in a vr theater. It absolutely does not work! The oculus drivers upscale everything into 4k even if the monitor being displayed is only 1920x1080... this results in unbearable stutter in the majority of non vr games. And this is something that an oculus go can handle over wifi with open source software like alvr and moonlight for go so I am shocked to see they dropped the ball so badly by not having a 1080p theater gaming mode.... it's actually unforgivable and I think I would have returned this item due to that fact alone if I wasnt having the USB power and snow static issues....

I think they rushed the software and the skimped on costs for a high quality cable...

reviews.title: like having disc

reviews.title: better than a rift s and mobile
reviews.text: I bought the Rift S instead of this at launch day, preordered. I was on the fence between both units... I returned the rift S. It was terrible!!!! I waited to buy the Quest afterwards actually it was so bad. Until I heard about the Oculus Link technology and witnessed first hand ALVR running PC VR on a Quest.... Bought one, I love it, Best thing ever!!!!!  Adding hand tracking soon along with the Link make this a no brainer!  The Rift S is dead!  This becomes a Rift Q with a good USB 3.0 cable. or wireless with ALVR like I said. One pro tip I can give you all though. instead of connecting to your local wifi network. buy a good USB 3.0 wifi dongle. and then create a hotspot network in windows withit. Conect to your hotspot via the quest and make sure your PC is wired to your network instead of wireless. but that last part is not a big deal with this method actually. But doing this will remove any network latency or traffic from your wifi. Simply go into your hardware settings for your wifi card and manually set it to 40 mhz and to only use 802.11 a/n/c or any combo of those otherwise the hotspot will default to b/g mode which you don't want. If you do this you can play ALVR wireless PC VR no problem! It's literally amazing!!!!! don't listen to the other methods. do it this way.

I truly believe that this is an isolated case and something that could happen with any microsoft controller- not just the pink ones. reviews.title: Wonderful, but not without some faults!
reviews.text:
I enjoy the occasional game and decided I wanted to get back into handheld gaming. While cell phone games do have plenty of engaging time-killing games to offer, I was missing games with some depth and story; like Zelda! So I decided to go back to my roots and get a Nintendo console (my roots are the old DMG-1).

After a shockingly small amount of research, I went and impulse purchased the New 3DS XL. If this is your first 3DS, be sure to pick up a charger as well, since, unlike just about any other device that NEEDS a charger, this system does not come with one! Taking the device out of the box, the first thing you will notice is the pristine shiny surfaces that greet you! The exterior is shiny, but don't expect it to stay pretty. It will pick up finger prints if you just look at it. Not only that, but I had scratches on it after a couple weeks of keeping it in my bag (in a pocket that was microfiber lined and all by itself).

Next thing you will notice is the weight. This device actually has some heft to it! It is only 1 or 2 tenths of an ounce lighter than the original Nintendo! I found that I did get a but of hand and wrist strain during the first could days of play. Just something to keep in mind!

Another thing you will notice is that the hinge is a bit flappy. When you open the hinge, you will hear it snap into place in two positions (and by snap, it sounds and feels like you are doing something wrong). This wouldn't be a problem since the second position is where you will want the screen opened to, but the screen moves within that position. I play a lot from a reclined or laying position, so I do notice the top screen wobbling quite a bit. I would estimate that the movement is about 5 degrees. It is enough that, if I am playing while laying down, I often find myself awkwardly positing my index fingers so they wrap around to the front of the device to keep it from moving while I am playing. I have seen video of New 3DS XLs that do not have this issue with the hinge, but most people seem to have it, and people who have contacted Nintendo say that Nintendo does not consider this to be a defect.

Even with all of the negatives I have listed, there is still so much to love about this device. The top screen is beautiful and sharp. The Super Stable 3D does great (even when you play in the dark). The console comes with a few interesting games, so even if you don't by games right away, there is definitely lots of interesting stuff to do on the device. The e-shop is great and even has some great games that you can get for relatively cheap including some old NES and Gameboy games. The controls are generally ergonomic, although I find that the D-pad can be a little uncomfortable if you are playing a game that uses that instead of letting you use the thumb pad. Streetpass and spotpass add a whole other dimension of entertainment. There are a lot of great games available for the system for almost any genre. All the old Nintendo franchises have games for the 3DS that have a terrific balance between familiar characters and new spins on gameplay that develop the story.

reviews.title: Perfect game for taking on the go.
reviews.text: This game is fun.  I love music and rhythm, so I really do enjoy playing this game.  Everything about this game is bite size, so it is perfect for those times you have a minute to kill.  There are plenty of other games that I love, but I need to sit and play them for long periods of time.  This is just one of those games that you can pick up and play for a few minutes at a time.  It is also varied enough that you can sit and play long stretches if you want without getting bored.  I find the game a little more challenging then I anticipated, but certainly something that can be mastered.

reviews.title: I like it better than the New 3DS XL
reviews.text:
I bought a New 3DS XL a while back, but quickly learned that it was a little bulky for my liking and I was noticing that I was having a bit of fatigue in my hands and wrists. I really wanted the smaller device, but I didn't want to sacrifice the benefits of the new 3ds (better 3d and the C-nub). I was also excited about the interchangeable faceplates.

When I bought this device, it was the only North American option for a non-XL, so while I wasn't really into Animal Crossing, I was very into the smaller device, and since the faceplates are interchangeable, it wasn't a big deal to me (though I do wish that this bundle included the plain white plates as well).

I shopped around and found a great deal online where I got this bundle for under $180 on Jet, so this was really a no-brainer.

I do find that I still get some hand strain, not because of weight, but because of the way I hold the console; my hands are just slightly too big for long use comfort (typically, I get strain after about 1.5 hours of use).

The new 3D face tracking is a big step up from the original 3DS. The C-stick is not used for happy home designer, but has been useful in the handful of games that have C-stick functionality.

I like the layout of this console better. The cartridge in front design seems more ergonomic than the last 3DS, which had it in back where your fingers naturally lie.

Overall, I think the New 3DS is a wonderful, polished console. It is the perfect size for travel. The new features increase the options for game developers (ZL/ZR buttons, c-stick). The new 3D face tracking makes using 3D more immersive and less of a practice of patience. As for the Happy Home Designer, I don't really have any interest, but all of those components are interchangeable, and the game arrives as a code that can be given to someone who will actually use it (it is not locked to the device).

I have no regrets with my purchase of this console. If I had list any complaint is that the new 3DS consoles do not come with the power supply.

reviews.title: Good for travel and cames that don't need precision L3/R3 input

reviews.title: Better than waiting for Nintendo
reviews.text:
I have had drift on my switch lite for the last few months. It wasn't that bad and since I use my lite mostly for tetris 99, I didn't use the stick that much. Now that Animal Crossing is out, I am using the stick more; the issue was getting worse and more annoying. It was to the point that I was playing with my pro controller connected to my lite. I picked this up and it came quick (original arrival date was the 25th (ordered on the 20th), but it still arrived on the 22nd. You should note that this kit doesn't include the tri-wing driver or philips that you need to do the replacement, just some extra screws (that you don't need unless you aren't careful and end up stripping the tri-wing screws). The replacement took less than 20 minutes, following a youtube video of the left stick replacement (it looks like the right stick replacement is a bit harder and more involved - the video said that the right stick may be too much for most people on the switch lite). Put everything back together and I am happy to report that this stick works perfectly. The color is a good match for the original and feels like the sticks probably felt when they we’re new.

Update 11/2021: My left stick finally started to die again, but instead of drift, it started to be unresponsive when pushing to the right. Couldn’t remember where I put the extra stick from the last swap so I bought a new one.

reviews.title: An amazing collection of video game history
reviews.text:
From my teenage son:

This is by far my favorite smash game. In every inch of this game you can really feel how much heart the developers put into this. This game is massive and I have been playing it on and off for nearly two years.

To start with there are over eighty different fighters all of which are unique and express their own individual personalities. I can't even imagine how much work it must have been to accomplish this, I have the utmost respect for these developer. Since I got the game I have spent nearly the entire game mastering the character link, it would take a lot of gameplay to master all of them.

There are two major complaints when it comes to this game: online mode, and balancing. First of all, yes... I agree that online mode lag can be excessive, but I don't find that it causes me to lose many matches. Balancing is kind of tricky... As it is quiet apparent that not every fighter is made equally, I feel like most of these accusations of overpowered or weak characters are over exagerated, as every fighter has their own strengths and weaknesses. for example, little mac is well known to be one of if not the worst characters, due to his trouble returning to the stage, but when on stage, a good little mac player can be hard to challenge.

The point is I think this is an amazing game, and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone of any skill level.

reviews.title: A fantastic port, but very buggy.
reviews.text: Minecraft itself is of course a great game, and it's great to be able to play it anywhere I want. The problem being that the switch seems to have a hard time running the game. It crashes quite often, and even lags in single player mode. These bugs can sometimes make it hard to play. All things considered though, it's a really great game, and you can really spend hours and hours on it without realizing it, so I think four stars is pretty fair.

reviews.title: A challenging game with a immersive world
reviews.text:
Hollow Knight is a beautifully crafted,immersive , poetic, and terrifying world. From the moment you start the game, you don't know how to do almost anything, the game literally throws you into the world so you can slowly figure it out for yourself.
The overall theme of this game works so well, almost everything about this game wants you to feel lost. From the confusing tunnels, to the fierce enemies, it can be really easy to get overwhelmed.

reviews.title: Destiny, but way better
reviews.text: There was a point early in The Division where I found the remnants of a voicemail left by a daughter trapped in the city and facing eminent death. She was calling her parents to tell them — emotionally and with her voice slurring from the few drinks she admitted to having imbibed to gain the courage to make the call — that she was gay and this was why she had moved to New York in the first place, to find a more accepting community. It was at that point, where I was listing to this message while also ducking behind cover to avoid the gunfire from looters, that The Division hooked me. I am a big fan of Destiny, a game The Division shares a lot with in terms of a persistent online world, but in that one moment The Division showed more story than Destiny's entire campaign, The Taken King expansion included. Up until this point it was kind of a nonchalant "Yah, take back New York, whatever." Now, however, the game had weight. You aren't fighting against some vague alien presence that for one reason or another is mad at the human race but everyone is too busy to explain why they are too busy to explain it to you, you are fighting for these people whose lives were suddenly uprooted. That's what makes The Divsion great. Ohh and the matchmaking is much better too.

reviews.title: Wow ! Awesome Graphics.
reviews.text: ( No Real Spoilers ) The wait is finally here. In this game I was thrust into the shoes of V, a mercenary in Night City who ends up with the psyche of long-dead rockstar and anti-corporate terrorist Johnny Silverhand trapped in their head. The graphics are really awesome and has an excellent gripping quest design. There is enormous amount of choices you can make – choice in dialogue options, how to build your character, how to approach missions, and much much more. And even when missions stop, Cyberpunk 2077 keeps things interesting by turning you into a Batman Arkham-esque investigator. The fun factor, replayability, and value for money is undeniable. This is definitley the best gaming gift for this season that will entertain everyone. Fast same-day shipping in my area. Game arrived in perfect condition. Although a bit expensive, it is well worth the price.

reviews.title: Great characters and sharp and witty humor.
reviews.text:
This is a beautiful game and quality product, crafted with love. The battles always feel winnable, even against tougher opponents, but you can always unlock new combat and passive abilities to defeat them. I like that Fenyx is a fully customizable character, shipwrecks on the Golden Isle, a magical land where some of the gods reside.
The storyline ia like A Greek comedy! If you love The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild, you would be out of your mind not to try Immortals Fenyx Rising.

Pros: Lots of upgradeable stats and special abilities

Cons: Controls are somewhat complex, though they can be customized

Embrace the game for what it is – a fun retelling of classic mythology.

reviews.title: A Good investment. Works well with Oculus Quest 2 VR

[[VIDEOID:16ef0f4b44ae49555383a8c87d52d50b]] I wanted to invest in a good quality Oculus cable and came across this one on Amazon. This Fiber-Optic cable works well and has a fast 5Gbps data transfer rate. I am also happy that this cable is long and braided for more durability as well.
Furthermore, it's powerful enough to charge the headset while playing, so you absolutely never have to worry about it running out in the middle of your gaming session.
I've yet to encounter any sort of issues so I am leaving a five star review.

reviews.title: Fun game
reviews.text:
007 Nightfire is out for all major platforms, in time for the latest Bond film. The graphics are stunning, gameplay is amazing. Well worthy of the series!
I'm a huge fan of the Bond games, and we have all of the previous ones. We got this one as soon as it came out, and were definitely not disappointed!
The graphics are a huge step up from previous versions. In the first 'training' mission, you're driving a car through city streets. The lights reflect off of the curves of the car, you can see inside to all of his controls and movements, the dents show up realistically, the back up lights glow softly, and if you bash it a bit, the trunk comes loose. The city around you has cobblestone streets, water rippling, streetlights that come down when you hit them. The attention to detail is just amazing!
As you then move on through the various levels, you see this same level of detail everywhere. From the Austrian castle and other alpine scenes, to the city scenes, watery scenes and more, each really shines.
The plot is very engaging and typically Bond. But in an attempt to show that this isn't about violence - he's a SPY after all, not a Rambo - you get bonus points for being stealthy instead of blasting in with guns, and for stunning or capturing enemies instead of killing them.
In fact, just about every area can be 'accomplished' in many ways. Bluster your way into an objective by a full frontal assault ... or sneak in the side way for extra points. Since you're also rewarded for your time and health, often the sneaky, non-violent way is the best.
You've got a huge array of equipment, weapons, armor and vehicles, and all work just the way you'd expect them to. I found the default controller configuration REALLY annoying, but a quicks stop in the config area got it back to the way I'm used to playing.
Plus, there's multiplayer! Play with up to four people at once on REALLY great maps with quite a bit of customization options on each one. Grab some bots for practice, and play arena, team arena, king of the hill, capture the flag, or other game types.
Definitely worthy of the Bond series, and highly, highly recommended to any first person shooter fan!

reviews.title: Too many button options to make it enjoyable to play
reviews.text: Game too complicated to enjoy. Too many options/combinations in the buttons to make just playing he game enjoyable. Story line is okay but usability makes this no fun. Constantly clicking or pressing the buttons in the wrong order don't produce simple things like reloading or selecting a weapon quickly. Just too much of a hassle/ learning curve compared to other shooter games like call of duty, etc.

reviews.title: Fun game. Lots or replay ability. Would recommend

I've beaten the game on the hardest level after a few weeks, and I still come back to play missions and approach them differently with different planes. I would recommend this game. Game controls are pretty simple to master.

reviews.title: Long battery life and priced right
reviews.text: A little clunky to get the controller to sit just right to enable the charger, but overall, works well, and I can play all night with no problems. I like the option of being able to add more chargers to it, if I decided to get additional controllers. Much less expensive than other brands, and I’ve used Nyko chargers for years. I would recommend this.

reviews.title: Fast, quiet, and powerful. Very happy with it.
reviews.text:
Very happy with my new console. Fast, great build quality and amazing graphics and gameplay. I added an external 4 Terabyte Seagate drive to store the games a couple of weeks later, while I’ll keep my game saves and profile on the internal drive.
I do think 1TB is kinda stingy of them for a brand new console, considering just 3 games I have take up almost 9 percent of the drive. Average game download is now 18-40 GB each, especially if you are getting Xbox One enchanced games. I do wish the interface had less self promotion and ads to buy Xbox live and other crap. I know how to go the store tab if I wanted it, but it should be left off the main screen.

reviews.title: Locks up frequently on a Xbox One X !
reviews.text: Got the ultimate edition, got all the latest patches and updates before I even tried playing the game. It frequently locks up when trying to go to locations to do an event. Especially locks up when trying to fast travel from one location to another. Extremely frustrating to try and play when it locks up and you lose the last accomplishment because it wasn’t saved. Ended up returning it. Unfortunately I can’t offer a true review of the gameplay, but since it doesn’t work on a new Xbox one X with a fast and reliable internet connection, I’m going to give it two stars for crappy compatibility. Need for speed payback at least works and has way better car customization features. Disappointed in this.

reviews.title: Great single player game.
reviews.text: Fun single player game. Kept me entertained for many many hours. Highly recommended for someone who doesn’t like online gaming. Challenging, open world with the freedom to do as wish in the order you decide. I like that the decisions you make, affect the game later on. I would recommend this game.

reviews.title: Great fun. Has many aspects of other successful games which make this very enjoyable.
reviews.text:
I was completely surprised at how much fun this game is. It has elements of Need for Speed, GTA, and Black Ops, all rolled into one fun game. I’ve been playing it for many many hours, and I still have 60% to complete. The game is challenging with puzzles, technology, shooting, racing with cars AND boats! , covert ops and cop chases.
I would highly recommend this game. Even the online challenges (which do NOT require xbox Gold) are extremely entertaining as you work with or against other online players. Since I only spent 8 dollars on this brand new, it’s totally worth it !

reviews.title: Not fun, not challenging. Good for very young players perhaps.
reviews.text: Eh, good for little kids I guess. As an adult gamer, it’s not challenging or even really fun. It’s completely guided, you can’t die, and you basically collect coins like Mario brothers and solve simple puzzles. It’s also lacking the witty dialogue LEGO games usually have. I’d pass on this game.

reviews.title: Great gameplay, online play sometimes spotty
reviews.text:
I have logged 281 hours playing this game. That in itself shows how much I like the game. The campaign mode is challenging, and fun. Online mode is where I spend most of my time now that I have finished the campaign. I love the hacking invasion of another player. It’s a lot of fun to mess with people by blowing stuff up, sending gang members after them etc. My only complaint though is a big one. The online play frequently locks up and actually causes my Xbox One X to shut off! This happens about 20% of the time. I’ve reached out to Ubisoft, but they have no response other than reinstalling the game, which isn’t the problem. It ONLY locks up when playing online through their Ubisoft servers. Watch dogs 1 did not have this issue, and checking the forums, I am far from alone, yet Ubisoft refuses to release a bug patch.
Overall, it’s one of my favorite games, which is why I’m so frustrated when the game randomly locks up hard. I have also found that there doesn’t seem to be a whole lot of people playing online. The group races, or showdown events are rarely useable because of the lack of participation from online play. I’d recommend this game, but be aware of its pitfalls.

reviews.title: Puzzle like game that I found a bit boring.
reviews.text: I didn’t enjoy this game as much as I thought I would. It’s mostly a puzzle like game firguing out how to get around one obstacle to the next. Good graphics, but still kinda boring for my taste.

reviews.title: Fun game, great online play too.
reviews.text: Fun game, lots of replay ability, and multiplayer is also fun without the hassle of online harassment. I’ve certainly gotten my money’s worth playing this game over and over. The missions are challenging, and the planes are different enough to use different planes for different missions.

reviews.title: Fun game, wish night mode had off road events.
reviews.text: Pretty fun game, though the story line is pretty short. Multiplayer isn’t enjoyable because it seems no matter how fast my car is, it’s like I’m walking compared to other connected players in the game. And just being able to honk at each other is stupid. As for single player mode, I like the arcade racer genre very much, and the cop chases are more difficult. It has replay ability after the story is complete, but it’s really just to collect more cars. Personally I think the off-road events are the most fun, but they are also the least available compared to race and drift events. A definite improvement over the previous NFS games, but there is still a lot of room for playing improvement. One specific annoyance is the inability to change the controls. The horn is located as a push on the left stick which also has major functionality for steering, so frequently as I turn a corner, the horn goes off. SUPER ANNOYING, seemingly an easy fix by allowing custom button controls.

reviews.title: Fixed the drift.
reviews.text:
Like some out there my daughters Switch had joy con drift. Since sending to Nintendo would take way too long I decided to replace the stick myself. I have experience repairing small electronics so it was easy enough. I think anyone that can take their time and follow directions would be able to accomplish the repair easily enough.

The package contains 2, I only needed one, and it was a good thing. The first stick would not calibrate, seemed a bit off. There was no drift but it didn't center once I let go. The other was perfect. Send company an email and they replaced the whole package very quickly. Despite the issue I'd recommend this for the repair if you have to do it.

Quality issues can happen. I'll always stand by a company or vendor that takes care of the customer when something happens.

reviews.title: Surprised.
reviews.text:
I'm a bit older hand have a hard time holding on to the switch lite while playing through this pandemic.
Bought these not really expecting too much. Wasn't fond of how it seemed the other products would work.

Snapped on easily and you have plenty of options. Have had for a few months and it is holding up nicely.
I'd not only recommend for the younger crowd, but for...more mature gamers.

My son in law came over tonight to borrow a controller and the game because he bought an xbox one also, after listening to my grandson tell him how much fun he was having with it versus xbox 360.
