reviews.title: Roccat Kone XTD
reviews.text:
Let me start off by saying, this is a BIG mouse. It is long and wide.

In the realm of "gaming" mouses (I don't game) there are many options, but there are few with a tilting scroll wheel. That severely limited my choices and is what made me pull the trigger on this. I love the texture, the lights, and the responsiveness of this mouse. The mouse is ever so slightly big for my hand, but it is a right handed grip which kind of tells your hand exactly where to go. The scroll wheel feels of quality, but it is quite stiff. The cord is braided and light and you can barely tell it is there.

My previous mice were a Logitech M510 and LX8 cordless mouse. These were smaller and ambidextrous and I found the grip to be perfect. In fact I just came across a mouse called the M500 which is corded and has all the features I like. I may in-fact purchase that one too.

Edit:I have used the mouse for a few additional weeks and it has grown on me. My older mouse makes my hand feel like cramping when I use it. I however keep my old M510 nearby in case I feel like using the claw grip, but compared to this one it seems so inaccurate and unresponsive. I am changing my review from 4 stars to 5 stars.____ This is a "palm grip" mouse, no question about that. But I can move my hand back and still use a claw grip if I so choose, and it feels comfortable.

Choosing a mouse without trying it first is difficult. You can read reviews and they can give you some insight, but it is a subjective experience. This is definitely one of the ones you should try, along with a few other names like the death adder.

Edit: I've had this for 3 1/2 years and it's still the best I've used. The forward and back buttons are in the perfect spot. The DPI buttons are conveniently located. I initially liked the Deathadder, but I now think it's crap. It feels cheap, the button clicks feel cheap, and the forward and back buttons both double and triple click. I haven't owned enough mouses to comment on the sensor as some say there are better ones, but it feels 100% accurate for me. I would say that a corded mouse is infinitely better than a wireless one.

With smaller mouses I tend to rest the heel of my hand on the desk and it causes me wrist and finger pain. This allows me to keep my wrist straight.

reviews.title: Mionix Castor review- shark fin grey
reviews.text:
I am not a frequent gamer, but I enjoy using products endorsed by the gaming community. My Roccat Kone XTD was beginning to wear after 2 years, so I thought about replacing it with the same mouse. I decided however to try a different mouse that caters to somebody with a different grip. I don't have much to say, but I will comment on the features that are important to this group:

First_ the box. I like the way the product was presented. The box is of quality, but I would love to have it exist in just a clamshell package and a 1 page sheet with info and a link to downloads and any relevant product manual. Use the money for some other feature, like a second DPI button.

Second_ the software. It's minimalist. There are adjustments for anglesnap and many other features. I like that you can control the number of steps. The Roccat however, the software just blows me away. It tracks every click and turns it into awards when certain milestones are reached. It's fun. You can use this information in your gameplay, and it's kind of fun. Oh, I've said that already, lol.

Third_ the building materials. The surface is kind of a rubberized material. IDK if it contains latex. It is comfortable, but I still prefer the build of the Roccat. This surface retains heat from the user's hand and with use is warm to the touch. The buttons are LOUD. The clicks feel of quality. I prefer the clicks of the Omron switches. I like the braided cord. The mouse however is too light. I am however used to the Roccat which is larger and has added weights.

Fourth_ ergonomics. I have a small hand. The mouse feels a little small, but I'm a palm grip user. I bought this because I thought it was good looking and I wanted something different that would make me want to use other grips. The forward button is a little hard to reach. The scroll feels of quality and the clicks are distinct, but it's a little small. I noticed now that you can't click the mouse wheel right and left. There are grooves that support your last two fingers, however.The Roccat lacks these grooves, but the height prevents your fingers from touching. The Castor is a little slippery, which makes the lift and drop technique possible.

It is quite comfortable, but the biggest flaw (to me) is the lack of height from the heel, but this comes from a person who prefers a palm grip. This is a fingertip style mouse, which the Roccat does quite well. Claw grip work best with tiny notebook style mice. FOUR stars **** . I would not buy again, but I think it's a good buy, especially at the now lower 38 dollar price tag. Enjoy! I hope I was helpful.

reviews.title: One of the best prebuilt keyboards available.
reviews.text:
I just purchased this and have not owned it for long, but I was anxious to type at length. The main reasons I purchased this board were for it's hotswap capabilities as well as the low profile/zero tilt case. For some reason flat enthusiast mechanical keyboards are almost unheard of. I have lower profile board in space gray, with Halo Clear switches.

Keycaps- The keycaps are certainly better than average, and they better be for the cost of this board. I prefer PBT- I like the harder material, the sound, and the rougher texture. However, these are almost too rough- they are gritty like sandpaper. My favorite keycaps are Leopold. Just to compare the keycaps on the Anne Pro II are also PBT, but they are pretty smooth and not ideal. I like the font and the shine through legends. On two sides they measure 1.33mm and the other two 1.01. I'm not sure why they are not even all around. The are OEM profile and have a pleasant sound. I may replace them, but am not rushing to do so.

Switches- This board has Halo Clears, though there are about 1/2 dozen other choices available. These are rated at 63 grams I believe, but they bottom out at 80 grams. They are heavy. The are smooth and have good tactility- and I like the force curve. They all ping like crazy however which annoys the heck out of me. I like these a lot, but I will be swapping the springs out for lighter ones. There is minimal switch wobble, but I think the heavier springs help to mitigate some of that.

Case- the case is flat and low profile which I like. It is aluminum which I'm neutral about. I'm perfectly fine with plastic and the metal adds cost to the whole package. This is a "floating switch" design, meaning the bottom of the switches are exposed. I used to like this, but I actually prefer the more tradition kind where the bezel covers the base of the switch. The case has zero tilt which was my number one requirement. It comes with magnetic feet which are quite sturdy and raise the incline about 4-5 degrees. There are recessed hole the feet go into and the case can even be declined. Don't worry they are not coming off if you slide the board. I actually had a really difficult time getting them off after I attached them.

RGB- These can be adjusted using FN plus various letters and there are controls for brightness, breathing, color, scrolling pattern, etc. I don't know if there is more fine tuning control when you flash the firmware (I just use a dim backlight). There is also RGB going around the base of the case which I turn off.

Stabilizers- I can detect just a slight rattle in the space bar, but I think the heavier springs help to prevent some vibration. I have read that the stabs are not very good so I have already purchased new ones and will be installing them tomorrow.

Software/Programmability- I have not experimented with this yet. There is a process to flash the firmware for the layout you desire. I would remap the Fn to the CapsLock and then the arrows to I,J,K,L.

Overall Value- $200 dollars is a lot of money for a keyboard. At this price point you can just about build the board yourself and choose the components. I would have chosen different switches (though I'm really starting to like these) and a plastic case which would have saved money, and different keycaps. However, I paid $140 for this new on eBay and I feel at this price it is a great value. Ultimately it was the flat case that made me pull the trigger. I have heard of people complaining about the rattling stabilizers which they felt should not happen at this price point.

I should also point out that there may be some issues with the USB-C cable. Some cables are not compatible- I believe they need to be rated for 2.4a, and not just data. I will say that my own USB- Cable would not even fit in the port which was strange- I did not force it. For people who like to use the fancy coiled cables they may not work.

Included in the case is a switch puller, keycap puller, and the feet. The are all wedged in the foam base.

reviews.title: Great value at any price
reviews.text:
I purchased these keycaps to replace the ones on my DROP Alt keyboard.

PROS___

-Fit and finish are top notch. There are no caps with mold marks or anything.

- Even fonts. They are near perfect. If I look very closely on just a few caps I can see where an edge is not perfect (noticed on about 2 caps)

- Texture is very pleasant. I like my keycaps with a rough feeling to them. The keycaps on the DROP board were actually TOO rough. It felt as if they were coated in sandpaper. These are a tad smoother. These are very comparable to Leopold keycaps, who make in my opinion the best ones in the biz. Only difference is these are OEM profile, and Leopold uses their own shorter SS2 profile.

- THICK. I measure 1.39- 1.5 on my digital calipers. The sound profile is also really pleasant.

- Cost. I think these are a wonderful value. I am happier with this $45 set than I am with my ePBT set that I paid more than $100 for. I will be purchasing more, especially if they offer more colors.

CONS___

- The colors offered are very limited. I would like to see more than black, white, and blue,
- Some of the keycaps did not fit the proper rows. For example, the PgUp key which on this board is
on the third row was made for the fifth row (it was too tall). The options were to have them not match the height of their rows, or to leave the original keycaps on from the first set. I elected to leave the old ones one. I like the way a few keys look that the darker contrasting keys look. This was only an issue for Del, Home, PgUp, and PgDn. The other ones I left in for aesthetics only.
- Lastly, very surprisingly there is no 1.25u Fn key. This is a VERY common keycap that many sets will need. I have 10 boards and almost every one has this key.

EDIT*- This does in fact have a 1.25 unit Fn key- So I'm buying another set!!!

reviews.title: Great compact, ergonomic mouse
reviews.text:
I have MANY mice and am always buying new ones to try and find something better. I was a huge fan of the Roccat Kone XTD. It was a little large for my hand, but the shape was perfect. This is essentially the same mouse but like 15% smaller.

When I first bought the mouse I didn't like it and almost returned it. The case material is pleasant feeling, but slippery and my hand would just slide up the mouse body and off. I put 4 strips of grip tape on the mouse and it's a whole nother animal. The tape make it just a hair larger which I like, but more importantly it sticks to my hand. My thumb and ring finger fit in the grooves perfectly and my other fingers lay on top of the mouse. I've been trying to find another like this but I haven't. The closest is the Mionix Castor, which does have a similar shape.

Ergonomics is the most important factor for me, but it also has a premium scroll wheel and quality buttons (My previous Roccat mice had Omron switches, I haven't opened this one yet). There is an LED logo and to be honest I don't know if it is RBG. I've used the Swarm software really only to change the DPI presets so I have not delved into it too deeply. I know for some the software will make or break their experience, but for me it is not important. You can set them (DPI) and use the buttons on the mouse to scroll up and down through your chosen presets. I am also a fan of the braided cable.

The grip is not for everyone and if you have larger hands , I would imagine the smaller size would cause your hand to cramp. Also, as I said, I found the mouse unusable without sports grip tape. I prefer wired mice, but I do wish this was available in a wireless variant.

reviews.title: quality + great value
reviews.text:
I simply cannot get over the quality of these caps for the little that I paid for them. The profile is called SEMI, but these are more or less just Cherry profile as far as I am concerned. I would have to measure them against a different set and the difference would be difficult to discern.

The legends on the alpha keys are dye sub and side printed. The legends on the modifiers however are laser etched I believe it is called and raised. However, they are on the side of the keycap and will never wear off.

What really blows my mind is the thickness. I measured a bunch of caps with a digital caliper and I recorded anywhere from 1.35mm to 1.5. Many budget keycaps nowadays are quite thin, but that is not the case here.

I do see some mold markings on the underside of the keycaps, but not really visible when mounted. The spacebar is slightly warped, which is not unusual for PBT at any price point, and it does not affect operation.

My only real "complaint" is that there are not more color schemes available. I also would like to see these in OEM because that is my preferred profile. So yeah. I will post a pic when I get to it. I think for the price you can't go wrong with buying them now and using when you need them.

The color I chose is Carbon. I am not crazy about it but I do like the contrasting red and black with the cream. I am not very good at seeing and evaluating colors, but the cream color is difficult to match to a case I think. I completely clashed with the silver case of my Drop ALT. It probably mates best with a black case.

The packaging is rather cheap. The plastic tray it sits in is flimsy and so is the cardboard box. However, at this price point that is perfectly fine. This helps to keep the price low. If you are looking for a sturdy case to store the caps in this is not it. If you are check out the Akko keycaps. They come with a very sturdy and neat folding case.

reviews.title: Well built
reviews.text:
I love this board. I own about 15 mechanical keyboards and this is one of my favorites. I purchased this used for around $70, used. I also swapped out the switches (came with Cherry Reds) if I recall and installed Box Browns. The case is very well made. I'm also a big fan of the keycaps. They are PBT and shine through- a pleasure to type on. They are a little shorter than OEM- maybe Cherry profile.

It's been a while since I've used the software- the Durgod Hera Compiler. I remember it being a bit clunky and awkward to use, but ultimately I was able to program the board to my liking. I moved FN to CAPS LOCK and arrow keys to IJKL.

Some people complain that there are no legs to adjust angle. This I don't care about and actually prefer flat or a very low angle. It's probably about 2 degrees. Overall I cannot find any complaints about this board. It's competitors would be the Anne Pro II, Poker 3, and the Ducky One. I have to say I am a huge fan of the Poker 3 and maybe a little bias. One thing I don't like about it though is the typing angle. It is much too steep and cannot be adjusted. It's probably 5 or 6%.

EDIT: I just measured the angle and it is roughly 4.5- 4.8 degrees or so, but I have adjusted the rubber pads on the bottom so it inclines less, so it is probably at least one degree steeper than this.

reviews.title: Doesn't feel like it's SUPER high quality
reviews.text: My girlfriend is using this charger, and it works alright. Doesn't feel like it's SUPER high quality, but it hasn't broken yet, and it's been a while. Would recommend.

reviews.title: the game here does not look nearly as good as some of the other versions
reviews.text: Admittedly, the game here does not look nearly as good as some of the other versions; that said, I did not expect it to. I found the gameplay to be just as good as the PS Vita version, and it was an amazing platforming experience. It's not exactly easy, but it's not cheap. It's rewarding, skill based difficulty. I love the level design and creativity put into this game. It is probably one of my favourite platformers, and since I have received it, I have been playing it nearly nonstop. There's a decent amount of content, and a lot to do. In my opinion, it has a lot of replay value. HOWEVER, I have not played this game with other people. I do not know if there are any issues with the co-operative play in this game.

reviews.title: and it plays great. I actually love the 2DS
reviews.text:
I got the product on time, and it plays great. I actually love the 2DS, because it's far more comfortable than the 3DS or 3DS XL to hold, especially if you have large hands. If you buy trigger grips for it (available at gamestop, at least?), it becomes even more comfortable. I bought the 2DS mostly to play Super Smash Bros, but I have been exploring other 3DS games more than I expected. The 2DS is way better for Smash than the 3DS in my opinion, and the trigger grips make it almost as comfortable as a gamecube controller.

I still find it fairly pocketable in hoodie weather and winter, since I can shove it easily into any pocket. It may be a bit more troublesome to carry during the summer, but even then it fits in most of my pants, albeit barely. I don't miss the 3D at all, and in fact, the screen seems brighter than any 3DS I've used, at highest brightness.

All in all, I would highly recommend this product.

reviews.title: the tactics combat system is rock solid and better than that of many other popular tactics games [including ...
reviews.text: Bought this for my younger brother. He cannot put it down. I played it a little myself, and while the style/premise of the game doesn't interest me too much, the tactics combat system is rock solid and better than that of many other popular tactics games [including the Fire Emblem series].

reviews.title: Wonderful replacements...
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:7cdb9677c1dbe530c74b3a16679b6dfd]] The rgb on the AUKEY km g12 blue switch keyboard isn't as bright as I would like so I found these lovelies and they're wonderful. They have a nice shape with a silver/white lining around the edge of each keycap. The base is clear which makes the rgb backlighting bright & awesome looking!! They feel smooth and well made, all caps fit perfectly, of course not designed specifically for this keyboard so some of the key markings are different than the originals. Even the clicky sound is muted ever so slightly. I used my keyboard strictly for my 9-5 and these were a great addition. Update: I just received the white pair and they look just as nice. This time around, I used rubber O rings to further mute the sound and worked wonderfully.

reviews.title: Very nice...
reviews.text: Solid built mechanical keyboard. The brightness of the rgb lights is absolutely awesome but It only has 3 onboard rgb settings & one is to turn off the lights. The key sound is clicky but not extremely loud. Purchased to use only for my 9-5, works well.

Original review:

I had to make an adjustment to using a silent mouse, it really is silent. The RGB lighting is pretty and the size feels good in my + average female hand. I use it 8 hrs-5 days per week for work only. At some time on Monday, it always needs charging. For my purposes, this was a good buy.

reviews.title: RGB wasn't bright enuf...

reviews.title: All right
reviews.text: Good condition!

reviews.title: Ooooh Shiney!!!
reviews.text:
I'm using this controller to play Steam games – it’s wired and came with a 10 ft USB cable so that made it an easy decision. I don’t have a use for most of the functions, even though it’s incredibly capable and I gave all of them a test drive.

The learning curve for using the features is a little steep at first, but I got used to programming it pretty quickly. First off the customizable prismatic pipe color is really awesome. It will lock to basically any neon color in the spectrum, so I was able to make it match my shoes, desktop, or whatever gaming interface I was using at the time. You can also map the multiwheels under the controller to different functions, which I found convenient in more complex RPGs. You can also customize the rumble feature and the led lights on the inside of the controller.

The software works independently of the XBOX ONE, so I was able to manipulate the functions of it as long as it was plugged in.

The aesthetics of this thing are really great – as far as the function goes it’s stellar, as well. The triggers feel a little springier and cheaper than the standard XBOX ONE controllers, but I got used to them pretty quickly. Once this thing is plugged in it looks really radical, and I wasn't having any troubles with lag – all the buttons and the analog sticks are super responsive and swift.

I like this controller a lot – I’ll definitely be hanging on to it for my PC gaming.

reviews.title: It's a winner
reviews.text:
I had been interested in mechanical keyboards for a long time, but honestly I didn’t really know what to expect. From the moment I pulled this thing out of the box I could instantly tell it was a very high quality piece of hardware. It has a metal frame with very solid keys. I eagerly plugged it in and connected my mouse through the port extension on the back of the keyboard.

There was a solid, deep red glow emanating from the keys. Very impressive. Typing on it is pure joy, despite quite a long learning curve. I don’t mind the adjustment because it's so pleasing to type on something so well made. The reason why it’s taken a while to adjust is because the Rapidfire indicates extreme sensitivity of the keys – if they travel just over a millimeter they will signal a keystroke. This means you have to be accurate and not attack your keyboard like you would with a cheaper brand. The backspace key posed the largest problem when browsing, as just north of it F11 triggers full screen browsing and F12 opens the source examine pane in Chrome. A little adjustment is all it took and now I’m learning to quickly and accurately graze the keys in order to type instead of bottoming out. It truly is a joy to type on the K70 Rapidfire.

It’s very comfortable to type on this keyboard. I usually don’t keep the included wrist rest attached unless I have some heavy word processing to do. It doesn’t seem like it adds much ergonomically, but it makes a huge difference when cranking out detailed reviews for Amazon :D (I’m on it right now).

Regarding the RGB indicated in the name, it’s a nod to the LED Array under the keys, and I’ve only mentioned the ominous red embers. In order to truly make use of these functions you need to get on Corsair’s website and download the Corsair Utility Engine (CUE) software. Be prepared when you do – the rainbow of color explosion that happens when you first fire up the CUE program is dazzling. It gives you a good idea of exactly how much control you have. It took some learning and a bit of video tutorial hunting but I learned to navigate the program and was creating my own custom color combos and animations in an afternoon – This is especially helpful to label hotkeys for your commonly used programs.

Protip: You can download presets for the K70 Rapidfire, but many won’t work by default. Once you download the *.prf files you’ll need to use a program like Notepad++ to open and edit the name of the hardware in the line of code that says modelName>K70 RGB RAPIDFIRE</modelName – Make sure it has this modelname (I know the K70 standard models work, but others may too) This is a new keyboard and it doesn’t have many presets yet, but the ones I use from other models that look great are Poison, Knight Rider, Hologram, and Sonar.

The only problem that I have with this keyboard is that it’s spoiled me rotten. Look how much I typed in this review xD. I’m going to have to replace my keyboards at the office too :P

5 stars. Get one. You won’t regret it.

(Btw, one sexy feature I forgot to mention that I’m crazy about is the knurled metal wheel in the top right hand corner that controls the volume. It looks really cool and feels great to use. It’s the only control that’s not assignable on this keyboard and it doesn’t need to be. It’s absolutely perfect the way it is.)

reviews.title: Great audio in and out, could use a mixamp or preamp for game consoles
reviews.text:
Didn't get off to a good start with this headset--one earpiece had a short. A $200+ headset with a short right out of the box? That's not so good. A little twist of the wire fixed it, but still...

The good news is it sounds great with an iPhone, iPad, Mac, or PC. Compliments were received for the mic quality (Sennheiser says it is broadcast quality) even when using it for phone calls.

The not-so-good news is the audio is lacking when connected to a Playstation or Xbox through the game controller.

It's more a problem with the audio outputs of the game consoles than the headset. It's going to take a little more than just plug and play to get the max out of this headset. Without that, you might as well use a $40 headset that is actually plug and play in console controllers.

It really needs a mixamp or preamp (preferably one with adjustable EQ) in the game console audio chain to bring it to its full potential. If you don't have one or don't plan to get one, another reviewer suggested going with the Game One by Sennheiser.

Otherwise, it is a comfortable headset, one that can be worn for hours.

Apart from the short, the build quality is high and audio quality, both in the speakers and mic, is outstanding.

reviews.title: Good quality, excellent value
reviews.text:
Great full coverage headset. Bass response isn't enhanced, so it seems to have a "flat" audio spectrum, which can be a good thing if you're an audio purist. A flat spectrum is also an advantage when it comes to hearing dialog and chat, whereas enhanced bass can make everything sound woofy. If you're looking for a lot of bass, I'd rate these as a 6 out of 10 in that area.

The ear pieces are comfortable and full coverage but don't completely shut out the outside world. You can still hear some ambient sounds. The automatic adjustable fit is excellent.

The mic is inconspicuous and easily moved around. The lighting is a bonus but only operates when connected via USB.

The only negative is the volume adjustment knob has a budget feel, kind of like a toy, but it works fine. Not enough of a complaint to knock a star off the review.

Great value.

reviews.title: Mostly great!
reviews.text:
Some people have complained about the weight of this headset, but so far it's been pretty comfortable for 2-hour gaming sessions.

This is a wireless VR headset, so everything is onboard---and that's why it's a little heavy. The games are stored in memory in the headset itself, and capacity isn't upgradeable. Keep that in mind when you are making a decision between the 64 and 128GB model.

Setup is easy. You will need a phone to download and use the app for setup and to get games. Then follow the instructions and in minutes you're ready to play.

Graphics aren't going to rival PC or console games---they're a little bit retro in terms of resolution, but that kind of comes with the territory and the small built-in screens in the headset. Besides, that might be a good thing when it comes to VR. If the the graphics are too good, things might get a little "uncanny valley" and not so fun to play for long. That's not a complaint, just a personal opinion.

The wirelessness is a huge convenience during gameplay---you won't feel a cord brushing against your arms or running down your back. And the controllers are responsive with no noticeable lag. Battery life is good enough for a several-hours-long gaming session.

Game availability is coming around, but isn't really vast yet. Maybe the prices of games will come down as more are brought to market.

reviews.title: Very comfortable, amazing sound
reviews.text:
This headset is very comfortable to wear for hours. The audio quality is great as-is, but it's amazing with the mix amp. It lives up to the claims in the features list.

It will work with a Playstation but you don’t get the full sound without the mixer. It works great on my Xbox and PC.

It's an open-back design, but a mod kit is available to convert it to noise isolating closed back, and you can order custom tags for the speakers.

reviews.title: Good sound and mic quality
reviews.text: These are full coverage over-the-ear headphones. The sound is a little heavy on the bass end, but not nearly as much as a lot of headphones. The mic attenuates the high end a little, which is good because it reduces sibilance. The 3.5mm plug allows them to be used with any device that has matching input---game consoles, phones, voice recorders, and so on. To use with a computer or device that has separate mic and headset inputs you'll need a splitter cable, which must be purchased separately.

reviews.title: Great cooling stand/organizer for PS5
reviews.text: Great features -- a PS5 stand with built-in cooling fan, docks for controllers that recharge them (complete with charge indicator lights), a headset hanger, a USB-C port, and slots to hold up to eleven games. It's a great way to organize a PS5, and it works great.

reviews.title: Great appearance and typing
reviews.text:
Great bang for the buck. The RGB colors look great with the pudding key caps. Lots of lighting modes. It works fine with Linux right out of the box. You get a bunch of contrasting-color extra key caps to customize the layout to your own liking. And a couple of key cap pullers are included, and a USB-C to USB-A cable (about 5 feet long) is included too.

Do keep in mind this is a 60 percent keyboard. It has no dedicated PgUp, PgDn, arrow (cursor), or Home or End or Delete keys. You can turn the JKL and I keys into arrow keys with a Function key + i combination, and turn the Backspace key into a Delete key with a Function key + Backspace combination. But the function key is on the right side, same side as the i key, and Delete keys, so those are kind of awkward to hit on the fly. To do anything more to add the functionality of PgUp, PgDn, Home, End, etc. keys would require remapping and reprogramming the keyboard, which is kind of complicated and more back end work than I personally want to invest. I like the keyboard, though. I like that it's compact and looks great and has a great mechanical feel when typing. So if you're like me and really want those dedicated PgUp, PgDn, etc keys without going to a lot of trouble, a solution is to get a separate number pad that can be set aside until needed. A matching number pad is available (as of this writing). Do a search for the brand name of this one (Womier). Or you could go with a non-matching wireless number pad that won't add an extra cable to your desktop and can be set out of the way easily.

reviews.title: Good quality, nice key action
reviews.text: This is a low-profile, short action mechanical keyboard. The keystrokes are not clicky. They're very quiet. The keycaps are low profile too, a lot thinner than typical mechanical keycaps. The action reminds me of a really good quality laptop keyboard, like a vintage ThinkPad. Nice feel overall. A light typing touch is all it takes. If you like to hammer your keyboard and like the feel of long key travel and the sound of clicky switches, then this is not the keyboard for you. But it's a great keyboard if you like a more quality laptop-type keyboard feel. A USB-A to USB-C cord is included, along with a simple user manual. Incidentally the LED colors are fixed---not a true RGB. But there are eight lighting modes (nine  counting "off") and brightness and effect speed can be adjusted.

reviews.title: Good for training, some fun games
reviews.text: I think one critic is a little too harsh in his review. At first I didn't understand why the game would not let me choose what I wanted to play. Then, I realized it was training me on how to use the controller with different types of games. Once you go through all the games, you can select what you want to play. I like Shooting and Table Tennis. Laser Hockey is okay, too. I like games that keep  me on my feet and active. Billiards is a challenge, but I'm getting the hang of it. I would not recommend as a first game, but it is still a good one to practice with.

reviews.title: Wii Sport Clenched This Sale For Me!
reviews.text: I played my sister's console before I bought my own. I love bowling and tennis, and I get a good workout from the included disc. I also invested in Wii Fit to get started on my workout routine. I am not a gym rat, and this will give me the benefits of a gym in my own home. I think most of the games are overpriced, but I was able to get some good deals at Target. Overall, this is a good deal for the price. Setup is easy and ready to play within a few minutes. My teenaged nephew has Wii, XBox and Playstation. Wii is the one he plays with most often.

reviews.title: Useful addition to the balance board but a little expensive
reviews.text: I bought this to complete my Wii Fit ensemble. The price is a little high for a pair of plastic pieces that only elevate the balance board for step aerobics. If you are addicted to step aerobics, you may want to purchase this.

reviews.title: Challenging workout program for a former couch potato
reviews.text: I hate going to the gym-can't stand the crowds and can't stand the smell. I bought Wii Fit and I now work out every day I'm home. The more games you participate in, the more games you unlock. For those with short attention spans, vary your routine by playing other sports like My Fitness Trainer. My focus is on balance and body alignment. Ski Jump and Tight Rope help me with my balance. Hula Hoop is great for aligning my body and giving my hips a real workout. My cardio burn routine is Super Hula Hoop and the run through the park. I'm in a job that forces me to sit for hours (I fly), so games like this are a real treat. Being able to track my progress for weight loss and other health goals is a wonderful utility.

reviews.title: Average, but don't expect too much
reviews.text: I don't know what the 1-star reviewers were expecting for the price, but the game is not that bad. It could be much better, though. After playing the bowling games in the Sports and Sports Resort, it seems more difficult to get spares and strikes. At least you have many choices of skins for the bowling ball, and there are many characters to choose as your player but they tend to be a little too chatty. If you have the cash to spare, I would recommend it.

reviews.title: Gift My Nephew Loves
reviews.text: Every year I buy this card for my nephew and every year he is estatic to get it. I do not buy the code because there seems to be a potential for too much to go wrong. It's a gift so I don't want my nephew to have to fuss and struggle to use it. I will continue to buy this card until they stop offering it or he outgrows it, whichever comes first.

reviews.title: Up and running!
reviews.text: The adapter works just fine, just as well as the OEM version. I moved and the cord got separated from my console. It was quicker to order another than to search through my boxes. I plugged it in and it began working with no problem (knock on wood). Inexpensive does not always mean cheap.

reviews.title: Inexpensive but works well
reviews.text: I got this and was up and running in no time. My console and controller recognized right away. I played two different games to make sure it worked correctly. Inexpensive doesn't always mean cheap quality. This was well packaged and arrived quickly. It's nice to have a good backup in case I do find my original.

reviews.title: Another not skinny dancer!
reviews.text: I live in a hot climate and don't like to exercise outside. I am also not a gym rat, which is why I bought the Wii. This exercise program works the whole body. I limber up and have fun dancing. There are a variety of routines so I won't get bored. I was a little clumsy at first because I had to learn the steps, but I feel less conspicuous as I get through the learning curve. Anyone who wants to dance and exercise to work out would enjoy this.

reviews.title: Get ready to sweat!
reviews.text: You don't need to be a good dancer, young or skinny to enjoy this exercise program. Think of what you will accomplish as you master the steps and moves. At the same time you are getting a great workout. There are tutorials to help you get started and learn the steps. The belt is included and more than large enough to get around most waists. Definitely worth the price!

reviews.title: Addicting!
reviews.text: I love playing Wolf Run and Wild Wolf in the casinos. Having it at home is worse because I play all the time! I also like Wild Goose Chase, although it takes forever to get the bonus round, it pays pretty well. Texas Tina is okay, too.

reviews.title: Favorites slots but lousy game
reviews.text: I enjoy playing Aztec Temple and Wild Wolf in the casinos, which is why I purchased this game. I bought it as a download directly from the company hoping they would have fixed the problems by now. Unfortunately it will not work properly. After every free spin, my balance returns to the amount it was before I won the free spins. Whatever I win in the free spins I lose when the game returns to normal play. I sent a email to customer support but I suspect I may not hear from them based on the reviews. That's too bad because the company could have had a winner in this game if they supported it properly.

reviews.title: Great and not just for gaming!
reviews.text: I got these to use with my laptop, not with any gaming system. I played a game and it worked very well. I also tested it with Skype and it worked very well. I then listened to my favorite music on my Samsung Note 2. Lots of bass, which I love! The headset is comfortable, although I will need to get used to the earcups. The microphone works well and at a lesser volume level. Overall, these are very nice.

reviews.title: Works with Win 10 but games difficult to play
reviews.text: I used to have this disc but lost it. I was glad to find it again but I do not remember the bonuses being so difficult to get. I prefer the old school slots but they are quickly disappearing from the US casinos. Fire Horse and Pharaoh's Fortunes were my favorites. Lots of nice line hits but I would like to get an occasional bonus game.

reviews.title: Sturdy holder to keep headphones in any space
reviews.text: This device is very handy to keep my headphones near wherever I am. This can clamp to an edge and sit upright on a flat surface. The clamp feels spring-loaded and the nut allows the stand to swivel. The plastic feels strong and will be durable.

reviews.title: Works great on my laptop with Win 10
reviews.text: I got this because it looked like fun on the videos. It is great for me because I am winning instead losing. There is a good variety of slots. You will not be bored with this selection.

reviews.title: Great keyboard
reviews.text: This colorful keyboard is just what I wanted for a backlit display. It worked right away.

reviews.title: Too short!
reviews.text: I was not a fan of hidden object games until I played this. I became obsessed with playing this game. I did not dream it would end so soon. There were some clues that were tough to find. I wish there were more download games like this.

reviews.title: It works!
reviews.text: I can use my old Wii once again. This will revitalize my exercise regimen because I really like most of the Wii games, especially step aerobics.

reviews.title: Looks great....
reviews.text: Purchased as a gift from an Amazon list, and he loves them! He said it looks great and works perfectly!

reviews.title: Works great...
reviews.text: Purchased for a gift, works perfectly, and would purchase again.

reviews.title: Great game!
reviews.text: Purchased from Amazon wish list for my son, and he is very happy with it. Great price and you can't beat not having to step into a store to purchase!

reviews.title: Meh
reviews.text: Works some of the time, then stops working...

reviews.title: Base sucks
reviews.text: I'm pretty much with the consensus that the charging base is a piece of crap.  I used it once and it worked.  The second time, I rested my 3ds on the base, and woke up to a still-dead battery.  I unplugged the charger, plugged it back in, and made sure the 3ds was sitting exactly right in the cradle.  Waited about 8 hours.  Still, no charge at all.  So, I just use the battery with the charger and the battery alone is worth the money.  It greatly increases play time before charging again.  So, the cradle is useless, but IMO the extra battery power alone was worth the money.

reviews.title: Hmmmm.
reviews.text: I was excited for this to arrive, and through Amazon Prime I received it very quickly.  I was nearly instantly disappointed.  It doesn't really snap into place, so unless I'm missing something, it just slips around the case until the 3ds falls off.  Maybe using the stand helps, but I generally play with it on my lap without a table.

reviews.title: Maybe I'm slow...
reviews.text:
But I feel this game is not all it's cracked up to me. Unless I'm missing the main point of it. All I ever do is try to make money...shaking the trees, catching fish, and hitting rocks mostly. I got my citizen satisfaction fairly quickly, but it took a while to get the down payment for my house. What the heck else can I do that's supposed to be so fun?

EDITED: I'm bumping this up to 5 stars. Once I realized how in depth this game can get, I became addicted to it. I loved building my mansion and especially acquiring all sorts of furniture and appliances, etc

reviews.title: Yay!
reviews.text: I own every Professor Layton 3ds game.  All of them are awesome.  It's fun using your brain to figure out the puzzles.  Some are notably harder than the other puzzles.  If I get stuck, I can get hints.  Great way to exercise your mind!

reviews.title: Wonderful game
reviews.text: I'm really getting into this game lately.  I love how you have to multi-task while you're you're evading enemies.  I've been using the bow, magic glasses, shield, and sword so far.  Most things can be killed by using your sward.  There are puzzles to figure out...how to get to where you're supposed to be going and hoping to get there with plenty of life left for your character.  I find it challenging...sword, shield, and bow, sometimes with your character running.

reviews.title: Hate these
reviews.text: Even though these came up as accessories for a 3ds, they do not fit in the ds stylus holder.  My daughter lost the one that came with the 3ds and so we bought these.  They are way too long to put in the stylus opening, so we have to keep them separate it she ever needs to use a stylus.  Very disappointed.

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.text: I'm stuck here and have to write a certain number of words and there's not much to say about this other than it is good quality and it works great.  It's nice to have as a spare as we've misplaced the cord before.

reviews.title: Great product
reviews.text: I always get frustrated when applying protective films on our phones, iPads, 3Ds, etc.  so I was prepared to let an f bomb out during application.  I don't know why but I barely had any bubbles to contend with.  It's high quality and just what we needed.

reviews.title: Fast and fun!
reviews.text: I'm in my 40s and ordered this game for my teenage son.  I tried it out and its very fun, in fact all 4 of my kids love playing it!

reviews.title: Great little case for your PS Vita games
reviews.text: very nice case.  Sturdy and easy to snap games into.  If I had to change anything, it would be the color of the case.  I've got too many black and charcoal colored electronics that it's hard to find sometimes.  I'm a bit of a slob though.

reviews.title: Sturdy and so comfortable.  Extends playing time because of this.
reviews.text: Very comfy!  Can play games now without awkwardness or tired hands.

reviews.title: Pretty fun. Gets old planting crops and watering them
reviews.text: Pretty fun.  Gets old planting crops and watering them.  Although you can train pet monsters to do this, I've never gotten to the level where they can.  I also can't find the voice in the forest.  So although I've played for many hours, I'm kinda stuck already.

reviews.title: Kids will enjoy playing this!
reviews.text: I got this for my 11 year old daughter and she's been playing it for two days!  I tried my hand at it, and my Pokemon ended up looking like a cat!  lol.  She is much better at it at me.  I'm not sure how far the levels go, for now she is on the more basic ones I think.  It makes them feel good, especially when a drawing of an artistically deficient character renders your child''s picture a masterpiece!  My daughter loves that part of this game a lot.

reviews.title: Great, even for older adults!
reviews.text: Enjoying this as much as Animal Crossing.  There is SOOOO much to do with each stage of the Town Restoration.  I got to the point where I had a boyfriend and was making stuff in the maker's shed when my daughter accidentally deleted the whole game!  I started it over and was really depressed, but by the time I was done with Town Renovation 1, I am having fun again.

reviews.title: Disappointing.  Seems cheap and graphics are not as clear compared to the 3ds.
reviews.text: Guess I'm just used to playing the regular 3ds.  Graphics are compromised and the console feels, and is, like cheap plastic.

reviews.title: Too loose of fit
reviews.text: I bought this due to the highly rated reviews.  However, I'm pretty disappointed.  Parts slip off or down whenever I use it.  Not the whole thing, but mostly the hinge area. The back area has to be pushed away to insert the charging cable.  My headphones pop out of the port, but that's probably because I put over-the-ear phones instead of ear buds, a longer/deeper jack might be fine.  Anyway, the fit is just awful on this one.

reviews.title: One of the best out there...well worth the money!!!
reviews.text:
I came back to review this, and saw my original review never went through...I had rated it after a day of playing it and only gave it 2 stars!

I picked it back up a couple months ago and have played it nearly nonstop! There is SO MUCH to do in this game! You get to choose your Life, or Lives really. I started out as an Angler (fisherman) and it was really fun. Later, I almost wished I'd started off as a Paladin or Mercenary because I really needed those particular stats to beat higher "monsters". Presently, I'm at Hero rank as Angler, Paladin, Carpenter, Cook, Woodcutter, and a Master at Crafting. Honestly, I'm glad I didn't start out my "main" or first life as a crafter, carpenter, cook, or woodcutter. Maybe it's ok if you switch often into other lives like Paladin for instance. I'm finding Paladin to be probably most important as I've got the add-on content of Origin Island and the enemies are even harder to defeat.

It's charming, I love the scenery and the characters, and the fact you can buy different houses in different lands and decorate them, also there is the quick travel which helps immensely when you're striving to complete certain quests. I have played so many hours on this, and still have several lives to start still. I think sewing will be fun to make new outfits but for now I'm so busy battling I'm usually in my Paladin gear.

There is just so much to do in this game it's unbelievable. You shop, buy, sell, create, decorate, chop down trees, mine, become an alchemist, do witchcraft, craft, make furniture, battle, fish...and going to different lands makes for an amazing experience. The graphics are great and the details are amazing. As the storyline progresses as well you are able to add many different parties (like the Princess, the Dark Lord, and many others) to accompany you on your adventures. When you level up you get points you can add to you or other members in your party (like attack, intelligence, dexterity, etc). There is no shortage on what you can do!

reviews.title: Disappointed, my 11 year old daughter barely played one time only.
reviews.text: I thought my daughter would love this game.  Turns out, she played it for less than a half hour and never picked it up again.  I don't know her reasoning.  She is 11 and able to play much more difficult games without help.  So apparently this was really boring.

reviews.title: Had a hard time applying it and it appears to have compromised the clarity of the device.
reviews.text: Difficult to apply, and seems to have dulled the visuals on my games.  Prior to having an XL I had a Nintendo 3ds which seemed to have a clearer screen than this after applying a similar product to it.

reviews.title: Did not like anything about this game.  Must be meant for children because it was boring and simple!
reviews.text: Simply put, this game did not meet my expectations.  I was drawn in by all the positive reviews and apparent popularity of this and other Pokemon games.  I must be missing something because it seems very simple and compared to other games I have, I have played this one the least.  I'm middle-aged though, maybe this is intended for younger kids as I just could not get into it at all.

reviews.title: Very fun!  We own tons of 3DS games and this one is close to being our favorite!
reviews.text: Great game!  Very addicting.  Can be frustrating because it doesn't save your game unless you have completed that level.  I'm not to good at it but my 11 year old daughter and I fight over this game.  She is much better than me though.  I've never liked Luigi because he seems so awkward.  But he's kind of cute in this game, making funny noises and getting scared.

reviews.title: Mine was stolen, so I bought another.
reviews.text: I bought this PS Vita last year, and after the 4th of July holiday I discovered it missing.  We left no stone unturned searching, so unfortunately it appears someone stole it.  However, I liked it enough to buy it again (ouch $$).  The only thing I forgot was that I forgot it didn't come with a memory card, and the only one that fits it is made by Sony and really expensive!  It was disappointing, because I had ordered new games (which disappeared along with my previous Vita) and when this arrived I couldn't play them!  So now I'm waiting for the card, which hopefully arrives today.  Anyway, I love how solid and and well-made it is.  The graphics are amazing, so clear and beautiful.

reviews.title: Ridiculously overpriced but required to play newer PS Vita games.
reviews.text: This price SUCKS, and there is no cheaper alternative.

reviews.title: Such a cute and fun little game!
reviews.text: I'm 45, and probably too "big" to be playing these games.  But I don't give a crap, they're fun!  I love this game so far...makes you problem solve a little bit, but is very fun at the same time making "Sackboy" jump, swing, swim, etc to get to the next level.  There are costumes and stickers you can earn as well which allows for creative input.

reviews.title: Simple and boring.
reviews.text:
Very disappointing. What items to decorate a specific theme are displayed and access at the touch of a button (magnifying glass). Plus...is this all you do, is design? I'm on my third house and it's already boring! No complexity to the game at all.

UPDATE. I'm increasing it by one star, simply because I play it every day, so it can't be THAT bad. The duration of it in which I play is very short however. A couple more gripes...your character can walk only a short distance, just by the shops around the small town. You can't wander into the great outdoors to visit anyone, you can only be magically transported to a certain person's house. Also, when you pinpoint the building site of each character on a map, you are transported their immediately as well. You also don't have your own house, which seems like kinda a big oversight, that or they didn't think people would be interested in having their own houses for some reason. So, every day, you go to play and the game begins with your character already inside the shop (or is it right outside?). Very very limited freedom in this game. Also, I bought a big set of Amiibo cards. The first card was cool, I got to build an aquarium. The 2nd card however, was of a character I already have in the game and all I was allowed to do was re-decorate or decorate with whatever theme I chose. I hope I don't have a bunch of matches but it's likely I will.

reviews.title: Hilarious!  Very clever.
reviews.text: I've had this game for awhile but never played it until today.  I made all the characters my real life kids and husband, and they look like caricatures lol.  I've been laughing out loud at the random humor and interactions.  You just never know what another character (or your own) will do.  I look forward to opening all the businesses and getting some celebrity Mii's down the road.

reviews.title: Great buy and very helpful!
reviews.text: No problems, works perfectly.

reviews.title: Color not as described, otherwise great!
reviews.text: I don't know why but my case is much darker, like a navy blue, and it's easy to lose sight of because of it.  However, it is durable and the games fit nicely in it.

reviews.title: Initially fun, but the "trial" was ridiculous and impossible to keep up with.
reviews.text: I was really enjoying this game up until the first "trial".  Getting to know the characters and the layout of the school was fun, and the mystery interesting.  Then came the actual trial after the first murder.  I don't know what the hell happened but everyone was talking so fast and there was no time to question their accusations or theories so honestly I stopped playing it.

reviews.title: Gorgeous graphics and a sexy main character.
reviews.text: Really fun game with beautiful graphics.  I used to have a Gameboy and loved the James Bond games, and this game kind of reminds me of them.  I'm a chick who doesn't usually like games with guns and violence, I'm more of a Little Big Planet kind of gal.  But this is really fun.

reviews.title: Adorable and fun game!
reviews.text: This game is so cute and fun.  Never have played a Sonic game before, and my daughter loves it too.  Definitely one of our favorites on the PS VITA.

reviews.title: Very nice case, indeed!
reviews.text: I am used to using my 24 game case which is a white plastic, the Nintendo ones, that are nice and not cheap plastic.  But, I saw this and wanted it...didn't want to carry the 24 case everywhere.  So now I will carry my 16 game case.  I love the way it looks, and knew it wouldn't be "cheap."  The plastic is very durable, and the clear case with the games and the turquoise pockets in it is just beautiful.

reviews.title: Inexpensive and mindless fun!  :)
reviews.text: Very addictive game which doesn't take much brainpower, so it's perfect when you're bored and don't feel like concentrating.  Fun way to pass the time, some new levels which give it variety are cool.  Can't beat the price either!

reviews.title: I haven't played it, but my daughter begged for it but only played it once.
reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old who is TOTALLY into clothing and designing games.  This one she was less than impressed with, but I'm not sure why.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
reviews.text: Really fun game.  I love how you move the console around, makes things kinda realistic.

reviews.title: Great fun!  I've bought a few games recently and this is my favorite!
reviews.text:
I'm still in easy mode, and don't know all the features yet, but it's very fun to play. I'm starting on easy mode and trying to get an "A" on all songs before moving to the harder levels. I love the fact that besides getting the rhythms right that you're also defeating monsters, and you can switch out characters who have different strengths and weaknesses and build up their abilities.

ETA: I forgot to mention, I have never owned or played a Final Fantasy game, but I love this nonetheless!

reviews.title: Simple to use, neat little gadget.
reviews.text: Wasn't sure exactly what this was supposed to do, but I bought it for the Amiibo cards I ordered which go along with Animal Crossing Happy Home Designer.  Simple to use.

reviews.title: Cute.
reviews.text: Cute little cards to add characters with new building requirements to the Happy Home Builder game.  I've only used a few, the rest of the packs I'm saving for my daughter for Christmas.

reviews.title: Bummer, had higher hopes.
reviews.text:
I have to admit, this game was somewhat of a let down. I haven't played a Mario game in awhile but I expected more from this one. Watching a few youtube videos prior to purchasing, made me think it was a lot more fun than it actually is. The graphics are really cool though. I agree with another reviewer though...it feels like you're playing mini games. C'mon, the Olympics are the big games!

Disclaimer, I am a 46 year old adult so this is JMO. I do have another "gamer", my daughter who is 11, but she has not yet played this. I know she'll love the equestrian portion, but not so sure about the rest.

reviews.title: Disappointed.  Daughter likes, but doesn't love!
reviews.text: I've tried it out, and I'm not impressed.  It's boring to be practically forced to do everything everyone tells you to as you play.  Run errands for people and get gifts.  Save up for special collars and outfits.  My daughter liked it however, but certainly did not play it for long, and she played it only once.

reviews.title: Cute, but perhaps for a younger crowd.
reviews.text: A little creepy, but fun.  The main character and the world he inhabits is made of construction paper.  It's a cute little game, I'm only at the beginning, where I've been doing things like jumping on trampolines to reach higher places, and playing basketball.  I guess every little scrap of paper that swirls into the air should be collected by this little guy.

reviews.title: Durable long cable
reviews.text: Pretty stiff but works fine. Nice to have a longer cord for my 3ds xl.

reviews.title: Crystal clear and inexpensive!
reviews.text: Easy to apply, and the fit is perfect.

reviews.title: Sheesh, it needs a better saving option!
reviews.text: I don't like that you have to get to a certain point before you're able to save.  I've started the game 3 times so far, and never had the time to continue to that point where saving is an option.  I'm sure it'll be much more fun when I can take the time to make some progress!

reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
reviews.text: I've lost the styluses and both of my XLs more than once.  This product solves that problem (unless I misplace the ziplock baggie they came in lol).  I like having the bright colors...not so easy to lose!  Fits perfectly in my 3DS XL and NEW 3ds XL.

reviews.title: I'm an idiot and didn't realize you couldn't play it ...
reviews.text:
I'm an idiot and didn't realize you couldn't play it on a MAC. I buy from Amazon practically weekly, is there any way I can get my money back??? I did not realize this until I downloaded Steam thinking that's what I needed to do to have it work.

Yes, I am a woman. I can handle my 3DS XL very well, but nothing else apparently. :(

reviews.title: Decent price, quality cables
reviews.text:
For some reason I always end up losing my 3ds charging cord.

I bought this 2 pack to ensure I always can find the cord, and having it in a royal blue color makes it more visible to find and distinguish easily amongst my other cables.

Seems very durable

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: This is a sturdy, attractive, and affordable case for my PS Vita and games.  The games fit snugly in their pockets, so no worries about them falling out.  You can also use the zipper compartment for games as well.  Overall, very pleased with the functionality and protection.

reviews.title: Get the best from the best, the A to Z team!
reviews.text: Lightning fast shipping, item exactly as described, delivered factory sealed in flawless condition, I enjoy 1st Person games and the Resident Evil series, this game is good!

reviews.title: A Must Own
reviews.text: This is by far the best game I've played this year (top 3 of this generation)! I preordered it from Amazon and it was delivered early in the AM on launch day! Lightning fast shipping, product showed in flawless condition, the game is phenomenal, a must play! Get the best from the best, from the A to Z Team!

reviews.title: Sony did it right with these!
reviews.text: I have always used Turtle Beach gaming headsets which are good but always fall apart and break. I was a little skeptical about purchasing outside my normal and couldn't be happier with these headsets. The microphone works great in my online parties playing games with friends, they hear me loud and clear. You simply turn on the headset and sound is transferred to the headphones and when you turn them off the sound goes back to your normal speakers your using hooked up to your tv or console which in my case a sound bar. Games sound really good in these. I'm impressed and I highly recommend them to all PS4 gamers online or offline.

reviews.title: Get the best from the best!
reviews.text: Great price, free fast shipping, controller arrived in perfect condition, works great. Highly recommended!

reviews.title: This is the Sony Playstation brand stand w/ Amazon Sticker on it!
reviews.text: I highly recommend this stand. It is manufactured by Sony which mean its exaxtly the same as PlayStation's 4 stand. Different box exact same product. Why not get the best from the best at DEALS! Thank you Amazon for my PS4 stand!

reviews.title: Amazing Spiderman In an AMAZING Game! Be Greater!
reviews.text: Sony, Marvel &  Insomniac Games knocked it out the park with this game! Gameplay is amazing whether your zipping around NYC at night or running around Central Park completing side missions! The gameplay is smooth and the graphics are gorgeous even on the original PS4 launch Counsel. The storyline is on point! Gameplay is fun whether ur crawling in airvents, stopping high speed chases in Times Square or landing combos on thugs & lets not forget the "BOSS FIGHTS" are bad @ss! The game is amazing just as you'd expect from a Sony Playstation Exclusive Title! The side missions are fun and challenging! After you play for a while and get used to the game and a feel for the controls & environment playing Spider-Man becomes addictive! Thank you Insomniac for an amazing game that lets you Be Greater for a change! Cant wait for the DLC & sequel?? 10 outta 10, 5🌟, 100%! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: This is a copy & paste gameplay!
reviews.text: The pre-release trailers convinced me to preorder the game months later it launches & I played the game & I was actually disappointed! For me the game has really generic game mechanics that feels like it was copy & paste gameplay all threw the campaign! Also the game feels as if the developers were lazy! I cant recommend this game because its boring &  its the same old same old copy & paste gameplay all threw the jungle! There are so many better titles out there!

reviews.title: Save Your Cash!
reviews.text: The rubber started falling off on day 1. I tried numerous times contacting Kontrol Freeks regarding this issue and was sent on a 2  week goose chase chasing my tail! There is nothing wrong with Sony Playstation 4 DualShock 4 Wireless Controllers or XBOX One Controllers! They do not help or improve anything these are a GIMMICK!

reviews.title: Treyarch Made Call of Duty Great Again!
reviews.text: Im really enjoying this game! I dont care it doesn't have a campaign this time because the Zombies, Multiplayer & Blackout make up for it! MP & Zombies graphics are highly polished & the games sounds so freaking good on my bar & surround sound! I was so impressed on day one I purchased the Black Ops Pass which means I'll be playing this all year long! I better get some good Kontrol Freak Thumbsticks so I dont kill my thumbs! Thanks Treyarch for Making Call of Duty Great Again! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: A Top Shelve Production!
reviews.text: I'm 20% into the campaign and I'm in shock and awe! The graphics are phenomenal! RockStar created a masterpiece! The characters couldn't be any better, there personalties are on point making me laugh all the time! The world they created is so fun to explore & hunt! The humor is perfect! A game like this doesn't come around often! Hands down its a must play! Highly, highly, highly recommended like a Rock Star!!

reviews.title: It's 100% authentic!
reviews.text: This Sony PS4 earbud microphone is the exact same one as the included inside a PlayStation 4! If you lost or broke yours this is an exact replacement! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: A masterpiece!
reviews.text: I enjoyed this game from beginning to end! The graphics are phenomenal! The storyline was awesome! So many different outcomes depending on your choices, so the replay value is high because every game play outcome is different! A must play for all PlayStation 4 owners!

reviews.title: A hidden gem! What a masterpiece!
reviews.text: If your a hardcore video gamer who enjoys an amazing campaign then this game is for you! I have never heard of this games developer/ studio before so I purchased this game with no expectations at all. However after delivery & loading it up to play on my PS4 I was in for a suprise! Once I started playing it I couldn't stop! The story, gameplay and mechanics are genius! I won't give you any spoilers about the storyline although I will tell you this game was exactly what I have been needing, a GOOD game to play from beginning to the very end! I hope there will be a sequel if not I will be keeping an eye out for this studios next game! This game is a masterpiece! I highly recommend it!

reviews.title: Modern Warfare = Realism
reviews.text: I’m really enjoying the multiplayer! I’m loving the realism! The graphics & gameplay are amazing! It’s one of COD’s best! I finished the campaign on hardened & unlike other COD’s it was actually a challenge & tough to beat! This year you don’t have to buy a season pass which is the 1st time since MW2! I haven’t tried the Special Ops yet. GOING DARK..

reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
reviews.text: I’m a driver who is a gamer who has allot of timed stops and an hour long lunch. My PS4 DualShock 4 Controller connects to my iPad Pro which means I get to use my PS4 Controller to play all the games on Apple Arcade! I couldn’t be happier with this purchase!

reviews.title: Wow, way to go Capcom! Thank you Capcom for developing another perfect RE Remake!
reviews.text: This couldn’t have came out at a better time! I’m home sick and have been on quarantine from being diagnosed with everything under the ☀️ besides COVID-19 (Yes I was tested). I have been to sick to play this when my Amazon 📦 arrived but now that I’m starting to feel a little better so I loaded it up on my PS4 and all I can say is WOW! The graphics, gameplay, in game sounds are on point & the controls are perfect! I’m playing this on a Samsung 4K Q Series TV and with Capcom’s developers putting there heart and soul into this remake + Playstation’s & Samsung’s HDR & frame rate refresh this game is mind boggling! I have to give this game a 9.9 out 10! Thank you Amazon for delivery 🚚 📦 to me while being on quarantine! Highly, highly recommended 💯

reviews.title: Purchased this for my old XBOX One Controllers.
reviews.text: Knowing that we are at the end of current generation video game consoles I decided to purchase non brand name with no expectations because I have always purchased Microsoft XBOX accessories for XBOX consoles but seems the XBOX Series X & S are dropping this November I decided to purchase generic brand rechargeable battery packs because I will not be playing the XBOX One much longer and figured why not save some money and use the money I saved to go towards the next Gen Consoles! They actually work so if ur on a budget or on the end of or your Consoles life might as well save some cash!

reviews.title: Sony’s best controllers yet!
reviews.text: Wow, these controllers are next Gen and Sony thought of everything! The haptic feedback is amazing, the grip is perfect, they don’t hurt your hands like the dual sense’s did, they look sharp and perform like a dream! Sony set the bar high for what next Gen gaming is and should be! The PS5 and me will be best of friends over the next 6-7 years!

reviews.title: What a fun 🤩 game with amazing graphics and sound!
reviews.text: Sony won the next Gen console war easily! This game was brilliant and fun! Glad I purchased it and played it! Me and my GF had good times playing this together!

reviews.title: I’m really enjoying this game(s)!
reviews.text: Super Mario 3D World is fun to play! The graphics and sound are amazingly perfect! Bowser’s Fury is great as well! I just don’t throw out 5 starts but Nintendo sticking to its original formula with some fun new twists make it feel the game we’ve always loved to play but with new fresh ideas making it seem new and fresh! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: What a Little Masterpiece!
reviews.text: Wow what a fun game to play! Great puzzles, sound, game mechanics & graphics are perfect! I can’t stop playing! Definitely worth buying! Highly highly recommended!

reviews.title: These joy-con colors made my switch unique!
reviews.text: These Joy-Con’s made my SWITCH colors POP 💥! I would purchase it again in a heart beat.

reviews.title: Does what it’s supposed to do!
reviews.text: Totally worth the money! If you switch Joy-Con’s you don’t have to worry about it draining your consoles battery because they are all juiced 🔋 ⚡️ up and ready to go!

reviews.title: One of Nintendo Switch’s best games!
reviews.text: Yeah I’m a grown kid that enjoys playing video games! And yes... This game is the reason I purchased a Switch and trust me I didn’t get let down! There is other good titles as well but come on, Zelda is Zelda! One of Nintendo’s best games!

reviews.title: Wow just wow! The PS5’s power makes this game perform perfectly!
reviews.text: What an amazing game! I didn’t not play this on the PS4 but I am beyond impressed playing it in the PS5! I’m running it in performance mode 60fps and it’s beautiful just gorgeous! I love me a good single player game that has a storyline that grabs you from the moment you start playing! This game just keeps getting better and better. It also comes with all the dlc included! I’m glad I purchased this because it’s been a minute since I have played a single player game that I have enjoyed. Seriously there is no load time and the 4K graphics are on point!

reviews.title: GOTY! The PS5 Power does this game justice! Don’t wait!
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:dc1ef54891939644469ba57492d7bcbb]] I can’t believe how smooth this game plays & how the graphics & 3D Audio are on point & phenomenal. The gameplay mechanics are solid! The guns and melee weapons are fun to use! Everything is upgradable in an alien way that works with human technology. Every cycle (death) the game just keeps getting better and better. When fighting a boss the projectiles are so visually impressive. So glad I purchased the PS5 reasoning - games like this. The people who built this game my hats off to yah! Thanks for producing a top shelve PlayStation Exclusive for gamers to play! The Developers did this game right! Thanks for making a true next gen game for me to finally experience! No need to wait for sell price this game is worth every cent! 🤩 FYI - This game is for hardcore gamers!

reviews.title: Ethan Winters journey is RE style abuse that is CRAZY 😜 sick & fun from beginning to the…
reviews.text: I’m about 1/2 way threw the campaign and I feel bad for Ethan Winters, poor guy has bad luck 🍀! Everything that can go wrong does go wrong x10! I’m enjoying the storyline, graphics, sound, Ray Tracing & the smooth 60FPS on the PS5! I haven’t played the bonus gameplay yet just the main storyline campaign. I always enjoy me a new RE game to play and this game meet all my expectations as to what I expect from a RE game! I won’t spoil any storyline of the game other than Ethan had horrible luck, anything bad that can happen does! Capcom nailed it again. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Stick with Sony’s PlayStation 5 Dual Sense Wireless Controller Charger!
reviews.text: I’d have it no other way! They charge perfectly and stop when they get fully charged + you always have one on deck ready! Sony made these specifically for the PS5 controllers so don’t get off name and burn out ur PS5 Dual Sense Controllers! Highly recommended!

reviews.title: Insomniac killed it with this game show casing what a next true Gen game is!
reviews.text: Wow just wow! Ratchet & Clank Rift Apart truly shows off what the PS5 is capable of!  True next gen graphics, 3D Audio, adaptive triggers, ray-lighting & true 4K UHD Graphics that are mind blowing  🤯 impressive! I can’t believe the graphics when hooked up to a 120hz HDMI 2.1 4K UHD TV! Sony & Insomniac killed it! I will not spoil the storyline but will tell you this, if your holding back because you think your to grown for this game your truly mistaking and missing out! If you own a PS5 this is a 100 definitely MUST PLAY!

reviews.title: This game is 🔥 🔥
reviews.text: I’m not gonna lie, for $30 my expectations were low but after getting my Amazon package 📦 delivered and got this game loaded up I was shocked. The gameplay mechanics are fun as hell (get it). Great weapons that are upgradable. Great story. Graphics are on point. The only thing I don’t like about this is it’s very addicting and hard to put the controller down. I will be checking out every SuperGiant games titles in the future.

reviews.title: Was a gift :) he loved it
reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend who lives states away. It arrived in good condition and he loved it  thanks amazon for helping me get a birthday gift states away in a perfect timely manner and with great care.

reviews.title: Repair kit.. yep it is.
reviews.text: A basic repair kit for xbox one controller. I needed this to fix my boyfriends controller and this kit had everything I needed. Something to pop the shell off, and a new thumb stick. It's good for the money and it worked perfectly.  We have a fixed controller now that works so good.

reviews.title: Works
reviews.text: Perfect for gaming

reviews.title: Worth the price
reviews.text: It's a bunch of thumb grips. That's all. Yes they worked, feels fine on the controller.  Didnt really like the white as much as I thought, but the different colors is just a bonus. We will use them all I'm sure. For the price, definalty worth it.

reviews.title: Worth it for the charging dock, alone!
reviews.text:
Searched for a cooling fan for the PS4 and found this with charging dock... that alone has been worth the price. Keeps the controllers stored neatly while charging and don't have to deal with the wires 🙋‍♀️😎

The fan works great at keeping the PS4 from overheating but I wouldn't exactly say it's quiet...not real loud either but noticeable (mostly at first then you're used to hearing it regularly). A bit like having a box fan set to low. Not a problem for us but just fyi to those expecting it to be super quiet. Also, it cycles, so it is not always running the fan.

The extra usb ports are also a nice bonus!

reviews.title: Gives a bit of advantage, like using them
reviews.text:
These actually work good on my PS4 controllers. It took a little getting used to but once I got the hang of it, I felt like it did give a bit of advantage in 1st and 3rd-person shooter.

They're very easy to put on the controller. Honestly, don't have any complaints. My only "advice" is to plan on giving it a little time to get adjusted to.

reviews.title: Good holder, I like that the middle part turns into another holder
reviews.text: It's a pretty good controller holder (for anyone wondering, it does not include actual controls). I like that the middle part slides out (if you hold down the back button and slide it) to provide yet another way of extending and holding the controls (as shown in the pictures I posted)...the only part about this feature that bugs me is that the middle part wobbles a little when it's all connected to the main controller holder. It doesn't affect my game play, though, just took a bit to get used to. Both sets of the lights work good. The plastic doesn't feel as heavy-duty as another similar holder that I have but there's nothing that stands out, or that has happened, to make me think it's low quality. I think for the current listed price at $10 it's a good, fair price.

reviews.title: Nice!
reviews.text:
In addition to the controllers that come with the Switch, we have a wireless controller- similar to size and shape of this one- but it's battery operated and eats through batteries like no other…so basically that one is worthless.

This controller is awesome! Not just because it's wireless and rechargeable but also because of the light-up effects and it also works great.

Setup is pretty simple and the instructions are pretty easy to follow.

It's very sturdy and a little heavier than the other Switch controllers we have… I'd say about like PS4 controllers (both in weight and size). It hasn't bothered us for gameplay, or anything, but just something to keep in mind if you aren't wanting something like that.

reviews.title: Help, I'm addicted! Only one drawback for me otherwise I love it 🙌🏼
reviews.text:
First thing to know and keep in mind is that I'm a newbie to Animal Crossing- about a month into the world of it (so I'm not able to compare to old school versions) and I started out playing Pocket Camp. While I love Pocket Camp and don't want to have to stop playing that version, I just can't do the cost part of it. I was tempted to but thought I'd just put money into buying New Horizons, instead (I'd probably have spent more on Pocket Camp!). We already have a Switch to play on. I'm so glad I got it! It's just as addicting. Purchasing the online code and downloading it to our Switch was a breeze and pretty fast to do.

I’ll try to group different points/subjects, regarding the game, in paragraphs below since it might be long and to hopefully help read or skim through. Even with a lengthy review, there’s a lot more to it...especially since I’m still fairly new to it myself!

***MULTIPLAYERS*** This may be a long-winded paragraph but I feel like this is one of the most important things to know about this game. Normally, I’m that person that does a ton of research before buying pricey items but I guess since I had been so into Pocket Camp and was excited about getting New Horizons, I didn’t spend as much time researching it. I still would have purchased the game but the main issue I have with it--and my reason for giving only 4-stars-- is because you can have only ONE island PER CONSOLE.
