reviews.title: Fun and catchy but not the best of DDR
reviews.text:
The good:
Fun, catchy songs that I immediately enjoyed playing.
Easy unlock process - you just play in free play mode to unlock songs

The bad:
Game level is a bit easier than other DDR games - I usually play standard to heavy in DDR, and with this game, I have passed every song on heavy/ expert on my first try. They were complicated enough to hold my interest, but I don't feel at all challenged here.
Only about half as many songs as a normal DDR game, graphics are clunky
The dancers, as always in DDR (I just turn them off)

For the price I found it a worthy buy - as a regular player I get bored of the same songs all the time, and so any new game that helps me mix up my workout is much appreciated. But it certainly isn't up to par with the other DDR games, much as I am enjoying playing it.

However, I could see new DDR players really enjoying this, because the music is catchy and accessible and the steps aren't too hard.

If you are a regular player, know that this is a fun diversion that you will enjoy for a good while, but isn't going to become your challenging new favorite.

reviews.title: Awesome - can unlock songs while just playing normally, good song variety
reviews.text:
I'm thrilled with this latest DDR game. I own all the PS2 Dance Dance Revolution games and I love to work out a few times a week with DDR. The last few games before this one required you to go through some kind of stupid dance master mode or something to unlock songs- so I was thrilled to find that you can unlock songs, dancers, etc just by playing normally in game mode.

Two annoying things in this one:

You can't shut off the dancers

The announcer is dire - really, really bad. Luckily you can shut him up in options.

I do love that there is at least one good rap song in here, and quite a few oldies like Dub-i-Dub and Butterfly (a new remix). There's also just generally a good variety of songs. There's an interesting clubhouse reggae song that I was particularly happy to see.

I have played four nights now with a person with very different musical taste than I have, and we both enjoyed it a lot and found songs we wanted to replay each night.

I'm giving it five stars because of the simplified unlock process and the fun variety of songs. Yay for X!

reviews.title: Awesome soundtrack, great gameplay with balance board
reviews.text: [[VIDEOID:46fef64578a45aef7c837552a437df4e]] This game is a blast to play on the balance board - you turn the board sideways so it resembles a small snowboard and it's easy to imagine you are shredding down the slopes, doing tricks and having a blast. I love the soundtrack and often when I don't even feel like playing, I'll play just so I can listen to the tunes. Any exercise from this game is moderate - it seems good for the legs, but doesn't tire me out (but then I am a landscaper so I'm already reasonably fit). Recommended.

reviews.title: So much fun! However, not a ton of crossover appeal to adults
reviews.text:
I'm a big fan of the Just Dance line of games, because I love getting exercise while playing. So I was excited to test out this version for kids, especially since I have a little one who will hopefully be able to play with me in a few years, and a niece who is just the right age right now.

What I loved about this is that unlike in other games in this line, the dancers on the screen are actual kids! Usually, we get some weird cartoon character with improbable fashion choices, and when I see them moving on the screen I think to myself, "of course you can do that move, you're not a person." In this game, you get to watch actual kids of different ages doing the dances, sometimes they are dressed up in silly costumes, and sometimes dressed to fit in with the theme of the video. Watching real people do the dance moves increased my enjoyment of the games dramatically, and I wish they had that option for all of the grown-up games.

The song list is fantastic for kids, and my niece was familiar with most of the songs. There were also a lot of old-fashioned favorites that I was familiar with, so we had fun together. However, most of the songs have that overly cheerful tone of most children's media, and after about a half hour, I realized that I would never voluntarily choose to play these songs over any of the songs in the grown-up games. Of course, I'm an adult, so that's to be expected, but you should be aware if you are an adult wanting to play this game, you will probably not find the song choices ones that have a lot of intergenerational appeal after the first few plays.

That said, they are great picks for kids, and the gameplay itself is a lot of fun. I'd say if your kids are young enough that you do not want them exposed to songs such as "promiscuous girl" which is an example from another Just Dance game, I would definitely choose this game. If you are comfortable with the content of the other games, I would definitely choose those, because the songs are more complex and interesting.

reviews.title: A quality mouse for smaller hands
reviews.text:
I received a sample for review but opinions are my own.

Several years ago, I got a RAT7 gaming mouse. I referred to it as my tactical combat mouse. I loved that mouse, but it died on me after a few months of use. It could be taken apart and adjusted to all sorts of configurations, but one I found the one I liked, I never adjusted it again.

This YCCTEAM mouse looks nearly identical, but is one fifth the price. As much work as they put into making it look identical, the hardware is not adjustable, though it does come with a full set of spare feet. The only thing I would change though is the length. It feels a bit short in large hands. It has a pleasant weight to it and feels durable. There are buttons all over it, but I don't tend to hit them by accident and the defaults are all decent.

Overall, I feel like this is a really good mouse for the price.

reviews.title: A worthy mouse with good build quality
reviews.text:
The Rat 6 mouse seems to be going for the customization market, but where it really excels is in simple build quality. The weight, smooth precision parts, and mechanical functioning of this mouse make it fell less like a peripheral and more like a piece of tactical combat gear. The buttons are well placed, it slides smoothly without catching, and the sensor does its job very well.

Perhaps my favorite feature on the Rat 7 is the small rocker switch behind the scroll wheel which can be used to raise and lower the mouse sensitivity (pointer speed) on the fly, which nearly makes the precision aim button obsolete. These aren't uncommon features on a gaming mouse these days, but they're implemented well.

I'm used to using an ambidextrous mouse and switching hands often. This mouse can be used left handed without much difficulty, but you lose access to some of the buttons and features when doing so, most notably the horizontal scroll.

I previously owned a RAT 7 and really loved it, but after a couple years it failed on me. First thing to go was the braided cable, which started to short out when parts of it were moved. I hate braided cable. Eventually, I dropped it and was surprised to find one of the buttons had broken from a short fall. In the end, if you use your mouse frequently, it's worth getting a nice one, but the really high priced ones probably aren't worth the premium.

Overall, more than worth the price difference between it and the lesser mice on the market.

reviews.title: Fun for the family
reviews.text:
My two and four year olds LOVE to play - I am the only one with a controller, but they play along and dance to all the moves. I just make sure my song selections are things I approve of for them, but they've edited anything really offensive out of the songs and the kids haven't picked up on anything inappropriate even in the normal, non kids mode game.

Our family favorite is definitely "I'm an Albatraoz", which has moves where you start out on your back doing bicycles. We also love Despacito, Beep Beep I'm a Sheep, Swish Swish, Side to Side, Angry Birds Balkan Blast, I Like To Move It, Nitro Bot, and Istanbul.

I own all of the Just Dance games and it is great to have something we can all enjoy together and also stay fit in winter when it is yucky outside!

reviews.title: Connects great and fits my hands perfectly
reviews.text: We have been playing a lot of side scrolling 2D Mario on our switch, and I've been really wishing for a better controller than the awful little ends of the switch controller that I end up getting when all four of us are playing together. This is been perfect! It connects easily with no problems, it's very comfortable in my hands, and the buttons work exactly as expected with no lag. I also like the styling of it that you can see inside all of the little diodes and connectors that make it function. It looks really cool, it feels comfortable to hold, and it works.

reviews.title: Pairs easily and works smoothly
reviews.text:
On a product like this, the less I have to think about it, the better I like it, and in that, this joystick is ideal. It just WORKS. I never have issues pairing it, I have not experienced any lag, it is just great!

Buttons smoothly press and joystick parts are great.

It is a slightly bigger one than a similar model I have from another brand. Better for size Med hands or above (in terms of glove hand sizing).

I like the see thru styling and how cool it looks!

reviews.title: Super fun for the family
reviews.text:
My kids and I absolutely adore playing just dance together! Maybe it's that I played previous versions of just dance while I was pregnant with each of them, and we kept it up as a family event together. This new addition to the lineup is great! A nice variety of classic style songs, as well as some new pop songs from artists that I have read about but not actually listen to. My kids were a big fan of the frozen song.

The menus aren't too cumbersome and we really like doing free play, where we select a song, then argue over what the next song will be, etc. It's a lot of fun, great way of staying fit and getting a little sweat on, and it's a fun bonding experience for myself and my kids. My kids are four and six, so there are a few songs I skip due to content, but overall it's pretty family-friendly.

reviews.title: Exactly as expected!
reviews.text:
If you have a new switch and have invested in some of the sports, dancing or driving games, this is a really fun set for extending the fun. We just got Mario tennis aces and look forward to figuring out how to use the hand controls so that we can actually play tennis, we have Mario kart and the steering wheels have added a different level of fun for the kids, the regular controller grips are great, and my particular favorite are the dance holders which have elastic that go around your wrist so you don't have to hang onto a sweaty controller while dancing.

The fact that you get for of each and everything fits perfectly is perfect. There really isn't anything they could be doing better with this set.

reviews.title: The light never shuts off! Lights up the house.
reviews.text:
This charger works fine, and it's nice that it can handle four controllers. It even changes colors to show when the controllers are charged. It's also the worst thing about it. They never turn off. It goes from red to green, and then just stays that way.

Glowing.

Not like that little LED on the switch glowing, more like the whole switch with a bright green screen. I can see to walk in the dark anywhere in my house when this is glowing in the living room. Like I'm wearing those green night vision goggles.

reviews.title: Lightweight and accurate
reviews.text:
I have another mouse that I really like for daily use, but every so often my hand gets tired and it all starts feeling a little heavy and "too much". I picked up this lightweight, simple ergonomic mouse for those times when I just need a bit of a change from my usual heavy and super accurate mouse.

I was gratified to find this mouse is not only extremely lightweight and comfortable to use, but also very accurate. Some other mouse's I've tried have kind of skipped in their connection a little bit or not noticed really fine tuned movements, but this mouse did a great job while I was working on a CAD drawing on my desktop.

I also was happy with the long battery life, I find I can just plug it in overnight to charge every few days and it does great holding that charge through my work week.

While it does definitely give a nod to ergonomics, the shape is not aggressively ergonomic, which I am grateful for. Sometimes the wild ergonomic shapes can have their own issues and irritate other parts of the arm or wrist, and this one is just a gentle, pleasant shape that is easy to get used to.

reviews.title: Thoughtful design features
reviews.text:
This feels like progress, and by that I mean two steps forward and one step back. The mouse itself is very light weight and looks and feels like it was built from a large eggshell. It has room for either a AA or AAA battery, which is something I hadn't seen before. Choosing your battery size and chemistry should be a simple hack for adjusting the weight, since the mouse itself weighs nearly nothing.

I'm assuming this rough texture and white color combination are going to lead to some unattractive stains over time, but I've got little proof of such as yet.

The ergonomics are nice, but suited for a smaller hand. I've got much smaller mice that feel more natural in a large hand, but it' not bad if you don't mind a couple fingers dragging on the table. The side buttons are especially well placed. Harder than most to hit accidentally, but still very accessible. Tactile feedback is good. The sensitivity adjustment is easy and has more stops than I'm used to, which is nice.

I love the choice of bluetooth or dongle, which is stored within. There's an easy to use three way switch on the underside.

Overall, it doesn't look or feel like a luxury mouse to me, but it's well designed and put together, which is more than I can say for most.

reviews.title: Amazing narrative, characters, settings, and dialogues...and it's smart!
reviews.text: An exemplary adventure game, this story of Manny Calavera and his quest through a Mexican limbo (in the afterlife sense) for a beautiful woman cheated from the afterlife she deserves takes us through a vivid world of politics, corruption, and heroism. This is no shallow game, but that doesn't mean it doesn't offer the thrills and fun of one. The script, music, and performances are of the highest quality, and the effect is both fun and moving. Play this!!

reviews.title: Horribly repetitive, plotless, and devoid of any real characters or goal
reviews.text: This game is amusing for perhaps the first ten minutes. Then you realize the ENTIRE thing is finding very well hidden objects in attractively rendered, though lifeless, backgrounds. You do that several times in a row and occasionally do one other type of puzzle (the only other type). The second kind is roughly like a jigsaw, but less fun and with clumsy handling. As you complete more puzzles, you get more...hints? I'm not sure what it is. It's mostly meaningless and short scripts, some factual (buut not very interesting) and some about "characters"...though there is no development to these personages...or a story, really. It's all pointless, and neither challenging nor easy. It is simply repetitive. If you want brainy games, something with a story, something with characters or any interest at all, try something else. It's not worth the money or time. Avoid similar games by this company.

reviews.title: charming, simple, and fun
reviews.text:
While the special features found only in a Wii are not used much for this game (movement-based action, use of personalized charactersany Wii user knows as Miis), it is still very cute and entertaining for kids or adults. Like other sim-type games, you are able to customize environments and clothing of some characters and have the freedom to explore and interact, but the similarities mostly end there. You do not control all of the characters/are not able to switch control from one character to another, and there is some linear flow to the action. You are given a series of missions on each of a few locales; as you progress, you are allowed to explore new locales, as well as accumulate options from all current and previous locations.

The basic idea is to rebuild and fix different places and help the residents in each one. Sometimes that means finding objects, other times, talking with people to resolve conflicts. To build structures or machines, etc., you need to have certain points which can be found by toying with trees, plants, and other objects. You also need raw materials that are sometimes hidden, or other times uncovered by mining (you have to find hot spots and then use the controller like a little pick axe) or digging, as though for buried treasure.

Sometimes it is a little repetitive, but that is the nature of the genre, and all in all, the loose structure and dialogue keep things moving. It would probably be more entertaining if the characters spoke a real language, but apparently the makers wanted to save on having to do multiple voice-overs and translations, so that's a bit of a loss there, especially for some younger kids, but having dialogue is still appreciated. Also, having to figure out mechanical puzzles might be trickier for the younger crowd, it's fun having to use a little spatial reality logic to make things work, though it's not Very challenging.

Wii is definitely improving its offerings, and while this isn't the best game I've seen on the system, the charmingly rendered environment and cute characters and story make this a fun little adventure.

reviews.title: adorable, and includes lots of fun stuff
reviews.text:
It feels like dressing your DSi in a trendy little outfit! You have stickers to cover the inside components, and the hard case for the outside (which also offers protection, obviously, and that's a nice added bonus). It also has a stylus that is painfully cute, if a little big, and a soft carry case that is barely big enough to hold the game cartridge holder (holds 6 games), stylus, and device; the soft case also holds an additional 3 games, plus the velcro thing to hold earphones. It's a tight fit, though!
Obviously, it doesn't work for the older generation DS--the case is a tiny bit too small, and only half the stickers work,

Great little item at a good value!

reviews.title: Excellent sound, comfortable
reviews.text: The microphone works fine and is clear, the headset is comfortable, whether for short-term use or for a few hours, but the part that impressed me most was the sound quality of the headset. The well-insulated headphones block out exterior sound very nicely, and the actual quality of the sound makes these great not only for gaming, but also for listening to music and other media. For music in particular, the sound is clear, with excellent bass and treble coming across without distortion. You can even hear fine detail like the breath of the singer in certain types of music or the movement of fabric as someone plays their instrument. I LOVE these headsets. Excellent product at a reasonable price.

reviews.title: Silly fun for the whole family
reviews.text:
While there are some technical aspects of the game that bothered us a lot, the overall feel of it was really entertaining and left us laughing and feeling silly (in a good way).

Here are the downsides:
-only one controller evaluates your movement, so technically, only your left or right hand have anything to do with the score, and your legs, torso, and other arm are technically irrelevant
-the stick figures that show the choreo are sort of different than what the person in front is doing, so it's a little confusing
-the rules and scoring are a little vague and hard to figure out

Having said that, you have so much fun looking ridiculous, the rest doesn't even matter. The "music videos" range from cute to incredibly goofy, and as an adult, I was laughing out loud for the disco one with the guy in a unitard and...well...what else can I call it but a porn mustache? There was also one with lasers shooting out of the girls' hands. Pretty awesome stuff, all in all. Lots of laughs guaranteed with this game!

reviews.title: Quality and versatility
reviews.text:
Great sound and versatility! You can use these noise-reducing headphones not only for gaming, but for phone calls at home (not driving--that wouldn't be safe), or listening to music. Adding the wireless feature, you can use it for the computer and watch movies or listen to music without having to be connected to your desk.
The sound isn't the very best, but for the price, it truly is excellent. The volume can go high without distorting, the bass is very strong, and while the treble is a tiny bit tinny, the overall sound quality has detail and strength.
I love these headphones!

reviews.title: Super Cool!
reviews.text:
This little dude is super cute!
This is small enough to fit on a shelf, windowsill, or desk, and it also works as a night light for your desk. The light is super bright, the design is whimsically retro—fun throwback!

reviews.title: Not the worst
reviews.text: Seems reasonably sturdy, but you can't expect it to protect your thumb sticks if you sit anything on top of it. My faith in it is harmed a bit by the pitiful carabiner included. It would definitely be a bad idea to use that to attach the case to something for the sake of carrying the case. It might be safe to attach something very small to the case for decorative proposes, but if you value whatever the item is don't attach it to the carabiner. Has slots to hold 10 cartridges and a pocket that word be good for manuals. Don't expect it to hold much more. The picture shows it holding the charger, seems to me that putting anything like that is just begging to have broken thumb sticks. The handle feels very sturdy and well attached.

reviews.title: Fun to use
reviews.text: This is a smaller controller and feels great in your hand. I have small hands and sometimes its awkward to use other controllers and hit all the buttons, but this makes it easy to use all the functions. It works fine and is very responsive playing via bluetooth on multiplayer. Pairing it with a switchlite, it doesn't do so well. It disconnects when it goes to sleep, needs to be re-paired and loses all settings.

reviews.title: Sketchy motion controls
reviews.text: I haven't needed to pay very close attention to the battery on these so the battery life must be pretty good. I used them to play Mario Party and even when the controller is held virtually perfectly still it detects motion and makes parts of certain games impossible to play. When I first tried the controls using the directions buttons I thought they wouldn't work as well as those on the O. E. M. controllers, however I was wrong again, the shape of the direction buttons is perfect. It is a bit frustrating that they won't fit in a standard joycon grip, but I assume there are non standard they will fit.

reviews.title: Sturdy
reviews.text: I wouldn't call it a heavy duty case but it does what it's supposed to do. Holds a good number of cartridges be careful not to overfill the pocket as they could compromise your joycons.

reviews.title: Fun game
reviews.text: There are a lot of ads if you don't get the subscription, which is about $25 a year. It does give you an awful lot of songs though. The regular game has a few songs and you can unlock harder levels of the same songs. The game is easy to play and a great way to get active if you can't get out.

reviews.title: Design has more depth, and case holds the essentials
reviews.text:
The case looks even cooler in person. You really cant see the full depth of the design just from the pictures. I have not seen too many travel cases with designs but we are a fan of zelda over here so I decided to get this one. The case is also waterproof which is a great feature, and stores the essentials.
Overall happy with the product.

reviews.title: Comfortable to hold and works well!
reviews.text: My fiance, daughter and I all like to all play the switch together. We only had one regular controller along with the 2 joy cons; so my daughter and I got stuck with one of those each. I got this controller to use instead of the little joy cons and I'm very happy with it so far. It's comfortable to hold (even for my daughter) the buttons work great (with no issues so far), and it looks pretty cool too! Having a wire controller has its pros and cons but the other 2 controllers we have are wireless so it's not a huge deal to have one wired. It's easy to hook up, but kind of wish the cord was black to match the switcb. The console does not recognize the controller if it's already plugged in; so you have to plug it after you turn the console on. But overall happy with this product!

reviews.title: Compatible with fast charging adapters
reviews.text: So far I don't have anything to complain about with these chargers. They are very long, so its easy to play a game on your controller or hang out on your phone while it charges. They are compatible with fast charging adapters, and could be used with phones or controllers, or probably any type C device. I will update if I have any issues but so far so good!

reviews.title: Good so far
reviews.text: Good response time, comfortable to hold. Buttons all work well, no sticking.. back has a little bit of grip to it. I haven't tried the audio jack but so far so good

reviews.title: overall good
reviews.text: We needed an additional controller for when friends come over to play games on our Xbox X. This one is wired and has a few additional features, so you don't have to worry about batteries, but you are limited to where you could sit because you are attached to the console. This one is supposedly compatible with Xbox and PC which is cool. Overall good controller. I will update if I have any issues, or anything else to add.

reviews.title: great so far
reviews.text: Cool mash up on the game cube/ switch controller! This controller is comfortable to hold, buttons have a nice feel and have good response, the cord is a good length. All good so far, and no issues!

reviews.title: Awesome backlight options.
reviews.text: My son is so excited about this keyboard and all of the backlight functions that it has. The keys click faster and don’t have to be mashed as hard as a regular keyboard which is important when it comes to a gaming keyboard. We are very pleased with this product.

reviews.title: it works
reviews.text: there isn't too much that can be said about this item. the packaging is good for the item. It is made from a sturdy plastic, that gives your PS4 a little more stability when standing it up on its side. It looks exactly as described, and is a good value. The rubber grips on the bottom are nice to keep it from slipping. Also, its good that it has vents on the bottom of the base, so that it doesn't get too hot. We had no problems setting this up to use with our PS4.

reviews.title: AWESOME!
reviews.text: These headphone are AMAZING according to my 11 year old xboxer! He loves the fit and says that they are very comfortable. Connecting them was easy and the sound quality is great compared to those that are cheaper. It is definitely worth it to go ahead and buy a good pair in the beginning instead of buying multiple cheap ones!

reviews.title: My son loves it
reviews.text: I can't claim to know alot about gaming keyboards. What I know is based off of my 11 year old son. I ordered this for him because he loves playing video games and especially Fortnite (which I hate). He has absolutely loved this keyboard. He loves the back light of the keys and the different options you have to change it. He says that the keys are quick. In my opinion it is very expensive for a keyboard, but he is happy with it. My recommendation is that if you are a huge gamer... you will enjoy this and think it is worth the investment. This isn't the best or more practical keyboard for someone who would just use it for typing.

reviews.title: My son is happy with it
reviews.text: My kid is happy so I am happy. He had no problems getting it set up and ready to play. he likes the lights and how they change. He hasn't had any problems with the remote sticking or doing anything that it shouldn't. We are happy with this!

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.text: I will be the first to admit that I do not know very much about gaming or gaming keyboards. My knowledge extends to my 12 year old son and nephew who use them when they are playing on their x-boxes and play stations. This keyboard worked with both gaming system. They both really liked the back lights and that said that it was easy to click on the keyboard, or that it clicked fast! They were happy with it.

reviews.title: 5 stars
reviews.text: My son loves this mouse pad. He loves "gaming" and this mouse pad was perfect. He really likes the colors around the edges. He had a keyboard and a mouse that have similar effects so this is the perfect complementary item for it.

reviews.title: 5 stars
reviews.text: these headphone's are easy to use and the sound quality is perfect. I was worried about it not working right but the people that I am talking to on the other end are always pleased. They were easy to adjust and to make them adapt to my computer. I would highly recommend.

reviews.title: Works great!
reviews.text:
Purchased to use with Steam on PC. Steam detected it as an xbox 360 controller immediately and windows installed the plug and play controller and detected as a gaming controller.

I did not have a chance to try it out with the xbox 360 itself, but the controller pairs great with the PC and works fantastically in terms of lag and input speed. Feels just like a normal xbox 360 controller!

reviews.title: Perfect for RetroPi Build!
reviews.text:
I've had a retropi for a couple of years, and while it's one of my favorite things I've ever built, the thing that always drove me nuts is that I had to be tethered to the Pi.

Not with these! They are completely plug and play.. place the USB switch in to the raspberry pi and then setup the controller in the RetroPi command center and you are good to go.

Battery life is good and lasts a few days before needing a recharge, I just charge straight off the rasperry pi when I'm not using them and they are always good to go.

reviews.title: Good quality gaming headphones
reviews.text:
If you're like many, it's hard to find a wireless gaming headset that lets you use the mic and quality stereo at the same time in many modern games.

This circumvents that by using a RADIO transmitter instead of Bluetooth to handle this functionality.

The sound quality is not AMAZING but it is good enough for gaming. Response time is perfect and the microphone sounds great.

I think if you're looking for a good overall well rounded headset for hours of gaming, this is the one.

reviews.title: Larger than expected but good quality
reviews.text:
After many years of using a RATPADZ I finally decided to try something new. My old mouse started to curve and attempts to revive it in the oven were unsuccessful.

I thought I would give one of thes fabric mats a try and so far I am impressed. They provide a nice experience on the desk and while this one is HUGE it does allow a lot of freedom and flexibility for mousing for work or play.

The rubber mat on one side helps keep it in place and once it's been positioned it does not move.

reviews.title: Older Model, but great mouse!
reviews.text:
This is what appears to be the 'older model' of the Pwnage Ultra Ergo, as the website lists an ergo 2 - however this is my first experience with this mouse. I have to say that in general I am extremely impressed with this mouse.

I have been using a microsoft curve 'ball' style mouse for many years now as I needed something lower impact, as my tendency would be to pinch the sides of the mouse with my finger during longer typing days for some reason. This would cause fatigue and make it difficult for me to continue using the computer.

Since switching to this mouse, I've found that I no longer need my wrist wrest and that the size of the mouse is just right for my hand size.

The software does not come with the device, and because I thought I was getting the 'newest' model I initially downloaded the wrong software and it would not connect.

The software, once you find the right one.. is pretty great and allows you to customize all of the lights and settings, including changing the DPI identifier LEDs.

I like the additional weight of the mouse with the battery in it, so I've left it inside the mouse even while using the USB-C cable for the wired experience.

The directions for customizing the panels of the mouse were a little ambiguous but was able to figure it out logically. I removed the black panels for the mouse and made it this slick two-tone that looks absolutely wonderful with my backlit keyboard with the same light schema.

All in all this is a HUGE upgrade to my mousing capabilities and the sensitivity is spot on.

reviews.title: The best for both worlds
reviews.text:
I’ve been using Pwnage mice for a few months, and I had not tried the Sym as I am a right handed gamer. However, the Sym is a beautiful mouse, ready for both handed use and for some this means a lack of ergonomic requirement.

I love the Pwnage software, personally. The combination of being able to customize so many features down to the laser sampling rate is wonderful.

Also, being able to run in either wires or wireless mode is a great feature and works seamlessly. I also appreciate that you can remove the battery to make it even lighter.

Fantastic all around mouse!

reviews.title: Works - with a caveat.
reviews.text:
I did not realize that gamecube and SNES had the same video output adapter, but here we are! After hooking this up to my TV I realized why gamecube games should not scaled up to 1080p over HDMI, but cannot complain all together.

It does not upgrade the video quality so much as provide a simple connection. What this does give you is an easy way to integrate older devices into modern equipment like a full HDMI receiver or HDMI Switcher - and for that it works great and has no issue renegotiating signal.

reviews.title: Issues..
reviews.text:
I really wanted to use this for the PC - but I had significant issues. It is detected by Steam Link just fine, but appears to be 'holding down a button' and so when I go to configure any game to use it, it spazzes out and causes a problem.

I have not been able to resolve, and the turbo button doesn't appear to be the culprit - so I will have to take it apart and see if something is stuck on the PCB.

reviews.title: Works alright
reviews.text:
This case kind of “gets the job done” I would say the best part about it is the plastic screen cover, which actually applied quite well and fits almost true to size.. However the case itself is SUPER flimsy. They did a good job in designing a case that allows you to use the kickstand, but they neglected to add enough sturdiness to the case itself to allow you to keep the case attached to the switch while using the swing out.

So, basically what this means is, when you’re holding it it’s “fine” (still pretty uncomfortable though..) - but if you use the swing out kickstand at all it just flaps freely in the wind and simultaneously does not grip the bottom side of the switch very well.

I would pass and get a rubber cover next time.

reviews.title: Different but works
reviews.text: For me, I am a gaming novice so this mouse seems like a Cadillac, not knowing any better. The real test cam when I had my son use it. For the most part, it delivered fast response. As with any change to what a gamer uses, it takes a bit to get used to different placements of controls. According to my son, the software is no comparison to the normal Logitech but for a novice , this would be great. So for gifting, I would recommend thus to a young gamer just starting out and more experienced gamers , this would be 50/50 depending on their needs and likes.

reviews.title: Great solution
reviews.text: For our needs, this stand fit the bill perfectly! Our headphones are wireless so tangled cords are no issue, but having thus stand keeps the headphones safe and secure without taking up valuable real estate on out end tables. This stand also hells protect them from having things laid on top of them. Very sturdy and adjustable, a great solution for most people and I really could see the benefit to gamers as well.

reviews.title: Great value!
reviews.text: One thing I learned from my sons and their gaming systems, always be prepared for more than 2 players, and this charger can accomodate up to 4 controllers being charged at once! Relatively a fast charger plus it’s very easy to use. Glad it did not take rocket science to use!

reviews.title: So smooth!
reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using this mouse. It is extremely responsive and accurate. Anybody who enjoys RGB lighting  will also like vibrant colors it glows. Would highly recommend especially for the price point ..extremely solid.

reviews.title: Spot on
reviews.text: Love that these don’t have to be Bluetooth Er and connects like a snap. Just plug and p,ay ! And yes, wireless. These are just as comfortable as other brands and the sound quality is great. Can’t speak towards longevity just yet but so far, it has hit all the must haves for my amateur gaming needs.

reviews.title: Works with other things
reviews.text: I selected this to see if it would charge other things, and I was right. It can be used for more than just an Oculus. The cord is of very good quality and is very durable but not stiff.

reviews.title: Not as vast as Oblivion, but I was tired of that game anyway!
reviews.text:
Fable 2 is a great game and I'm glad I purchased it. To any of you who are on the fence regarding this game, here are a few points to help you make your decision:
1) I experienced zero glitches. I think patches have been loaded because I have played for 2 months and never had a problem.

2) As the title of my review states, the "world" is smaller. You don't really travel the roads from one town to another, you just "fast travel" there instead. Actually, I liked this feature because it saves time and just gets to the good stuff.

3) I really enjoyed that you don't have to rely on finding money or merchandise to sell in order to get gold for the items you need. Various jobs are available so you can control how much money you make. This is especially great at the beginning of the game.

4) It's definitely a shorter game than Oblivion, I think I logged only half as many hours in Fable 2 compared to when I beat Oblivion. What I like about this is that the ending leaves you three different options. I don't feel like "Oh, that'll take forever I can't start all over." I have already begun another game with a different character and am enjoying making different decisions this time around.

Overall, the game is definitely worth your money and I recommend it highly. I can understand other reviewers giving it low marks for lack of depth and that they beat it very quickly...but take your time and complete all the quests and enjoy the game and it won't go by too fast. The review that cracks me up is the one where someone gave it one star because they had a lo-def TV and couldn't read the text! Wow. How about giving your TV a one star review? The game is great!

reviews.title: A great game to rent
reviews.text:
Overall the game is fun, realistic, and engaging. I really appreciated not having to learn a new button sequence as they kept everything the same as COD. Therefore, there's really no adjustment period to get used to the controls. The first thing I usually do when I rent a game is play through the campaign on Normal. I enjoy playing on Hard difficulty, too, but usually save that for games I purchase. I was done with the Normal campaign in about 6 hours. It was certainly the shortest game I have played, and I found myself wishing it was longer.

However, similar to COD, they do a nice job mixing things up so that you have a chance to use many different guns and vehicles throughout the game. Combat is great - the first time I shotgunned a guy in the head...HOLY cow. Anyway, I think it's definitely one to put on your "rent list" and then see what you think. Luckily, I didn't purchase this game right away since COD was coming out in early Nov. I would have seriously wanted my $60 back.

reviews.title: It's a Trap!
reviews.text: As an avid fan, I would love to play a Star Wars game but I cannot support a game that locks all its characters behind dozens of hours of gameplay unless you fork over *even more* of your hard-earned cash. EA is going to make an absolute killing on this game as I'm sure unknowing parents everywhere will buy it for their kids for the holidays. Good luck with the credit card bill, folks.

reviews.title: Cuts out often, unreliable
reviews.text: I use this with my XBO controller...I’ve played with the headset a total of four times (about 2 hours per session). The first session was great, no issues. However, ever since then if I even bump the connection slightly or lean the wrong way the connection breaks, I can’t hear my friends/they can’t hear me. I have to twist the connector around and after several pops try to find the exact position where I’m reconnected. It’s highly annoying. Can’t recommend and I’m looking for a new rig.

reviews.title: Just Dance 2020
reviews.text: Just Dance is a party. This is the first Just Dance my family has ever had, and my kids are having so much and keeping them so active. There are some songs that we have never heard before, but they are upbeat. I like that they still feature older songs like the Back Street Boys. They have new hits. I like that it really keeps my kids moving, and it's for all ages. My 5-year-old to my 15-year-old love it. It has different levels or songs that are for beginners. It is just a Dance Party.

reviews.title: Perfect for Family Game night
reviews.text: Our kids and I play the switch together all the time, and this is such a great idea to be able to charge the controllers at once instead of 2. It really helps everyone to play together and have no one sit out waiting for their controller to charge. We play Mario Kart, and Mario party that features up to 4 players so this is perfect for us. Super easy to use My 13-year daughter hooked it up, just put the controllers in a different slot and plug up and they charge pretty quickly, it also helps to make the area look neater and keeps everything together.

reviews.title: Great Keyboard
reviews.text: My daughters absolutely love this keyboard, she uses it to play games. The colors are just so bright and beautiful. The lights change color. It has only 87 keys, but that's All we use anyway. It comfortable to use and this keyboard will not slip it is weighted down somehow. Its made gaming much more enjoyable.

reviews.title: Switch Joycons
reviews.text: These joysticks are a little different in shape and feel from the original switch joysticks, but they work great and fit on the switch and play well with all the different games.

reviews.title: PDP Gaming LVL50 Wired Headset with Mic for Xbox One
reviews.text: WORKS GREAT SOUNDS AMAZING

reviews.title: Very comfortable and the sounds is nice but...
reviews.text: First off the headphones are extremely comfortable. I have worn them for an extended period of time with no ear fatigue. The sound quality is quite nice for this price point. Now I did have a very hard time with the microphone... no Matter what I did in the settings I couldn’t get the microphone to sound anyway louder than a whisper.

reviews.title: Comfortable for wearing for long periods of time
reviews.text: Usually headsets cause pain after two to three hours of use.  I've used this one for up to six hours at a time without any soreness.  It surrounds the ear so the padding touches my skull rather than my ear making it so comfortable.  This is the first headset I've ever tried that works with my glasses.  The sound quality is clear and the mic is really good.  The only thing I don't like about it is the wire is on the left side and so it's often draped across me to connect to my computer, but the cord is very long which makes up for that.  For the price, this is an amazing headset.  I totally recommend it.

reviews.title: Works Well
reviews.text: The JoyCons fit fine in this holder.  It's comfortable to use, just a little bit big, and works just as well as the one that came with our Switch.  The price is excellent whether you need a replacement or want to have a spare just in case.

reviews.title: Add fun to your gaming
reviews.text: These little steering wheels make playing Mario Kart on the Switch extra fun.  They feel like a real steering wheel.  The JoyCons fit securely.  You can't beat the price making these an excellent buy for your little racer.

reviews.title: Responsive but poor button placement
reviews.text: The mouse itself works fine, but the two buttons are where I rest my fingers so I keep accidentally pressing buttons.  Whenever I reposition my fingers automatically go back to that area.  This does not happen with any other mouse I have used.  The scroll wheel and LED work well and it is responsive.  If you hold your mouse differently from how I do, it could be a great mouse for you.

reviews.title: Decent headphones
reviews.text: This headset is comfortable.  The sound quality is not the best, but it is good enough.  The mic being removable is a positive and a negative feature.  Positive because you don't have to have it on there if you don't need it.  Negative because it is easy to lose once it is off.  For the price, it's an excellent choice.

reviews.title: Handy
reviews.text: The one thing I really dislike about Switch games is how tiny the cartridges are.  They are way too easy to lose and the cases are too big to keep the Switch area from looking cluttered.  These card cases are also small, but much less easy to lose.  They are cheap so you can get a whole bunch of them and save space and keep your Switch area clean.

reviews.title: Expensive, but really nice
reviews.text: If you have a need for a high demand gaming keyboard, this one is an excellent choice.  It has a great mechanical feel.  You know when you have pressed the key down.  It has a unique reinforced micro USB connector.  It makes it easy to disconnect the keyboard from your computer to take it along with you if needed.  The colors are beautiful and have a reasonable selection of patterns to choose from.  The only drawback for me is that there is no number block on the side.  Otherwise, this is a perfect keyboard.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: This is a great wireless and wired mouse.  It's very responsive.  The fact that it charges via a USB cable and while it's charging you can still use it as a USB mouse means there is no downtime when the battery dies.  It comes with five DPI settings for how quickly the mouse moves across the screen.  Two is more than adequate for my set-up and I was able to disable the others in the software.  It's great for switching between big motions and precise targeting.  Overall it's a great mouse!

reviews.title: Highly responsive
reviews.text: This keyboard works very well.  It's highly responsive making it an excellent choice for gaming.  The color patterns are a fun addition.  I really like that it has a dedicated number keypad.

reviews.title: Frivolous, but fun
reviews.text: The USB charging is nice to have unobstructed on my desk.  It is a space saver because it doesn't take up extra real estate on my desk.  The LED lighting is fun.  It's a little finicky toggling between the LED setting it is on, but with a little effort it's fine.  The price is high for a mousepad, but since it's a mousepad, RGB lighting, and charger all in one it's about right.

reviews.title: So useful
reviews.text: This charger makes it very easy to charge up to four JoyCons at a time.  Often my kids wouldn't play all at once because one or more of our JoyCons would be dead.  Now we just keep them all on this and they always have enough charged up to play together.  The lights make it easy to tell if one is charged or charging.  Very useful.

reviews.title: Such cute headphones!
reviews.text: You definitely pay for the brand and design with these headphones.  But, they have exceeded my expectations.  I love the light up cat ears.  The sound quality is excellent.  The microphone quality is exceptional.  They really are nice (and cute) headphones.

reviews.title: Way too small
reviews.text: This little controller works, but it's way too small making it hard to hit the right buttons.  It also doesn't have all of the controls on it.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: This controller works very well with the Nintendo Switch. It's very responsive. The buttons are very comfortable. We're very happy with it.

reviews.title: Works for most game consoles
reviews.text: This controller does not work well with our Switch. It does work with other game consoles we tried. It's comfortable to hold and the buttons are responsive.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: Great Thunderbolt docking station. East to add fast NVME Storage on top of the included 4 gig HD. 4K Display port works well. I also was able to use a USB-C display off the second Thunderbolt port, just not at the same time. Lots of USB 3 Type A ports.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.text: Works great on the original Switch. Easy to take with for playing Switch on the go.

reviews.title: Great JoyCon replacement
reviews.text: These controllers work great. They feel a little cheap and are wider than official JoyCons. They work great, however, and the turbo button being includes is an excellent addition to gameplay. They are very responsive. The price is a bit of a savings over official JoyCons making them a great deal.

reviews.title: Clear sound
reviews.text: The sound coming out of these headphones is nice and clear. They are easy to use and comfortable to wear.

reviews.title: Nice mouse
reviews.text: This mouse is comfortable to hold and is accurate for where you click it. The colors are nice. It works great for playing games.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: This is a comfortable mouse to hold and use. It is totally plug and play. It works well and accurately.

reviews.title: Pretty keyboard
reviews.text: This is certainly a pretty keyboard. It is comfortable to use. Even after almost a year of daily use the letters are still clear and are not showing signs of rubbing off.

reviews.title: Didn't last very long
reviews.text: It didn't take much use for these headphones to break. While they were intact they worked pretty well. The sound quality was decent.

reviews.title: Comfortable
reviews.text: The face cover is a lot more comfortable than the one that came with the Oculus. The rest is very useful for making game play more convenient.

reviews.title: Great games
reviews.text: This works totally great. The games preloaded on it are super fun.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: it is what it is

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: mice but thought it should be wireless for the money you spend and was hoping it was rubberized feel

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text: awesome design

reviews.title: Five Stars
reviews.text: as described, works fine

reviews.title: THE BEST EVER
reviews.text: AWESOME KEYBOARD, LOVE THE LIGHT EFFECT JUST WISH IT HAD MORE OPTIONS AND ROTATING COLORS. THE KEY BUTTONS ARE NORMAL NOT LIKE MY OLD ONE SINCE THIS IS BACKLIT AND NOT KEY LIT YOU DONT HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT THE BUTTONS WEARING OFF AND IF YOUR LIGHTS GO OUT LIKE MY OLD ONE DID (DIFFERENT KEYBOARD) YOU CAN STILL SEE THE KEYS. HAS AN AUTOMATIC LIGHT SHUT OFF WHEN NOT IN USE AND HAS THE OPTION TO SHUT IT OFF, STEADY ON OR BREATH

reviews.title: Great Headset
reviews.text:
being on a budget does not preclude you from having a terrific gaming headset. This one provides surprising performance at an affordable price.

The first thing I look for in headsets is comfort. I do't consider myself especially hedonistic but the bottom line is if you are going to wear something for a prolonged period of time, it better be comfortable. the memory foam headband fits snugly. The cushioning makes a difference and wasn't too hot , tight or heavy. Similarly the ear cuffs are light. They effectively block outsides sounds and the overall sound quality is good. The controls on the cps are easy to use. I liked that the mic was detachable. Although I have been pleased with its performance on non-gaming application, I prefer a less intrusive clip on mic. However it does work for gaming as well. I just prefer the clip on option. This headset works on multiple platforms including Xbox One, PS4, PC, Mac and mobile devices. It seems well built and reasonably durable. .this is a great headset that provides comfort and performance affordably.

reviews.title: Superb Battery Life and Exceptional Comfort
reviews.text: These wireless headphones offer superb  battery life and exceptional comfort. I love the lack of wires. Set up is simple and the controls are uncomplicated and easy to master. Sound quality is adequate; not the best but far from the worst. The detachable mic works decently. they do't look dorky. If you like to break up your work with gaming or your gaming with work, you won't be embarrassed by the appearance. I've tried other wireless phones without much satisfaction. These provide everything you need, clear, crisp sound, a long charge and comfort.

reviews.title: Superior Comfort & Sound
reviews.text: I was amazed at how comfortable these headphones are. Sound quality is excellent. I use them for entertainment as well as gaming and am impressed by the quaality overall. The design is simple with no unnecessary doo dads that serve only to confuse before breaking. The controls are easy to master when you become accustomed to them. Noise cancelling is more than adequate. They work well with both my PC and laptop. and provide superior sound on my Android phone. The phones's sound is not the best to begin with but these proide a vast improvement. Very pleased.

reviews.title: Good Budget Option
reviews.text: This is a good basic set. I liked the gold and it is pretty comfortble to wear. Everything works as expected. the mic is fine nd the phones work well. there is a four foot cable that is adequate but when it comes to cable I am in camp more is better. But this one does the job . surround sound, No. Noiseblocking, no. but a decent budget option.

reviews.title: Mighty Sound & Comfort
reviews.text: I am impressed with the comfort and performance of this headset. It is wired but frankly I am usually glued to my computer when gasming so it is not a deal breasker. There is a conenience factor with wireless phones  but usually the mobility comes with some decline in sound. The flip out mike works well. The phones themselves are extremely comfortasble exven for extended periods. I do wear glasses sometimes and these accomdoate them better than most.With some phones you get all hot and sweaty but these are breathable. Sound quality is amazing. It is surround sound, clear, crispt and realistic. Battery life is excellent. For under a hundred dollars, these pohones are awesome.

reviews.title: Simple Set UP
reviews.text: Optimized for XBox, this router is easy to set up. Ifollowed the quick start guide and had no problems at all. The speed is decent althouogh I can't say I  noticed a major difference and the connection is fairly reliable. Initially I had a number of drops but this seems to have resolved itself. It has a somewhat futuristic look I swapped out the rather crummy network cable for a better one. The gamers in my household love it nd I am generally satisfied with its performance.

reviews.title: Smooth & Responsive
reviews.text: this gaming mouse is smsooth and respohnsive. Plug and play, it is easy to set up. You do have to download the soft ware to adjust the features but that is a fairly straightforward process. It is best for adults especially those with larger hands.I found it intuitive to use and was impressed by its performance. My gaming however is just for entertainment' more dedicated gamers may want more bells and whistles. but this is a good value for the moeny. Performance is top notch, it is comfortable and set up is relatively painless.

reviews.title: Superb Comfort & Performance
reviews.text: these headphones look cool and are exceptionally comfortable. They adjust easily. I love the over the ear design and muffs provide ample cushioning. They are a tad on the heavy side but I've experienced no discomfort. Performance is superb. Soundquality is excellent and they are easy enough to use. They are versatile and will work with most devices although adaptors may be needed. Excellent for gaming and other applications.

reviews.title: good Sound, Reasonably comfortable
reviews.text: this is a good set of gaming headphones. the sound is decent, rich and nuanced. the foam makes them more comfortable than most to wear. the mic functions as expected and is detachable, a nice feature IMO. the connecting cable is thick and braided. It is designed to last. The phones themselves seem reasonably sturdy. good buy for the price point.

reviews.title: Decent Budget Set
reviews.text: this inexpensive headset gets the job done. the color is bright and fun for kids. It is fairly unisex; no one will object to it being either too masculine or feminine. sound quality is adequate though not extraordinary. It fits a variety of head sizes, a definite plus. that being said the headphones are not comfortable. I have a strong preference for over the earphones. These are on the ear. They are bearable but not my favorites.  I would prefer a longer cord. This is a decent set for the price point. If you are looking for a stellar experience you can spend a lot more. but so far this has been working well.

reviews.title: good But Not Great
reviews.text: These are attractive headphones that are reasonably comfortable. the sound is good but not exceptional. The mike is quite sensitive, not always a good thing. The biggest complaint I have is with respect to the volume. II does not really get as loud as I would like. Similarly, the PC software is clunky. Took me a while to get things going, not a big deal but at this price point, I do expect pretty near flawless.  still a sturdy, functional headset. Buy when on sale.

reviews.title: Basic But Good
reviews.text: we go through headphones at an alarming rate and frankly I prefer not to break the bank on them. These headphones are basic but more than adequate in terms of comfort, sound quality and usability. The padding is thick and ears do get hot and sweaty. sound quality is surprisingly good and the mike is adequate. I've had no issues with interference or static. I like the basic black. Overall a good budget set.

reviews.title: Comfortable and Decent Sound
reviews.text: these are decent headphones. They are compatible with a number of systems.s sounds quality is good. The mic works well and they are lightweight and comfortable. the controls are simple and straightforward. My household goes through headphones at an alarming rate and I am loathe to spend big bucks on any. these are a good option that work well, are durable and don't break the bank.

reviews.title: A Winner
reviews.text: Finally, a wireless gaming mouse that equals the performance of a wired one. this mouse is fast. The estimated battery life is an impressive fifty hours. This seems accurate and it charges via any Qi-enabled surface. The lights and buttons are programmable. The finger rests are removable and the mouse is ambidextrous. It takes some playing around to find what conformation suits you best.  Dedicated gamers will find the eleven different buttons useful; I found them gratuitous. I enjoy games but am not rabid. My brothers however are and absolutely adored this mouse. It is a pricey proposition especially if you spring for the related mousepad. But the convenience of fewer cables and superior performance makes this a winner.

reviews.title: All Around Disappointment
reviews.text: I could not get this to work on either setting. With  the bluetooth it just blinked a d never connected. No problem with other devices. My computer would not recognize it. Downloading the driver was not simpke. You have to download their Synapse 2 program. I just wantd a driver. The black plastic looks and feels cheap. I do like that the battery is on the top. Disappointing experience.

reviews.title: Okay Mouse
reviews.text: The mouse itself is fine. It looks sharp and is comfortable and responsive. But if you want to customize it you must register and download a whole package.  It is just a mouse and the level of intrusion is not justified. If you don't mind forgoing the customization or don't care about surrendering your privacy the mouse works decently and is good for gaming.

reviews.title: Well Made
reviews.text: Large and thin this mousepad provides a smooth surface. The rubberized base really holds. The fabric topper is waterproof. My mouse glides smoothly and seems more accurate. It is almost the same size as an average sheet of paper. It is thin enough to transport easily. So far I am pleased with it. It is well made with stitched edges so I anticipate it will last longer than most. Nice pad.

reviews.title: All About the Bass
reviews.text: This headset is comfortable. The vibration and bass are good and overall sound quality is better than expected. The noise cancellation is better than expected snd the mic works well. It does not connect to the controller, it connects to the system  A CD is included or you can download the needed software and drivers. It fits snugly but is comfortable. The controls are on the earpiece and it takes time to get accustomed to them. Overall it looks cool and performs decently.

reviews.title: Love the Rainbow Lights
reviews.text: This is a great mechanical keyboard. it is responsive and performs well. Set up was simple and I have had no performance issues. My favourite feature is the rainbow backlighting; very cool. It is good for gaming and also works well for regular use. It is sturdy and doesn't slip and slide. Good value.

reviews.title: Good Sound
reviews.text: The sound quality is excellent. There is a detachable mike that works quite well. The headset itself is quite comfortable although  I wish there was more padding and give on the ear cups. no problems with them on a PC. The noise cancellation is adequate. The controls are easy to use. I f you are a hardcore gamer you might want to go for something more advanced. But if you need a decent, affordable pair of headphones that you can game with as well as perform other functions, this set is a good choice.

reviews.title: Great mouse, but only lasted me about a year.
reviews.text:
Not a verified purchase because this was gifted to me a little over a year ago. This mouse has been my favorite mouse I've ever owned, but sadly the right click now malfunctions and clicks repeatedly on press. I would definitely recommend this mouse to anyone interested in something customizable and reliable. Just beware the hardware issues.

The software is easy to use and set up custom macros and keybinds with.

Perhaps the build quality could be a bit better. I took it apart for cleaning and it seems pretty flimsy and cheap.

reviews.title: Feels fantastic!
reviews.text:
[[VIDEOID:6f460032c603a4e493400d6806c3d810]] UPDATE Jan 2020: 8 months after my purchase the right button is messed up. CUE software constantly forgets my button remappings (STILL!!). Super frustrating, I really regret this purchase. I really can't believe how bad iCUE is.

Let me preface this by saying if you happen to have long nails you might not like it as much. My thumb nail constantly gets caught on the plate above the side buttons. I need to have it centered because my hands aren't too small and it becomes a bit irritating having it constantly move.

Mouse feels fantastic; the build quality is amazing. I expected it to be heavier and larger than it was. It's actually pretty lightweight and on the smaller side compared to my Steel Series Sensei 310. It works amazingly on my mousepad as well (both sides). I think there's an issue with the surface calibration because sometimes my cursor just shoots off into a random direction. Not so ideal for something like an FPS or MOBA where you need precision with your clicks and aim.

Once I got the CUE software to FINALLY register my keybindings and remapping (about an hours' work) I fell in love with it. I'm super excited to start using this for FF14!

CUE software is definitely a huge downside to this mouse. I wish I had gotten the Razer Naga Trinity instead if I knew this would be just as bad as their Synapse software.

reviews.title: About what you'd expect for the price.
reviews.text:
I really do not think this will protect my Switch if it takes a fall, but it gives it a nice grip when I hold it and does look nice. The screen protector is really nice. Very easy to apply and is probably better quality than the one I had previously.

For the price, though, this is definitely worth it.

reviews.title: Love it.
reviews.text: Works great. Hasn't fallen apart. Feels like a good quality built item. Love it.

reviews.title: I think I got a second-hand case?
reviews.text:
The case came stretched out and sits floppily on the switch. It's not a huge deal but it does bug me seeing the black bars on the sides off-centered. It's also kind of sticky for some reason? I've been wiping it down often to try to help.

The screen protector is nice and fits fine, as do the little thumb grips which are really cute. I also like the micro fiber cloth.

For the price I think this is a fair deal, as it is really cute regardless of the small issues. Does NOT fit correctly in the dock but I don't mind putting some pressure on to make it fit. I've done worse with a bigger case I used to have on my console lol. But if you're not comfortable doing that you may want to find skins rather than a case.

reviews.title: Unbearable input delay and poor quality
reviews.text:
The video output was atrocious and the Genki program's UI is awful, but I guess it's very simplistic so it's easy to use. There's no way to configure any type of setting aside from "performance/resolution" modes, which seem to do almost nothing. I was honestly really looking forward to this but I can't even play a basic RPG game without getting frustrated. Moving the joystick takes a significant amount of time for the character to turn. I took my Switch out of the dock and I couldn't believe how different the game felt.

Save your money and just invest it into a better capture card.

reviews.title: Eh.
reviews.text: Overhyped. 10000% not worth full price. Outsourced to a no-name company and it really shows. It has some nice qualities, but honestly if you can just find this used/half-price, I'd say grab it - but anything over half price is an actual scam.

reviews.title: Kids love it!
reviews.text: My boys play this game for hours and hours. One prefers to play serious games, while the other actually spends hours creating characters and teams. He loves how much customization goes into that part!

reviews.title: The only video game you need from now on.
reviews.text: Can't say enough amazing things about this game. My 8 year old, 10 year old, husband, 25 year old brother and basically anyone else that walks into our home plays this game. It's amazing that they can connect with buddies on rainy days - a Minecraft playdate. I love the creativity in 'creative' mode. We tend to stay away from survival mode for the most part, and still have countless hours of fun time with this game.

reviews.title: Never get tired of this one!
reviews.text: Of all the sports games my kids have, I think they've spent the most time on this one. My younger son (8) loves creating players - giving them funky colored uniforms and hairstyles, then having them drafted onto a team. My older son (10) enjoys actually playing the game - and seems to think it's improving his actual real life ball skills. :)

reviews.title: A Favorite at Our House
reviews.text: My sons, 8 and 10, love to play this game - my 8 year old moreso than my 10 year old, but he's the video game fiend at our house anyhow. Love games that are fun for only ONE player, to avoid fights when both kids play at once. It's easy to find a stopping point, which means mom and dad don't have to wait twenty minutes for them to find a saving point.

reviews.text: I don't know why but this download did not work . It keeps flickering . It made me dizzy .

reviews.title: Great game!
reviews.text:
To be honest, I bought the game because there is a clown on the cover. I love clowns.
The game is really good, kept me occupied for a few hours.

reviews.title: Great game
reviews.text:
I liked this game, the instructions were clear and the seek and find could be rather difficult.
The background is pretty interesting, Poe is about to be dragged down to the underworld unless you find the murderers of both Mary Rogers/Marie Roget and Poe. When you are playing the game, be sure to click on all the ravens you see.
It is a fun game, and you really can't go wrong with a $0.99 download.

reviews.title: Lots of fun to play
reviews.text: Another great Stray Souls game.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable
reviews.text: fun game and it downloaded perfectly
