reviews.text: No scratches and a great price! Thanks!

reviews.title: The game is great! Just be aware that windows 10 will most ...
reviews.text: The game is great! Just be aware that windows 10 will most likely not be able to play this game.

reviews.title: Four Stars
reviews.text:
Game arrived in good quality, will give 5 stars after playing the game.
Update: The home screen says "Calling All Units" but it is just the standard edition. Otherwise a great game. Easy to get started and figure out. I kinda like this better than Forza Horizon 3 just because it is not as in depth when it comes to car tuning.
Update2: Game keeps on dropping off due to connection issues.

reviews.title: Great alternative to the $50 controller
reviews.text: Great alternative to the $50 controller. Feels great in your hand. My only complaint is that the vibration sounds like a siren.

reviews.title: Really fun game for all ages
reviews.text: Really fun game for all ages. Puzzles are fun to figure out. I love that you get 2 games in one. Oh and I forgot, I'm playing this Xbox 360 game on the Xbox one!!! It's awesome!!

reviews.title: Works as advertised.
reviews.text: Works great! Batteries last a while. I switch them about twice a month (not a hard core gamer but I have my binge moments) I plug the charger into the back of the console.

reviews.title: Fun game
reviews.text: Fun game for my wife and I. The puzzles are fun and new. I like how you can switch between any character in the game during freeplay. Also the Finn minifigure was a nice touch (deluxe version)

reviews.title: Really long game, but fun!
reviews.text: Fun game, been playing for 50 hours and still haven't finished the game!

reviews.title: Awesome Gaming Headset!
reviews.text: We got this headset for our son, 15, who is big into gaming and he absolutely loves this headset.  The comfort, noise-cancelling, and sound quality is top notch!  He really enjoys the adjustability and the comfort, along with the noise cancelling.  He can also still hear us if we need his attention and that is a big plus for us!  I would definitely buy this set again and recommend it to anyone looking for a really great gaming headset, especially at this price.  Hope this review is helpful!!

reviews.title: Outstanding VR Cable
reviews.text: This VR cable is absolutely an excellent problem solver when it comes to gaming PC with your Oculus 2.  The  right angle C is great, I love right angle cables because what I have noticed is that there is less tear and fraying accidentally because the actual cable is never having to manually be bent for accommodating odd angles.  The length of this cable makes it great for the added PC gamin experience with your VR because you are able to set good boundaries to prevent accidents.  It's not bulky and thick like some of the others I have seen so the thin sheath is great for protection, but not obstructive.  Most other cables that are similar are ridiculously priced and when I saw this one pop up, I figured it was worth a shot especially at this price point (less than half the cost of most others).  So far, it's been fantastic and if we need more just like it, this will be the one we get again.  Hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: Hidden Little Gem of a Gaming Headset
reviews.text: Okay, I will start this by saying we have tried SEVERAL different gaming headsets at several different price points, and by far, this is THE best gaming headset we have used.  The sound quality and noise cancelling is absolutely superb.  The market of gaming headsets is vast and it can be quite frustrating trying to find just that right one that gives you all of the functions you are hoping for.  We loved it so much we ordered 2 more, one for our other son and one for a gift.  Yes, a gift at this price is quite spendy, however when you are trying to find something for a gamer that they could really get a lot of valuable use out of this is really perfect.  Comes with a stand too, and just a beast of quality.  Highly recommend and I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: Works Better Than More Expensive Brands
reviews.text: We have gamers and so naturally, with that comes the added need for lots of gaming equipment, and headsets are essential.  We have tried so many different ones, expensive, middle of the road and cheap ones.  For a gaming headset I would consider this a middle of the road as far as price, but as far as quality?  Top notch.  Absolutely zero issues right out of the box, been using it for 3 months the battery life is phenomenal, the sound quality is excellent.  Noise cancelling is great enough that it makes the gaming experience easier to get enthralled but not so ridiculous that if someone needs your attention you aren't able to hear them.  Comfortable ear foams and headband.  Absolutely recommend this headset, without question.

reviews.title: Perfect RGB Pad For Gamers
reviews.text: Bought this to try for our 15 & 11 yo gamers.  They have their own gaming area, and this did not disappoint.  They love the RGB and the range they have with mouse usage, what I LOVE is the wrist support.  They are on the computer a lot, not just for gaming but for school too and I have less worry when they are able to follow ergonomic protocols to help try to prevent carpal tunnel.  This a great gift idea for any computer gamer for sure.  The price is very reasonable as well.  Hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: Face Cooling Fan, Works Really Well
reviews.text: If you are looking for an Oculus face fan and expecting any one of them to completely eliminate sweat, I really don't think one exists just yet.  Having said that, or keeping that in mind, this one is really spot-on.  It does a really good job at eliminating the facial overheat that you get from the stock headset that comes with your Oculus.  It works well enough that you will notice a huge difference and you won't be able to go back to using the regular headset.  There will still be sweat obviously, because those more intensively active games are going to bring the workout with them, but with the combination of the fan and the cotton interface that helps absorb the sweat, it definitely makes it more user friendly without a doubt.  For the price, this is a great deal and definitely one of those accessories that is absolutely worth getting.  The comfort is important too, and you are not sacrificing any comfort with this fan cover head strap.  Also, this would make a great giftable accessory for someone you know who really loves playing their Oculus and doesn't have a face fan yet.  I would absolutely buy this again if I need another one.  I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: It's GREAT!!
reviews.text: What can I say, this battery pack is impressive.  Obviously if you already own an Oculus, then you know how quick the standard, on-board battery can get used up quickly and when you are really into a game, that low battery coming on at the most inconvenient time is frustrating.  So we grabbed this battery strap/pack in hopes that at least it would extend game play by at least half of what they say it will.  Please keep in mind, the charge your Oculus keeps, and the charge the battery pack keeps will greatly depending on how involved the games are that you are playing, but having said that, this battery pack has lived up to what the company states it will.  Usually, it does extend the game ply by 4 hours, I don't keep super tabs on that because we put everything back on the charger when it's not in use, plus no one in this house plays the Oculus for that long at one time, and generally speaking only 2 people play the Oculus back to back,  but from what we can tell, it keeps game play going for an extended 4 hrs at least.  The strap is extremely comfortable and easy to set up.  This would also be a great accessory to give as a gift to the other people you know who own an Oculus.  Absolute five-star review that is well deserved.  I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: Works Great!
reviews.text: We've had these controllers for a few months now and using them daily in order for me to give a fair review and we are not displeased at all.  They work great at converting from handheld to regular controller, zero lag or glitching when casting to the tv or the computer.  Feels great in your hands just like the controller you are used to on the other gaming systems and the construction and price are really good.  I definitely recommend for switch gamers who need to conversion when casting to the tv or computer.  This controller has a long battery life and quick recharge as well, fits your standard console charging cables.  I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: They Work Great
reviews.text: We bought these for our boys, so this review is based on the feedback I got from them.  Our oldest is 16 and he uses them the most, and he reports that they are very comfortable in your hands, no connectivity issues.  The back paddles are really good for re-mapping the button selections so that you don't have to continue to go back and forth as much to the joy stick from the regular buttons and he seemed to really appreciate that feature and he has been using them for a few months and literally had nothing negative to say.  For the price I would say these are a good direction to go in.  I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: LOVE This New XXL RGB Pad!
reviews.text: I already had an RGB black large gaming pad, but when I saw this one I really wanted to give it a try because of the galaxy background and colors and it when I received it, it did not disappoint.  Was extremely easy to set up and install, easy to go through settings to find the light cycle I wanted, the material is strong and completely solid along with the trim stitching.  Also, when I am taking pics of things that I make, this RGB gaming pad doubles as a nice backdrop for my photos and I love it.  I would definitely buy this again and not hesitate at all about recommending it to others.  I hope this review is helpful!

reviews.title: Great Charging Dock
reviews.text: This charging dock, surprisingly, works absolutely perfect for our space and our Oculus.  I say surprisingly because of the price, I thought it might end up turning into a piece of junk or just be junk to begin with.  It is absolutely not.  It's lightweight, yes, but sturdy and holds everything we need in the space that we have for our Oculus and no more having to lay it on our bar area for charging, because this dock provides a home for the Oculus as well.  We have 2 units now so I need to purchase another one and I will definitely be grabbing this one again.  So far, it works great.  We have only had it a month but it is stable, sturdy and the charge ports work great!  We get lots of daily use from the Oculus so it's a true testament that it holds up to the constant on again, off again replace and removal.  I will update this review if I feel like it doesn't serve the life expectancy that we have for it but so far so good!  Like I said, I will be purchasing this one again for our 2nd Oculus.  I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Works Great!
reviews.text: This mechanical RGB keyboard works great and as good as can be expected.  Easy installation, RGB flawless easy to change patterns there's not really anything constructively negative that I can say about the build of this keyboard.  Would make a great gift for any gamer for sure.  I wouldn't hesitate to purchase this one again for the price.  I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Perfect Silicone Covers
reviews.text: This set of silicone covers for the Oculus are a really great addition to our Oculus providing extra protection and the fit is exceptional.  Very sturdy and well worth the price.  They hold up great with our boys who are not easy on items like this which is what made us purchase this set because we just wanted the added protection.  I would definitely buy this set again but also would like to add that this would be a great gift for anyone who owns an Oculus.  I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: My Favorite So Far
reviews.text: This Targeal headset is by far my favorite one that I have tried so far (and I have tried more than I care to admit to) because these headsets aren't incredibly expensive, some are and so many of the ones I have tried end up being a piece of junk either right out of the box or shortly after.  I am not a huge gamer, but I do use them with my PC, I take very good care of my headsets and this one so far (been using it for just a little over a month) is holding up very nicely.  It is easy to set up the blue tooth, has great stability.  The range is not horrible, works pretty comparable to other sets as far as that goes.  The sound quality is fantastic though and the noise cancelling might work a bit too well.  They are very comfortable on my head and ears, not too light and not too heavy.  They are made of quality material and I am just overall super pleased with this set so far.  The RGB works great too, matches all of my other RGB gear.  The buttons are easy to use, all of the input ports are solid, zero problems with them so far as well.  Fast charging and they keep a very long charge too.  I would buy this headset again for sure and I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Great Replacement
reviews.text: We purchased this as a replacement for the original strap because it accidentally snapped and broke.  This head strap is every bit as good as the factory brand head strap and the price is very reasonable so if you are looking for a replacement, look no further.  So far the strap installs and is just as comfortable and somewhat a bit more sturdy than the original.  I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Love This Gaming Keyboard
reviews.text: If you are looking at this item, clearly you are in the market for a mechanical keyboard and this one is fantastic.  I love the key placement, it works just as well as the other two brands I have that were a tad more spendy, but got this one for our son.  He is huge into gaming so naturally, RGB is a very real part of our computers and accessories.  He even has an RGB night stand that he insisted on and as far as this keyboard goes, he felt the same.  We could have gotten a standard mechanical kb, but as I stated, the RGB sticks with his preferences and so far so good.  They keys are very fluid, the keyboard is easy to install, it's durable and sturdy, just a really solid build.  We have been using it for 2 months now and zero issues.  This one would make a great gift too for any gamer.  I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Great For Advanced Saber Players
reviews.text: I say for advanced because when I was starting out with Beat Saber, there is no way I would have been able to use the long stick way of playing.  But as an advanced user, it's actually great. These grips are made with good quality foam and plastic, sturdy even.  This will be a subjective way of playing that game because you will run across people who prefer to use the stick controllers over the individual handles and vice-versa, but me personally, I could play either way and depending on the song, I often do better on some of the faster songs with the stick versus the individual handles.  Either way, this set is a solid good one and would make a good accessory gift to anyone who is all about Beat Saber or any of the other music beat games.  I hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Really Like This Set
reviews.text: This set is better than just the controllers alone and I think the thing I like the most about this set is the red and blue color because it actually does help in the game to keep those differentiated.  On some of the games I prefer the individual extension grips and on some of the other songs that are faster in Beat Saber, I do better with the joined stick handle grip.  These are solid build, comfortable and the foam area makes it really comfortable to use for extended play.  Sometimes we play for 2 hrs at a time and that's a long time to play a game like Beat Saber, but these handles make it easier to do that, especially if you are having a competition.  Definitely worth the money and would make a good gift to an Oculus user who loves the Beat Saber type of games.  I do hope you find this review helpful!

reviews.title: Impressive
reviews.text: I've just started playing hidden object adventure games, and this is by far the best.  The graphics are very good, the music is moody, and there is lots to do.  Most hidden object games make you find meaningless objects over and over in scene after scene that all look relatively the same.  Not Dreamland.  Each hidden object scene is very unique in appearance, and makes sense in the theme of the place.  And the puzzles far outnumber the hidden object searches, which in my book is great.  It took me almost 6 hours to finish this game, and that's much longer than most I have played.  Very unique in concept, design, and execution.

reviews.title: Actually Played it Twice
reviews.text: I found this one very entertaining.  First of all, no HOG objects that weren't needed to perform some task.  Second of all, no tasks that didn't have some purpose to further the storyline.  My only complaint was that there were some pretty obvious pieces missing from the story at the beginning that would have made the ending much more logical.  But all in all, a very nice game.  The cut scenes were a bit "plastic" looking, but the game art was top notch.  No puzzles were too hard, and you could skip any of them.  Good game overall.

reviews.title: Too Bad This is the Last One!
reviews.text: This series of games is just top notch!  The artwork, the intricacy of the tasks, the story as it unfolds.  The games are neither too short or too long, neither too easy or too hard.  I really enjoyed playing this one, and will certainly play it again, which I rarely do.  It's just a pity there aren't more games in this series.  Well worth the price.

reviews.title: In the End, I Remain Impressed
reviews.text:
Original Review:
Beautiful graphics, quirky gameplay. I'd have loved this game, but I came to a mini-game towards the end of the game that requires you to shoot 33 enemies without getting shot once. This is NOT why I play adventure type games. And there is no way to skip it, so I was deprived of the joy of finishing this lovely game.

Edited Review:
I am editing this after completing the game. I was too thick to realize that there was a way to replenish my "lives" in the mini-game I mentioned in my original review. Once I figured that out, I was able to complete the mini-game pretty easily.

In closing, I have to explain that I used to play this type of game all the time back in the heyday of "real" adventure games (like Myst). And back then, there wasn't always a walkthrough - you just puzzled it out until you figured it out. And that was half the fun. How lazy I've become! What's left of the adventure genre of games is way easier, and you can almost always skip the mini-games. So this game was very hard for me. I couldn't have finished it without a walkthrough, but that's just proof that I have become spoiled and lazy!

All in all, this is a beautiful game, beautifully designed, illustrated, and executed. They just don't make games like this anymore. If you are a fan of the old-fashioned adventure game, and particularly one with no violence (unless you count shooting at tiny red pixel bad-guys with a tiny blue pixel gun), and if you love the artwork and design in your games as much as the games themselves, Machinarium is the game for you.

The reason for the 4 star rating is that it would have been nice to provide a "skip" feature, for those that just didn't want to kill themselves with a mini-game they didn't like and couldn't solve.

reviews.title: Fine Quality Throughout
reviews.text: Beginning with the awesome graphics, and ending with a well thought out storyline, this game is a joy to play.  Just the right mix of tasks, puzzles, and HO scenes, it moved at a very nice pace.  And it was far longer than most games of this type.  Highly recommend this one!

reviews.title: Just Not That Great
reviews.text:
I wanted to like this one, I really did. But the story is so choppy, and there is no real feel for what you are supposed to be doing. The puzzles are too repetitive in nature, and I ended up skipping many of them because they were just too boring.
If you are a fan of HO scenes, you will love this game, because there are A LOT of them, and they are nicely drawn. But I personally detest hunting for a bunch of useless objects over and over again just to gain one thing I need.
The artwork was nice, but just not enough to make the game worth it. I ended up rushing through it just to have it over with.

reviews.title: Great Game, Jam Packed
reviews.text: Wow, this really is a great deal at under $9 and free shipping.  This game is jam packed with great graphics, lots of mini-games (puzzles), and beautiful HO scenes.  As the game progresses, you need objects from inventory to complete the HO scenes, which makes them a lot more interesting.  The puzzles range from easy to challenging, and there are many different types of puzzles.  The story is interesting, with lots of cut scenes.  And the game is LONG, including an extra smaller game at the end of the main game.  There are even bonus mini games that you unlock by collecting flowers in each scene of the main and extra games.  All in all, this game really has it all.  It's not the newest game on the scene, but it will keep you busy and entertained.

reviews.title: Thoroughly Enjoyable
reviews.text: Lovely graphics, quirky storyline, nice music, great variety of puzzles and HO scenes.  I really had no complaints about this game at all.  It was nice and long, with lots of different rooms to explore.  I loved the different versions of the rooms, and the transporting effects.  As a matter of fact, even the little details like the effects when you locate an object or complete a task were so well designed.  A really great game, and worth a few extra bucks.

reviews.title: Fabulous!
reviews.text: I loved every aspect of this game.  First of all, there are far many more puzzles than HOGs, which is just the way I like it.  Great variety of puzzles, too, and none of them too awfully hard.  Lots of having to move objects around to accomplish tasks.  The storyline flowed very well, and the length of the game was good too.  I can't say enough about the graphics - this game is extremely artistic.  Even the HOG scenes were well thought out, with quite a few objects that had to be pieced together, or the need to find objects inside other objects (like chests, drawers, even paintings).  I even loved the music!  All in all, this game was quality throughout, well thought out, and enjoyable.  Well worth the price.

reviews.title: One of My Favorites
reviews.text: Wow, this game is truly wonderful.  Artwork is great, concept is very inventive, lots and lots to do.  I am playing a second time to get all the strawberries.  It's really quite long, but I couldn't tear myself away from the computer, so i finished it in a few sessions.  Lots and lots of artistic detail in this one, puzzles are varied and different, story line is quite unique (if you like fantasy), music is lovely.

reviews.title: More Puzzles than HO Scenes - Fun Overall
reviews.text: The graphics are wonderful, and the puzzles are mostly fun, but I skipped a bunch of them because the instructions just didn't make sense to me.  Overall, an enjoyable, if short, gaming experience.  The HO scenes are more interesting because there are many objects you need to combine first.  The story is interesting, and the video sequences are well done.  I enjoyed collecting the flowers and money and bulding my garden.  It was a nice addition to the game play.  My biggest complaint is that it was far too short for me - finished it over 2 days, and not too many hours.

reviews.title: Fun Game
reviews.text: I really enjoyed this game.  A nice variety of puzzles, and I didn't even mind the HO scenes because you were gathering items you actually needed.  The story was interesting, and the graphics and cut scenes were top notch.  My biggest complaint was the ending, which was way too abrupt, and felt like they just ran short of funds....  Still, a good 5 hours of gaming, which is okay by me.

reviews.title: Nice but Short
reviews.text: Not your usual game, very unique graphics and storyline.  I really enjoyed playing it, but it was way too short for my taste.

reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time
reviews.text: This was absolutely the worst game I have ever played.  Tons of repetitive and boring HO scenes with the same items over and over again, no item manipulation or hidden items.  A very loose story line consisting of characters telling you to do things for them that require you to visit those annoying HO scenes over and over again.  The small number of mini games or puzzles were unoriginal and either too easy or impossible to determine what you needed to do.  And the help consisted of highlighting the hot spots in the scene you were currently in.  Unless you enjoy HO scenes and nothing else, steer clear of this one.

reviews.title: TOP NOTCH GAME PLAY!!!!
reviews.text: Absolutely everything about this game was awesome.  Lots and lots of puzzles, beautiful graphic throughout, wonderful story line, great voices, a solid game progression that actually made sense.  And it was LONG!  Well worth the full price.

reviews.title: WOULD NOT DOWNLOAD
reviews.text: Tried multiple times.  Downloaded another game, so it wasn't my system.  Got a refund from Amazon.

reviews.text: A little costly for their size but my son loved opening these little Pikmin guys on Christmas morning.  Holding up well despite being tossed around.

reviews.text: So cute! Perfect little gift for an Animal Crossing fan.  Can play as Tom on Mario Maker which made my son's day!

reviews.title: Could be better...
reviews.text: As opposed to the many other Pokemon games that came out I would have to rate this generation of pokemon as a whole at the bottom of the list. They are becoming way to cartoon like to where it becomes weird. I cant really explain it but the Pokemon are just wack now. Your choices for pokemon are also limited in types. For instants you will mostly find Water and Grass type pokemon. And the new replacements for team Rocket, Aqua, etc, is are bunch of nerdy loosers known as Team Galactic. Idk, its like Pokemon was once ment to be enjoyed b everyone and is now for kids like under 10. But the graphics, sound, animations were good, color too. If you never played the old games then you my find this fun. However to the seasoned veterans that have been fans since gameboy, I recommend you either wait for the remakes of silver and gold or get diamond or pearl if you must, they were better than platinum.

reviews.title: Nothing more than Hype
reviews.text: I got this game expeting exceleent things! But it wasnt all that. Its a game packed with a bunch of level that are no more than about a minute long, or as little as about 5 seconds (literaly). Whats more your creations will turn on you! So watch out. But seriously, for something that is so supposed to be so complex, you will be shocked by its sheer simplicity. Which is to say that this game was a bit of a dissapointment.

reviews.title: Gravely Dissapointing TW fans Beware!
reviews.text: This game is terrible! The action is little, and its not like TW at all! So anyone who plays TW do not buy! Even Empires was better than this trash!

reviews.title: Really good game for the money!
reviews.text:
Okay, I will try to make this sweet and simple. This game is really a fun game. It is a very challenging game, especially fighting raptors. They are actually smart! You have the ability to use your knife to kill them! Weapons look cool, scenery is decent, action is good, on the level of the original Killzone. Pretty good overall and for this price you just cant beat it. VERY CHALLENGING GAME! OMG IT WAS THE HARDEST ONE I EVER PLAYED! Whats cool is you fight a lot of dinosaurs but also have a lot of gun fights! I Highly Recommend!

For what it was:
Graphics: 8
Sound: 8
Story: 8
Gameplay: 8
Controls: 7
Action: 8
Challenge: 10
Overall: 8 or ****

reviews.title: Buggy! Vista users Beware, will not launch game!
reviews.text: I want to say first off that this is a pretty good game. The fun factor is 9/10 for sure for me, and I beat the game 4 times. That said, I had to buy it for Xbox. The PC version is not user friendly in the least! You will be able to install your game but unable to play it on vista! I have checked around on 7 different sites, no one can give a straight answer to the problem! Even if you manage to play the game it does have a lot of glitching and freezing at some points, mostly while opening things and running around a lot. But from time to time throwing grenades can also trigger it. Don't get me wrong, the game itself is fun, customizing is average as I would have liked to choose from a variety f faces, attires, and saber styles for the get go. Choosing your path is a bit too straight forward it seems, but all and all it is a fun game. Once you have beaten it about 3 times you are ready to retire it for a LONG time. After a year or two you may go back to it again, only to realize it's shear simplicity. That said, once I was able to play the game smoothly the first few times, it was pretty epic considering when it came out and all. Comparing it to games today it still gets a fairly decent score in the fun department. I would still give it 7/10 for the fun and back then a 9/10. So why the one star? Well because I was refering more to being able to play the Xbox version, this PC version was never able to launch and so if the game can't be played how can it be any good?

reviews.title: One of the Greatest games of all time!
reviews.text: Title says it all! You can run the campaign as you see fit! You can conquer the world! Raise mighty armies to crush your foes! AND you CAN mod this game as you see fit as well. You start with the 3 roman families, Julii, Scipii, and Brutii. As time goes on you can unlock new factions and play as Egypt, Greece, The Gauls, The Britons, Germania, Carthage, Parthia, and more! Not only that but you can mod the game so you can play as whatever faction you want and when that's not enough you can take the fight to your friends online or play tag team battles! Swords, Axes, Spears, Bows, Arrows, Siege Gear, Horse Archers, Elephants, you will finally have your chance to cease complete control through TOTAL WAR!

reviews.title: Pros & Cons review
reviews.text:
Ok let me start by saying that this game is really fun but it does have some fatal flaws that you should look at before buying it.

The Pros:
-Good Campaign Story
-Brought Back and Revolutionized Zombies
-A lot of Extra Map Packs for Purchase
-A new and better lvling system in multiplayer
-A wide Range of Gun selection
-No more Noob-Tubing
-You can now Purchase your guns with money you earn rather than break your back with stupid achievements.
-You can Make your own Emblem
-Way better Killstreaks
-Improved Graphics
-Overall Very Fun!

The Cons:
-Campaign Gameplay is rather bland
-You'll lose connection to the game host more often
-Some Guns are not Accurately portrayed (Some Guns like M16 are 3 round bursts only and FAMAS is full auto only, also the AK47 is weaker than the M16?)
-They got rid of the SCAR

Overall you can plainly see that the Pros really outweigh the cons by A LOT! They have a storyline their just because but this really is a game that was made to shine for multiplayer and in fact in many ways I think it's much better than MW3 and MW2 and is a much more balanced and realistic gameplay. You get most of the most reputable guns of the cold war and even some rarely seen and unique ones! This is definatley a game your gonna want to pick up and try. The main reason I think people are dissapointed in this game is the same reason for most games/movies of this league.....OVER HYPE! Some people who gave this game a horrid rating do not have an open mind either to this style of gameplay or the reality of the design of this game. Is this game for everyone? No. But if you like fast paced action/first person shooters and like to interact with others than I highly urge you to give this game a go! Please note that if you do not have internet set up or dont like multiplayer games that you will HATE this game because it all revolves around human interaction for it's fun. If you like going solo go for Call of Duty 1,2,3, and World at War and maybe Call of Duty 4. And yes SCAR lovers I do feel your pain too. But try to lighten up, their are a ton of good guns that can take the place of your SCAR for at least one Call of Duty game.

reviews.title: WOW!
reviews.text: I love this little system. Just got  it in the mail  today and  mmaaaaaan it is so fun. I only have Lego Star Wars for it right now but the 3D effect is awesome and the screen is so freaking big. I love it! Its is very well made, solid as well. The colors are great and when you actually see this in person you'll know what I mean. The blue on the system has a pretty metallic look. The weight isn't too bad but I am using it more for at home and in the car. But  this system is fantastic and the games out and coming out for it still are good. Its worth the buy. Enjoy and happy gaming! =)

reviews.title: Pretty Darn Good
reviews.text: If you  haven't played Sims in a long time or  its your first time it may take a bit to get used to this game. Make sure you only play this game when you have plenty of free time. While  you may not have a huge area to explore they do improve your options from Sims 2. You can play Arcades, use computers and such  to find jobs, chat with other sims, or go to the boardwalk and learn to play the guitar. Also having pets is a bonus if you want them, but you don't have to have  them either which is cool as I didn't really want any. You can choose where you  want to  live. You can also build and customize like all the Sims which is freaking awesome. Overall its pretty darn fun on long road trips or just relaxing in the bedroom and play. This game can be fun for all ages so long as children can read and understand financial stuff like your mortgage or rent. I really like this game even though it doesn't compare to the PC/Console versions. That said I give it a 4 star rating just because it has some shortcomings. Its not quit as fun as the Xbox or PC version, but  all that  said, sometimes I am not in the Mood to play Lego, Mario, or Pokémon games. In  those cases this game is very addictive. You can spend upward of 3 or even 4 hours playing in some cases. Hope this review helps somebody out.

reviews.title: Total Letdown!
reviews.text: This game is NOT very good. It does NOT live up to the old RTW at all. Empires Total War is better than this garbage and that says a lot! First off the Unit/Building cards are freaking ugly. They confuse you. Its hard to identify units unless you put your cursor over each one so it can tell you what they are. Its horrid! Also I was lead to believe the settlements were or could grow to be huge. But after several siege battles they  look nothing like the Siege of Carthage trailer portrays it to look like. Also no cut scenes for each faction before playing  to set you in the mood and not General's speeches just really saddened me. I always looked  forward to them. Options for this  game are very limited. I liked the other games more, as they gave you more options in the way you  could expand. Instead this  game gives you strict guidelines and  the diplomacy is  STILL broken. The AI ALWAYS tries to screw you and sometimes its impossible to even get trade rights (which is crazy). After conquering the British Isles I got  bored to  tears. The whole thing is  SOOOO slow. The wait time in between turns are also insanely long. Look, I own ALL the Total War  titles and I can say this  was the worst and the biggest let down. I can't say I hate it. But I wont be playing it much. Absolutely NOT WORTH THE $60 they want for it. Its corny as hell. Maybe I wouldn't be so mad if it were a $20 game. But  it  is just  not worth  the  money or hassle at the time. Check back when  a Darthmod is released. till then have fun with the other titles in the series.

reviews.title: Don't Listen To The Haters
reviews.text:
This game is extremely fun and addictive. I have played and beat all 3 campaigns which were all awesome and sometimes creepy. As a marine you have got to stay on your toes, never know when those damn Aliens or Facehuggers can pop out at you. You get a 18 round Semi auto pistol to start off with which can be a decent weapon when low on ammo but not accurate at longer ranges (as one can expect from handguns). The pulse rifle is straight from the movies and is the same model of rifle as was seen in the original Alien movie and follow up in the Prequel Aliens. This bad boy can hold 99 in each mag and is a straight shooter but be careful its rate of fire can get you into trouble if you don't stay on target. Shotgun! Love the double barrel shotgun in this game, get those pesky face huggers away from you and headshot a Alien, that will learn em! So you are surrounded by a bunch of eggs? HELLO FALMETHROWER! If you like the smartgun you will see it later on in game and it can be a life saver from the hordes! Also some decent character interaction all be it very short and brief in lvls.

Predators: You recall the first AVP movie? Ya boy, you are gonna get all those weapons my friend! The smart disc is probably my favorite weapon. Its a non lock on disc that you can throw and it will follow your laser! Get good with that and you can drop 2 or 3 aliens in one swing! Of course you will also get those huge wrist blades as well which are good for melee offense and defense. As a Predator you will also get the notorious lock on Plasma Cannon that we have all come to love! But you have limited uses so make shots count and be a true hunter. You will get 3 types of vision. Regular, Thermal (as seen in Predator 1 and 2 and AVP), and also a special vision to detect those Xenos. All said this was actually my least favorite campaign for some odd reason. Its all personal preference but it was still good fun!

Aliens: The Aliens campaign might just be my favorite with the marines a very close second. I must admit I enjoyed the creep factor and darkness of the Marine campaign a lot. But as an Alien you become a profession hunter of the dark. You can stalk and lure your prey towards you and sprint so fast they wont know what hit them. Also when you sprint you are neigh impossible to shoot when running away. Sometimes I just like teasing the Marines for a while and toy with them before killing them. BE WARNED, Aliens are probably the weakest as far as defense goes. If those Marines are packing shotguns you better have a plan. You can climb on walls ceilings, roof tops....pretty much everything, no wait scratch that you can climb on EVERYTHING. I love it! Stealth kills truly are fun! Ripping off faces, shoving that wicked tongue clamper into heads, impaling with your tail...just awesome!

Graphics: are pretty good in my book. They are not the best but far from the worst! I give the graphics an 8/10
Sound: excellent! truly the original sounds from the movies and creepy as hell at times! Keeps you on your toes. 10/10
Gameplay: Gameplay was excellent in my book. Tons of fun and challenging, super intense. Action packed but also as a Pred or Alien you needed strategy. But sometimes as an alien you could mess up on kills because of how they cling on to things. It takes a while to get used to. And I wasnt a fan of how the Preds left stealth after using certain attacks or weapons. Gameplay as a Marine was everything I could have asked for. Major creep factor to keep you on your toes, excellent action, and all the essential weapons as well from the movies. Overall the gameplay gets a 9/10.
Multiplayer: Is fun but sadly you don't see a lot of team work. I personally suck and I wont lie about it but it is still pretty fun. 8/10
Cons: This game was really short! While the lvls were decent in length you only get 5-7 lvls per campaign with the Marines having the longest campaign. I really wished we could have had more content and lvls in campaign. I killed the Predator and Alien campaigns in one sitting and wrapped things up with the Marines the very next morning.

VERDICT: 8.5 is my overall score for this game. I really think its awesome, challenging, action packed, creepy, and extremely fun. The multiplayer is fun but it does take time to get used to. The only real problem is the campaigns are too short. To remedy this I recommend trying it on hard mode. It will keep you playing much longer than easy or normal modes.

reviews.title: Game on!
reviews.text: Nice form factor for mobile gaming. The white handles do not mark easily which was a concern for me. A screen protector is a must for me and a buyer should consider getting the largest memory card they can afford to go with it.

reviews.title: Great Workout
reviews.text:
First I would like to say that this game was a lot of fun. I got it yesterday and played it for an hour and was sweating so much it was crazy. If you're a MJ fan, then this is the perfect game for you. I danced, I sang, then I danced some more. Interesting enough it wasn't hard to follow the moves from the pictograms or even MJ himself because they depicted his signature moves. I'm totally in love with this game.

Now for the bad... unlocking training videos, really? Training and warm/up videos should have been a feature that is available to the user before they begin attempting the dance moves and not something that the user gets after he has attempted the dance moves. The next thing that I found annoying was that I had to enter my name each time I completed a song. I should have been assigned a avatar/user at the beginning of the game to eliminate this need.

Overall, BIG FUN!!! But, I couldn't in good conscience give this game the full five stars because of the problems with game usability. The realism and fun of the songs and dance moves are a solid 6 stars but the usability is a only worthy of 2 stars. Thus, I'll compromise with a rating of 4 stars.

All I can say bad about this is that a few of the edges are a little sharp, but that is nothing that some sand paper and black spray paint can't fix.

reviews.title: Stands out from the croud
reviews.text:
I've been using this headset more or less exclusively for the past few months, from listening to/editing music and videos, to playing video games such as CS:GO, Battlefield 4 & Hardline, Arma II and III, GTA V, Skyrim, etc. During this time I've noticed what this headset is capable of, and I must say that it is amazing. I've used a multitude of comparable headsets over the years, SteelSeries, Logitechs, Turtle Beaches, Razers, pretty much anything I could get my hands on for under $200. I must say that the HyperX Cloud II's are, from my experience, among the best, not to mention among the few you can really use as normal headphones on the commute if you wanted to.

Pros:
-Lightweight
-Sturdy and visibly well crafted
-Comfortable
-Good, clean bass, for those nice explosions or just for music
-Clear highs and lows for good sound quality
-Useful features, for instance the detachable mic and inline volume/mic controls
-Useful extras included, like the nice carrying bag, extra ear cushions and extended usb cord
-Aesthetically pleasing

Cons:
-Very loud, at least compared to the Razer Kraken 7.1 Chroma's I switched from, might be my soundcard, might be that the Razers were just quiet

Conclusion: Out of all the headsets I've purchased and used over the years, these are one of the only two I'm comfortable wearing for very long periods of time, the other being the SteelSeries Siberia line, but these have better sound and mic quality and added extras to sweeten the deal. When it comes down to price, I'd have to say not many headsets are even worth a mention with these around. Well worth the money.

reviews.title: Definitely recommend it for this price ($19
reviews.text: What can I say other than it works flawlessly? I use it for both Dolphin Emulator and legit Gamecube purposes, it hasn't let me down. Definitely recommend it for this price ($19.95 w/ free shipping at time of purchase)

reviews.title: Mayflash GC Controller Adapter for PC and Wii U
reviews.text: Works exactly how it should, useful for both the Wii U and PC, all four ports work perfectly. Not much else to be said here, product just works as it should at a good price.

reviews.title: Wielder of the Schwarz Sechs Prototype MkII.
reviews.text: Rikka Takanashi is one of those characters that sticks in your mind, for one reason or another. I lost a lot of family members earlier in life too, and responded in a somewhat similar way as she did. I'll always love Chuunibyou, and as such, Rikka. So, that brings us to the product in question. The build and art quality are both phenomenal. It's certainly sturdy, feels like nothing would happen if there were to be an accident involving a shelf, an elbow, some force, and a fall to the ground. While I read the dimensions, it still seemed a little tall to me while I took it out the box, which is really nice. Definitely recommend Sega products, I have a few more on the way, and already received two, the other being Chino from Is The Order A Rabbit?

reviews.title: Great mouse, iffy middle button
reviews.text: Amazing mouse. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is the middle mouse button which can be finicky. I thought I was going to have to buy another when it became hard to get it to click without pressing very hard, but thankfully it went back to normal. Seems to be a consistent problem with this mouse among many users.

I was reluctant because the price was so cheap but after some adjustment my Son felt he had his controller more in tact & ultimately games better. The silicone is nice & flexible. reviews.title: Love this game
reviews.text: I bought this game for my 4 yr old daughter for her birthday.  When I asked her to review it (and of course had to explain the word at first) she said "I love that game".  It is short and mostly uncomplicated for younger users.  I had to help her to design her character at the beginning and sometimes she had some troubles moving it around the game but she absolutely loved it.  Truly meant for an optimistic princess.

reviews.title: It's a skylander "I" did not previously have.

reviews.title: Works Great.
reviews.text: Love the pop-up feature, think it made it last longer than some of the other dual charging stations I have purchased in the past.  Will probably purchase again if or when it breaks (I have small children and consider broken items more of an inevitability than some).  But this has lasted much longer than I expected already!  I was surprised, when I first saw the picture I thought it would be much more cheaply made.  Pleasantly surprised.

reviews.title: Didn't have it.  Now I do.
reviews.text: What more can be said?

reviews.title: Flawed, but adequate....
reviews.text:
BAD:

The memory card manager corrupted my memory card and destroyed saves. It takes a long time for the disk to load, and like most cheat devices many codes don't work and it also causes freezing quite often. This device uses a different type of code than any other device so your stuck with what the manufacturer come up with...which isn't that great.

GOOD:

The most usefull part to me is that it lets you play different region DVDs on the PS2. Also, the ability to download codes and gamesaves is pretty cool.

Over all this is a decent buy, but I would probably be happier with a Codebreaker or the newer USB AR MAX.

reviews.title: Best online shooter on PS2.
reviews.text:
For anyone that has played the first Socom game, don't expect "Socom 1 with new maps." This game has quite a few changes.

Good:

There are still rarely ever any online cheaters. The game is lots of fun and is probably the best online shooter for PS2.

BAD:

There are a lot of bugs in the game. Hit detection and lag are really bad, so it is common for your shots not to register. Also, the weapons are inbalanced and not consistant.

I have gotten my moneys worth on this game. It is now a greatest hit and only $20.00 new....I would pay that just for the offline portion!!!

If you like this type of game I would also recommend Star Wars Battlefronts.

reviews.title: This game is a blast...
reviews.text:
I'm not a Star Wars fan, but this game is so much fun. I haven't had this much fun on a game for a long time.

GOOD:

There are so many vehicles to use. There are also some cool characters....and jetpacks. The levels are creative and the "capture the base" style play keeps respawn play strategic. Playing with so many bots gives a big battle feel that I haven't experienced in a game. Also, there are many details from the SW movies that are added into the levels.

BAD:

The online servers aren't set up very well. It's hard to find a game with a friend, or any specific room at all. Also, some of the blaster guns trail way behind your crosshairs and this gets annoying. As with any online shooter there are occasional teamkillers.

If you like first person shooters and/or Star Wars than get this game. It seems that Lucas Arts is releasing online patches quite often to fix all the problems in this game.

reviews.title: Made for giants...
reviews.text:
This mouse is great for the price, and is very customizable. The buttons are responsive, and it seems to be well-made.

Unfortunately, this mouse is too big (and I'm a larger than average person). I thought I would get used to it after a few days, but my wrists hurt from using this product.

The side buttons (1-12) are set to use the number pad. If you play an MMORPG that uses a 1-12 action bar, you will have to change the 11 and 12 buttons in the game to use - and + as their key bindings. Also, most gaming mice call their extra buttons (the ones an the top) M4, and M5 and you can just click them into a games interface to bind them. This mouse requires you to name a function for the buttons in it's own software.

Something that I didn't like about this mouse is that the lighting is changeable on the buttons, but the mouse wheel always glows yellow. It's an eyesore.

One thing that I really like is the multiple profiles that are switchable on the fly. For example, I might use a profile with a fast mouse speed for a run and gun shooter, and simply hit a button to slow the mouse speed when I'm sniping.

of many of the motion controls, shaking of the controller required in the mini games.

reviews.title: Nice accessory to the switch controller!
reviews.text:
Gaming on the switch controller, I get tired after some time. Using this easy to hold accessory reduces finger cramps and enables me to comfortably game longer without cramping!

Very helpful is the notch on the bottom to easily remove the controller for charging. There's 2 rubber stops to keep the controller in place. Great product!

reviews.title: Wireless decent quality similar in size to my xbox series x controllers
reviews.text: This is a decent mid-tiered quality switch controller that provides turbo for a lot of the smashing type or wrestling games.  I initial thought it was small from the pictures but upon receiving it, its actually the same size as my xbox series x controller.  Compared to xbox and switch pro controller its buttons and joysticks are a bit softer but not by much and this is a great value with great looks!  Didnt see link to manual so I took picture of the manual.

reviews.title: Pictured next to a Deathadder, its a quality product
reviews.text:
Subtle rainbow leds on the bottom adds warmth at night.
If you owned a Deathadder before it performs similarly in feel and tactile response.
Even the mouse wire is similarly in that its soft and flexible.
I have large sized hands and this feels right at home.

The feet could have more teflon surface area but still good.
Didn't need software for it to work outright out of the box and its adjustable in Windows.
You can adjust the pointer speed from the 2 middle buttons below the scroll wheel.
This is a decent gaming RBG mouse.

reviews.title: Value MMO mouse
reviews.text:
I use this to play MMO games. Even though it has less side MMO buttons 2X4 vs 3X4 configurations its seems easier to use without the middle button. There a nice thumb rest on the side that others dont have but it feels for my large hand there's nothing to rest my pinky finger on.
Also scroll wheel doesnt click left to right but thats more so for spreadsheets.
By default without software it works right out the box with pleasant pulsating rgb lights.
Its a good mouse nevertheless.

reviews.title: One of the better jigglers out there
reviews.text:
At first I was hesitant as some of these jigglers identify themselves in device manager as mouse jiggler which is a dead ringer giveaway. However, this one only discreetly says "usb mouse" as the identifier.
What sets this jiggler apart is the 2 buttons, one turns on/off and the other has three modes of movement. I have mine set as the 3rd option which moves in a square pixel pattern. With this setting on it mostly does not bother me when I have it on and is using my pc actively. I also like that it remembers my last setting used when I turn it off.
I had to take off one star as it did not come with an usb c converter as advertised.
Aside from that minor issue, this works very well.

reviews.title: forward & back buttons are reversed by default
reviews.text: This mouse works nicely for the price.  However the default buttons for forward and backward is reversed.  I tested this on another computer just to be sure.  Not sure if this is designed by as such or if it was a defect.  Also did not like the visible screws showing on the underside of the mouse as it potentially can cause scratches.

reviews.title: Yay! Best racing and car take down game!

I really missed playing this game. I also miss how far I had gotten in ps2 since, you know having to start over again. Oh well, either way, it's a fun game. My favorite racing game where I get rewarded for driving like a maniac and taking down rival racers! :) their music selection sucks though so I had to turn that off while playing.

reviews.title: Favorite game ever!

It's still a good game. Just wish I got what I wanted and paid for. The photo of what I got was misleading. :(

reviews.title: I like it

Either way it’s a pretty good game and I’m not much into shooter games! Then again I have it on one of the easier settings. Lol. I have the VR set, and although this is not a VR game, the VR set allows me to play games while someone else is watching TV. I am so needing to try it since it becomes like a giant theater screen while playing. :D
